review: I'm reviewing online because that's the only thing that the devs seem to give any about and work on.All of the DLC released that has been made in the past year ing sucks. Its all just copy and paste of the last where you have to buy some stupid expensive warehouse buy some stupid expensive cars or planes and then make pennies shipping cargo. It is very noticable how lazy the devs have been when it comes to making content. They seem to care more about their bank accounts right now than making a product worth buying.There is a very odd cycle going on in the game right now aswell. Where the devs think they can make more money buy making their cars cost 1.5 million each. But in turn people see that the price is ing dumb and cheat to get money. So rockstar will make everything cost more. So people cheat more. This has left everything costing a ridiculous amount and now the only way to get new car and stuff like that is to cheat or to buy the money. If you wanted to go with route 2 then good luck because its going to cost around $6 000 dollars to buy everything.Another scummy thing that these bastards did was remove all of the new stuff from single player. So you HAVE to go to online and give them your money just to ride a flying car.If you are going to play this game for the single player then go ahead cause it was pretty good. But for online NOPE. Just a bunch of money trying to pry their way into your wallet

This game does a lot of things right and a lot of things wrong. I'll be discussing the single player portion and the online portion in seperate sections as at this point they are nowhere near the same game anymore.

I am coming from console and I haven't gotten the chance to play the heists but oh my ing God is it a miserable experience trying to get a heist going. It takes a long time to find players and they are impatient s so they leave without letting others join. If they don't leave you will get complete who don't know how to do heists or are there just to ing troll you. Also with the new doomsday heist how you have to do preps in free mode who the thought of that?! My friend and I make it to an area only to get ing bombed by an orbital strike which by the way costs half a million dollars. So just us trying to mind our business to do a heist gets bombed by a kid who uses his daddy's credit card. I love the game but I hate the players. They are more toxic then Call of Duty kids.

review: This game is just great that is if you have creativity which not everyone does. If you have a mind that can come up with things to do and don't mind a bit of grinding to get exactly what you want then this game is amazing. I would definently recommend it since it has so much replay value and pogression that can make the game last basically forever. My only worries about the game is that with the most recent update (Doomsday Heist) my frames dropped by about 30 40 and hasn't been fixed yet (happened with my friends too) and the fact that the game is becoming more grindy with what seems like every update. The fact that it takes around $5 million to buy 2 planes in dlc and $100 shark cards only give you 8 million which isn't enough for that price anymore. So even if you buy the shark card it won't last long with the increasing coast of the dlcs. But overall this game is great for the price and if on sale I would definently recommed the game since if you have friends the experience can the best longest lasting fun in a while.

review: Enjoying this game has gotten more and more difficult over time. EVERYTHING has gotten expensive these days but the legitimate ways to pay for them have not changed.If you want to host one of the new Weaponized Vehicle missions (which is the only way to get discounts on the new vehicles) you have to pay a MINIMUM of $GTA 2 290 000. For the cheapest bunker and the cheapest Mobile Ops truck with absolutely no options. But unless you've dropped fifty real world dollars on a Shark Card there's no quick and legitimate way to get that money. Your best chance would be to host the Pacific Standard heist eight or nine times a tough and time consuming affair on its own.Once you've managed to scrape enough cash together to afford the bunker and the truck you will likely be unhappy to find out that all the fun toys they show off in this update weapon mods vehicle upgrades etc. are all hidden behind more paywalls. You can either wait for each item to be 'researched' or you can pay to have the research 'fast tracked' for a hefty fee. It takes about 8.5 hours per unlock time. Keep in mind that most of the items are things like weapon liveries and vehicle paint jobs. And you don't get to choose which items get researched when. Total . Paying for all the upgrades and focusing all bunker staff exclusively on research... it will still take about 6 hours per item.If you don't want to wait that long fast tracking research costs $GTA 225 000 per item. To pay to unlock every single item will cost you $GTA 10 350 000 for everything. That's over $150 USD's worth of Shark Cards. Or you can wait for about 380 hours for everything to be researched.Personally I'd rather just wait for a generous modder to drop some cash on me. That way I won't have to wait 17 straight days for unlocks (not counting things like sleeping or going to work) or literally spend my whole paycheck on Shark Cards.

review: I loved this game when I bought a PS3 copy of it along with a new television in october of 2013. I finally finished a new gaming rig in March and figured "Hey I could download and replay GTA on my new computer." So I finally got it and just wow. The graphics frame rate and even some of the playability were greatly improved. I have to admit I will be buying a controller for it soon seeing as I hate using the numpad to control flying vehicles but other than that it is great now that I have it set up properly. The only issue I had when I installed my game was a direct 3D graphics initialization error that would cause my game to crash every 5 35 minutes and I would get massive frame drops and wondered why my PC was doing so poorly on what were mostly mid to high settings. It turns out at least for me you need no less than 12 gigs of RAM to run this game without any hiccups. I have read in some forums that people are getting away with as little as 6 gigs and it runs fine but I had to double my setup to 16 so as to guarantee no frame drop problems. My system uses a little over 2 gigs at full idle with my utilities running and if I subtract that number from the max RAM usage of 11.3 gigs I saw after a few hours of straight gameplay I get within 100 megs of 9.1 or 9.2 gigs of RAM utilized just by GTA. The ERR_GFX_D3D_INIT issue I was having was fixed after I turned down some settings and I figured after a lot of troubleshooting that it was my older graphics cards I'm using that don't support some of the technologies in this newer title (most likely some forms of AA or similar settings) so if you have a GPU from the Nvidia 700 series or newer you should not have any issues as long as you have an adequate amount of Vram for the resolution at which you wish to play. I use two GTX 650 Ti BOOST cards in SLI with 2GB of ram each and at mostly high settings they were only using about 1641 megs of Vram at 1080P. At any higher resolutions I would recommend at least 3GB of Vram and something as powerful or more powerful than a GTX 970. Good luck and have fun being mischevious.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is basically it. This is as of the time of posting this review the definitive open world experience.It's fun satirical and a hell of a world to play around with.The environments are diverse and so are the vehicles and weapons even the NPCs are their own thing to explore.The game does however as of the time of posting this review have some perforamance issues when there are a lot of police A.I present at the same time causing the FPS to go down sometimes from the 60s to the 40s 30s and even 20s in extremely severe scenes. Some users have also reported micro stuttering during normal gameplay but I don't have this issue personally.This is honestly one of the best games out there at the moment and I can honestly recommend it to pretty much anyone and everyone assuming you haven't bought it yet though the Online portion of the game is somewhat plagued with script kiddies and pretty grindy but fun with friends.

review: I mainly play on the Xbox but the editor makes this version even better (if your system can run it may want to research system specs in depth before buying). In addition to the most realistic and immersive GTA city so far it has blimps skyscrapers ramps and more. Story modes are always great in GTA but this one made vast improvements in online play (unless R* is down) and the frequent expansions have all been (so far) free.

review: I don't usually pay full price for a game. I usually wait for the game to get a little old and for interest on it to die down I snatch it up on special on Steam for somewhere along the range of 60 90% off. That being said I paid full price for this game and I would pay full price for the next Grand Theft Auto to come out on PC and I would encourage everyone else to do so because Rockstar have gone all out in making this game and the level of value that they are giving the gaming community and their level of dedication is rare and should be supported and encouraged by us.

review: The game has been out for two years there's not much for me to add in detail.That said I'm constantly floored by how much detail they packed in. I'm a sucker for a good open worlder R* continues to be the diamond standard.I really wish there were a lot more missions though. R* built this huge open world but I've got a feeling we'll only see limited additions if any. This is because the emphasis seems to be on multiplayer. That's not my thing so I'm worrying my favorite franchise may be dead. Anon Multiplayer is a hugely expensive feature to add because of the amount of investment into network optimization and anti cheat you have to put in. Here's the short of it I'd gladly pay 30bucks for an equal (or better) expansion pack that did nothing but place a new (or sequel) story line in exactly the same world. No new features just a lot of new missions and story.Or a good heists engine for single player. That would work too.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I was a bit reluctant to get this game due to the whiners complaining about so called hackers as well as people bi***ing about the sales practices in which Rockstar and or Steam used in selling the game. However in playing the game I have found it to be interesting to say the least. I have only been on for a few hours and have worked my way around the game a bit learning here and there. In the short time of playing it I really like it. I have dipped my toe into the ONLINE side of this game and it feels a bit odd however not as bad as everyone was making it out to be. I don t know it could be the hour that I am on or what. Who knows? From this experience so far I am happy with it. Things I m not pleased about Buying the Shark card from STEAM is T! In order to claim the mother er you have to go and submit a ticket to rockstar with proof that you bought it. T!!!

review: Everyone seem to be very negative about this game but you must give the game a chance.Pros The game looks gorgeous even on medium settings. The singleplayer itself has a good storyline and you will hardly get bored running around the city and doing shenanigans The Online is good when you make a private session and play with friends. There is a lot to do in Online and you can have a lot of fun with your friends running around the city. If you play GTA V for first time you will be very excited exploring the city. (It took me like 3 months to start getting known of the city even now I still sometimes use the GPS in case I want to go to some places)Cons In almost every Online session there is a cheater or group of cheaters and ruin other people's fun. Most acitvities in Online are dead. Every session in Online I see kids asking the cheaters for "Free" money.Conclusion The game itself is good but these days Rockstar charge too much for the game. Thank god I preordered the game for like 50 EU. The Online is good if you avoid the cheaters. If the cheaters put a mark on you simply change the sessions. You can also make a private session and invite friends to play so you can have fun or do some activities. If you don't have friends that is your problem. xD (The problems in Online are the reason why the game has such a negative aspect so I hope Rockstar sit on their and do something.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Honestly brilliant game! 170+ hours Story Mode + Great story+ Brilliant main characters + Multiple choice endings+ Brilliant graphics+ Story is 30+ hours or so It's quite a beefy game I couldn't even play without lag and it crashing when I first got it+ If you suck at particular mission the game eventually gives you the option to skip it Online + If you have friends to play with it's pretty fun plenty of jobs to do and places to go on the map+ Character customization It can get boring quite quick especially if you overplay it Cheaters and modders who ruin the experience for everyone else (stealing/giving money bombing killing teleporting everyone) Modders can get you banned Rockstar support is not that great As soon as you spawn in you will have a target on your back and probably be murdered within 30 seconds Money is a hard thing to get a lot of unless you buy it with real money Cars/planes/helicopters etc are very expensive

review: Reviewing the whole game not just the cluster**** that is online hence the recommendation The game itself is by far one of the best games ever released the open world is constantly in motion and everything from the graphics to the dialogue is perfect (or near perfect)Now to the Online experience it's not THAT bad like most people's reviews indicate yet having spent 100 hours grinding cash I've had enough. Every time you log in you will spend the first 20 minutes hopping through servers until at last you find one that has less than 5 players. Why? Because you have a much greater chance of actually being able to finish a mission (VIP work bunker stuff etc.). Eventually though the server will fill up with people and then comes the inevitable kiddy on his f****** flying motorbike firing rockets at you ending your mission immediately you get nothing. Time to start the mission over again better luck next time.There's nothing wrong with allowing this kind of action in a game (direct PVP) however the way it's been implemented encourages (and REWARDS) the griefing of other players. The only legitimate way around this problem making money in game is to cough up your own hard earned cash to pay Rockstar for "Shark Cards" which are pretty pathetic in terms of bang for buck. 50 for 8 mil? Are Rockstar so strapped for cash that we need to get Bob Geldof in for a Live Aid concert to raise funds for this evidently struggling game corporation? Bono can keep his traditional line in the charity single we release.Buy this game for the single player campaign and by all means play online if it's your thing just expect a lot of griefing.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Take 2 Interactive has firmly shot themselves in the foot with PR and a lack of connection with the community. Rockstar is not to blame for the downward spiral of this game Take 2 Interactive is. With updates that continously gear GTA towards promoting in game microstransactions (Which is hilariously enough made fun of in the game by lester on a set up mission for a heist!!!!). This is exemplified by take 2's press release entailing how they could pretty easily squeeze more money from their player base cut more wood so to speak. Well this forest is gone and you dumb ***es are solely repsonsible for it. Killing the modding community by using a cease and desist on OpenIV and making the entire gaming community feel like nothing more than dollar signs to you is a good way to destroy your crown jewel's popularity. I love rockstar and I am truly sad that their parent company is managed by a bunch of village idiots. Take 2 needs to perform so serious damage control if they want to escape this unscathed and if they want their Red Dead Redemption 2 launch to go smoothly.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: i love gta 5 because the story mode. it's amazing and fun it has a decent story though i the first time i played i didn't play for the story mode i came for the online.Unfortunately the online is not what i expected. i used to play gta online on the last gen console i had ton of fun. But now it's just all microtransaction's vehicle is expensive even if you buy the Gunrunning Doomsday Etc. vehicle you still have to pay for the bunker facility Etc. and the extra money for the MOC Avenger its a waste of money.Additionally hacker's is almost everywhere. I got banned once because of a hacker but when my account is back it just reset all of my character and it's stats plus i have to grind everything from the beggining again. The good part is they refunded every money that i have D. I give a 8/10 for story modeand 7/10 for gta online
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I love this game. The city landscape and pretty much everything the player sees perfectly rendered.The gameplay is really great not much to complain about other then the infrequent glitches that become annoying.Vehicles and weaponry are fun to use and I really enjoyed the ability to switch between 3 different characters within the game. Each is totally unique and nothing like the rest especially in consideration of their individual stats and ability.If you enjoyed previous GTA titles like Liberty City stories or Vice City then you'll love this GTA of the future. While I can not comment on the Online portion I used it sparily and when I did I'd get sniped as soon as I spawned in game. I prefer the Story Mode espceially now with 3rd party mods.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I wish I could rate the single player and multiplayer seperately because the single player is amazing a definitive gta experience. The multiplayer however seems to be designed to fill rockstars pockets with money via microtransactions unless you want to grind for months to get a single vehicle that some in the same lobby paid 20 bucks for and most of the multiplayer ways to make money have to be done in an open lobby so if you're just trying to make money you have to deal with all the who just paid real money for their jets and flying cars with rocketlaunchers to try and get anything. It's an absolute how. In recap single player good. Multiplayer how. I didn't even get into the fatal flaws with the main attraction of multiplayer which is heists if you dont have 4 friends that play regularly anytime you try to do one of these with even a single random player if that player disconnects or loses connection every person in that game is kicked out of that heist back to the multiplayer lobby where you have to drive all the way back to your apartment to try and start the heist again. Extremely frustrating.

review: I have always played Rockstar games. I loved them. Recently I came back to GTA online after 8 month of not playing. I woke up the next morning to be informed I was banned. Confused i tried to talk to rockstar support online only to recieve an automated scripted reply. I tried calling to get some awnsers only to recieve scripted replys and to be told they have no supervisors I can talk to. So thats it. bought the game for 3 consoles. played since it was released just to have my character and all progress deleted with no explaination. The fact they can delete your character for any reason and no warnings is crazy. but the worse is the support it is non existant.This company has lost my business and I will share my experience with everyone I know and encourage the same.

review: Beat it first couple times on PS3 at launch. Bought another copy on Steam. It's great.Story is told through multiple main characters this time which makes them more shallow than we're used to. That said it's still a great story. Characters remain very interesting. All GTA games are standalone story wise so don't worry about catching up.Multiplayer was a disaster at launch but now it's the mainstay for most players. New content is really fun. All in all very much recommended. If you're worried that it's a game about killing hookers and doing blow don't worry it's a common misconception.

review: Rockstar and Take Two have slowly but surely been killing this game over the last two years. From perma banning users for being forced by hackers to recieve money (bans regardless of how long are non appealable and if you send them a ban appeal WHICH IS LITERALLY A SECTION ON THEIR SUPPORT PAGE you get an automated response essentially telling you to go yourself.) Along with the CEO of take two recently stating that there aren't enough microtransactions in their games despite the fact that they are currently charging $100 for enough in game money to purchase only a couple of the higher end vehicles which means that a couple vehicles are worth more than the entire game itself. But the final straw is sending a cease and dessist to OpenIV essentially destroying the entire singleplayer modding scene.Rockstar and Take Two are the very definitions of how to be horrible developers and a horrible company in general. Do not support their games.

Oh and Rockstar and Take Two for trying to compete with Nintendo for the Most DMCA Takedown Notices Sent Award. You stupid idiots realise that once the mods go on the Internet there is nothing you can do to prevent their redistribution through other sites? Plenty of people have archived those mods and as you take one down two will arise in its place. Congrats on alienating your fans.

review: The best aspect of this game was the large open playground within single player where mods could be installed to increase the longevity and expand on the "player narrative". Single player mods to the game to whatever I desired and whatever the wonderful modding community could cook up. Was this game not about doing "whatever I want"? Well I want to mod. I want to enjoy the game that I purchased in the manner that I thought best. Single player mods harmed no one affected no one elses game play and allowed me to enjoy Los Santos for more than just "Be a crook kill some people or whatever". Well instead you've killed your player base. I will not purchase from Take Two I will not purchase from R* and I will certainly not purchase the next GTA. You killed our fun we kill your profits. Enjoy.

review: Avoid.Got bored of this one pretty quickly and realized I'd have more fun no longer advancing the story and playing something else. To be fair the same thing happened with 4 but I loved the MP in that (firetruck races!) and I thought I would like 5's too but it's all about GTA Online. You can't hop in and screw around with friends without dealing with disgusting pubbies. Events are a PITA to set up and the whole thing smells like free to play nickle and diming. It seems to be their main money maker now too so it's never going away.At least mods were cool.. but those are no longer allowed thanks to Take2. Their attitude and pricing makes it seem like they think their poop doesn't stink but the game just isn't that fun.

review: is GTA V superior on the PC? yes it iswhy you ask? because of Mods for the single player i sayso should i get this then for all the cool mods? no you shouldn'tTake Two have now essentially stated that Mods are illegal when the served up a cease and desist to the creators of the OpenIV basically the main mod that s been used to mod GTA for over the past 10yearsSo I can t in all honesty recommend buying this game with modding gone it s the only reason I bought this again on PC likely why a lot of people bought it on PC the single player is fun for sure but it s that mods that really sell it and with the micro transaction ridden hell that is the online this isn t worth your money without the Mods

review: Same old GTA. It seems to be less buggy than previous versions and the graphics look great. Unfortunately it's just boring. There is nothing new in the game and somehow the world seems small and closed in. It just desn't feel like the San Andreas I knew from before (maybe because it used to be really sparse?). It probably should have been a whole new setting since I felt kind of the same with GTA 4. The main characters all have some special ability but I don't use them. They are not necessary and just seem like a last minute half baked idea. You can interchange between 3 different characters but all that does is make the map more convoluted. For some reason you CANNOT DISABLE 3RD PERSON CAMERA AUTO CENTER. I cannot tell you how horrible this is for me. This was an option on all the other games why not this one. Screw you especially hard for that R*.Whenever I start the game I just can't bring myself to drive through Franklin's mansion neighborhood. It just seems like more work than the game is worth. I guess I "grew up" or I'm just sick of the same old game being rehashed over and over....

review: Anything that can be said about how amazing this game is has already been said in much better detail by others then me but I just want to throw my two cents in.This game is a masterpiece. Every Grand Theft Auto game has redefined the definition of satire violence and open world gaming. The city is vibrant and alive and feels like it is based in reality by using over the top characters brands and companies that are all parodies of counterparts in the real life. The driving a key component is smooth and simple and fast something very few other games have been able to accomplish. The missions and story and seemingly amazing and it almost feels like I am playing through a hit TV series.The online is your virtual playground where the missions are just as good as the single player. The only problem with it is the people themselves but other then banning hackers (something Rockstar has lacked the availability to do) there isn't much any game this one or any other massive multiplayer game can do about it. However to me this isn't much of a big deal as I have ran into two different types of hackers. Ones that spawn a tank and around in it for twenty minutes and the other who drops bags of money on your head giving you between 2 20 million dollars. Overall not much to complain about here.In the end this game is a masterpiece that will go down in history as one of the best games created joining the ranks that only a few hundred games have achieved in the twenty+ years of gaming.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: A.Story Mode The story is quite nice its fun and most missions are unique.B.Online This is most likely the part of the game that you will find yourself playing the most if you have some patience. Though it can get really annoying at times its can also be very fun especially if you're playing with friends.Pros +Lots of gamemodes to play+Player created content+You can spend lots of time in freeroam either if you like to cause mayhem or have friends to play with+Vehicle customisation is more in depth than most racing games these days+Regular content updates+Great controller support+Well optimisedNeutral The community has all kinds of players (Both very friendly people and the ones who want to kill everyone all the time)The grinding can make you either play more or get sick of the gameYou can buy ingame currencyCons Lots of hackers that can either ruin your experience (or very rarely make it a bit more fun) The content creator is annoyingly buggy Repetitive missions Long loading times Connectivity issues Clean racing is hard to come by if you don't have friends or if you aren't in a friendly crew

review: GTA V is that type of game that almost goes in its own catagory. Shooting cops buying a supercar investing in the stockmarket exploring the massive city driving on the freeway racing and betting taking a hike buying houses and flying jets this game has it all. Amazing graphics and even if you dont have a gaming rig it still runs fine. Super long story that is fun all the way through and even has hundreds of other things to do after the storymode with sports and side quests. I have played this game for 440 hours yet there is still things I have not done. The only thing I was not too sure on was that the driving is not how it would be in the real world. I have played it since it came out on the xbox 360 and I am still playing this game. One of the best games I have ever played.

review: Grand Theft Auto V... now this is a game. I'd like to preface this that I played the majority of GTA V on PS4 and only got it for PC to enjoy mods. Do not take my hour count at face value I have well over 1500 hours in Los Santos. TL DR Singleplayer is where it's at don't bother with Online. The Singleplayer for Grand Theft Auto V is fun a touch on the lengthy side but you'd enjoy the 10 ish hour story. There are plenty of intense moments throughout though some of them can be quite annoying. The story itself is pretty bland I'll be honest you're not playing this game's story for the story at all. You're going to get a lot more kicks out of the free roam and doing your own stunts playing with the environment and discovering everything within.Onto Online... and this is the part of the review which comes so close to ruining the game as a whole... but at least it's mostly independent. GTA Online is... a massive P2W skinner box. It's a constant grind to get to the best cars weapons and assets. And it's only gotten worse with age. Back when I first played the most a P2W player could have is the Tank and even then you had to have put some hours in first. Now... there are VTOL aircraft motorcycles that fly around spewing rockets everywhere APCs that absolutely crush everything apart from the Hydra which is in turn crushed by the Oppressor. And they're all insanely unfun to play against. And might I add all the new cars all the new stuff? Insanely expensive $40 to buy a pretty bad supercar released now not even factoring in upgrades.If there's one thing you take away from this it's to just enjoy GTA V SP and not set foot into Online. If you want to play with the stuff locked behind there Trainers are a thing. Outside of that mini vent the map is great full of little nuances references and fun places to explore. Driving while not very realistic is very fun and enjoyable a welcome change from GTA IV's land boats. Overall 9/10 Graphics7/10 Story10/10 Gameplay2/10 Multiplayer8/10 Soundtrack10/10 Replayability/Return factor9/10 Value (SP)0/10 Value (MP)Overall 8/10 Would recommend
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Rockstar support is very helpful when you are troubled. +rep lulThe fact that Grand Theft Auto V (GTA5) and GTA Online feel like 2 different games to me and they come in one pack seems very critical. I find the main story to be casual rockstar script writing it does the exaggerate the feeling that it is unique in the sense of how things play out in terms of story route. If you get the game you probably should get it for the sake of GTA online solely. It feels uncomfortably worthwhile to say so that just GTA online is worth $60 USD its quite steep but to say the least the features and entertainment you get for just GTA online is of a significant amount. This has the environment where this could be a game requiring a lot of grinding. You could end up procrastinating a lot over this game. Load times are crazy. I mean sure keep items and feature prices steep no problem don't take it to the point where we need to become a pay to win player or have to pick up some unethical measures. Ping difference in combat results in troll results it's frustrating to be on the short end of the stick in that situation.To conclude get it for GTA Online or not at all.

review: ok i wont recommend getting this having said that i do love the GTA franchise i have played them all to death.GTA V single player is awsome the story is rich and filled with action it is truly amazing. 10/10now... GTA V... Online.i used to play it on my ps3 then did the convert when i bought it on PC oh boy what a mistake.every server i play there is blatant hacking i spend more time on loading screens or calling mors mutualto get replacements ive tried hopping from heist to heist staying inside my building but those absurd cutscenes where you all "finish" the mission together always ends in 1 person shooting the others before you make it away safely. my rank of kingpin is rather empty when i average 15k per heist (after losing 5k being shot in the back of the head trying to leave)im only writing this now because i dared venture out of my house to get teleported and locked in a cage and then my game actually crashed because 1000's of people appeared in the cage with me.i recently just started playing it again and today has reminded me why i wont try again. toxic community and even rockstar have set it up to encourage micro transactions which is incredibly dissapointing considering it made over $800 million on day one of sales.having said all of that i am still a fan of rockstar's work and i really look forward to GTA VI rockstar has always made incredible improvements to the new titles over the previous ones and i hope they learn alot from this title (as it is the first attempt in an online environment for GTA)
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Personally I ve enjoyed GTA V for several years at this point. I ve played it since release and still believe it is a very well made game and has aged well. The story is interesting enough to keep you hooked and the online mode is something you can play for hours on end without getting bored. The only cons I have with this game though is the copious amount of modders that never seem to go away and the insane prices for some of the latest DLCs. Rockstar needs to get a bit less greedy and focus more on being more friendly and kind hearted in their fluctuating prices of the online economy. Other than those complaints this game is definitely worth the price on sale or not.

review: Note I know what Steam says my playtime is. That's because I tried installing and playing this once through family sharing didn't work. I likely have hundreds of hours of gametime in reality though because I've played through the storyline entirely at least twice and played countless hours of GTA Online just grinding to try and get new stuff. Warning Long tirade ahead TL DR I personally went through hell and back just to play this fetid pile of dog vomit I'm sure many others did as well if they bought the physical copy of the game and when an update came along that finally brought my interest back in it somewhat TakeTwo go and pull a cease and desist on OpenIV which is one of the things that keeps this grindstone abomination alive and fun. TakeTwo should take turns choking themselves to death on a gorilla's chode. Wait a week or two and I guarantee modders will come back dropping more money than every only play then to give them a huge middle finger if you play at all anymore.I remember back in 2015 I picked up my pre ordered physical copy of GTA 5 for PC because I had played it on PS3 years ago and loved every second of it and I saw all the new features that were going to be added to the next gen/PC version of the game and thought it'd be great. I came home with excitement in my heart because I thought I was gonna get a great experience just like playing the game for the first time all over again only for the following experience with it to be a year long nightmare just trying to get the thing installed. The initial installation went smoothly and I didn't mind it but after that was all done I thought I was going to play but instead was greeted with a required day one patch. The game hadn't even been out for a few hours yet and there was already a day one patch for christ's sake. 5 gigs too so even more waiting to play my game. I thought nothing particularly ill of it at first but then soon realized that the installer was starting off normal speed and then slowly trodding down until it hit zero kb/s when normally I had (at the time) gotten around 1 to 2 Mb/s.I then spent the entire rest of the day trying to get this piece of crap installed all the way I looked up if anyone else had this problem and everyone else who bought the physical copy did (quality servers R*) so I looked up if anyone found a fix for it and tried every last one that came up and none of it did. Through sheer willpower I managed to basically force it into installing and then I fired it up with my hopes still somehow being in tact for a great experience.It crashed. Alright that might just be the settings my computer was really freaking old at the time so I figured I could probably run it with everything set on lowest and that'd be fine by me. Set everything to the lowest possible settings crashed again but this time after giving me the false hope it wouldn't because it took quite a while longer to crash.I immediately gave up on it uninstalled it and didn't give a crap about it for the entire rest of the year. Then my PC was upgraded to a current (in early 2016 that is) and pretty good mid range rig. So I then went through installation of GTA 5 again to see if it worked and it actually did. I was able to play with decent settings at a stable 60 FPS and so I beat the storyline fully again and went through with porting my Online character and all that stuff.But there was one problem it wasn't fun anymore. Online was a chore now because by the time I was able to play it again from the last time I played it so many updates had come out that increasingly made it take more of a grind. I hadn't been able to play it for around 3 years at this point so you can probably figure what the updates exactly were that did that. Singleplayer was alright but the storyline isn't nearly as interesting and fun to play through the second time as it is the first time.So I uninstalled it again bored with it and somewhat disappointed that GTA Online turned into a grindfest filled with cheaters and toxic scumbags when before you could at the very least drive down the street safely for a while.Then comes the Gunrunning update something that actually gets me excited. I install it well before Gunrunning releases and start playing the Online portion to try and get money and of course modders are there as always. They drop money on me and I don't give a crap I take it and buy a bunch of crap because I can't be bothered to grind for it anyways. Gunrunning drops and I immediately by the bunker but before I can buy the Mobile Command Center my money all disappears. My own fault really I should have anticipated that and bought a bunch of sell off cars so I could keep it after the inevitable cash wipe. So now I get stuck with a bunker a CEO office and some warehouses to make my money. All slow boring chores of processes that really aren't that much better than grinding the original missions themselves like all those years ago.And then they decide to attack OpenIV for no god dang reason like a bunch of bumbling that hate freedom and jerk off to the scent of money. Suck my balls TakeTwo modders are the only thing keeping this game from being a soulless abomination of grind. And you overpriced your Shart cards 8 million for almost 200 real life dollars are you high on meth? The PRE REQUISITE items that you NEED to even begin using ANY of the freaking new content in the gunrunner DLC totals up to almost 8 million. You think this one update is worth almost 200 dollars on it's own are you a bunch ants with cordyceps eating your brains?For the same price as that worthless Shart card I could buy a bunch of games during the Steam summer sale you ain't getting anything from anyone with a brain anymore. Hell you'll have hard luck getting moron microtransaction "whale" customers to fall for your schemes. What an awful game this ended up becoming.

review: Great game. Never really played single player so I don't care about the single player OpenIV modding tool but its back now anyway so stop complaining.I have played over 680 hours online at this point in time. It has had its ups and downs. Moments when I wanted to murder my own freinds and family because of the rage it was causing (difficult tracks made in track editor which I thouroughly enjoyed). Theres a sense of accomplishment when you finally complete a difficult track. Sniping has been fun. Running my own business has been great. Owning a motorcycle club has been a blast.There is one reason above all else that makes me not recommend this game. Even after all the time spent on it and the fun times I've had.Modders/Hackers/Scripters!!!What ever you want to call your self you have ruined this game for everyone else!There have been times I have found it entertaining to suddenly become a toilet and have an arcade machine spawn on top of me. but mostly these guys just spawn in money ruining the in game economy spawn kill others glitch you out of your vehicle when you are winning an event or turn on god mode so you cant hit them. Insta kill is annoying. So is aim bot.The worst part of it all is that even after all this time Rockstar hasnt done a hpthing about it unless it stops them getting a Shark card sale.I finally thought they were trying to do something about it by closing OpenIV (even though it supposedly cant be used online) but no! modding online is still rampant and Rockstar dont't do anything to stop it. For now this game is dead to me. Sort your Sh*t Rockstar

review: **EDIT**Rockstar Games has attempted to reverse the actions of Take Two and is attempting to repair the bond it has with the modding community. This will take time and I am still not very happy with Take Two. I hope to see More of the GTA Online mods (Like Force Hax) and let the singleplayer Flourish.**EDIT**I purchased this game on PC for the sake of modding singleplayer (I do not condone modding GTA Online) When I play GTA Online I use an unmodded copy of the game. Take Two Interactive (T2) The parent company of Rockstar Games has made modding near imposable in an effort to stop people who will just find a way to mod without the tool OpenIV... In effect punishing all people who mod the singleplayer for the actions of the few who mod/ cheat in GTA Online. In a few months modders will be back in GTA Online and gutting the modding community will have done nothing. I have had this game for just over a year... review: GTA V Single Player Review (spoiler free)I just finished the story of GTA V. I bought the game for 30 when it was on sale because I wanted to play a game with a great story with my XBOX controller. Basically this is what I got.GTA V is a great GTA but it didn't dig me as I was expecting it. I was hoping for a successor to GTA San Andreas and had really high expectations. I missed the feeling to start from the button and work my way up to become rich and so on. In GTA V the success comes too fast. In my opinion you get the nice house car etc. too early. I also didn't identify with the characters as much as in previous GTA titles. The radio stations are good but they also didn't convince me as a legit successor to previous titles. Also you can't eat in restaurants you can't buy street food you can't train your body. It makes no sense for me to buy cars. It makes no sense to me to train the pet of one of the characters. So all in all it has all the core elements of a good GTA but it is not the big thing I was hoping for.It is a good game. I am recommending it. It is fun to play. The story is okay. The dialogues are great. The gameplay is super. The graphics are awesome.

review: I bought this game for the story line and enjoyed the single player story line. It was unique in its style of character choice and it's impressive character development. For the single player I would recommend this game. Online however I was definintely intrigued at first and felt I really liked it. But the reality is I don't. Every session has someone who has modified the game or has hacked it. There seems to be no means of enforcing the rules against these hackers and it simply isn't fun. This is only of course after your game takes forever to load the online section of play. Then if the modder/hacker decides to manipulate the game where it crashes it on you then you have to reload the entire process.It's upsetting.For the single player however I would recommend the game.

review: Easily the best single player campaign story I have ever played in a game and that is saying a lot. Absolutely compelling characters from beginning to end perfect pacing and missions that are an absolute blast. It's like participating in the best crime action thriller ever made.The Online mode on the other hand is a different story. While it's definitely got great ideas building your own criminal empire in a massive territory going about your business whichever way you please there just isn't a way to play by yourself. PVP is not only involuntary it is also unrewarding as the reward for killing another player is minimal while the losses to yourself can be extraordinary. Extremely frustrating when you're about to jump into a plane to sell a shipment of weed when some comes along in a fighter jet kills you and destroys the product that took 4 in game hours to grow and be developed. It will feel like a lot of wasted time.That being said the game is worth the price for the single player alone as it will be a gaming experience that you will never forget and sets the tone for all single player stories to follow it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: SINGLE PLAYER REVIEWI have nothing bad to say. The voice acting is some of the best in the biz. Being able to switch between the 3 characters is pretty awesome though it doesn't have much of an impact besides different storyline quests. They did an amazing job with the map. It's the perfect size in which it maintains a sense of wonder at the beginning of the game but you still find hidden locations later on when you can snag an airplane and explore. The driving feels good but the vehicle upgrades seem a little random without continuity vehicle to vehicle. My only complaint in single player is the inability to save vehicles permanently for later use. This doesn't make sense seeing as you drop loads of cash to upgrade a vehicle only to lose it if it gets destroyed.You'll still get 60 bucks out of this game for sure but given it's 2 year age I'd wait for it to go on sale just for the principle of it.

review: If you haven't played it go for it. If you played it on any other platform don't waste your cash. Single player is a good game (probably the best of the GTA's outside of Vice City I consider Vice City to be the best GTA game) multiplayer *sounds* like it would be a great idea but when you make GTA multiplayer it just turns out to be a really really bad idea. And the architecture of the multiplayer system basically completely prevents Rockstar from preventing cheating . . and it's not even clear if they care about cheating in the slightest.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Solo Wonderful!Online only if you have a bunch of friendsMy main gripe with this game is the long loading times when playing online It consistantly takes over 7 minutes to get into a session from startup even with SSDs. Sure it take 2.5 minutes to get into solo mode which is pretty long compared to other single player AAA titles from the same era (Witcher 3 Fallout4 Skyrim).Then you have to wait for the job queue to load.Then you wait for the heist setup to start.Then you wait for the heist to load.THEN you can start playing.It takes FOR EV ER to actually start playing the game to make money. I guess you just need to roll with your RL friends.Oh yeah then greifers come in and you up.Play with RL friends in your own private session or play solo.

review: Im not the gamer GTA 5 was created for so keep this in mind when reading this review. I have no complaints about GTA 5 although I would prefer something with a lot less stealing and killing. I like the stock market feature and the cab runs gives me other options for making money with no violance and I wish I didnt have to wait for the Car Towing feature to unlock. Having the violance being part of the game is understandable for the games market. I will leave any debates about the violence to others. I could only suggest other features I would love to have in this game.Keep in mind I would pay for these features as program upgrades or add ons. 1.) Have a non story single player mode or free play I dont know enough about editor mode to know if this mode qualifies. I found it interesting but couldnt do much with it except being a super villian/Hero and battle an army single handedly for hours on end. Onlone mode is too intense for me. 2.) More side missions ( more on the side of short side missions ) For example More racing missions Bus driving missions Various Trucking missions and just more ways to make money while involved with the world population in some way similar to cab fairs or car racing ( Also similar to Triatholons Tennis and Golf ) For violence enthusiasts When in certain neighborhoods a prompt trigger gets activated when a person or gang member challenges you giving you the option to choose same as when driving by the car racing trigger. 3.) An easier playing level ( handicap ) for those of us who can't pass the missions by making the player harder to kill as a way to making the non story single player mode unneccerary or have the handicap feature available before all missions. 4.) This one is my favorite An upgrade or add on for an improved world A.I. (Maybe Artificial Intelligence Theme add ons for example). The focus on graphics are great. Wish my computer had the technology to run it at one of the higher graphics levels but I would prefer a higher level of A.I. in the game. For example the emergency vehicles still sometimes get stuck in the same spot doing circles and other hilarios antics have the population react in more than just two ways run off in fear or try to kill you. What about some one trying to stop me just to get a few angry words about almost running them over or bumping into them. Or instead of saying "Cool car can I get a ride?" but actually give one of them a ride for real basically more random characters with deeper personalities. Examples are endless.5.) Cash Cards for single player mode.6.) Be able to transfer money between characters.The multi character feature is innovative and fun unfortunately I won't live that long and have to start over making money for each character. I played for more than two hundred hours less than 20% story missions completed and made about $250 000 by mostly cab fairs and the stock market. Micheal was only recently available and have not played his character yet so you can only imagine how many cab fairs I must have done. Easily over 800 fairs. Its going to take me for ever to get far enough in the story missions to unlock the bussiness and property buying and vehicle collecting etc. Unless I find some kid to do the missions for me. At least I was able to purchase a garage for $30 000 to store my race cars and taxi cab. Still waiting to be able to buy the towing company so I can make money doing that for a change. The cab fairs are becoming repetative since I have taken it to the extreme.I could go on but time is limitted.From a leasure game player thank you Rockstar North for being part of the Open World concept.After thought Now that I have played over a thousand hours in the single player mode and some online my only hope is that GTA 6 doesn't take forever and has the option to run on lower range gaming systems like mine. Difficulty level in the missions was great once I found out I can pass a mission after my third try and still be able to progress in the game genius!

review: Edit Thanks Rockstar for listening to the internet. The gesture will always be greatly appreciated by the community.Loved the game the first time i played it on my PS3 and I decided to replay the game on PC only because of the mods Take 2's decision to block Open IV is one of the biggest blunders in gaming history. I have never played the game online and yet i decided to buy it on steam just to try out the mods. I have done the same for both GTA IV San Andreas and everey episode before that. One of the reasons why GTA survives on the shelf from one release to the other is because of these mods. It makes a different experience for the gamer everytime. I seriously hope they hear us and reconsider their decision to block modding it one of the key ingredients to what makes GTA....

review: Their is not much to say other than this game is still one of the exciting fun games I have played. I have played this game on both PS3 PS4 and I have now moved into the PC world of GTAV. With all the experience I have had with this game I can tell you it still holds and will probably still hold in the next few years. The only downside is I had to actually start from scratch again on GTA online since Rockstar discontinued the transfer process. However restarting your whole GTA online progress is still fun since as soon as you reach rank 120 what else is their to do? When I saw this game on the steam store I looked at the page and noticed that it had mixed reviews. Upon further inspection I noticed that the negative part of the review was due to the fact that the player could not mod which is not a justifiable reason to hate the game. (If you want to mod play a game that was actually meant for modding).

review: Easily one of the best games I've ever played. This game is fun exiting a good story teller and always has something to do. You never run out of activities the communithy is great and there is veruyu complex and itteresting characters with their own story and mindset. If there is something something wrong with this game is that when you're done you want more and more! 10/10 +Story+Characters +Dialogue +Community+Monthly DLC (not always amazing but they do care for their game)PS I'm reviewing this gmae based on its "vanilla" structure not how Take two treated it in the past.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: New Update did a terrible job of eliminating hackers and caused public outcry.The new vehicles and weapons released in Gunrunning are overpowered to say the least. Any player who isnt being given money by a person modding the game will be defenseless against APC Mobile Operations Centers and the like. Overall a negative experience when playing online.Story mode is fun for about 12 hours until after you complete the main story. Only when you've gained your riches do you find out that effectively none of the online content is in Story mode for you to play around with. Overall a negative singleplayer experience.Regardless to Rockstar's upsetting actions in the new update GTA V is still a unique game and has some upsides to playing it. I've logged over 450 hours on it and I'm still finding new things to do. Although playing online since the new update has been a hassle.If you are thinking of purchasing the game the choice is up to you but my experience has been generally negative.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Well what can I say. I originally bought GTA V when it came out for the PS3. The single player was great and the online play was fun until Rockstar said they will no longer provide the updates to PS3. Fast forward to now I figured I would pick up GTA for my PC cause the price seemed right and from what I read Rockstar had fixed the multiplayer modding. Well it would seem that it is still happening. When I was about to complete a mission all of a sudden where ever I stepped flames would shoot out of the ground (like the flames shooting out of a propane tank that was shot in the game). I was prepared to play the game and do the grind to get caught up to other players but not when modders make the game so unenjoyable. Hopefully Rockstar will have a better handle on their multiplayer ecosystem in future games.

review: 14th July 2017 It looks like Rockstar has convinced 2K to leave singleplayer modders alone for now. So unless anything negative happens with 2K getting too overzealous again I'll recommend the game.26th June 2017 Rockstar are supposedly in talks with 2K games about leaving singleplayer modders alone. Until it is officially confirmed my review will remain negative.Restrictive policies abandonning singleplayer in favor of a grind fest multiplayer that has earned over $500 Million while the CEO says they are under monetizing players. Since it isn't enough money they attacked singleplayer modding in order to push people to the multiplayer. GTA IV was incredibly fun with mods which were blocked in this game due to microtransactions and "fairness" (Most modding tools for GTA IV blocked multiplayer or just segregated modders silently). Rather than embrace the excellent modding community that has existed for most of the existence of the Grand Theft Auto and has vastly extended the life of the franchise they choose to attempt to eliminate it. They likely won't suceed in killing off modding but until their policy changes Take Two and Rockstar will see no more money from me. For the record I have bought GTA San Andreas three times GTA IV twice GTA III twice and all other PC titles once.Edited to fix me being an idiot and mistaking 2K for Take Two though 2K is owned by Take Two so still not buying from them

review: Single player story is alright I'd give it 8/10 (When I played it back on the Xbox 360 awhile ago)Online 7/10The Community as a whole 5/10Online is on the other hand is a very mixed sided set of coins one side it has alot of stuff to do and you can do alot of stuff to fill your time. Flip side to that coin it gets old rather quickliy as it tends to be the same thing over and over again. With that said Rockstar does do a good job to add more content to try and keep you interested.The selection of vehicles is really nice and there is always something being added to keeping your interests going. Also the level of customization you can put into the vehicles is also very nice. Some vehicles could be considered to abused depending on what sort of lobby you get into.The online can be fun on your own but in my opinion it's alot better with your friends or a group of people who you are cool playing with as it gives you more chances of doing fun things and generally being able to do stuff together which on your own may seem more like a waste of time or a long boring process.What I would say if you are going to get this game for just the online then you need to understand that the game has alot of hackers on it who will abuse their exploits to grief/bother you in many ways they can for example using god mode to be un kill able or to have unlimited ammo and even some vehicles which have weird and wonderful traits etc. The community as a whole for the game is a mixed nag of people you will find people who are cool to hang out with and to just play the game but you will also find the groups of people who act very un mature and very unsporting towards eachother and yourself for no reason or whatever reason feel etc you will also find those people who will abuse jets tanks helicopters and other vehicles of that nature to kill you over and over again regardless if you have done anything to them or not and usually they will keep doing it until you leave or get a reaction and then keep doing it.Even though it is an 18+ game unfortunately you find yourself having to deal with people under the age requirements.Overall with that said would I reccommend the game? yes? I guess but you need to keep all that in mind and if you can try to play with your friends or find a group of people who can play with.

review: Before we start let me just say that this game is really fun. If you have a bunch of friends to play it with I think this could be a good game. HOWEVER lets talk about the bad. First off loading times in this game are actually insane. It can take anywhere from 5 15 minutes to load into the world and you have to load into anything you do in the game. EVEN TAKING A SHOWER HAS A LOADING SCREEN! Rockstar has also made sure that it will take you a long time to get money in this game. You can get $20.000 $40 000 every 15 20 minutes in game modes during double money events. Another big issue is the modders. Rockstar doesn't care enough to deal with them so most servers have modders running around screwing up the server. Which wouldn't be a problem if you didn't have to be in a public server to do missions. All in all I think underneath all the garbage is a great game. 4/10 Would get chopper stomped by a modder again
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is either a hit or a miss. I'm saying that it is a hit because of the singleplayer story. It brings a lot of excitement that makes you want to do missions after missions. Also because of the multiplayer. Multiplayer or online mode gives a lot of fun and excitement you do heist rob a store join a race or be able to wreck havoc in the featured adversary modes. Now with the miss. I'm saying that this game is a miss because of the money it gives you after a long time playing this game. This game gives you only a little amount of money after you finish heists or by playing other modes. I could say for you to be able to buy a low end apartment you need to play atleast 4 or more heists to get one. One also are the cheaters of this game they ruin the game for you and for others just to satisfy theirs. And the shark cards are ssshhhh*t

The next morning I went to log on again and it said I was banned for a month with the character reset. Maybe they will fix their issues with steam/pc clients in the future but i wont assume it. For now I'll just take it as a single player game and say don't pay full price since you won't get the full experience.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is a game set within the fictional state of San Andreas which is based on Southern California and its developers has done a great job of replicating real world locations. The game is very well optimized as well compared to the previous title Grand Theft Auto IV which was such a disastrous game to run.The gameplay is quite fast paced gunplay feels fun and satisfying. Driving in this game stroke a minor controversy as it felt a bit too 'casual' compared to the previous major installment GTA 4. The graphics are phenomenal for an open world game and the level of detail in the world is incredible and the city feels very lively with a variety of NPC pedestrians scattered across the map The story is fun and well written. There are three led protagonists throughout single player and players can switch between them. Each of every mission in the game's story mode is unique so they don't feel very repetitive. When the story is over there really isn't much left to do however there are a number of activities in which you can engage in single player such as racing hanging out with your friends hunting down the wild life and playing sports but they're not as fun as they ought to be. GTA Online is probably the main reason why people get this game but in my opinion it barely has any redeeming qualities and I don't know why people are buying the game just for this. Firstly the concept of playing around in a huge open world with friends just simply sounds fun and it actually is surprisingly. There are a couple of things you can play in Online mode missions heists races and adversary mode which has a variety of game modes. But that's pretty much about it for the fun aspects of Online now for the cons. Online is very very grindy and is just pretty repetitive overall. Let's just say that you have a wish to buy a vehicle that costs around 2 million dollars (just a reference) which is pretty easy to get in single player but it's different Online. You will have to repeatedly do the same missions / heists / works over and over until you get enough money and by the time you get the vehicle you will feel a sense of satisfaction for a short while until you find another vehicle you want to get. Sure there are micro transactions called shark cards which add money into your character but for the price it's not worth it at all. Another negative of the Online mode is hackers they ruin the fun of the game and makes it worse especially when the game itself isn't much fun.To sum it up I think the game is pretty good especially the single player campaign but I do not think that it is worth spending $60 USD just for it and the multiplayer is trash in my opinion but do buy this on a sale if you have money to spare.

review: Great game honsetly. "Then why do you not recommend it?" I'll get to that..The story is really well thought out its interesting with "lovable" characters well as much as you can get attached to a psycho and 2 sociopaths. The map was made with care the weapons and cars are well done most of the time you get what you pay for.Now here is why i dont recommend it So after you finish the story (if you give a you turn to online. You log in yadi yada create a character that looks like it regrets being born. After you're put into a server after what felt like 50 minutes of waiting you instantly get killed by a degenerate wit (me) spamming stickies from a T20 (also me) you finally notice the little green notification requesting players for a heist you join either get kicked because you're a level 1 or they're just happy that they finally got players and start. You somehow manage to finish it you get your first 20k as it was only a setup you dont know how to spend it or what to spend it on so you buy a car and put all the upgrades in that you can. Gets blown up obviously. It's 2 A.M and you have exams tomorrow so you go to sleep. Wake up at 6 you had 4 hours of sleep deem it good enough you open the game try to get into online but the following message is presented to you " off you're banned we wont tell you why. No we dont give a please buy the game again if you wish to play online".You put in an appeal for the ban the ticket gets deemed as resolved and you get a message that says &amp quot off kid we told you that we dont give a "You uninstall the game because after you finished the story for the 15th time it gets boring and you have literaly done everything imagineable. The game sits there Then you decide to write a review.Overall? Great game... support but unless you get banned you hardly have any reason to complain a? Well unless you dont mind the grind that is the online.Cheers for reading )

review: My original review is preserved underneath This updated review is tough to make but it's on the basis that on balance I wouldn't recommend this game any more mostly because of Rockstar's attitude to it.By all means get the game for the singleplayer content because it's a fantastic story line and one of Rockstar's best. The mechanic for jumping between characters to progress their parts of the story or to give another angle on a particular mission they team up on is quite inspired.What ruins the game is the online component and Rockstar's attitude to it and the game in general. There's a lot of fun to be had in GTA Online initially but it quickly devolves into a grind. Rockstar offers in game money for ludicrous real world prices and as a result trying to save money to purchase nice content (more of which gets added every few months of course) requires either a ridiculous amount of grinding or spending the game's value again in "shark cards" to buy in game money.This relationship with GTAO's currency also means that since launch the only real focus for Rockstar has only been on multiplayer content and primarily focusing on buying new things in order to get you to buy more currency. The online heists were fun but no new ones appear to have been added (because that would mean you could get new content without buying currency). Having to pay ridiculous amounts of money for new content or grind like hell isn't really fun.Additionally hacking is rife in public lobbies and hackers will do anything from blowing you up teleporting you trapping you giving you money (which seems like a perk until Rockstar bans you not the hacker for it) and just randomly screwing around with stuff. Moderation is otherwise virtually non existant.Finally Rockstar seems to have a love hate relationship with modders invariably banning modders and their users from online parts of the game for using mods to enhance single player content.The Singleplayer is fun but it's not going anywhere if you want to play for that get the game on sale. GTAO is a toxic wasteland which Rockstar profits from and has no real intention of cleaning up to make a truly enjoyable experience. Don't give them money for that. Original review This story starts with a cat and how curiosity killed it....I've enjoyed playing through the GTA V story so far but the event that stuck with me the next day probably wasn't intended by the scriptwriters. Instead the fate of one cat set loose many questions.The event in question happens just after taking control of Franklin before you steal a couple of supercars. A couple of cats are hanging around in the back garden of the property you're about to steal the cars from. As a cat person I naturally approach the cats to see how they behave and if they could be interacted with. The simple answer was no Franklin clearly had no intention of touching the cats and after trying to get close to one of them a few times the cat got spooked.What I didn't entirely expect were the events that happened next. The cat bolted out of the alleyway by which point I was busy getting Franklin involved in his caper. However I was promptly distracted by a soft "thud" and the cursing of a truck driver. Looking up I saw the truck slowly pulling away leaving behind a small furry corpse that just moments ago had been at my feet.I didn't have much time to mourn at the time but looking back on it I can't help feel some remorse over my involvement in the (virtual) animal's death nor slightly affected by Franklin's indifference. It makes me wonder when such a dynamic event occurs how deep the simulation really goes. I know it's unlikely but I wonder for a minute if there was a family waiting for that cat to return. Would I start seeing "Missing Cat" signs in the neighbourhood? Was the truck driver emotionally affected by the experience?The answer to these is probably no but perhaps one day this is something a more deeper simulation will hypothesise.Until then the memory of the cat I accidentally killed will probably stay with me throughout my playthrough. There's probably some irony that a game that necessarily has you kill hundreds of human beings intentionally could affect me more by making me complicit in the accidental death of an animal.

review: 2/23/18I played this game online and offline for years and enjoyed it very much.Then today for no reason that I can fathom RockStar Games suddenly suspended my Online GTA account for 30 days after which they say it will be reset instantly erasing all the years and hours I've spent earning money buying cars and properties and building up my characters.I have never modded and I'm not someone who goes around spewing hate speech or messing with people.I have no idea what led to this nor am I able to even ask or appeal the suspension in any way.So I guess just like that I am done playing Grand Theft Auto (at least online anyway).Needless to say I will NEVER be buying another RockStar game again after this.

review: UPDATED STORY MODE excellent hands down one of the best story modes I have played. Now to what ruined rockstar and made them greedy and what ruined the game. BUT NOT DLC for story mode which also aids in this games neg. review.GTA ONLINE FIRST if you buy this game just stay away from online. From the start of gta online when they launched it A MONTH after the game came out it was full of problems then the glitchers came then the modders. FAST FOWARD Today modders are out of control soo much rockstar lets a machine decide now who gets banned. YES is does ban a lot of actual cheaters but at the same time it takes people that hasn't cheated. Support is useless you will just get a machine that says bans are final same goes for their phone buy instead of machine you a very rude person that will hang up on you.ROCKSTAR IS GREEDY Ever since rockstar added shark cards to online they have become very greedy if you look at everytime that was out when online first launched to todays dlc prices there is a huge gap will small payout increases.IN SHORT I give this game a poor review because of no story dlc online unplayable because of modders and ban machine poor support from rockstar and rockstar getting more greddy.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game feels like San Andreas pumped up on Vice City drugs the hype is real but sadly so are the amount of modders.as i probably assume that Rockstar works hard to remove all these problems it seems that they might want to invest more into these issues instead of releasing new contents all servers long i see people asking for money and getting money drops. Aside from this the game offers a true experience story wise as well as offline you get to feel what its like to be part of a movie experience i can see all the love that went into creating this game and it is by far a masterpiece on the singleplayer experience. Sadly wished it was more but i am human and we always want more. As for the offline experience it has so much to do and should have focused on more story driven heists (which might just be my personal opinion) GTA V Story mode overall score would be 8.5/10GTA V Offline mode overall score would be 8.0/10 I can't degrade the game just for its attackers as the game is really promising and offers many fun. The community itself might need some improvement and preferable servers people can select since its either 50% existing out of foreign speaking countries who don't or can't cooperate. and the ridiculous long loadings and queuing.Take those away and you get yourself a 10

review: After recent updates this game is a must buy. I reset my account and started over and im slowly making my way up the criminal market DThe story is probably one of the best video game storylines out in THE ENTIRE INDUSTRY.Now i will of course not focus only on the positive. If you are new and don't have much money many rich people will mess with you. It is frustrating but thankfully you can just join a private session and make money there. Honestly that is the only major flaw i can think of wait a second... that can't be right! HACKERS! now rockstar has recently been striking hard against hackers but some people will still make it trough to ruin your experience. Now that is the only two major flaws i can think off. It is fun when you are having an epic car chase. It is fun when you are transporting a prison bus and people come after you only to get blown up by one of your sticky bombs and you see them rage in the chat. It is just so epic whenever you have a dogfight with someone on high altitude and you get to show of those awesome moves you have been practicing in singleplayer.Despite the high price you should buy the game. And if you after this review are still feeling unsure wait for a sale to buy it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single player is decent. It was cool and fun the first time I played through it. Now it just seems overdone and try hard. I don't mean the gameplay or graphics those are top notch. I mean the story itself and the crude references to our soceity. Bashing Western civilization was fun when I was a teenager who didn't know my from a hole in the ground but now it's boring and r e t ar d ed!.The online is pure cancer. You can grind for weeks but you'll still only have enough money to MAYBE buy an expensive car or bike. They keep releasing new content that is too expensive. And the content itself? Pure crap. Not even fun. The only real fun you'll have online is with actual friends or going solo in an invite only session. The heists were fun... those couple times I was actually able to keep a team together and FINISH one.Sorry Rockstar but you pushed it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Amazing Story mode extensive online mode... ing splendid. On online I have spent over 1 100 hours across all platforms (PS4 Xbox360 And PC). The DLC in this game for the most part is great and is free... But the items tend to be worth a lot of in game cash (GTA$) and at times you find that you need to use the microtranscations which in my opinion should not be in the game as it has influenced certain patches on functions of the game (I.E Rooftop Rumble payout decreased and difficulty increased) though through all that nonesense this game is a must have for me. The DLC has also been getting better as of late ever since they dropped last generation console support for DLC.Edit After Rockstar has banned modding singleplayer I can no longer support this game and tell people to buy it this absolutely ridiculous. Modding has been a part of GTA since this series started and to shut down OpenIV after all the years?! I can't support Rockstar or Take Two in the new direction there heading with all the microtransactions and the Anti Modder outlook they have on the commuinity.Edit 2 Since Rockstar has agreed to let OpenIV resume its business I am reccomended this game again but be cautious because Rockstar's higher ups are changing and the new business men have been a lot more greedy lately.

review: One of the best single player experiences out there! GTA never fails to amaze me with the level of detail at which they render the world. You'll see something different every time you play. Online is fun with friends and a nightmare in public lobbies. The entire system needs to be streamlined to reduce the number of loading screens and get you connected with friends faster. Aside from that it's as fun as you would expect. The missions aren't as detailed as they are in the single player story and it can get grindy trying to raise the funds necessary to buy cool stuff. No other game ticks all the boxes like GTA.
