review: All of these bad reviews are a response to a sale they didnt like... This is the best Grand Theft Auto yet. It is gorgeous and the vehicles handle better than ever before.... the free aim system is still lacking but when a company puts so much into one game it's hard to seriously nit pick. The story kept me playing and while it is well written it isn't anything special but thats ok... It is compelling enough to keep you interesting... Heists are cool even though the build up is kind of boring. Plenty of stuff to do in this game. If you like the series you will like this game. 8/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand theft Auto V Where to start?Campaign The story is great the open world enviroment and 3 choosable characters are exciting as you go through missions and discover their past and present deals friends backgrounds and abilities. They spot light of the campaign is the almost neverending side missions for each character which are exciting to play through after you finished the main missions and got bored (if you ever will D). You have a lot of option of spending your money for example Real estate cars stocks boats clothes guns and so on. The campaign is the best i've played in a while.Multiplayer There are Pros and Cons with multiplayer and mostly there are cons.Pros.The expanded enviroment of races multiplayer missions clothes cars and such. The heist clubs and companies that you can create with your friends is great.Cons.The requirement to play missions with players or friends it's often hard to find players or friends that are willing to do these missions with you. The heist system is not good often times you get paired up with players and maybe it's good for them it's not good for other higher skilled players because almost always they have to be mentored..The money system is okay sadly a lot of cars planes boats clothes real estate and races aren't available in singleplayer. I Definitely recommend the Singleplayer not so much the multiplayer.

review: Great game. However there is an occasional bug in single play mode whereby when you invest in stocks your investment isn displayed in your portfolio. In fact it the money you've invested just disappears completely. This has resulting in some irritating game reloads.Also the game's online mode gets tiresome very quickly. Servers issues in which the connection keeps dropping are bad enough. But juvenile hackers and modders always have the upper hand and tend to pick on new players. They have all the advantages in terms of money and weaponry so you can forget having any advantage over them unless you're willing to waste 20+ on rip off shark cards that give you in game money.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single player is great fun with the hilarious trademark satire. Nice looking game. Good music. Controls are more console biased but played on KB/mouse just fine (competitve driving requires gamepad IMO). Various funny but flawed characters and 3 very different protaganists with a good interwinding story across the beautiful backdrop of Los Santos. Multiplayer is mostly fun. Cheats/modders are very common &amp annoying. But if you solider on the co op missions &amp heists are what i enjoyed the most from it despite this. With a little free roaming on the servers.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I think I would probably have been able to say something nice about this game if I could play it. I think A LOT of people would say wonderful things if they could play it. However that isnt the case. As for me I am waiting for some kind of response from Rockstar on my support ticket that was submitted 35 hours ago. There hasn't really been even a recognition of the crashing launcher problem. Pretty new to buying games and first time buying anything from Rockstar and now I haven't even been able to open the game.Not the best launch. I am happy for those who have been able to play this game but wouldn't suggest anyone purchase it until it is fixed.Side note Once this is fixed I feel like I will most likely change my ratingOnce the game was fixed... awesome... lots o fun

review: Update Like mostly everyone else the ban on the modding tool OpenIV is just cancerous. Its like the complete opposite of what gta was about before. The huge modding scene just got killed. There was a multiplayer mod on gta san andreas called MTA sa. MTA was amazing for the time. All servers were created from scratch by the community and all was moddable and you could do whatever you wanted it created the best racing game for me. I created so much with it !Now we have the complete opposite. We go from an amazing creative modding platform (which was the previous gta games before) to an eating money machine. This is one of the best example of modern triple A bull***hit. I must put a red on that one as a modder myself.Edit Change has been made for the good modding tool is back again legally______________________________________________________________________Old review and the meat of it if we forget that absurdity above Did not bother the GTA Online section of it still.However can talk about the Story which is the best GTA Solo to date.The missions are amazingly interesting in term of setup and gameplay change.I mean the missions are really diversified. I really like the pace of starting criminally slow and then Trevor comes.Game is like San andreas HD the city is completely different tho which is cool.The place is alive People doing contextual action animals in woods lot of little activities when you are not on mission.GTA V is beautiful big Technically a gem long Diversified ofc cant argue with that !On the other hand every game has holes in it. There's mostly 2 things that I dont like The way the player is handled he handles like a tank really similar to GTA 4. Example if your on a ledge and you turn back you will fall. The ragdoll can sometimes kick in for small raisons and you lose the control. I must say that the ragdoll is funny tho.The other reaison is even if the firefights are mostly easy the mission fail are sometimes too strict aka failing just because you exit the mission car or the police touch you but you must not attract cops attention. You cant expand the creativeness too far and must follow the mission rules.

review: Right I won't mention funky modding policies and other stuff in this review I want to focus on gameplay.GTA V main story mode was quite good I enjoyed it but I would call it a bit short? Also very few mission where you can actually control 3 main characters. Other than that it was really great at the time.GTA V Online as it is right now (2017) is a giant sandbox. Lots of it is locked behind levelling system and high prices.Levelling up system just bad. Because you are new you will have to jump truth so many loops and now when every player has guided missile/armoured vehicles only thing you can do is run. Don't even try to meet other players until you can afford rocket launcher. Prices are steep. My best advice is to take it slow set up objectives and just try and do that by having fun.My biggest complaint the elephant in the room that Co op is terrible. after every mission your group gets disbanded you need to manually re join your friends world ask him to re invite etc... Loading time is also really long especially when you have to re join your friend every so now. I had like 20 "lifetime" promotions to specific rank each day. Also if you are working with your friend to support his "business" then wow... business owner will get 80% of the cut while you who did the same amount of work maybe more will get something like 10%? GTA V online is so punishing to play with friends that I would suggest to play it as single player and avoid working for other as it is so unrewarding. GTA 5 please make proper "guild" style system where players could work together to progress. create a party system where one "captain" could initiates activity with his group first and then invite others. How can Online game feel so single playerish?
title: Grand Theft Auto V

You can race against other players or AI and you can also do very difficult Coop missions and Team Deathmatches. But the gameplay is very hard and punishing. (especialy the races.) And GTA online has the loooongest Loading times ever! 50% waiting and 50% playing thats what you get. If you want to get depressed Buy this game.

review: Hi Fellow gamers So what does your money buy with GTA5. I haven't played another game that would allow me to steal a car make it my own in very sense live the high life and all that it encompasses Hire hookers and strippers get drunk till you pass out and die. Rob Banks Commit unspeak acts against your fellow man. So whats not to like? Here is where it gets really wierd for me. The game is based on letting the player commit any act of unspeakable depravity he or she would like but if you shoot or interfere with other players to much you are PUNISHED LOL. If you kill to many civilians your mental state rises? The game in that way sends the strangest signal. Then we come to my favorite part. I have been a computer gamer since the 80s. I don't remember a game in recent memory including both Dayz and Dayz Standalone that had this many glitches and I mean serious jacked up no messing around glitches. If you make friends with another player as I have your game could crash untold number of times trying to join there game. Hacking and Modding is on an epic scale. Its the strangest thing in the world to sell a game for 60 dollars plus and to have issues on this level. So here I sit with this game it's like the girlfriend that you always liked but annoyed the heck out of you in the end you couldn't decide whether to break up or marry. My message to all would be buyers. GTA5 is like the SEA you love her but don't turn your back on her because she has a kitchen knife.

review: newbs perspectiveso yeah i haven't ever really played or got into the previous GTAs with all of the news and gaming entertainment coverage i was able to get a grip on what it was all about but never had much of an interest in the whole sandbox style "game".i got GTA5 chee op beeyotch. and i'm having a LOT of fun! there's a TON of stuff to do in an amazingly buzzing city that is so damn close to a real city that it's a little bit scary. i mean the detail is mindblowing (i know small explosion) i can't stop taking screenshots of all of the different environments (driving flying helicopting? scuba diving bicycling dirt biking tanking etc). they have you do it all. you CANNOT get bored in this game although there is a serious lack of fast travel. i do wish that i didn't have to drive so damn much thankfully the driving is kinda fun as well so it isn't too bad....perfecting acting super crass joking in just about everything like advertisements and TV shows. the craziness of the missions will always surprise you... i'm running out of nice things to say now. technically the game runs smoooth. i'm running at full blast 3440x1440 with "ultra" settings and it rarely dips below 60fps which is insane considering how much stuff is getting rendered out. i don't play online so i guess that's why this review won't have a lot of negative comments it seems like there's a very mixed feeling going on in these reviews. get it on sale when you can. 60 bucks is insane regardless of the game.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Update 5 Goodbye Grand Theft Auto and this is the last straw. ICYMI a GTA Youtuber (Broughy1332) got banned on all platforms (PC PS4 XBOX) for no reason after speaking out against ol' Cuckstar and Take 2 Much and the new DLC. In case you don't know Broughy specializes in vehicle testing and uses his testing to inform players on what not to waste their hard earned money on. It seems like this multi billion dollar company can't take a little criticism so it decides to abuse its power to silence a critic. Welcome to Grind Theft Auto where the inflation is extreme and the ruling company is fascist.Update 4 New DLC released Doomsday Heists and as usual everything is expensive af. If you have a group of friends who play regularly and you guys can handle the newly added griefing tools and you guys can spend 5+ hours a day grinding away then the DLC isn't too bad (60% of the heists are actually fun). You want an amazing flying Delorean from Back to the Future? Well that'll be 5 million GTA$ or 60 Dollars in sharkcards or about 15 hours of grinding! It's not ok when a hacker explodes everyone on the server but it is ok if you buy a 900K orbital strike canon alongside your 2 million dollar facility and spend 500K per shot exploding random people on the server. Bad things are good as long as Cuckstar can make a buck or 2 from it. The gaming community stood up against EA and its bs with Battlefront II maybe it's time to make some noise again.Update 3 Good news is I've been banned. Bad news is facking Strauss facking Zelnick (CEO of Take 2) said that every game they release now (Take 2 R* 2K) will have "recurrent consumer spending" (microtransactions) because that's how they make money now. Looks like RDR2 will be a facking mess like GTA O and looks like this is goodbye T2 goodbye R* and goodbye 2K. I'll still pirate your games not play them (maybe except BDL3) and delete them afterwards though.Update 2 So R* just decided to remove about 23 million of my hard grinded money and you know in some ways I'm glad because I was getting tired of the grind anyways. I've also downloaded a hack so hopefully R* catches me soon so I don't have to open Online ever again. Single player is still fun with mods but I guess R* doesn't care because single player doesn't drive shark card sales and who knows with all that take2 openIV bvllshit that happened a while back who knows if the next GTA will even support modding. Goodbye R* hope RDR2 fails and that you'll never make a good game ever again.Update 1 Everything in this DLC will cost at least 48 million GTA$ or about 700$ in shark cards or about 100 hours of grinding. So yeah for the first time ever I'd rather have paid DLCs than this t.R* may have changed their view on single player modder and allowed OPENIV to continue existing (or they did so for damage control). But they clearly have not changed their minds on monitization. Yes new DLC is "free" but if you look at the latest update it adds 19 new vehicles (9 of which are unaccessible and will be drip fed until christmas) new aircraft hangers new planes. All of that is cool but everything is locked behind a pay wall. If you want to buy the new planes (which rnage from 600k to 5 million) you need to buy the new hangers (which is like 2 million) and if you want to upgrade your new planes you'll need to buy a workshop (1 million) on top of the hanger so you'll have spent at least 3 million before you can buy the new planes (3 million is equal to about 6 hours of non stop grinding or about 50$ in shark cards) then you decide to buy the new jet which is 5 million dollars well guess what that's another 10 hours of grinding or 100$ in shark cards with 3 million left to buy some gliders. The prices of the new content is absurdly high and unless you enjoy grinding or want a second job on top of your current occupation (student or whatever it maybe) I'd stay the hell away from this game.

review: RIP GTA. I think soon I will completely drop the game. And for sure I am never ever buying anything targeted at multiplayer from rockstar again no matter how good it is. Probably will download a pirated game when it appears but developers' attitude to players is not worth paying them money.Single may be okay. I don't like GTA singleplayer and I got mine just to play multiplayer.And... multiplayer sucks a55. It takes AGES to load and connect. You will spend up to 10 minutes waiting to enter multiplayer (normally it takes less of course but not less than 5 minutes) Missions (and free mode too but that's not critical) sometimes just throw you away into separate session. Means you are still online it just disconnects you from the heist and it is failed because you "left". And your and your team's time is wasted. Awful interface and user interaction. Be ready that in a situation while you need something quickly it will behave oddly. Cheaters are everywhere. Prepare for that. Obviousely they are fighting cheaters as there are fewer of them now but they are still there.Seriousely if you're expecting for multiplayer fun better don't bother it's multiplayer is not worth a penny. The MP game is awesome from many aspects but it just does not let you enjoy it because of often disconnects and long loading time. I think about 10% or more time I spent in this game were spent waiting for it to load restart and connect. And another 10% spent in missions that failed because someone got disconnected for a second or two and thrown away from session (while the internet connection was always stable as we were voicespeaking in discord all the time...)After playing GTAV Online it felt so strange for me that other games multiplayer JUST WORK seamlessly (and even if other games disconnect you that's still SEAMLESS compared to GTAV behavior) and are enjoyable.It feels like the developers just do not care much about multiplayer. Well they DO care adding a lot of stuff you can purchase in game but it feels like that they're encouraging us to buy virtual ingame money. Of which this game is clearly not worth.UPD Well okay half year has passed. Now with new addons some super expensive imbalanced things are at play. Various superweapons that cost tens of millions literally. The only way to get them is by donating. And 50 usd donation does not give you much only 8 millions which is nothing with the prices for MP stuff. Of course there's ways to grind those but that would take weeks of grinding.Prepare to be killed by cheaters ones who donated 300 usd and ones who have no life with new superb weapons you have no access to!Welcome to a 60 bucks free to play game!UPD2 Oh when we thought it could not be worse rockstars immediately prove us wrong! New heist needs us to purchase expensive stuff (there's a paywall) + new update has an orbital strike feature to simply immediately destroy anything you want which makes it a legit griefing tool.If you think you will have fun in multiplayer and are planning to buy it avoid this game it is no longer worth the money by any means.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

This open world sand box can be enjoyed through the storyline or perhaps your like me and slip off into the occassional daydream (aka a killing spree with an insatiable appetite in which i am only awakened from when i die and realize "hey that's not where i was supposed to be going"). Either way you will be more than satisfied with this epic saga. I can't wait to see what they do with their next installation fo this game!!!

review: Take Two the publisher of this game (and pretty much the owner of the series) has decided to sent a C&amp D letter to the team behind OpenIV the multitool required to unpack modify and repack files used for the multiple and creative mods on this game and its predecesor GTA IV.the fact they are pulling this after DECADES of just looking away on people modding the Grand Theft Auto games. (they not even reacted like this when the Hot Coffee hell broke loose) and the fact this kinda coincides with Bethesda stubborn push to paid mods seems to confirm that they are probably looking at the same end as Bethesda to capitalize what for decades have been a free perk of PC Gaming.DONT SUPPORT THE MONETIZATION OF SOMETHING THAT SHOULD BE FREE.DO NOT BUY THIS GAME UNTIL THEY REVERSED THEIR STUPID DECISION. UPDATEThey reversed their moronic decision. you are free to buy this game the story mode is good. and the visual area is stunning to say the less

review: After playing Grand Theft Auto V on PC for just over 100+ Hours I feel it has been a big improvement from what they had on the PlayStation 3 and XBOX 360. I don't usually write reviews for games however I wish to try it out for a few games I have listed the 'Pro's and Con's' of the game. Pros Smooth gameplay providing you have the requirements needed Most bugs being fixed frequently New and immersive features e.g. First Person Large selection of things to do in Grand Theft Auto Online Cons Very long loading screens (Particular to entering GTA Online) A lot of money required to get anywhere in GTA Online A lot of connectivity issues Saved files when regarding Singleplayer get corrupted and remove themselves (This may just be my PC)

review: As i haven't played the single player much i will focus on reviewing GTA Online.GTA has a massive open world with plenty of interactions. After a large number of free DLC's it now has even more content. Some of which i find sort of pointless but certainly also some stuff i think is quite nice. I wish it had more heists which is a high level mission in several parts. However heists do require a group of 4 friends as playing with random strangers can suck. Online however has an issue with loading screens which are frequent and looooong. I play on a brand new gaming PC on a 250/250 mbit fiber connection but it still takes several minutes for load screens that crop op a lot more than you would tihnk is necessary.Overall a very nice game with plenty of content to keep everyone entertained but with stupid flaws that i have no idea how they havent fixed. Still highly recommended.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game has been my life for so long. I rememeber launch day on the Xbox 360. I was so excited to play this game and all of its epicness it holds and then GTA Online came out... GTA Online has been where most of my memories have come from with all of my friends like landing on the Maze Bank building with a Titan flying so high into the air and everyone jumping from the plane and sky diving so the floor and seeing who can pull the parachute last and ending up all splatting on the floor dying with laughter. This game has and always will be one of my favorite game to ever play and I hope everyone who gets this game has the same amazing experience as I did. 10/10. Would Play Again

review: The game is great but not without problems.GTA Online is a great game to play with your friends you can also find a lot of people to have fun with but you'll mostly find yourself running away from s in jests and attack helis.With the introducition of the Doomsday heist DLC we also have to deal with orbital cannon which can trace you in a heli jet etc.Another downside of GTA Online is Rockstar's overpricing of the new content which is understandable for things like a stealth tank or attack heli but making a regular car cost over 2mln GTA$ is just not okay when you get about 300k for a heist.On the bright side you have a lot of races missions heists parachute jumps deathmatches etc.In addition with this year's DLCs you have a lot more ways of making money but they require a lot of work if you're alone (Biker's stuff CEO crates exporting cars weapon manufacturing and air freight missions.)If you're not interested if the multiplayer I'm sure you know about the story mode and i don't have to talk about it so I'll just say it's' great even though I haven't played it a lot on PC.Overall if You don't want to waste your money on shark cards and have more fun then just driving around in a stolen car getting killed by s on public session bring some friends it's a lot more fun to play and you can make money easier and faster.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

I just really wish Take Two would bite the bullet and do some singleplayer DLC already but whatever.

review: To start off I really don't want to make this review but im so dissapointed in Rockstar that I feel the need to do so.GTA Online when it first came out was to put it simply fantastic. It was tons of fun to play on my ps3 with my friends. Once I got it on P.C. I enjoyed it so much more. This was in my top 5 games for the longest time. But now it has become one of my least. Rockstar ed this game up. They became to focused on people buying micro dlc (I.e. Shark Cards) rather than helping the player base enjoy the game. Every update that comes out is such a boring repetitive grind. It takes a amount of time to get anything you want. Hell some of the new cars are upwards of a million dollars and for the most part they really aren't worth it. The only ways you can get a majority of items in GTA is to either buy Shark Cards or getting hacker money. I may be wrong but if I remember correctly the most money you can make legitely in an hour is around 400 450k. Since new cars are around 1.5 mil you may have to grind for just short of 4 hours for 1 car. This is why I never understand people who say "Just play the game work for it". The fact of the matter is that most people don't have enough free time to spend a few hours everyday to get some of the new Unless you are a Youtuber/Streamer for GTA or you dont go to school/work then you can get these items fairly soon after the update comes out without getting modded money or Shark Cards.All I wish that rockstar would do is make this game reasonable to play again. Either a more effective and fun way of grinding out money or start making everything cheaper. Casual gamers really can't play this game anymore. It makes me sad because this game to me was very casual in nature when it was released but now it has become such a hardcore grind that it doesn't seem worth it at this point.My last note on this game is the ridiculous amount of hackers that are in the game. Rockstar doesnt seem to give a damn about them they care more about getting modded money off acounts than banning those that mod the money in. These hackers/modders what ever you want to call them often ruin the experience for players who simply want to play with their friends.Rcokstar. Fix your This game was fantastic but now it's just not fun to play anymore. Its to much of a boring grind that is such a waste of time. I can't recommend this game to anyone anymore. It just isnt worth the money
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Take Two should not have the ability to stop something that even the developers have previously encouraged (Rockstar have even shared mods before on social media).Many people bought the game because of what modding can bring to it. Many only still play to this day because of the longevity that modding brings to games.It is a very clear cash and power grab by Take Two and not speaking up could influence other publishers to do the same thing in order to try and milk their customers for more money.It's a brilliant game whose publishers have killed a large percentage of the playerbase for a quick cash in with hopes of increasing sales of microtransactions.

review: I tell you what....The singleplayer brings an interesting criminal story filled with scripted action and twists. Well I guess it's a must for every gamer who respects him or herself. I enjoyed that it's perfectly done it delivers you a lot of freedom and shows you some new ways of amusement and entertainment inside virtual world. Great job R* this was 9/10 that 1 point is taken away for... I dunno this game lacks something but it's too well done so it's 9.5/10...Now the multyplayer....Yes it's true there are cheaters (here they are called "modders"). Yes they ruin all the game process. Yes this is annoying. Yes the puiblic community is cancerish. Yes there are jerks and meta gamers. Yes today you gotta grind to get the best of DLCs.However I can't stop enjoying GTAO. It's awesome. First of all you can always join a GTA gang and play with adequate people on gang servers. It's okay there to compete it's okay there to cooperate. So just get to it!Secondly missons and grinding with a friend or two is awesome. I play GTAO with my gf... Well she is not much of a shooter but she was happy to buy luxury appartments clothes for both of us and she also is a good driver so she helped me out many times with resupplies for my bunker. We are running 2 orgs now. She rules Los Santos I Sandy Shores. Helping each other and fighting some... bad NPCs is nice. Best criminal co op RPG with open world cars and guns customizations and much more. With friends it always seems not that bad. This one feels awesome!Co op missons heists competitions money now you can share it!

review: I finished the game. Trevor is still my #1. Phillips Industries for life fool.This game features a beautiful set of graphics in a huge world that takes you far beyond the reaches of your imagination. I found myself getting immensely lost in the game for hours. Playing singleplayer before online was a great plan for me because it helped me really immerse myself in Los Santos and become familiar with the streets so I could navigate myself without the map so I recommend you do that.I also got really attached to the characters. At first I was not a fan of Trevor Phillips. He was rude crude and downright despicable. The more I played his storyline and learned more about him however the more I grew to like him as a character despite his insanity and horrific criminal activities. Upon playing the very beginnings of the game I had decided Franklin was my favorite. He was cool! He did cool stuff! Indeed he proved himself valuable throughout the story and I can't deny he's still pretty awesome. Michael is pretty awesome too and I really like how dedicated to his family he is even though he's a little bit crazy from all the crime...but he made it work in the end. If you made me choose a favorite I think I would go with Trevor but the other two are a close tie for second.There were a few people I got to kill that I was really happy about killing.Oh and I chose the best ending "choice C" and I'm glad I did.

review: PROS Fan online and singleplayer missions and experience. You get to play as multiple characters in Story mode rather than needing various games/DLC to get each story. Great detail on the lore environment and vehicles. The vehicles are really cool R* interpretations of real world vehicles.CONS Story mode never received support after the game released. Some bugs may persist. Lack of any DLC for the story mode that R* hinted at coming before the game was actually released and the lack of R*s interest in putting time into this. Online can be hit or miss. Not all servers are set equally. Hackers still exist and run through causing issues. While they have patched many glitches and bugs for Multiplayer they seem to not focus on the bigger issues and focus on fixing things that aren't causing issues. R* also has an extremely poor methodology for dealing with hacker/cheaters. Though that may improve in the future. Microtransactions are tedious and a bit lame. If the whole point of Online is to grind missions to earn money microtransactions are a way to 'cheat' your way up the ladder by paying real money for fake money to buy gear and vehicles. Another big con has been Rockstars parent company TakeTwoInteractive. T2 not that long ago took a very strong action against the modding community with a Cease and Desist legal order against the company behind OpenIV. T2 claimed OIV was the tool used by online modders to cheat and cause other players issues. Whether or not this is true it was not due to the OIV developers intentionally making their tools to do that. Normal use of OIV and mods in Story mode prevent you from going Online with the modified game. It was the dev behind Menyoo that was the actual culprit as a paid Menyoo tool existed that could be used to hack the online session and cheat the system. Because of this singleplayer modding was in an unknown area of legality. This has negatively impacted the modding community that has done nothing to cheat Online merely wanting to improve SP since R* has ignored that side of their game since release day. It was this asinine legal action that caused a spam flood of negative reviews of GTAV. This was done during the time to let R* know that we as consumers will not tolerate being punished for things we have not done. OVERALL This is a decent game with a very much alive Online component that is always being updated. Though story mode has been neglected by R* and if you want to ever just run amok make a copy of an unmodified GTAV folder so that you have a clean one to go online with and a second one for modding the story mode to do whatever you want to against the games AI. Don't expect much support from R* and be sure to keep a close eye on your online account details so that if something happens you can ensure you have proof.

review: I am giving this game a 7.5/10... Okay so this game is a MAJOR upgrade from GTA 4. This is mostly played for online i havent played the campaign yet but i will update this when i do. In terms of the online i think this game is okay. One major problem is the modders.. Some are okay and will stop if you ask Some will rank you up give you money crash your game spawn NPC's stuck on you give you all guns spawn cars. And some are cool in a way where they will make a race for you. But i think the modders need to be dealt with. This game also has one major fault... In order to buy say a mobile operations base (semi truck with the trailer base thing) you MUST own a bunker. The cheapest bunker is 1.2 mil.. plus over one mil for the MOB (Mobile Operation Base).. it almost makes this game feel p2w (Pay to Win)..Then when some guy is flying at you in his delorean and your in your Lambogini that costs 5k to get back from the insurance co. it gets annoying... It also takes a while to be put in a session. And then when you finally load in theres an annoying modder and you wait a while to find a new session. If you also meet the right people you can have friends.. I met at least 3 people so far willing to help me make money (legitly) show me the stuff they have such as cars air vehicles and more. Then others dont even care and just throw a sticky bomb on your car and KABOOM you gone..... And don't get me started on the cops..... Also NPC's driving they will cut out infront of you and your nice new shiny million dollar car you just got is wrecked.....I think that Rockstar needs to (no matter how long or hard they have to try) get rid of modders... I know they are trying their best right now.. Also lower prices for ingame stuff... I am saying yes i recommend this game because i have it above 5.. I did get the game on sale. If you don't feel like paying $60 for it then wait for the next sale.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Today I Ran around the city wearing only underpants old style pilot hat goggles and a flasher coat. Robbed a corner store at gunpoint and shot the owner for fun. Twice. Car jacked several people and sold their vehicles at a crooked auto shop. Sniped countless randoms in the head from a great distance for no reason. Bought a variety of firearms without a license or paperwork and killed more random people. Snuck up on someone who was not paying attention and beat them with a hammer. Then again with a pool cue. Went to the strip club paid for dances from 3 different strippers and touched them when management wasn't looking. Enjoyed back alley shenanigans with a hooker I picked up in my stolen ride. Checked up on my lucrative weed methamphetamine and cocaine businesses robbing supplies for each on the way.After doing all of this I went home and played GTA V Online the best game of all time. Practice makes perfect.

review: EDIT 7/10/17 OpenIV is back it'll be interesting to see how things will go from here on out. My review will not change as the whole modding debacle is what finally pushed me into writing a review.I've been playing GTA V since release day first on the PS3 and then on the PC. Online started out fun and then just turned into a mess. With the introduction of team based missions where everyone had to cooperate a significant part of the community turned into trolls who would intentionally fail just to ruin everyone elses fun. That mixed with the hackers increasing in numbers and non hacking players getting banned for other hackers' doings I quit playing online entirely and stuck to modding offline just to get my kicks. Today I noticed that OpenIV recieved a cease and decist letter and decided to shut down their mod. After reading this news I have decided that GTA V is going to be my last Rockstar game I will ever purchase. I've been a fan since GTA III but watching this game go from a decently fun game to a Pay To Win game that also has a chance of permanantly banning your online account has just finally pushed me away from Rockstar all together. I will still play GTA V offline and mod the living crap out of it but I'll be spending my money on other games from now on.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA 5 will probably go down in history as one of the greatest games of all time. But there is a hell of a lot wrong with it. All 3 protagonists are the most unlikable tools of all time. Franklin is just a who follows on everyones comment. Michael is just a hypocritical grumpy hate ridden tool and Trevor is just a nod to what GTA's core fanbase is a raven pack of dog freaks. As for the story it's as generic as they get with the only positive points being the Heist missions.Honestly Rockstar after everything you have earnt from GTA 5 you could help out your fanbase some more and stop dicking them over. (Also public lobbies online are all 12 year olds screaming N*gger so that's fun)

review: This is the first Grand Theft Auto game of the franchise I have played but I certainly enjoyed it. The game has amazing graphics if you have a decent graphics card. The attention to detail is amazing for example in back alleys and under bridges there is graffiti and shadows. The single player mode storylines are amazing and you can play as four different characters and each of them interact throughout the storyline which is cool. Moreover the online setting allows you to do missions explore mess around or just cause mayhem. The criticisms however are apparent The game as a very long load time even with an SSD hard drive and can lag or cause micro stuttering given the number of textures to load. And as always there are plenty of hackers in the online setting so when they come out to play it can be better to just log off. It comes with a hefty price tag but I believe it is worth it given how many hours you get out of the game both in online and in story mode.

review: So with all the Negative reviews complaining about mods I thought I'd clear things up for people who DON'T care about modding.Single PlayerThe single player is ineresting and if you haven't watched a play through already the storys decent nothing revolutionary but I like it but single player will get boring after a while It does not feels as repetitive as some games lkek AC 4 BF but it is kind of doing the same things sometimes ( kill this person chase him down or kill all the enemies get a car escape from police etc) but the way GTA V does it makes it feel more entertaining plus everyonce once in a while theres something new and interesting. ( I probably have like 5 10 hours in the storymode so take this with a grain of salt)Multiplayerthe Multiplayer is interesting. With the multiplayer there's multiple things to do such asClassic tdm or as the game puts it LTSRaces this inculdes stunt races with quads that turn into jet ski's (kinda) to cars with rockets on themOther Unique ish ideas for example Rockets vs Insurgents ( I'll explain later )There's also other "Events" that happen while your just driving around such as longest wheelie most sniper kills most head shot kills etc. (you get exp and money for participating in these events)Plain old PvP around the map (you can go passive mode or be a ghost to a player if they kill you 3 times in a row)Other things I wanted to mentiontake note that I'm noob The level to unlock all weapons is 220 and Im like level 30 there's plenty of other (good) features that im too low level or never got interested enough to check out. Back to rockets vs insurgents its unique because ive never played any type of game mode like that this is how it works there's two teams one team is on a high platform with rockets and other in armored cas theres ramps that lead to the platform and there people in the cars have to kock off/kill the peopel on the plat. This may seem easy but if you go too fast you fly over them and too slow you dont make the jump this may not sound very unqiue but it was a pleasnt surprise for me. ( Just wanted to explain an example)ConclusionUnless your really into single player mods completely ignore the bad reviews*P.S Sorry for any Gramatical mistakes*
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This review is directed at the Story Mode only. For comments on the online experience look elsewhere.An incredible gaming experience through a living breathing open world. Not only can you play through an amazingly entertaining main story there are also a high number of side quests mini games and "life simulation" to entertain you to your hearts delight. From playing tennis racing your kids in bike going to a movie with your buddy fueling your racing needs (wink wink) and participating in any possible form of debauchery This game has it all. So buy yourself a copy get yourself comy in your chair rady your clips and have some fun by bringing mayhem to Los Santos and/or living a second life in a parody world.

review: I really enjoy this game and I find the community generally to be a welcoming and helpful. However the never ending crapshow that is modders and hackers in this game just makes me want to uninstall and never pick up a rockstar/taketwo game again. Five different sessions just today and each time some modder ruins the experience. As far as I can tell there has been ZERO change in the frequency of disruptive modders in this game since I started playing. How can you justify charging people so much money for just the game (not to mention shark cards) and then have this crap happening constantly. Extremely disappointing. Do not buy and I would suggest do not buy their future games either if thisis their idea of customer service.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I used to play this game so much. It has an incredible amount of content and development the story has so much fullness that you can compare it to real life and the multiplayer wasen't perfect but it was among anything I'd ever seen in an open world game. Unfortunatly my thoughts on this game have changed since I got falsely permanantly banned. Make no mistake folks that means your account and every thing you've earned goes away to the void for you to never be able to access again. Early in my accounts history yes I tried modding online and got a 10 day ban on my account okay fair enough no more mods. However when another modder unwillingly gives me millions of dollars thats a serious flaw that needs to be addressed. When I initially got the perma ban well I was mad but at who? the modder? Rockstar? Well it turned out to be Rockstar when I found out (after waiting for hours to speak to multiple representitves not even going into their sub humorous technical support) that my account was banned permanatly and there was nothing I could do about it. When I asked what for they declined to share the information with me. When I asked for an appeal they said I couldn't appeal. This is fankly unacceptable from a company that I have bought games from for years bought GTA 5(three times Xbox 360 PC and PS4) put almost 400 hours into(not even counting the hours from xbox and playstation) spend countless actual money on shark cards and in the end my loyalty to Rockstar means the absolute square root of jack s*** to them not even enough to let me appeal something that I was falsely accused of. My advice If you buy this game don't spend actual money and don't go Online If you do go online and find yourself in a modded lobby for gods sake get out.

review: "You reap what you sow"No expression better suits the callous disregard for consumer demand and creative innovation Take Two has expressed in the past 24 hours. This can not and will not fly with us the GTA community and paying customers. Take Two deserves every single bit of backlash and negative press that has been put forth in light of recent events. Do not buy this game. Do not support publishers that put their bottom line before the demands of their consumers. Publishers and developers in the video game industry can no longer be allowed to screw over their customers left and right and think that it's acceptable.On behalf of the OpenIV team and a very irritated community Take Twoedit fixed typoEdit 2 We did it after an overwhelming uproar from the community Take Two has felt the heat and retracted their Cease &amp Desist. With the modding crisis averted I will now wholeheartedly recommend this game.

review: I loved this game. One of my most played games of all time. I bought it for the 360 xbone and on pc. I even put another $20 into it because I love the game. Countless hours spent having fun doing random with friends. It still is a wonderful game aside from the grinding to get anything of course. A lot of people blame this game for bringing microtransactions to the gaming industry but I disagree. The microstranactions in this game are different and are present to allow them to release content for free. At least when you buy a shark card you know exactly what you are getting and exactly what you can get for it in game unlike every other game with microtransactions. Even behind all the grinding and other players being s it is still a fun game to go back to to around with friends on.

review: GTA 5 has been a good game for a while. The singleplayer campaign can only be described as an experience. The online play has been enjoyable but more and more the focus of online updates has been on milking money out of players through microtransactions. As of 14/6/2017 a cease and desist letter was sent by Take Two (Owners of R*) to the developers of OpenIV a kind of base for GTA mods. This means that a huge amount of player content is unsupported. It is likely Take Two sent this cease and desist due to cheaters in multiplayer but OpenIV only works for singleplayer mods. They may have taken down this content in hopes to force more people into GTA online in order to make more money. Because of these things I can no longer recommend GTA 5. Should the cease and desist be retracted by Take Two I will consider recommending GTA 5 again.EDIT As of 23/6/2017 Take Two seems to have retracted their takedown. I will be recommending this game again. The excessive cost of recent updates is still a problem but I think the good outweighs the bad.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is a really good game considering I was expecting it to be dead judging by the recent 60% off sale during the Steam Summer Sale. This game has very exciting missions and a fun storyline which is shorter than San Andreas but still definitely worth playing.The driving and flying physics are amazing for a game that isn't even entirely about that anymore. (The driving is even more enjoyable when you use a controller or gamepad and drift in the Futo).GTA Online is very far from dead with updates coming all the time and a community so strong after the Steam Winter Sale that the servers went into a Limited state for PC for quite a few hours.Building up money in Online is fairly slow but this means you spend longer earning the rewards of being rich. Once you have a high level and money there are still races missions and heists you can do with a team of friends or dedicated veterans from the GTA subreddits.Recommend this game to people who love exploring in free roam and need to relieve stress on civilians or gain stress from being dominated by the online players. 8/10 because the storyline is a bit short and some vehicles and updates added to the game have taken the game's style a bit too far from stealing cars and low level crimes although it's still very very fun.

review: CONCERNING SINGLE PLAYER Get it It's the best GTA yet hands down. Hilarious thrill ride of action feels drugs and impotent rage.CONCERNING ONLINE PLAY Pros I have fun when I have friends to play with.Looks pretty good.Gameplay is enjoyable but fixed wing aircraft controlls need to not suck.Great sense of humor throughout the single and multi player experiences.Heists and jobs are fun to do with friends in general the game is always best with friends no matter what you are doing.Cons General players are clinically disabled and cannot be relied on for anything aside from for to suck which is great if it's any sort of competative play the people who play this are as dense as a daikon radish. Pwn freely.Rockstar is a batch of hilariously ironic criminals with their business practices surrounding this game namely in how getting cash is a grind if you don't have 3 other DEDICATED friends to run entire series of heists (fun but tedious after the first 2 3 times) every day to get whichever amazeballs cool toys what get released with each update and all of it is exhuberantly expensive.Navigating the UI feels like a personal skill it's convoluted trash. Anyone can figure it out sure but it shouldn't be as broken up and... obtuse as it is.Still $60 many years after release.***I'm giving this a thumbs up because it's not terrible and I wouldn't say you shouldn't play the game but note that in my opinion it's really a 50/50 split. For single player YES thunbs up all the way.... but for the whole other half of the game multiplayer it's a definite NO if you don't have at least 3 other friends to play with***
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I have 637 hours on this game. That's 26.5 days!!!!!! I absolutely love this game. I totally recommend it BUT I need to share this warning. This game is very grindy. You will never get anywhere unless you spend hours and hours and HOURS (like 100) doing the same missions over and over again. Time is money in this game. If you aren't doing something that earns you money your wasting your time. I love this game so much i don't mind the slow progress but I'm just letting the new comers know that you have to spend a lot of your time just doing the same missions over and over again. Then again it's your time so why do I care. Consider yourself lucky you saw this reveiw because I'm giving it to you straight up. The game is really fun don't get me wrong but it takes a load of effort to get barely anywhere. There are a lot of things that I don't agree with but that's just my opinion. People who say you can just buy shark cards are wrong. Unless you want to spend $500(us) your not getting anywhere. 100 dollars will probably get you 4 MAYBE 5 good things. Not worth it. That's all I have to say. Thanks for reading and have a great rest of your day dear viewer.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: As of today I'm changing my review to a recommend just because the single player portion of this game truly is an amazing experience and worth the cost of the game. In the unlikely event that you have never played the single player then get it on sale and enjoy one of the best stories in video gaming history.My previous comments in my initial review about multiplayer still remain mostly true. It's still full of hackers and not a fun experience. It's still ridiculous that they haven't implemented any anti cheat on their servers. But at least Take Two reversed their decision on OpenIV in response to player protest and that was my reason for not recommending.I still can't fully recommend multiplayer. It's a very transparent cash grab at all turns and when that is the case you want to see that the money you spend is giving you a benefit but since you meet hackers at every turn who will have things that cost you real life money or hundreds of hours of grinding it makes you wonder why you would bother.In summary buy it for the single player and enjoy that. Don't buy it for the multiplayer because it's honestly terrible which is a real shame considering the potential it has.

review: Note A to the point review with no spoilers.UPDATE Sep. 2016 With the amount of content that has been added to GTA Online I am able to revise my review and recommend GTA V. The shortcomings I have previously listed are sill relevent but I can say there is enough content now that it is worth $60.UPDATE May. 2016 With added online content and new gamemodes I would revise my value of GTA V to $40The single player story feels abrupt and haphazard as though it were told by a second grader with ADHD. Character development is shallow at best with arcs as defined as Mr. Magoo s sight. Understand that any story judgement is purely subjective but when I compare it to previous GTA titles five falls quite short. The voice acting sound effects and textures are all amazing. These three areas in particular are what I see as the only saving graces of the game and their respective departments should be proud. The multiplayer is a disheveled exploitive mess with net code reminiscent of Battlefield 4 at launch and Rockstar s constant knee capping of any method of progression. One main issues plaguing online is faux longevity caused by constant reduction (Rockstar s Patches ) in amount of RP (experience) you can gain making it take longer to obtain level locked items. The other primary and worst offender in any game is freemium inflation caused by devaluing the in game currency thus leading to high cost items and low currency gains from missions. The devalued currency is solely there to encourage people to buy Rockstar s Shark Cards and is tactic synonymous with poor game quality and no respect for the consumer.Conclusion Overall I would value Grand Theft Auto V at $20 if you pay more than this you will feel swindled. I understand companies are primarily about the bottom line but as it stand this was a deplorable misstep to cash in and leaves me feeling robbed. Unless changes are made in future updates this marks the last Rockstar game I will buy. I no longer have any confidence in the company's ability to deliver a solid game unbridled by greed.

And speaking of world it manages to feel smaller than San Andreas.. Yes yes technically it's bigger but it doesn't feel bigger it doesn't have that many different areas. It's basically Rich district poor district and desert. Yes ofc i liked the missions in MP but only with friends with randoms it's just chaotic. I believe youtube has made the MP bigger than it should be. And sure it's a great world to just be hanging out with your friends in...IF you're bored that is why not play an actual coop game together instead of just driving around in cars bored.

review: GTA Online reviewWhen you start off as a low level make sure you push M and scroll all the way down till you see passive mode. Keep this on to avoid getting spawned killed by toxic playes. Join a private lobby if you want to kill a bunch of people without your K/D going down because off a jackass till you get some health and weapons by leveling up to protect yourself. Don't even bother playing heist till you are rank 100 because people will just kick you from the lobby+ the fact that you don't have full health. You get 10% health every 10 ranks till you are rank 100. Just do the missions story based characters give you and/ or go into the mission menu and pick missions to do that you have unlocked via rank. +The game is still updating on the regular with double xp/money and new missions. +Easily 100+hrs MP Load screens are super long in this game. 1 4 minutes when getting back to the lobby. I suggest you get up and walk around. Random disconnects kick you all the way back to singleplayer undieing enemies Slow xp. I generally have no problem grinding for thing like money and clothes but when health is also locked behind rank it becomes a problem. You know you are better than player B but will always lose to player B in a gun fight because he/she has double the health that you do. 90hrs in with 3 heists completed loades of missions and still only have 60% of the health of player B. The complaining about the anti cheat system is overblown. A lot of the people complaining about either got banned for modding overclocking using third party overlays and playing with a person they KNOW is cheating ex. modding free money. Updated 2017. People getting banned for singleplayer mods.........2018 less annoying modders and a lot more to do in game. Coming back to this from an RNG mmorpg you start appreciating how you can do everything without paying real money.

review: GTA V. Good story mode much more mechanics than IV different driving and rag doll physics.. already too much debate and info you can google on that that's why i only wanna focus in the gameplay and overall experience of the online and collect and analyse the biggest problems with the game in a midly readable review.As for it I still don't know if i like the game more than i dislike it. I'm a big fan "roleplay" servers in SAMP and the fact that i have to install a 3rd party client to play that game mode here is sad.Even then I'm not a big fan of playing with 32 or less people (versus the SAMP svs +400 people in a map half the size) doing something similar to the money farm and jobs like in SAMP but mostly with bots and a occassional encounters with players for me that makes get boring pretty quickly.After the small rant let's see what online has to offer Basically the main game mode called freemode is a grind deathmatch with RP elements. Activities are miscellaneous and some created by the community. Races DM matches fights in or against weaponized vehicles and a long etc. You join 32 player (max) sessions or solo sessions. FiveM developers the creators of the 3rd party online client mentioned earlier are working on breaking this limitation and making possible servers with 64 or even 100 player slots. I don't see Rockstar devs working on this.... You can own different types of properties. Some are for vehicle storage only some as bussines buildings and some to do missions/heists which are coop missions with other people. More in that in a minute ) You get to buy different vehicles. Not getting in depth but some are cars helis planes military vehicles with guns anti explosives and bulletproof windows armored vehicles and special vehicles with crazy features like rocket propulsion or bunny jumps.Important points you should consider before buying.1.Friends or solo? It's fun AF with friends.If you play solo its still pretty good but the experience wont be nearly the same as if you played with friends. You can make friends in game pretty quickly. Let alone freemode stuff some work and coop is better to so with people you know.2. Grind for That Auto.By far the BIGGEST flaw of online.Pretty much every nice thing costs about +2 million. EVERYTHING. And for this you have to consider that the most money you can grind in 1 HOUR of NON STOP grind would average 200k. Sometimes 400k.. really depends on what bussinesses you run and tha is considering you ALREADY OWN certain useful vehicles to get you through easier and bussiness buildings to be able to start some jobs which alone would be not cheaper than 2.5 million. Oh my god. Good luck with that of you are a new player.New update cars? pay 1 million or 2 million each.New update properties? Pay 1 million up to 3 million. EACH.Want a car that is faster than the average street car you can hijack? Pay 200k AT CHEAPER Or stick to boring slow sedans and undriveable muscles. And still be prepared to be outruned by almost every user with a more expensive car which make up 90% of players you find in your average lobby.It's not very hard to make money once you have bussiness running but for that exorbitant prices forget about trying ALL of the new or existent content without having to use glitches cheats or buying shark cards.Grind is not necessarily a bad thing when its well done but GTA Online game mode is NOT a RP server with 100 people peacefull folks to make more bearable the jobs you dont have chance to "be" and play a character because 1 out of 3 people you will rarely encounter in the sea of bots will try to kill you or destroy your work cargo nor in between all the ways to make money all are fun or profitable.3. Connection problems.It's very common that you have to setup your router settings to make the game work properly. In PC at least after hours of research and trying things only disabling uPnP (which in theory was enabled to SOLVE connection problems in games) i was able to play without connection errors most of times.And this is not MY issue it's a common problem in this game.Yet to get rid of all that i had o activate DMZ for my IP which would make my router naked against malware.... thanks Rockstar.4. Heists.Not much to explain but this has to be the best part of the IMO. Basically multiplayer missions. Everyone gets a role and they have succeed since team work here is a requirement. If someone messes up you have to restart. Consist in a series of setup missions followed final heist which is longer harder and more complex than the setups but it also pays much more. From taking down some targets to stealing a plane getting deployed while your team defends you from a chopper robbing a bank etc. Good and very fun way make money.5. Tryhards.When in game mode this individuals usually have owned a lot of the stuff available to buy and start to find joy only in messing up with other players with less firepower. They kill you over and over destroy your work vehicles your cargo not only killing you but making you lose potentially dozens of thousands. I really feel to point this out because it can get very annoying but you can always switch servers.6. Cheaters/Hackers/ModdersBasically someone with a trainer that can do anything. Some are very chill and nice people tha even give you money (Note Spending modded money can get you a temporary ban and your account wiped) or hang out doing crazy stuff only possible with a trainer like spawning top tier cars and racing but others... oh my. They bug you insta kill you. destroy all your vehicles even kill multiple people using your name so everyone would think you are the hacker and more stuff i would get old naming... unfortunately this players are not uncommon on PC. Again you can switch servers but if it wasn't for Rockstar's lame anti cheat and lazy moderation this won't be such a big deal as it is now.As a quick note load screens are insanely long averaging 1.5 minutes. Understandable but not less annoying.That's about enough to know. Has flaws enough to get you mad and wonder if Rockstar spends money on improving and maintaining their games or they fully run the greedy bussines tactics other big companies do yet all that not being enough to make you want stop playing.As Mr. Ross Scott says i love the games that get you lost in their lore and make you want to play for hours and hours potentially ruining your personal life. Those are the best games.Definitely a love/hate relationship with this game.

review: A fun story and a soild single player experience the only reason this game is a Yes recommendation. If you like GTA then it won't disappoint and a serious step up from the heavy handed seriousness and dull interpersonal management of IV. Remember the fun of Vice City? It's not quite so wild but more tightly crafted.Multiplayer isn't so hot. All the "DLC" that's been produced is amazingly uncreative be prepared to spend large amounts of money on "businesses" which require large amounts of upkeep and high risk on each job to ensure the profit from them is as slim as possible. Each new release also comes with vehicles which require even more money than the last. It all adds up to make getting money a daunting task for anyone unwilling to commit thousands of hours to the game all in a thinly veiled attempt to force incredibly poor value microtransactions on the players. It's pretty easy to tell what they care about when it seems like the only hacking they activly persue punishing is the stuff that impacts their microtransaction economy.Rampant greed aside the experience online will also vary greatly session to session. Having a few friends with you will help smooth out the gradual progress to be made just be aware that PvP is inherently encouraged by the game and going "passive" will severely hinder what you can do.

review: We all wanted to revisit the good ol' San Andreas that we so intimately know and love while this game doesn t include San Ferro and Las Venturas nor the vast desert between the two it is by no means less of a game. Los Santos is bigger and livelier as ever before a truly throbbing heart and arteries of life.The main protagonists story is captivating emotional and terribly entertaining. The game carries itself and pulls you along the way and once you finished the main story and the myriad of side missions there is the online mode. Although it not as flushed out in the PC verse as in the console counterpart but it gives you hours and hours of entertainment for your buck.Buy dem shark cards people. No more cheaters. No story content. Loads of expensive digital stuff to buy with your in game money.

review: UPDATE With everything running fine and regular content drops for GTA Online the gets a solid thumbs up and I feel a little better throwing some extra cash Rockstar's way with the shark cards. Though the in game economy is wacked if you can't group with 4 since the heists are niegh impossible to do.UPDATE Error 1000.50 has been largely resolved. I still encounter it occasionally thus making the game still a hard sell. I still feel like the game needs work in terms of FPS stability due to the content updates in order to make this an easy recommendation.As many of the other reviews explain the game is wonderful. It is the most expansive and deeply detailed world. The cars are drivable unlike IV and the gunplay makes combat enjoyable. It is the closest thing PC players will get to Red Dead Redemption on PC. Plus wioth rolling free content updates whats not to like. All in all the game is solid 8/10. IN THEORY...The problem comes with the intertextual chicanery that Rockstar forces on players. I am currently going through a bout of problems with an infamous error 1000.50 which makes the game unplayable because you are unable to load into the social club I have submitted a ticket with Rockstar and we'll see how that goes but I'm not too sure. There have been a heap of issues that kept me from even loading the game. Months after launch I can only play when the game decides I can. The fact that I expect the game to fail more times than it works makes the game a very hard sell especially with the microtransactions and the sale price adjustments. I would gladly give back the updates if only the game would run.

review: Oh boy this is one hell of a game...I'm reviewing the single player component of the game as there is nothing to say about online except the fact that it is filled to the brim with hackers.GAMEPLAYAh the fresh gameplay of GTA V this game has a huge world great cars and handling mechanics great guns and the shooting feels very smooth and fresh. Not much to say but its damn good. 9/10GRAPHICSMan the graphics are absolutely breath taking as you walk around the city of Los Santos and Blaine County. Whether your at the peak of Mount Chiliad at dusk or cruising around the city at midnight its stunning.10/10SOUNDIf you like music then you won't be dissapointed. The games score is pure synthwave and electric. The radio ehhh. There is a wide variety of music in the games radio system but it isnt as good as what you would listen to in GTA SA. But its much better than GTA IV's radio. The guns feel sound similar to each other and the cars sound ok. GTA V has a great sound design.8/10STORY***MAJOR SPOILERS***You play the role of three characters Franklin Michael and Crazy Trevor. Nine years before the present in GTA V there was a big heist that involved Michael Trevor and Brad. This heist was setup however and the government made a deal with Michael to wipe his criminal record clean if Brad dies. Trevor isn't informed about this till much later And tries to kill Michael for lying to Trevor. I can't tell anymore because there is alot of stuff in the main storyline to list.10/10FINAL VERDICT37/40 ING AWESOME.

review: TL DR The game is great in singleplayer and in multiplayer with a good group of friends/people but you risk being banned from online play because you left Skype running while playing and will get no communication from Rockstar and be accused of being a lying hacker by the community and it's total ing t because there isn't you can do about it because everyone insists the anti cheat is perfect and it's impossible for it to be wrong and will wish death upon you and your family for trying to insinuate otherwise.I love this game so much and that's why it pains me to give it a negative review.I preordered this game just before it came out on PC in April 2015. I managed to be among the first people into Online during the PC launch and for the first week (I was free all week) I was the highest ranking person in every lobby I joined excluding those that ported characters from the other consoles. In just 8 days I had reached level 72 in Online beaten all the online heists on Hard and owned most of the vehicles and properties I wanted. Realizing how carried away I'd gotten I stepped away for a week before returning with my other friends and continued playing at a normal pace. Two friends of mine one playing for this first time on PC that had been leveling evenly with me and another that ported a character from XBox became the GTA gurus of our group. We were all at least 20 40 levels above the rest of our friends and mainly assisted them in heists missions and other activities. These months of play were hands down the best I'd ever had in GTA until present.We slogged our way through lobbies filled with hackers both good and bad every mission and race we could get from our phone contacts and bought every single weapon in game. We even bought things we could only afford following a visit from friendly hackers. It was in these private mission lobbies and chaotic free roam lobbies that the game truly shined. Our group would team up and cut our way through hordes of enemies using rockets machine guns and armored trucks. It was something amazing and represents some of the best times I've ever had with my online buddies.Then over time people slowly drifted away for various real world reasons and I found myself the only one logging in regularly. The others busy moving with school or careers had very little time to play and chose to spend it on the games we'd all originally met in. I continued to log in frequently buying up cars and weapons as updates were released and generally just roamed empty lobbies alone exploring the map and testing my ever growing collection of high performance cars. I became a collector of vehicles for our group turning myself into the guy that could provide you with any vehicle you might need at a given moment.Then in January of 2016 I too was forced to leave the game. I joined the military and spent a long 2 months in basic training. After that it was off to techinical training for my job. While at tech school my parents drove my computer and truck to my temporary base (I was fairly close to home while in tech school). I started up my computer there and nursed the weak and unreliable wifi to the point that it was able to let me log in and resume my roaming. I couldn't play with my friends yet but it was something. After tech school I went home for a short time and built a new PC from scratch. I went onto my permanent base and GTA Online was my first priority once I got my internet set up.I began playing frequently with a military buddy of mine that had just gotten the game helping him to level up. This lasted for an entire 10 days. I was banned without warning following one of our sessions. No feedback from Rockstar on exactly why. I scoured the internet until I began finding threads saying that an update had temporarily caused the anticheat system to register overlays and programs like Skype Teamspeak and OBS to trigger hacking flags. The posts all said the issue had been patched but here it was. staring me in the face. More research led to more recent posts claiming the same thing but all these posts were denied by users saying the system was perfect and that the victims must have been cheating and were just lying. I waited out my ban like a good little player and tried again. I was again banned for no apparent reason while running only Skype and the Steam FPS counter after just 2 hours of play. That ban has also since passed but I haven't played the game yet since I fear getting a third permanent ban before the issue is fixed. Another part of me fears that the issue will never be fixed and that my time with GTA Online is over. At least until offcial support is discontinued and some guy on the internet makes a mod reviving it on his own servers.So dear reader what should take from this? In short if you want to enjoy a rich and engaging singleplayer game that will take you hours to fully complete and explore everything then buy this game. If you want to enjoy a grindy but ultimately fun and addicting open world multiplayer crime and racing simulator wait until the banning problems are fixed and buy this game. If you want to play an open world multiplayer crime and racing simulator rife with hackers screaming children (and adults) with a ludicrously unbalanced economy that requires days of non stop play just to buy one nice car then maybe buy this game anyway. Otherwise don't even bother before you end up out 500 hours of your time and your some of your real world money with all to show for it.

review: An overall great game with endless amounts of things to do it won t be hard to find yourself sinking hundreds of hours into this game. The PC port of the game is very well implemented I had no real issues with adapting to the keyboard and mouse controls after previously playing the game on Xbox 360 (you can still play it with controllers on PC anyway). The graphics look phenomenal on high settings but people with lower end PC s will still be able to enjoy the game with decent frames/performance. The next gen version of the game also has additional features that the old gen versions lack such as director mode self radio first person and increased lobby player caps (from 16 to 30). A big draw back for the PC version (and almost all PC gaming) is the hacking/modding that completely plagues the online aspects of the game. Sure sometimes it can be innocent fun however more often than not modders choose to ruin peoples play experiences and this occurs far too frequently. Rockstar do try to prevent modders but it surely will never stop happening so if you choose to purchase this game just keep in mind that cheating is very apparent in online.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: A great game however... I pirated a version of the game first to see how it would run on my PC it ran absolutely fine so I bought the game the problem I face is that the pirated version was much easier to install! Why is the pirated version easier to instal!!!So upon launching GTA V once Steam had finished downloading it I was asked to sign into Rockstar's "anti" Social Club and when the game attempted to launch I was told that it had been incorrectly installed. Okay fine... I'll just download it and reinstall it from the Rockstar site not that simple. When I attemp to install the Social Club client from the site it tells me that GTA V is not installed. So what're ya telling me that I've paid 40 and waited 6 hours for a game to install just to find out I can't play it because of the Social Club integration? Yup!

review: Grab That Auto V also known as GTA V is a third person rpg action multiplayer shooter developed by British people who live on the Trump Underground Tower in L.A. In short this game is a TPRPGMS.It's an accurate representation of real life and the feminism political struggles that Americans face everyday.The game focuses on 2 middle aged bussiness men and a black guy. Who have existencialism problems by focusing on the quantity of money they have on their bank accounts and the lack of government involment to help.As a Sci fi Open world game citizens are willingly giving you their cars so you can avoid taxes and prove your point to the White House. The main mechanic of this game has you working as an honest temporaly accountant that works on various banks and jewelry shops across all Vice City you have to make the final cut even if the police and the managers are trying take you in jail for unkown reasons.Just kidding i was lying all along. An honest accountant? Pffftt. You have to steal as much as you can to be the perfect accountant of all Liberty City and invest all your money on the online cellphone market app.Also this has a parent simulator inside of it to activate this mode you have to register your Rockstar account and agree to the terms of service from the game after that you'll enter to GTA Online also known as Greet The Annoying kid Online.In this mode you have to find a way to keep the children out of trouble showing them how hard life is until they enter in a state of anger and frustration that leaves them no choice but to quit the game and hate adult point of views.

review: The campaign mode and the overworld itself is worth quite a bit of money already. Though I would not recommend this if you plan on buyiing this for the sake of online mode only. The Grand Theft Auto series was made from the ground up with singleplayer as its priority you'll notice that the world is much more interactive when you're playing as one of the protagonists of the game. That being said online isn't bad especially when you play with your friends and have certain objectives in mind. The online world offers wave after wave of modified game modes available for you to enjoy. Heists jobs and missions not only offer the players some fun challenges but they also yield decent rewards (In most cases they're money. You can use the earned money to buy various customization options and goodies.) Outside of the missions however things could get quite dull. There's a limit to how much entertainment the overworld of GTA Online could provide and the bar is relatively low. Unless you find joy in shooting up some hyper generic NPCs and often paranoid players you're better off looking somewhere else.
