review: Grand Theft Auto V What can I say about you that hasn't been said a million times? Well this is one that has been on my radar since I first picked it up for my PS3 and it struck a powerful chord with me. From the story to the characters to everything. I'd reccomend it to anyone getting into the GTA Scene.I will be giving my honest thoughts on both the SinglePlayer and Multiplayer Stories Characters Vehical controls Heists and Gun Play Let's get started! SinglePlayer A Story I first picked this up in the year of 2014 the same year I got my PS3 I wasn't expecting much in this game since I previously saw GTA4 Vice City and San Andreas as glitchy bug filled messes with an odd fanbase backing it. When I first plugged in and turned on my PS3 with the copy of GTA V in it as I said I wasn't expecting much then I saw how much Rockstar had put forth an effort in the first mission alone Robbing a bank in North Yankton/ Possibly our Canada. After a botched getaway Two of the three heisters are shot and presumably killed sending the third one into a blood rage slaughtering any cop in the area. After the shootout the third heister runs out of rounds and books it out of there. cut forward nine years and our supposed dead second heister Michael Desanta Formerly known as Michael Townley is now living in Sunny LS. We run into our second Character Franklin Clinton an ex gangster out doing a repo job with his "Homie" Lamar Davis/ LD/ Long The repo job goes off without a hitch and the cars are returned to Franklin's and Lamar's boss Simeon a person who sells cars at insanely high prices and takes them back by having either Franklin or Lamar steal it back sometimes both. A few more Repo jobs later and we find ourselves out of a job because Michael Desanta made us smash the SUV into the shop destroying the window and damaging the store significantly. Just from the first hour alone I was hooked My first playthrough I took two to three days to complete everything I could. Story 10/10 Characters From the high class criminal of Michael to the ex Gangster of Franklin to a third familiar coked up psycho none of the main cast feels cardboard or cheap. The same could be said about the side characters from the stoner Tonya to the FIB agent Dave Norton or magee Steve Haines even to face Billionare Devin Weston none of them feel two dimentional they feel like they could actually exist in the real world. Characters 10/10 Vehical Controls Playing on both console and PC for GTA V I can safely say that the PC controls are much more acurate Trying to fly a heli or plane with a controller is next to impossible. The vehicals feel like they actually have weight and force behind them even in multiplayer but i'll get to that later. Vehicals 9/10 Heists The heists in the GTA V storyline are the most fun you can have in any story from robbing a jewlery store in the rich Portion of LS to A bank job in the boonies to the biggest bank in Los Santos. The heists can show you how quickly can hit the fan and make the plans you made obsolete making the characters improvise as best they can. In my personal Opinion the Boonies heist when I first executed it turned me into a blood hungry psychopath in thick body armor carrying a chaingun/minigun. THANK GOD FOR AMERICA! AND THANK GOD FOR GTA! Heists 10/10 Gun Play I have nothing bad to say about it the Gun Play is top notch in the Story mode you lock onto enemies and gun them down with whatever you have in your hands at the moment. Though one gripe I have with the weapon wheel you have to scroll through so much before you get the weapon you want. Gun Play 8/10 Multiplayer Story For the story in GTA Online you start out with character customization from your looks to your perks. Then you fly to Los Santos if you spawn as a girl Lamar is at the airport with a rose which you throw away. He lets you into his POS car and gives you the starting pistol with very few bullets only three spare clips move buddy. After you do the job for Lamar you race him. Either you win or lose he comes back and says that Simeon will call him and speeds off. Thus ends your first day in LS. The story is all out there in GTA Online and I love it. Story 10/10 Characters Sadly Mike &amp Franklin don't make a reappearance in GTA Online but a familiar hacker does make an appreance along with our coked out friend. And That is just talking about the main Characters there are others within the game that I either loath or love one or the other. Characters 10/10 Vehical Controls The Vehical controls in GTA Online feels smooth and fast it controls very well until some ed player shoots out your tires and guns you down FOR GOD'S SAKE! OFF! Vehical Controls 6/10 Heists The heists in GTA online are good but you have to deal with Randos coming in and randomly dropping unless you have friends who play the game as much as you do which I do not. Heists 6/10 Gun Play The Gun Play seems the same as the singleplayer but you have players that gun you down for no reason and KD Warriors that kill themselves because they don't want a player to ruin their KD. Hackers that run amok killing players getting work done. 5/10Full score 74/100 Grade B A good game for singleplayer but multiplayer needs some tweeks and some work.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: One of the best games ever made as far as I'm concerned. Too bad they've ruined the online experience by injecting micro transaction junk and a new DLC that is complettely out of place. Cars and aircraft still have no real purpose for the most part and Rockstar/T2 have failed to deal with the issue of hackers/modders. In fact they seem to support hacking/modding in the sense that they know both are out of control yet they require that DLC content is played in public lobbies full of these people. The single player game is still worth playing and GTA Online is worth a bit of play but I caution players to avoid getting caught in the grind trap and falling out of love with what once was an excellent online game.

review: Grand Theft Auto 5 is not only a preposterously enjoyable video game but also an intelligent and sharp tongued satire of contemporary America. It represents a refinement of everything that GTA 4 brought to the table five years ago. It s technically more accomplished in every conceivable way but it s also tremendously ambitious in its own right. No other world in video games comes close to this in size or scope and there is sharp intelligence behind its sense of humour and gift for mayhem. It tells a compelling unpredictable and provocative story without ever letting it get in the way of your own self directed adventures through San Andreas.It is one of the very best video games ever made.

review: I will split the review into 2 sections Story Mode and Online.Story Mode Rating 9/10Online Rating 8/10Story Mode Pro Needless to say the envrionment AI engine object varieties mini games songs are awesome. Lots of side quests and random encounters with very interesting funny dialodges won't be feeling repetative at all. Each playable character with detailed background and development. Players will like them more as the game progress. Good endings based on player's choice.Story Mode Cons Very few heists in the story mode and only available based on story progression. You will only get rich at the end of the game in which in kinda meaningless. Very few attires acessories cars and hairstyles selection in story mode.Story Mode Overall One of the best game of the year. Worth to play and spend time for the story.Online Mode Pro It's free! A lot of heists good story progression. A lot of attires acessories cars and hairstylesOnline Mode Con Time consuming. You have to WAIT LONG just to enter a session quit a session join a heist and the heist fail if 1 player quit then wait to enter another session. IT'S ALL WAITING ONLY. Many idiots Weapons and cars unlocked based on player level unless you willing to spend real cash.Online Mode Overall Would recomend you find friends of 4 and enter a private session.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Much as I love this game. It is unfortunately a modders heaven right now. Between Rockstar being unable to keep up with the high volume of injection mods and ever changing scripts. And their unwillingness to drop the ridiculous prices of in game content and shark cards. Your garanteed to have "AT LEAST"..... Can't emphasise that enough. One game breaking modder In any given lobby. Now that being said there are plenty of things you can do that keep you out of lobbies like that and you can even search out new lobbies that have little to no people in them. I've seen it like night and day some lobbies are chill and have a full roster. And others are not so tame and they only have a few people in them. Just the luck of the draw. Invite only lobbies are also always a thing. Not to mention you can interupt your connection breifly through your resource monitor and have a lobby all to yourself. But there's no telling how long that last could be an hour or more could be 15 min or less. All in all this game is still very worth it's $60 pricetag. You can still have a blast doing whatever your heart desires On the SP campaign and the ever challenging online aspect. So to be fair despite all the nonsense taking place right now. I'd give the game an 8.5/10. There is much that can improve but in terms of what is already possible. It really isnt that much that needs it. I do recommend this game. I have had it since release on my 360 way back when and still continue to play it as if it is still something fresh.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: *Changing My Review* for me gta 5 has been one of my favorite games to ever playive racked up almost 700 hours of online alone and beat the campaign 4.5 times on my previous xboxs but one day I decided to buy it on PCI loved this game to death but ever since the CEO update released this game has gone downhillIt became a constant grind for money which I was not prepared to do (and yes I bought dozens of shark cards) it just became repetitive and I grew tired of having to get on to grind instead of getting on to enjoy playing with my friends. With the new updates people have become more aggressive which is the complete opposite of who I amI got on this game to have fun not get repeatedly killed by vehicles which ranged from 2 6 million like wtf some people might enjoy this kind of stuff but now rockstar basically just cater for those players and none of their other playersNow to my main argument I enjoyed playing on PC whilst I had no friends as of that time I made do with what I hadAll of a sudden my game started crashing on launch (yes I can run it I can get 60 100 fps on Max)ive been trying to solve this problem for months going to rockstar support who were completely and utterly useless aswell as consulting with other players who had the same issue.In its current state I am no longer able to play this game on PC and my whole gta play experienced has been tarnished by lazy devs and useless supportWho knows maybe they will fix this one day but from what ive seen I will never be playing another rockstar title on PC ever againThis is disgraceful and I can't believe that rockstar wont listen to their fans problems with and about this game

review: You've probably paid for this game when it came out on PS3/xbox360 then paid for it again when it released on PS4/XB1. Dont get it again for PC because the main draw for this game on PC was online play and the mods. Online completly sucks the connections are horrible everything takes forever to connect and being able to connect and play with friends is near impossible. It's a terrible system that is designed only to get you to pay for their microtransactions called "shark cards." Check out the prices of the Shark Cards and see if you really want to pay that kind of money to play online after you have probably already bought this game two times across two different platforms. If you havent heard they want to get rid of modding in SINGLE PLAYER and be able to control it and monetize it. Everything this company has become is garbage and is a sad new reality for what gaming has become. Microtransactions unfinished games and terrible customer support are the norms now and if we keep giving these jackass companies our money things will never change. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME

review: This game succeeds at what it strives to accomplish it has a strong story that most would call the best in the series which is then complemented by solid gunplay and driving. The story was strong enough the catch my interest and keep me going even through tedious and formulaic missions.Aside from main missions it has competent side stories that mostly follow the same formula that the main missions would have this being to kill follow or chase a person through Los Santos it does throw in a few collectibles that directly tie into missions one being where you have to collect several spaceship parts for some guy that lives in the middle of nowhere.This game isn't only a single player experience though most of its players lurk within the online where the developers constantly add content to their almost 5 year old game. Most servers are almost full (at least at the time of writing this) and the community is active.This game is packed full of content both offline and online. It's a decent story and expansive open world complemented by its ever expanding online scene has made it well worth the price of admission.

review: I've decided that I can't recommend this game.The reason? T2's attacks on modding teams which while it has been going on for a while finally culminated to a C&amp D sent to OpenIV just so they can keep on exploiting GTA Online players into buying shark cards.Only buy this game if you're in it just for the story mode and you can look past all this but even then I'm hesitant to say that because it would probably further encourage them to continue with their disgusting business practices.Update Despite T2 rethinking their decision I'm still setting this as "Not Recommended" they need to learn their lesson by making this a permanent blemish on their track record.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Bought the game on day one for Xbox 360. Purchased the PC version at launch. Had a blast playing GTA Online for hundreds upon hundreds of hours. LSPDFR a modification for GTA 5 allowing you to play as a police officer added another few hundred hours of gameplay for me and thousands of other users. 3rd party multiplayer boosted the game in popularity by the thousands becoming a phenomenom on live streaming sites where the game towered with tens of thousands of viewers rivaling top streamed games such as Counter Strike and Overwatch. At one point even DOTA 2 and PUBG.Until Take Two has a radical change of opinion towards modding then I will not recommend GTA 5 or future Take Two games. Neither will I purchase future games published or developed by Take Two.Update Take Two Interactive and Rockstar has since the general community backlash retracted their cease and desist demand against the developers of OpenIV and has had a positive change of opinion towards singleplayer modding. Recommendation changed to reflect on this fact.

review: The state of GTA O has improved but still has some of the issues that have plagued it from day one.It seems like this game is becoming more of a pay to win game rather than a "pay to have luxuries" game. You can easily purchase million dollar (that is if you can afford it) vehicles that have weapons in them and set them as your personal vehicle to shred through players. This used to not be the case you had to order the weaponized vehicles SPECIFICALLY by calling a contact on your phone or using the menu. Now you can just store them in your garage and people who can't afford to take it down are screwed.You can pay to research and get OP attachments scopes etc. for your guns. I got a thermal scope which is extremely unfair as it is literally wallhacks but "legal" wallhacks. I can see players through walls before they can see me. And it doesn't put me at a disadvantage because it replaces the regular scope or anything I can easily turn it on and off.I can research an EXTREMELY armored suit that can take many hits before I die. Given a minigun or any other heavy weapon I am basically unkillable. Hate cops? Don't worry shell out a few thousand and cops will ignore any crimes your organization commit allowing you to wreak havoc everywhere you go without any risk.Rockstar continues to try and roll out Shark Cards encouraging people to pay for them and whatnot including the new start money for business and enterprise $10m for around $50. Which is absolutely nothing you'll get at most like 5 cars that is if you don't fully mod them. Or 1 yacht. Wanna fully upgrade businesses bunkers etc? Good luck! $10m sounds like a lot but is basically nothing in GTA O right now.tl dr Everything is overpriced money wins every time. Pay2Win in some areas.I'm only giving this game a positive review because it is fun and many issues have been fixed and polished out. In no way do I support the scummy practices the developers have fallen for but I appreciate the hard work and effort putting into making all types of fun unique vehicles It really makes every experience with this game unique and endless.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Love this game. very very fun to play with friends
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: First off this game will be fun as hell if you have friends. But the misery kicks in when things cost literally a fortune to buy. Missions payout is low adversary modes get boring after a while. Heists are too hard for new players. In my opinion that's not how you should approach the game.I think dev should change mission reward system. The reward should be constant regardless the time. Some vehicle (super cars planes ...) and offices bunkers hangars facilities need reasonable price tags too. CEO and MC payout sure need to be increased.In the end I know the devs don't even bother to look at customer reviews. But if you do well that's my two cents. Other than that this game is so good despite being a 5 year title
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: What a mess! Let me describe feel of the game for you all it feels like the game was made by seperate groups and then someone just took a duct tape and patched everything together. Your experience is going to be highly unstable where somethings work fine and others don't for no reason. The game looks nice but when you get down to it it feels very cheap and unpolished. There is a new trend on youtube called "Rstar logic" it's because there aren't many things that make sense! people who've been playing this game know what I mean otherwise this is just my take.Rstart has turned GTA into a heavily moditised battlefield with flying cars and tanks. The only way to play in peace when in freemode is to create an empty public lobby. GTA V is home to many many modders(hacker) which are continiously ruining everyone's game. prices of in game items have been increased a lot! that is huge problem where money grinding sources are giiving you the same amount as before. Why? sharkcards that's why. The COOP missions are extremly half arsed except for the last heist (dooms day) if you are looking for an exceptional COOP experience with your frinds then I'd say there are better games out there.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Keep in mind this game first of all need to be rated on the Singleplayer front since this always has been a singleplayer game for the most part but the online part is nice as well I just wish there would be fewer hackers as it is and well really only played the online part briefly as it is and the online part is also the only part I would rate this game 1 point down from 10 stars also being able to make money a little faster would be nice.If you are or have bought this game solely for the multiplayer part of the game you will be disappointed as all the fun happen in singleplayer and is well worth your bucks spendt on getting it if you are a GTA fan.GTAV pretty much offers everything from any of the previous GTA's but better what I am missing a bit though is more programs on the TV sets but in general the gameplay and so on and so forth reflect alot of the GTA's for an instance the skill system is partly back as well which is not bad missing the options to have girl friends in the game though but it is a 3 way game and might prove difficult likewise hanging out with friends sort of am a bit flat.Both Martin Franklin and Trevor both have some awesome traits... and well it is somewhat mocking the todays community as well in various ways making it a fun piece of satire as well when going through it.One thing I am missing though is actual difficulty once on certain missions and more it seem like there is none and is somewhat watered down to the general games that come from the console generation making it in general ultra easy in many ways it is not the 3 different modes that the characters that is the problem though it is a cool feature seen in a few other games as well but well you guys probably get it if played the game.Overall though I would say that this game is defineately worth a buy also you get alot of entertainment and fun in between as well as Rockstar always surprices it is one of the few games series that never became to ruined as for sticking to in general what it is about.Storymode Pros Awesome GFX Awesome music Awesome story Awesome gameplay Awesome huge world.Cons The difficulty especially for PC users would need a few more levels of choice so we are not stuck on the console version also a few things did not port to well over from the console port.GTA Online Pros Alot of things to do be able to live like a kingpin a choice in what one want to do.Cons Hackers seem to be a problem very repetetative and it can get very grinding alike and different oddities that it is difficult to account against.all and all coming together I would rate this game 10 out of 10 stars for the storymode and more like 6 7 out of 10 stars for multiplayer.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Singleplayer &gt download update&gt mod car handling weather and make the game otherwise nicer for myself&gt play for a couple of days&gt RockStar adds 2 cars to multiplayer and update&gt all mods break&gt rinse and repeatModders get tired of this and stop updating so game gets worse for me with every update. Why can't they just leave singleplayers be? Why can't they just let us play with earlier patches so we could have a much better experience with the nice mods? RockStar is just basically farting in the mouths of all players of this game who don't want to play online.Please don't encourage this buy purchasing. The game itself is awesome but this is not the only bad thing about RockStar. Their customer service is practically non existent and what they did to the steam version of GTA San Andreas is just unacceptable.

review: This is my first Grand Theft Auto franchise experience and man am I glad I got into this game. It's f***ing amazing. Jaw dropping graphics entertaining &amp well written storyline humorous characters &amp dialogue and tons of replayability. I haven't touched the other titles in my library since I became intent on beating the single player mode and I still haven't bothered playing any other games besides GTA 5 because of its myriad side missions and the pure fun from free roaming the GIANT map.Highly recommended game. BUY IT.Note I am reviewing this game based on the Story Mode (single player) only I have very little experience playing GTA5 Online and frankly couldn't care much less about that part of the game anyway.Addtl note I can run this title on "Very High" settings at a steady 60 FPS on a 1440p monitor with an overclocked Intel Core i5 a GTX 1070 (slightly overlocked as well) and 16GB of RAM. The graphics settings are exhaustably customizable though so I'm sure you can get decent results with better/worse hardware.

review: Really good game. Basically console version upgraded with native 4k support and other features like "First Person Mode". My only dislike is severe desync online and the severe amount of modders online. This problem is growing but they are doing slow paced moderation on the modders. Then other thing is vehicle insurance issue in this game. The issue for example if a player drives up to you trying to kill you and you blow up thier vehicle you have to pay a deductable on that vehicle which is outragous. So you basically get penalized for defending yourself and it can cost you up to 30k on some vehicles. The logic and design of this system is bad and makes no sense. Besides those issues the game is pretty awesome and enjoyable with friends with quality updates.

review: The offline story mode is truly the only good thing left that Grand Theft Auto V has to offer.It has been over 3 years now that Rockstar has received numerous complaints regarding Online. At this point most Online players are either extremely fed up or have decided to just not play the game. The problem lies in Rockstar's fractured cheat detection system. Multiple players have spent hundreds even thousands of hours playing Online and unlocking items and upgrades for their character only for that character to be permanently terminated once they encounter a player with modding capabilites.Cheat detection is completely and utterly broken yet Rockstar has consistently failed in fixing this aspect of their game. And with the amount of copies that Grand Theft Auto V has sold it almost seems impossible for Rockstar to reach out to the players that have been wrongly affected and restore their deleted characters.The worst part is I've only covered one aspect of Online's seemingly never ending list of problems. If I were to cover every single issue that still exists in the game today this review would take an additional 1 2 hours to read.In conclusion I would only purchase this game for the intent of playing the campaign. Do not waste your time with Online. And if you don't believe me just read the other negative reviews. You'll see why.3/10. /
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Good game modding makes it even betterBut to be honest the game gets boring fast. once you've completed the campaign there is nothing to do but play with mods (which can be fun) or online which is now the worst part of the game in my opinion Online WAS fun at the start and halfway through but now with all the online updates if you decide to start online you are ed whilst you're there with a pistol and 100 dolans in your pocket there will be some guy with a flying car that fires rockets looking to with someone granted you could play with passive mode on but that just ruins the fun not to mention the money grind is real grinding heists is fun for a bit but quickly gets boring and heists are the most time effiicient way to get lots of money!A way rockstar could fix this is make updates that don't just focus on the super rich players give the new players some help by giving them more ways to gain money easily until they get to the point where they could afford to get a small headquarters or biker club. in which case you could make it harder to gain money.But all this aside its a good game but i'd reccomend picking it up on sale.EDIT I just noticed the DLC which gives you a massive advantage in online ing 40. nice one rockstar... and i thought the shark cards where bad enough

review: Edit It's been around a year and I've decided to change this to a positive review. My major issues with the game were poor preformance and a larger hacker base. Rockstar did clear out many of the hackers and I was able to fix most of my preformance issues by uninstalling GeForce Experience entirely. There are however still many issues with the PC port of this game so buy this at your own risk. I ran it buttery smooth at 30fps locked on a GTX 750ti but when I upgraded to a GTX 1060 SSC the gameplay adopted serious stuttering issues. Edit + Rant is over.Unplayable. I used to play just fine but something's happened that makes me unable to play at a stable frame rate.Specs GTX 1060 SSC 6gbAMD FX 83508gb HyperX RamMSI 970 Gaming Motherboard

review: EDIT Since we have been so wonderfully shown what the creators of this game think about creativity and hard work they can go themselves.So you want to be a gangster for the day eh? GTA is the way to go. This most recent venture into the GTA world is outstanding. The storylines are great. The online portion of the game is immersive and is overall a great time if you can get a few friends together.One complaint. So far Rockstar seems to have neglected finding or creating a solid anti cheat for their multiplayer component. At any given time a modder will rain down millions of dollars on your character or simply spawn a submarine on your head. It can get fairly annoying and is one of the primary reasons that I no longer venture into the online portion of the game.10/10 single player experience7/10 multiplayer experience
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Do not buy this game. In game reasons why you should not buy this game. The singleplayer while good has yet to recieve any new content since this game's original release on 360 and PS3. The multiplayer is a grindfest unless you buy shark cards. For some of the stuff it gets as bad as mobile free to play games. The multiplayer features loading screens that can take 5 10 minutes or more. This has been a problem since the title launched. The multiplayer while recieving content updates regularly has the content priced in such a way that feeds back into the grindfest. There is simply no way to make the cash in a reasonable timeframe without shark cards. The multiplayer lobby system is crap. People have reported joining a lobby as a group and then when the game ends after waiting for 15 minutes in a loading screen they get dropped into seperate instances.Out of game reasons why you should not buy this game. Take Two (the parent company of Rockstar) has nuked singleplayer modding on this title and on GTAIV. Take Two's CEO believes that even with all of the money they make from shark cards and from the repeat sales of this title they are "convinced that we are probably from an industry view undermonetising on a per user basis" Speaking of game sales there was also the first time GTAV went on Summer sale and they decided to remove the base version of the game and instead offer "discounted" versions of the game that came with shark cards with the lowest tier coming to the full price of the base game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I enjoy this game a lot for certain reasonsPros fun to play with friends even if you dont have a dollar to your nameRockstar is finally understanding how to make fun updatesThe player base has chilled out quite a lot since i started playingCons The thing rockstar doesn't understand is that 1. the updates are super expensive (20 30 hours of grinding for one thing) 2. Their shark cards are super overpriced (if you wanted 2 billion you could just pay 3$ for a hacker)bottom line is that they've made the game way too expensive prompting people to buy shark cards and grind missionsThe final thing i dont like is how the Associates get paid once you've completed a CEO task. The CEO can be paid upwards of 800K on a selling run but the associates can only make 35k (if you're in a Motorcycle Club base pay for CEO stuff is 10k) Making it a chore for your friends to do CEO work with you because they get paid their weight in salt.I think GTA V Online had a lot of potential sadly it's too far in it's development to fix everything wrong with it (Rockstar is just greedy) the game itself is so much fun and so glitchy that i have fun no matter what.It's a great game i just think rockstar needs to chill with this whole spending 800 million dollars for one thing I would be fine with buying shark cards if they had REASONABLE cash grabs but it's 100$ US to get 8 MILLION DOLLARS IN GAME.if they increased the money given from shark cards and made everything give more money in general the game would imo be revived. currently it has such a little player base that you'd need to wait 30 minutes to get one Random Person in your lobby only for them to leave.Story is good you already know that.Story 8.5/10Online 7/10

review: When I first bought this game I loved and played the singleplayer. The singleplayer component of the game is really fun and I want to say would be worth it alone.Unfortunately for this game there's the online and arguably more popular portion of it.Let's start with the most recent case of horridness. From all the reviews I've been seeing on the store page here a lot of people have been getting legitimately earned money taken from them with no explanation and Rockstar ignoring any support tickets sent to them about the issue. While I haven't had any issues with this myself I can completely believe that this is happening given how little Rockstar seems to care about the game outside of the money it generates for them combined with the other bad design decisions they have done for the game.Which brings me to my next point. This game really just seems to be little more to Rockstar than a cashgrab and it really shows. Almost all of the newer DLCs that come out are extremely pricey (It takes about $100 to get the most expensive yacht for instance) and requires several hours of grinding to get even just a few of the items that come out each update. Most of the missions and jobs in GTA Online pay out very little given how much you need for most of the items and playing heists with randoms is about as painful as getting your teeth pulled between how long it can take to get 4 people to start the heist only to have your teammates either die repeatedly or them ending up rage quitting. Also doing CEO/MC sale missions in public sessions full of people? Forget it. They'll easily be able to blow up your cargo in most cases you can't really do much about it if they do manage to blow your cargo up you will get nothing out of it and lose all the money you put into getting the crates.Speaking of other players the game is also littered with modders. So many of them to the point where it's insulting that this is considered a $60 AAA game.I am still unconvinced that they did NOT do this all (losing the legit funds seems like gross incompetence though) in order to promote the sales of sharkcards. Why bother making the game actually fun to play and pay out fairly when you could just pay Rockstar a good sum of money to just bypass all of that? Heck even the Take Two president came out a few months ago and basically said that GTA V is UNDERmonetized.Lastly a more minor complaint of mine and a few others the AI seems ridiculous at times with near aimbot level aim. Sure that police officer just hit me 3 times killing me while both of us are speeding in vehicles fine sure...whatever.All in all a good and fun game that had severe promise and even several decent things about it ruined by awful business practices and awful designs. I would highly recommend against playing the online even if you buy it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto is a past time of mine I relish and truly enjoy. This is another in the series I thoroughly enjoyed and would recommend this game to anyone. It has most aspects any game can possess leaving you with a ton of replay value and a reason to continue playing well beyond the end of the story and online regardless of your rank. I own both this version and the PS3 copy and I admit that the next generation versions are far superior. I love the new passive mode graphics manipulation first person new cars and all of the other additions. I've had many problems with this game in the past several years of owning it but I always come back in the end.As I stated above I've encountered some issues in the past several years within this game between the two versions of the game I posses. Online servers always have been very weak and easily disrupted leading to MANY disconnections lag issues and other problems. There have also been numerous missed opportunities for Rockstar to cash in on but they seem to have avoided what customers often desire. The censorship has been a confusing problem being that this is a game meant for an older audience and has led to plenty of pointless problems. You would think that in a game filled with violence drugs crime sexual themes and other adult themes there would be less censorship. Of course lastly I must include Rockstar's ability to overlook pressing issues and succeed at fixing small bugs and attacking their own fanbase for silly reasons in an attempt to uphold something I have yet to quite understand.Anyway aside from the problems this is a VERY solid game. Rockstar knows how to make a Grand Theft Auto game even though sometimes they come to disappoint in a multitude of aspects ranging from their quality control to how they please their fans and audiences. Buy this game and I am sure you will be very happy with your decision.

review: So after many hours of trying to fix the lag in this game i finally managed it with the help of a few good people in the GTAV community and not the typical "get a better PC" crew. I had to turn off Vsync in game along with a few others and then activate the different settings in my NVIDIA control panel's 3D settings. I had to put Vsync on 'adaptive half rate' though this really doesn't bother me at all! From then i have spent countless more hours on the game both online and offline with no lag what so ever and even with the graphics on very high including maxe reflections grass water and shadows. Since i have been able to actually sit and enjoy the game now i love it. It's amazingly fun to play story mode but even better when you play with friends online. I'm going to try to 100% this game now that it's 100% playable!

review: Edit As promised I have edited my review as Rockstar have joined talks with OpenIV and allow development to continue while they target other sources of cheats and mods for Online only. I do recommend the game but we wary it can get dull fast if you dont have some friends to tag along with Online. The Online section is a hellhole where each update is painstakingly designed to be overpriced and encourage the overpriced sales of their Sharkcards to actually get anything without an excessive amount of grinding to earn enough money to set up a business to earn some money back. The single player is really enjoyable however. Its really well paced and will keep you going for a long time. Unfortunately the single player has been put through a blender to filter out everything fun in the form of BANNING one of the top modding tools OpenIV. Without it there is very little you can really do. No new vehicles or textures. As well as all the youtube machinas that will be unable to make new content. The worst part is that Take Two have banned OpenIV in the name of stopping cheating online which OpenIV has nothing to do with in the slightest.Until the ridiculous measures Take Two have taken are reversed or adjusted ill be keeping this review negative Forget it returning to negative review. yet another Online update for masses of vehicles and planes which require further things such as hangars in order to buy in the first place. I can let it slide if it were cheap but its not. At this point I cant be bothered with even more grinding to get something new without paying for a shark card

review: Update! my review is now out of date they fixed the hackers and modders problem. A bunch of people aren't to happy about this because they cannot use singleplayer mods. Personaly. i'm just glad i don't have to worry about getting banned outa nowhere and i'm glad it's fixed. Rip mods but online is lit. this game is now a 100% worth it even if it is a little pay to win. A lot of the updates leading up to Doomsday have really made the gap between casual players and those who pay money/sell their souls to dat grind is much bigger and more fustrating. Back about a year ago when you joined and online session you way encounter a guy with a tank going on a massive rampage but it was one guy and you could avoid him easily. Now half the player base has a flying missle lauching death moblie and you can easliy get gang banged by 5 guys using tanks flying bikes or flying cars.(Everything in this damn game shots missles and flys). The wrost part is that you can get to a point where you can't call a vehicle and gtfo in time. Gta 5 is a game about Capitialism and you need to change your tactics to have fun and surive. I would HIGHLY recomend getting any armoured car such as the duke o death to help you in your heisting. Missles and jetpacks are the new meta and i don't think that will change.How to Avoid the Ban WaveSo you are considering buying gta 5 on pc? Great! but you will need some steps to play online. if you do story ur fine. people in these reviews talk about hackers and getting banned for no reason it's not joke. people i know have joined lobbies to instantly get 4.5mil and have to contact rockstar to avoid a ban. so here is what you do. 1. Get some friends to play the game with you2. launch singleplayer3. go to online4. play online 5. start friends only lobbythe goal here is to avoid public lobbies at ALL COSTS. if you do join one watch the chat to see if anyone is asking for money items calling hacks or any other indication of a cheater being present. i'd guess that there is a cheater in every 6 lobbies. whatever you do GTFO of that lobby as soon as possible! Leave the second you can or alt f4 on the loading screen. you are not safe anywhere. you run the risk of being placed in an open lobby mainly after quiting a job.This is one of my favorite games but you must be careful. AVOID ONLINE LOBBIES LIKE THE PLAGUE!

review: So far I've kept up with every GTA game and every add on GTA 5 in terms of complexity and freedom is by far the best! Unfortunately there seems to be quiet a few problems since PC release with variety of systems... Personally I have massive frame drops where the game becomes unplayable (system is up to recommended specs) so I've put off playing further until more problems are resolved. On that note if you can't wait to play the story mode and have a PS go that route. If you don't have a PS and have lots of cash then keep upgrading your system until you get decent FPS. If you don't have money to blow ... sit back and wait for more patches. Unless you get lucky and things go smooth for you! After a week of replacing hard drives OC cpu OC gpu replacing RAM to higher frequency and better parity better monitor with 1ms response.. I'm left with either upgrading CPU and GPU higher (even though both are above recommended specs). I get anything from 120FPS to under 5 FPS 0.o even with everything at lowest settings with massive stuttering after RAM gets to 2.3GB (16GB available) . No thermal issues everything under 60c

review: The story is really fun and humorous. The characters are interesting enough to actually want to follow their story. The customization aspect is good. There is so much to do for completionists. I recommend this game to anyone who loves storyline and a doesn't mind a little RPG aspect.The GTA Online part is when the game starts to get really fun. I'm not sure how enjoyable this game is when you play alone but I have a ridiculous amount of fun when I play online with friends. There are so many different things to do. You can mess around and kill random people or steal cars and planes or helicopters. Or you can play some mini games where you either race or shoot eachother or both. Then there're the heists. This is when you get together with other people to accomplish multiple missions to complete a goal. You designate each person to a role and each person fulfills that role in order for the mission to run smoothly. Sometimes it gets complicated which is fun.This game is super fun especially when you have friends to play with.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V is a awesome game that has happen ruined.This game had alot less grinding before and alot less of the sci fi sh*t. The game has a very good storymode its somewhat long and pretty good characters some cool missions. You can even get mods to make it better. The games atmosphere is very good (graphics background noise &amp music attention to detail views houses/map in general even civilians/ai are good) Online now this i am not sure what to say about however one thing is clear atleast to me online was alot better few years ago. Much less grinding &amp the missions/heists felt more fun back then. Nowdays its way to much grind &amp almost all the new updates have basically same moneymaking methods (however not the doomsday heist update it was fun first few times playing) Also before there was alot less paywalls i will not go into detail in that but paywalls are complete bs. Otherwise online is pretty fun like racing buying new cars doing missions with friends etc.Something id like to mention is the controls some controls like flying vehicles submarines etc have very weird controls. You will get used to them in time though. I also really like racing its quite fun still.My list of "downsides" to this game Loading screens To even get into the game you will sit 2 3min in a loading screen and theres alot of loading screens and all of them really long. Also alot of weird cutscenes. GTA V online Paywalls You want to buy 1.5 vehicle? Well f**k you you need to buy this facility for 2 million first. Also most of the vehicles you buy are severly underpowered and you end up wasting 2 million on some garbage thing.Combat system against AI is allright but against player a nightmare D Sync bullets not damaging when hitting directly and the BS amount of damage you can take u can take when you have the skill "100 health" (takes like 5 ak shots to kill a player)And of course i havent mentioned hackers you will encounter them. They can take your money trap you inside items teleport you kill you. Basically anything they want. Other i do not at all like some of the things added in doomsday the stuff is way to futuristic. Clones jetpacks flying cars etc. I prefer being semi realisitc than sh*t like this. Theres alot of things i also dislike about this game but the review will be to long if i wrote everything.Ratings in my opinion Storymode 8.5/10Online 6.5/10Physics 7/10Combat 6/10Graphics 8/10Atmosphere 9/10Map 9/10TLDR Campaign/storymode is awesome graphics/ atmosphere is great online fun but to grindy. Your first 100h hours of this game will be great but then it goes downhill. If u want GTA V buy on sale. Not sure if to recommend or not.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is a very large game with a lot of features so I'll split into 4 sections. Pros and cons for GTA V and Online respectively.edit now that i am sane i am no longer going to add points for things that are expected of every game.GTA V (Offline)Pros 1. You get excellent graphics (maybe depending on if you can afford it). (+2)2. The story is definitely better than GTA IV so expect a little more fun out of that. (+2)EDIT Emphasis on "a little"EDIT2 subtracting 3 points for lack of bowling cousins3. You can replay any mission at (almost) any time. Good for those going for 100%. (+5)After all everyone actually enjoys the gta missions and nobody sees them as obstacles to enjoyment.4. Wide selection of vehicles from a blimp to a golf cart. (+4)EDIT Selection of vehicles is actually more like this joke vehicles air vehicles air vehicles2 cars nicer cars less nice cars expensive cars bikes mopeds thats all folksCons 1. Excellent graphics also means you'll need high end equipment to play it. It's also poorly optimized so it almost feels like it was made to sell graphics cards. ( 3) (now 0)EDIT null and void. I gained administrator access on one of my school's computers and it ran this game just fine at minimum settings.2. The story is written better but it actually feels like a recycled GTA IV with slightly improved graphics and a different map and a small assortment of other features. ( 5)EDIT Confirmed. a GTA IV mod exists to convert it to GTA V.3. The mission rating system is a perfectionist's nightmare. ( 4)4. The wide selection of vehicles is nice but obtaining them proves very difficult. There's also many things that are overpriced such as car modifications. ( 6)EDIT not a concern. The new concern is losing your damn car after having it for 45 ing seconds because you got out and then someone ran you over. You cannot keep purchased cars except in garages.5. It's massive. It could easily be better compressed but it's not. So expect to budget as much as 100GB for this game. ( 5)6*. On some GPUs the game refuses to start requiring you to start the game with integrated graphics instead. ( 1)5. Controls are somewhat intuitive and easy to learn but the settings in the game are poorly organized. For example I cannot check what key swims upwards so I have to keep drowning myself trying to figure out which one it is. ( 2)edit moved this to consI used to think it was a solid addition to the gta series now I find it is not just identical to gta4 but actually it is inferior. (+13/ 23)If you're not playing with friends and not doing a youtube series you'll stop enjoying this game after around 40 hours.GTA OnlinePros 1. Play with people around the world 'nuff said. (+6)2. Private servers for just you and your friends (+5)EDIT The reason this scored so highly is because nobody has to host it. Rockstar takes care of that. It IS a pain to set up though.3. Heists and vehicles that you can keep as well as a somewhat efficient heist management system. (+10)EDIT the vehicle system on GTA V online is way better than the singleplayer version. Rockstar's team is just too busy watching the sales to add any decent upgrades to singleplayer.Cons 1. Performance. This is an online game so I expect to lose some frames but dropping from 45fps to 15fps sometimes fluctating up to 20 gets very annoying very quickly. ( 6)2. It will randomly crash your entire game requiring a restart. This is usually during a mission. ( 6)3. Poor security. There is almost no cheat protection on any of the servers so hackers very easily give themselves unlimited health and money in online mode. ( 9)EDIT You are more likely to be banned if you are NOT cheating than if you are.4. Poor community. This could easily be fixed by implenting some sort of kick/ban system so why not add it? ( 2)I would treat the online mode as more of a bonus and not as a reason to buy it.(+21/ 23)EDIT It's a dark day when GTA Online is worse than the main game.All in all I wouldn't reccomend it except on sale. Most of the issues I listed are fixable. This game doesn't feel very finished. While graphically impressive it technically is not. $60 is too much to pay for an unfinished game. If I could do it all again I'd pay no more than $20 for this piece of with a nice tie.*Only mobile GPUs (laptops) experience this and there is a workaround though it is very tedious.

review: Product received for free. Grand Theft Auto Five surprisingly blew my expectations out if the water. The game is visually stunning and it has some of the best graphics I have ever seen in any game period. Gameplay for the most part is smooth and flows nicely it can get a little choppy if you are driving really fast but definitely an improvement from past GTA s. The game has a strong main story line a large diverse map to explore and of course there are tons of side missions and other things to keep you entertained for hours on end.I really enjoy the plot In GTA five it is broken into three main characters with their own stories missions and abilities that all tie in nicely together to create the main plot. Which is different from past GTA s where you are restricted to just one character which can make the story line get repetitive or boring after playing for a while. I personally love the idea of having three characters to choose from it makes the plot more complex and much more fun. If you are struggling with a mission or just want to go somewhere else you can just change your character and do something completely different. Not to mention on some missions when you are together you can change between them to help your characters out.I cannot say enough about the visual improvements of GTA V which were much needed from the previous games. The developers did an outstanding job capturing all the small details on everything from the mannerisms of the random people on the streets the vehicles and even nature. They also added a new feature that lets you change the camera to play in first person which I think makes it even more realistic compared to the third person view and helps bring more of the details to life. However driving in the first person view is quite challenging due to the fact that you can t see your surroundings as well.There is also large online multiplayer games that you can participate in which is also fun. I have not spent that much time on the multilayer platform because I enjoy the single player story so much but it is a different and good way to change the game up a little bit.Overall I believe this game is a must have you will not be disappointed. The main story is great and like all past GTA games there is a lot to keep you occupied. You can create your own fun outside of the main plot and go off and explore the huge map as well as cause chaos
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V is a game that runs pretty well. It looks great when run on Very High. On normal it looks OK. Gameplay is fairly standard to the GTA series. The online aspect is....not as immersive as the single player and a few clothing options found in single player are not found in multiplayer for whatever reason. And you kinda have to hope that you dont run into one of the million modders in the game (myself included). If you so much as recieve one dollar from modded characters you will be blacklisted and be forced into modder heavy servers where almost everyone will be either in god mode or aim bots. Good luck
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I thought by GTA V i would be over Grand Theft Auto but bought it since the reviews were still overall quite good despite the shady pricing shizzle during the sale and the online trouble with hackers. I was very pleased. It has great new additions to the game making it an awesome game if not seemingly an all new original experience. If you dont mind spending the money on a great game then this will be a great addtion to your library. Being able to play and switch between three characters any time save for certain missions really is the best part and does nothing to bog the game down or make it feel like a grind if like me anyone is hesitant on that part. It really actually is the icing on cake.

review: GTA V is has an awesome and fairly expansive single player experience. The online componenet however is one of the most fun and at the same time frustrating games I have ever played. Loading into a server is painstakingly slow at times and getting into the same server as a friend can take upwards of 20 30 minutes. Then trying to find an active playlist (race deathmatch etc.) that has more than 4 players can take twice as long on an average day. The single worst problem with GTA V Online is the rampant hacking/modding community. In the last week alone I've had my game crash four times due to a hacker/modder and thats the least anoying part about them. Worst case scenario you get stuck being transported along with every other player in the server to some location being stripped (temporarily) of your weapons and being forced to do random acts (meelee mosh pits sitting on the ground while the modder repeatedly runs you over with a tank etc.) or face being continuously blown up or transported several thousand feet into the air without a parachute to fall for endless minutes to you death. I love GTA V Online but the hacking/modding community has infested the game like a cancer rendering it utterly playless at times.

review: Grand theft auto has always been my favorite gaming series ever since GTA San Andreas and still is. I've played GTA V on consoles since the release but have all the time just been waiting for the PC version and I can say that it was worth all the wait. Just download the latest drivers (which I forgot) and the game will run perfectly with just a mediocre computer. GTA Online allows up to 30 players and doesn't lag at all (if the players are in the same part of the world still not that laggy). GTA V is a must buy and everyone with a decent PC should get it. The graphics and overall gameplay is massively upgraded from the consoles including animations textures particles depth of field motion blur shadows reflections cars and pedestrian density and animals just to name a few. The game also feels supersmooth in 60 fps compared to the console fps at 30 fps

review: EDIT ROCKSTAR HAS SEEMINGLY STOPPED MESSING WITH OpenIV SO IGNORE THE PART ABOUT THEIR STANCE ON MODDINGTo start the single player story is pretty damn good. It took me roughly 50 hours to complete playing mostly the main story.The rest of my time spent in this game was either on modding the singleplayer or in GTA Online split about half and half.The online play is a pile of Don't get me wrong the heists can be fun but only if you have 4 friends to play it with because the other online players will not play well enough to complete it or they will end up disconnecting in the middle and that's if you manage to get started in the first place. Most of the nice vehicle houses and almost all of the DLC content costs $1M $2M per item which would be fine if you could get that much money in a reasonable amount of time. Some of the higher income things you can grind will get you just over $100K an hour. This is all an attempt to force you into buying in game currency through micro transactions.Another major issue with the online is hackers and even worse is how rockstar has decided to handle them. Often hackers will just grief the entire lobby killing everyone instantly over and over again. But sometimes they can go as far as taking all your money out of your bank account wasting all the time you just spent grinding to get it. Hackers will often also spawn money for them and maybe even for others in the lobby which would be nice if rockstar didn't ban anyone who recieved hacked money. So a hacker could give you millions of dollars of in game currency against your will and your account will be banned from the online indefinitely.Now modding.The modding community was great. Lots of fantastic mods that added new maps new weapons new clothes new ways to play and reskinned cars.Recently as of writing this review Take Two the publisher behind the GTA series has sent a cease and desist to the developers of one tool that was crucial to the modding scene OpenIV. OpenIV allowed you to access the games files to modify them and add new ones a feature that was core to most mods. In the cease and desist Take Two said that any bypassing of their security and modifications of the game files was agains the terms and was illegal. They just killed the entire modding scene.Overall this game had a ton of potential to be amazing but rockstar and Take Two ruined it. All the game has going for it is a good singleplayer story mode and nothing else that's enjoyable. I wouldnt recommend this game solely because of rockstar's and Take Two's total and complete disregard towards their customers.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: In GTA V you play as 3 characters Michael Franklin and Trevor. All of them have vices in their own way but you grow attached to them nonetheless. Massive open world environment with plenty of things to do even off mission. You can go parachuting you can spend the whole night at a strip club you can play golf tennis go swimming get eaten by sharks discover random objects underwater etc. Replay value is high just to try to obtain the achievements. I have not delved into GTA Online yet but it seems fun. Great online community that provides guides cheat codes mods and walkthroughs if you ever feel stuck. Overall a great game that everyone should play.10/10 would get eaten by a shark again

review: If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples peeled cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double crust pie Directions 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10 inch circle. Cut into 8 (1 inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter sugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

review: Playing this game Online in 2018 is tedious and time wasting. From my experience I often encounter cheaters who blow you up with your vehicle no matter where you are.The loading screens are absurdly long after 5+ minutes of waiting there might be an error and the game kicks you back into the single player which means you have to sit through another 5+ minunte loading screen.The fun vehicles are overpriced and the grind for cash is about the same as grinding in an MMO. They really want you to take the easy way out and buy the shark cards.The clubs CEO offices yachts and other properties like them are very expensive but you can't do anything important or fun with them. The heists are not rewarding enough considering how much effort you have to go through. Like random player disconects and deaths. I was stuck on one setup for 3 hours because some guy on my team would run into the enemies alone full Leeroy Jenkins style and die or someone would disconnect. Also every time someone disconnects you have to get back to you house go into the heist room and sit in a waiting room till the game finds enough players to start the mission.If you value your time and effort don't play this game Online.That said if you want this game for purely single player experience and mods go for it.

review: This game is awesome except where all those San Andreas states go? (San Fierro Las Venturas)FROM NOW ON THIS IS NOT A RECOMMANDATION THIS IS SUGGESTIONIf there is going to be a DLC or a map mod for singleplayer I think It should get that states back.But I still appreciate their work because apparently game is around 60 GBs and If they tried to fit the other states probably we'll had to buy a whole new SSD or HDD for GTA V even a new PC because all that rendering for that huge map couldn't be done in nowadays decent systems. But If Rockstar makes something to the new GTA game that can allow us to travel like GTA 1 ' s playing system (To choose between GTA IV's Liberty City San Andreas' San Andreas Vice City's Vice City) THAT WILL BE AWESOME.Imagine you are approaching to the airport and going to one of the ticket selling places and saying that you want to travel Vice City from San Andreas and they giving you the ticket. There is a small flight scene (taking off and going twords the sea) then boom landing of the plane and getting out from the plane to the inside of the airport. And now you can do whatever you want in the city. But this is impossible because everyday graphics get better Better Graphics Better Game More Storage Space + Powerful PC Better Graphics + This Feature 10.000$ PCIf they add all this features to a game that might fall in next 6 years only high end PC's of that year can handle the game and there will be more work involved so the game get delayed 6 years more.Long story short if that's going to possible I will love to see some feature like that from Rockstar but I don't think that is going to possible. Not because Rockstar can't make it because computers might not be able to handle that.Thanks for reading this long stuff. Enjoy playing GTA V. If you haven't yet don't worry the days aren't making this game old. Whenever I got bored from singleplayer I go online when I got bored from online I'm installing mods when I'm bored from that new mods came up and Rockstar prepares an update. THIS GAME IS NEVER GOING TO GET YOU BOREDBy the way PLEASE DISABLE YOUR MODS BEFORE GOING ONLINE THOSE MODS ARE ONLY FOR SINGLEPLAYERScrew this mods are BACK
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Story when you compare it to GTA IV or GTA SA it sucks... it's like a level below. This was so far the worst and most stupid "bank robbery" story that I've ever heard of. Missions got a bit repetitive. OFC in compare to older GTA games.Gameplay There's really nothing to do... it feels very poor and like it has a lot of cut content... yes they've brought back some cool stuff from older games but also they did cut a lot other content. There are some badass things to do that have been found in folders and old leaks.3 Characters it was cool for like 15min but in the end it wasn't really anything "cool"... 1 character story is much better for games like GTA.And you won't really enjoy it in missions... you can change characters only when the game wants you to.Physics and attention to detail are awesomeOnline that's a different story... It has much more content and everything. It's really fun.Free DLC...Online that works.The "hacker" problem... there are bunch of hackers like 1 or 2 weeks each 4 months and then R* releases an update or a banwave... and if you are smart enough you can always click that "FIND NEW SESSION" tab. "Hackers" aren't in every lobby and not all of them are morons that just want to disturb you... 75% of cases when I've met a "hacker" was a good guy which was fun with and that helped you with things.R* support dont ever expect them to help you... Ubisoft for example are complelty awesome in compare to this one.Online makes like 80% of this game.Now would I recommend GTA V? No... there are tons of other games that are better.Would I recommend GTA Online? Yes... it's pretty unique with free DLC still comming out.

review: What can I say about this game that hasn't already been said? The graphics are detailed smooth and full of life and look fantastic with all settings maxed out on a high end rig. The storyline is fun and exciting and the characters along with the voice acting is quite possibly the best ever heard in a video game. The game melds several genres and does each one extremely well. There's something here for everyone and most people will enjoy everything the game has to offer. The missions are fun and well thought out unlike a lot of sandbox games. The world itself might be the most amazing aspect of this game though. It goes on for miles and miles and you actually feel like you're in a real place. Nothing is half and the locations are very believable as are the NPC's that inhabit the world. The length of the game depends on what you decide to put into it. You can blast through the main story line in about 15 hours or so. Or you can take advantage of the multitude of extremely entertaining side missions that all have lengthy well done dialogue that will have you laughing your off. Trevor is the star of the show here and I guarantee you will laugh out loud many times throughout the experience. Quite simply GTAV is a masterpiece and should not be missed if you enjoy video games. I can't wait to see what Rockstar does next(pleade make a Red Dead 2).
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I really enjoy this game. I was worried that I'd hate the new player system where you change back and forth between three main characters but it turned out to be one of my favorite features! So here are the pros and cons PROS First Person perspective option I personally love FPS! Three well done main characters with their own stories and missions that intersect with each other. Amazing graphics. Smooth gameplay (with a good video card). Golf and Tennis minigames which are pretty fun. Heists!!! Very fun very exhilarating! Most of the missions are very well done fun to play and not overly complicated or too easy. Wide variety of vehicles and special vehicles that can be bought ingame (with game money) from websites. Really BIG game world with beautiful scenery. Wildlife and domesticated animals you even get your own attack dog with Franklin! Funny TV shows and radio as always. Underwater exploration. Buyable businesses. I found the main story to be quite enjoyable with a decent length to it. Most vehicles are customizable at autoshops. You can rob convenience stores. There are many random encounters (unlisted freeform missions). A wide variety of clothing for all three main characters to buy. You can get paid to hunt as Trevor which is pretty fun from time to time. Buyable garages / hanger / marina to house a wide array of collected vehicles.CONS No Pool (the minigame) No Bowling No Casino / Gambling No DLCS No Las Venturas or San Fierro No enterable restaurants. Cannot beat people up like in GTA4 where they would be injured on the ground get up and run / walk away... they just simply die in this game after punching them a few times. Most interiors are not reenterable outside of a mission. Only one enterable bar and one enterable strip club. Yoga (whoever thought that this would be a fun activity was an idiot)I would recommend this game to anyone who has enjoyed the GTA franchise as well as anyone who loves open world driving games with a rich story and characters in an immersive setting. Although I felt it could have been better that can be said about almost any game. Some people do not appreciate the satire but I find it to be a boon to the series. A serious storyline in a world that makes fun of the worst aspects of our own! I love this game!

review: This Game is like several games linked by a place instead of one game. A couple of things that I feel get left out of general reviews Bikers Bloody hell is this awesome...assuming you like to drive motorcycles. Start at that because if you don't this DLC will be irritating. Past that the ability to call your *any* bike to you in a second The business opportunities and the missions are pretty slick. Where they aren't bugged. You can make good money and it's not *terribly* expensive to start but all four worthwhile businesses (DO NOT buy docs) with upgrades is expensive AF. Some of the bikes released are amazing (Defiler Sanctus Shotaro) all have a host of visual upgrade options and being able to have 10 bikes in your clubhouse and modify them in your garage is sweet. Cunning stunts Stupid amounts of fun. I'm torn on this one after they revised the speeds on the supers they released. The vehicles they released are some of the fastest in the game but more of them are pointless to be part of a race pack (I'm looking at you Lynx). Some of the tracks are obvious stunt fests others you have to avoid stunts if you want to win. Finance and Felony Money. Maker. If you have a buzzard welcome to your new income stream. *so* many missions. The vehicles from this one are fun especially the Brick. UPGRADE YOUR EQUIPMENT they are there for a reason. Oh and familiarize yourself with ending tasks or unplugging your router losing 3 6 hours of work and upwards of 2.2 mil because of a botched sell mission is rough. Also save up way past the costs for this one you have to buy crates to fill up warehouses and you will go broke without a buffer. Extra VIP missions help with that.

I don't have a lot of games I would say are worth $60 but this is one of them. The bundle during the summer sale came with more in game money bundled to it than I got for pre ordering and it was the same price as the pre order!*The game might be years old at this point but Rockstar actually put the time and effort into making this a great port it might as well be a brand new game. Games that release only a couple months before the Steam Summer Sale almost never go on sale during the Summer Sale so you should be thankful that Rockstar even let you guys have (more than) the in game cash you would have gotten for pre ordering.*10/10

review: I played the story mode fully on the PS3 on launch day. I played the hell out of online and had a ton of fun with it. So I decided to get the PC version so I can enjoy it at the best graphics settings at 60 fps (GTX 980M here). I can't get past the launcher and have tried everything. 10/10 will get screwed pre ordering on PC again.Edit 1 So apparently the problems I have been having is caused by the fact that I am playing on a laptop. SERIOUSLY? They delayed the release THREE times (I think?) and the game can't be played simply by pressing the "play" button?!?! Well I technically can play now but I have to disable my NVIDIA GPU to load the launcher and then re enable it as soon as the launcher closes. THIS IS T! I do love the game though. But at least the game worked properly on launch on the PS3.Edit 2 They recently released a patch that apparently cleared up the launcher issues D Thanks Rockstar! But now the game is "rubberbanding" on singleplayer..... Like I will be driving and the car and scenery constantly slows down and speeds up. Almost exactly like if your playing an online game on a terrible connection. Except this happens on singleplayer mode. It gets really annoying really quickly. Unfortunately I still can't recomend this game. The game plays but it plays terribly. They still have a long way to go until they get this game up to par.Edit 3 A new update was released today WHICH MADE THE GAME 100% PLAYABLE! No more having to disable drivers no more rubberbanding! The framerate is acceptable at acceptable settings (given my laptops hardware). I can finally recommend this game! Good going Rockstar! You really ed up at launch but you guys pulled through and fixed the multitude of problems (not saying ALL problems are fixed though) that were preventing me from playing!Edit 4 AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAANNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNDDDDDDDDDDDDDD they ed up the game again. This game is no longer playable. Rockstar support has been absolutely no help whatsoever.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single Player Campaign While still retaining the outlandish and absurd themes that make a GTA game exciting and spontaneous Rockstar pushes their character writing and dialogue to a new level in this installment. Most characters are interesting and funny and the stories that tie them together are for the most part as well. Gameplay is fairly smooth graphics are still as impressive to me as they were when I first saw them and the voice acting/performances are top notch. The only real complaint about the single player aspect I have is character arc inconsistency. But that could just be Rockstar telling me not to take the game as seriously as I am. GTA Online While In theory an online aspect to GTA V could be great and seemingly was for a while there are a few glaring issues that cut my playtime short. Firstly the obvious greedy/cash grab mentality of the team in charge of maintaining this game mode. I can't tell you how much I've tried to keep up with content updates and trying to participate in them only to be indirectly pay walled by in game prices that would require absurd amounts of grinding to achieve without buying shark cards. Secondly at least around the time I was still playing there was a massive hacking issue that seemingly went unchecked. I would only need to join a few different servers before experiencing some sort of hacker friendly or not. Regardless I still had a lot of fun in GTA Online and don't regret the time I've spent playing it at all. There were enough things to keep me busy and entertained most of the time though I'll probably never be able to afford the yacht I wanted.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I will review here only ONLINE mode of the game which is bad. I recommend the game itself for story mode. GTA ONLINE REVIEW MADNESS 50% of all online VEHICLES are militarised so people kill you all the time randomly with their fancy vehicles. Rockstar makes them purposely expensive and OP against other poor players to milk sharcards. Online is just big synonym for a efficent cow that is being milked constantly (refrence to SHARK CARDS). People sure want fancy vehicles that they can't afford to have so they grind buy sharkcards or buy modded money wich is not allowed but way cheaper than shark cards. I see alot of MODDERS ingame (some of them are nice) that troll or abuse people. LOADING SCREEN is my favorite part out of gta5 I guess that's why I have 100h in there (it was a joke). But in total seriousness loading screen is way too long it's like 20 mins normally. I don't know if developers could even reduce it but in my opinion it's way too long even for 80gb game. DRIP FEED is a real hell they have "leaks" that tease all cool and awesome AND expensive vehicles just to release them in 3+ month long period to get to another DLC. Big portion of PLAYERS are pretty toxic and not likeable their hobbies include griefing killing randomly modding insulting bulling noobs. It's really hard to grind or make money alone or make money at all.

review: The long wait has been worth it. If you re a PC gamer who s spent the last eighteen months envying the console crowd while they all got stuck into the latest greatest GTA then rest assured that you can now play the definitive version. Sure the Xbox One and PS4 versions were amazing delivering GTA 5 at higher resolutions with more detailed textures smoother surfaces better lighting and cool depth of field effects but the PC version offers even more enhancements plus a couple of additional features that play to the PC s strengths. In doing so it adds a few more metres to one of gaming s towering achievements.Having covered the game twice already we won t go too far into the detail of what makes GTA 5 so good. Partly it s a question of experience. With four previous 3D GTAs under its belt plus Red Dead Redemption Bully and assorted DLC packs Rockstar has had time to refine its vision for open world gameplay and its systems and GTA 5 has the best driving the best shooting and some of the best mission design of the series.It s also a question of structure. Dividing the action amongst three protagonists with three interlocking storylines and three distinctive flavours means you nearly always have the option to flick from Michael s ageing career criminal saga to Franklin s ambitious hoodlum story to Trevor s crazed amoral brand of mayhem where the dumb cathartic slapstick violence we all deep down love GTA for finds its natural home. With repeated play it only becomes clearer how well all three tales mesh thematically with Rockstar s savage satirical take on the Californian dream.
