review: I thoroughly enjoyed this game for the time I had it. Then I got banned for some unknown reason and after several calls to their customer support was told they couldn't say why I was banned that it looked very odd but that they could do nothing about it. I accepted my random ban as it was only a month and when I tried to play online again for the first time a day after my ban was up I was informed that my account had been permanently banned the minute the first ban was expired. I called again and was informed that I was banned for modding which I lack the competence to install. I asked him how my account was flagged if I hadn't touched it since the date of the original ban and was promptly read off a transcript of the same god awful automated emails you get when you send in a ticket before being told they would not help me and not to call them again in very rude terms.This game doesn't reward players for investing their time or money in it. This is $60 and nearly 500 hours I will never get back and their customer service is if existent at all. I strongly encourage you not to get this if you have any plans or notions of getting actual help with issues you come across. I hope this saves someone the frustration I went through.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: TL DR Its a fun game if you can show some patience.Im going to level with you here This game is FUN. AS. HELL.I wouldnt say the story is spectacular but considering some games this day and age are now outright removing single player in favour of following trends I can say that the story is above average. Movement in the game is pretty straightforeward as well. Driving and flying is relatively good its not floaty enough that it feels like you're on an Ice Rink (*cough*WATCH_DOGS*cough*) but its just enough that most of the time a mistake is generally your fault not the game's fault.Online has a whole hell of a lot of different things to do Heists the Doomsday Missions Regular Missions Races Gunrunning Product Distribution etc. There is really just one thing holding the game back however.THE GRIND.Now in all fairness I think the grind is a good thing. It gives you something to strive for something to do a tangible goal that sets a bar and gives you the freedom to reach it in your own way. If you had everything in the game right off the bat you'd probably be bored within the first week or so (I know I would). I would've said this was a problem back when the game was relatively new. However thanks to the introduction of heists CEO missions and Product Selling there are more options to make bank than ever before.If you have time on your hands and the patience to finish heists and the like I'd say go for it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I bought this game for the PS3 back in 2013 60Then bought the game again in 2014 for the PS4 60Last year I bought it once again this time for PC 60I basicly spend 180 on the same game (actually more than that since I bought quite a few Sharkcards on the PS4) but somehow that's still not enough for Take Two. I bought the PC version specifically to mod it but by taking down OpenIV Take Two seems to have made GTA modding something of the past. Probably to push players back into GTA Online where they'll almost have to spend extra money on Sharkcards since everything in GTA Online is way overpriced. But that is not the only problem GTA Online has the community is toxic as f**k. Most of the time you can't do anything without being run over by a tank driven by a screaming 9 year old. It's simply terrible. The only fun I've had online was doing races although those often end up with people ramming you on purpose. Modding for me is essential to a GTA PC game to have fun that lasts till the next GTA game comes out. It keeps the game alive. I fondly remember spending more time playing as a cop chasing criminals with LCPDFR then playing as Nico Bellic in GTA IV. As said I specifically bought GTA V for the PC to mod it. It has a great modding community with a wide variety of possibilities. Take Two now has decided to destroy that community because they somehow feel they haven't made enough money yet (despite GTA V being the 4th best selling game of all time).That's what I call greedy.Take Two F**k you!I won't play GTA online ever again on PS3 PS4 nor PC. I won't pay a penny for any DLC for any of your games.I won't buy any game that has been developed by you (and that includes unfortunately the upcoming Red Dead Redemption 2)Until you see the error of your ways.

review: The Singleplayer on this game is pretty average as far as story goes the missions are pretty fun and are different to the ones from the older GTA games. I don't really like the three protag system though I would have prefered a more in depth single protag and the car physics are really off. Overall though I can say I enjoyed SP it was just fun and there was lots to do to keep a player entertained.HOWEVER the online portion of the game is why I'm leaving a negative review. At first it wasn't too bad a bit grindy but was still fairly fun. It got worse as time went on though things got more expensive money became harder to get and more griefing tools were added in each new update. Rockstar's anticheat is also absolutely broken many people have been banned for absolutely no reason. Online has single vehicles which I you not in real money cost over $100 due to microtransacations If you aren't willing to pay that then have fun with grinding for ages to get one vehicle that will be replaced with something better in the next update. Hackers are also all over online this could have been alleviated had Rockstar not made a system which essentially promotes people hacking in money so they don't have to sell a kidney or live on the game in order to afford the new content in their updates.My complaints with online wouldn't be that bad of an issue if Rockstar also hadn't neglected Singleplayer GTA 4 had 2 SP expansions meanwhile GTA 5 has none. They also stopped people from trying their new content (vehicles weapons etc) on SP.I wish I could give the game a positive review due to the fact I thought the Singleplayer was okay but the Multiplayer is so god awful and a horrible example of how to treat consumers and run a multiplayer system. Don't buy this game if you do you're supporting Rockstar's terrible business practices. If you wanna play it for the online worthwhile aspect (SP) you can buy it from VERY LEGITIMATE OFFICIAL WEBSITES rather than supporting Rockstar's t.

review: So Rockstar or T2 have killed the OpenIV.It was a year 2003 and I was in love with Vice City and GTAIII. Had no internet back then but we had those pirate warez CDs and among these were the GTA mod CDs. You want your boat to have naked Candy Suxx sunbathing on top? No problem. Flying DeLorean? Here you go. Oh man have you heard about this new sh*t for Vice City the zombie overhaul? And so on. We've exchanged with friends we stalked pirate game stores we were obsessed with finding more sh*t to throw onto our GTAs. Then San Andreas came and with it I first got my hands on the Internet. Free dial up over night you know what I'm up to right after the porn pics. The GTA mods. Download as much as I can throw everything on CD share with friends. Then was the GTA IV and ADSL internets for even more modding stuff. Laggy and bug infested the game got it's mods as always. Now the devs are trying to kill what I was growing up with.Now I'm 25 I don't have that much time to patiently smear mods over my favourite game but still GTAO cars and weapons along with couple of graphical and gameplay tweaks were a must have mods after another GTAO patch. I don't even play this sh**ty grindfest I just want to visit virtual LA and maybe ride some real cars with realistic handling at eternal night time with a bearable FOV and so on. Unfortunately marketologists rule the game dev now so sh*t like this was expected to happen. Though I'm sure we'll see a rise of a modding scene again. When GTAO will die and it will after the last patch we'll see the people enthusiastic enough to pry the game open and mod the hell out of it.For now I'll pirate the latest moddable version and fu*k these online flying bikes updates.

review: After playing the game for almost 150 hours now I feel I have put enough time in to review it fairly so here goes.I'll start with the good It's the GTA that I know and love. It feels more like San Andreas than like GTA 4 to me which is a good thing since I adored SA for its open space and variety and felt like 4 (despite being a solid game) just doesn't live up to the legacy. GTA 5 has a well written and interesting single player experience the playable characters are diverse and interact well with each other the mission are entertaining and numerous. Probably the thing that interested me most about this iteration of GTA was the native support for multi player (finally!) with its Online Mode. In it players can join friends crew (think "clan") or strangers in session of (I believe) up to 30 players. The online version of the game is rich in Rockstar created activities and the mission creator allows for a great deal of additional variety. You can race fight arm wrestle play tennis contend for resources and do a whole host of other activities with fellow criminals.Recently I spend most of my gaming time in GTA Online and I feel that it really is a great addition to the game. Despite this it has its ups &amp downs. There are several key issues I should address here Hackers Mission requirements and player dependency Loading timesSo hackers. What do I mean? One moment you're cruising around with a friend taking on the world and feeling its the best game ever. The next you're violently exploded by a hacker from half the map away. All your weapons are suddenly gone. You open the menu to hit to hit "change session" but you can't even do that since THE GAME CLOSES THE MENU EVERY TIME YOU DIE. Sure you can report them by email. Sure hacks are transient and eventually the game should grow "safer" and less exploitable as Rockstar addresses issues and releases patches... but right now some days are just bad like that.What's that about mission requirements? Well to me the best kind of missions in GTA Online are the heists. These require a 4 person team to play. So sometimes you're in the swing of things running with a solid crew and clearing out mission after mission... and sometimes you're just stuck in eternal lobby limbo waiting for that elusive "last member" to join your team and every time you get one they quit mid mission (throwing you all out since that's how the game is designed). This might not be a problem if you're not going after heists with such enthusiasm but eventually you have to remember one thing Multi player games are just that meant for multiple people to play together and your fellow players will make or break your experience with the game almost every time. Keep that in mind and if you have a big group of friends who are already into the game good for you!And finally loading times. I got a fairly high end PC and I can run the game on very high settings without performance issues and still I spend a good 2 3 minutes loading into the game at start up and a minute or two after every mission. This is time consuming it breaks the immersion and mainly just sucks because sometimes the game initiates loading in cases where it really shouldn't have. I'll give you an example that happens to me daily You're invited to a mission while playing online. You hit 'accept' and instantly get a message saying 'session full returning to GTA online'... so far so good too bad you were in session literally 3 seconds ago and now you're going to load up another one for 2 minutes. Done loading? What's that another invite? "Heh let's try" you say... Nope. Full again. Loading again. Enjoy your wait. This issue might not be that bad if you're running the game off an SSD but then again it's a 60 GB game. Kinda heavy IMO.TL DR? I got you covered.Good Great looking game. Very solid single player. Online mode is a beast especially when you have friends online.Bad Some bugs ruin missions though rarely. Hackers online. Game aka "Loading Simulator 2015."Final verdict Very Recommended!Thanks for taking the time to read my review. Obviously all the above is just my opinion and I appreciate anyone who cares enough to read it. So far I enjoyed the game very much and I'd say buy it and have a blast )

review: As for your personal score and perception of this game.. it really depends on what part you are trying to play. Are you just doing SP or are you doing the GTA Online portion as well?Because GTA Online (PC) still has a ton of issues since launch especially those of modders and hackers killing the entire 30 player lobby at once and then blaming it on another innocent player. And even though there are not that many 12 year old squeakers as in the console version you are now having to deal with smart teens and young adults. Another problem is matchmaking. Trying to play a heist with a lagging Chinese player teleporting around the map is no fun. There are no region locks so you might end up in a lobby where everyone speaks Russian. And then everyone disconnects and you are the only player.But if you simply want to avoid all of this together at least complete the single player mode or if you played the console version before you should try beating the game again. To be able to make out the unshaved stubble on Michael's chin to see the beautiful water reflections on the waves as the sun is setting brings a tear to my eye. I am running on a low spec computer and I can still perceive all of this with everything but texture resolutions toned down. Your online character will have new makeup and facepaint options too as well as highlights for your hair and opacity for your eyeliners.

review: A while back I submitted a negative review because of the whole OpenIV fiasco. When this was resolved I changed it to positive. However I am now changing it back for different reasons...Over the years GTA V has changed a LOT. Unfortunately these changes only added new content to the Online aspect of the game and were increasingly more pricey. After being away from this game for a while I am now beginning to see just how much of disgusting pile of GTA V has become. When you don't own every single addition made to the game you will get bombarded by phonecalls emails and info popups to remind you that you still need to sink those millions into that pointless property that you will barely use. And if you dó use said property a lot there will be upgrades that cost you MILLIONS to obtain! Meanwhile the real life money to gta dollar ratio has not changed at all making this even more ridiculous.Seriously this game has become a disgusting pile of and I refuse to support it. In fact I'd rather recommend people to buy cheat menus at this point.

review: So it looks like its another wave of people getting banned. Many people myself included have been banned even though we've never violated the terms of use. A character i've spent 1257 hours on according to steams "play time" gone in an instant and I do not even get to know why. Like many of them I've tried multiple times to get Rockstar support to even get this looked at and all I get is bots telling me all bans are final. When I ask WHY I was banned Rockstar support just tells me "Read terms of use". It feels like their responce is simply "You know what you did" or "We don't know you figure it out". I could go on a rant about this and tell how Rockstar is greedy and how little they care about their players even going so far as to censor people who raise too big a stink about stuff like this. But there are enough people telling you that here already. Instead I will give you this warning.Do not grow to fond of your character or invest to much time/real money in them as I did. At any moment Rockstar's ban bot could ban you and delete the character while it is at it.

review: It's GTA V. What else can you say about it?If you don't know this game you must be either completely new to gaming or waking up from a pre 2000 coma. Welcome back!It has A WORLD of content it still gets regularly updated with new things it's active and there's a lot to do. You are very likely to encounter hackers sooner or later but you can just switch lobbies or play with your friends (it's fantastic when you get a crew to roll with) or even alone. You create a character customize it dress it up as you like you level up by doing stuff shooting stealing racing killing heisting the good stuff you name it. As you level up you unlock loads of stuff to do and play with properties to buy like safehouses and garages businesses to generate more cash more missions vehicles clothes tatoos hairstyles etc.You have stats for shooting driving flying underwater breathing but all that is improved through playing and never really degrades so unless you're really obsessive about it you needn't pay much attention to it.Regarding the single player aspect it's fantastic lots of stuff to do three protagonists to play as the missions are varied and wacky in true GTA style. PC gets first person too which is a damn fine addition to an already very polished game.The only literal bad thing are the loading times but if you can stand that (through SSD or sheer patience) you're golden. Enjoy!

review: *I edited this recently*(KEEP IN MIND THAT I HAVE NOT COMPLETED THE STORY AND HAVE MOSTLY PLAYED ONLINE)GTA V is a hell of a lot better than I was expecting. The gameplay itself is fun and the co op is good. I enjoy the co op because it actually requires coordination and not everyone can go in balls to the wall without saying a single word to the team without failing. (I mean this as in Lamar missions and Heists) I find playing with friends to be the best way to play through this game but I will say this.Anti Cheat isn't good. I have played online with randoms for a very small amount of time and I found a modder 2 out of 3 times. Community also isn't great *cough cough* Sernandoe *cough cough**Edit*I guess that I've jumped the gun a little bit here. The game itself isn't that bad but you're going to have some pain in terms of grinding. Rockstar places ridiculously high prices on stuff and that normally wouldn't be an issue but you're going to be grinding for hours sometimes days. I'm fairly certain this is to sell the shark card (which are not worth it I might add)

review: Have been an avid GTA player since day one including all the side ones like GTA London. Had GTA V on xbox transferred to PC when bought it here also.Cant fault the game all the extras they've added to the online game theres loads to do even in the single player. Theres even side games of golf tennis mountain biking and skydiving to name a few.The only issue you are going to have apart from their shocking server issues and hackers/modders is trying to get your account unbanned after they wrongly ban you for whatever reason they picked as they never even tell you this either.You can be in a game suddenly have cars planes moneys trees etc you get the idea drop on your head then suddenly you have a months ban. Nice guilt by location I was there so I must be guilty.Sooner or later it will happen to you when it does good luck. Whilst I agree you need a system to ban the hackers/modders blanket bans across the server room you're in doesnt quite cut it for me. I made 300k in 5 hours before I was banned for a month. The only other issue was I had two cars mysteriously drop from the sky onto my head before I managed to change to another server. If you read from their forums anything to do with bans they ignore whether it be twitter a ticket or the forums. Theres no appeals process once they decide you're banned permantely I assume you're gone for good. I assume this transfers to earlier and later games also as I cant be arsed to check.Whilst I have enjoyed the game series for so many years theres always something that spoils it. Be it modder/hackers or customer service/game infraction rules. I cant recommend this for online gameplay with the state of play at the moment knowing full well that sooner or later with their severe system in place you could loose access to anything you have earned bought or worked towards. Unless of course this is a marketing ploy to make you buy Shark Cards(ingame credit boosts) to retrieve what they removed.The single player game whilst good wont keep you very long and once you've done the sotryline theres only so much more to do. I wont be buying the next in the franchise for this to happen again unless I read something stating they've changed the system they're using for hackers to something more fair and appealable for when they get it wrong.They're still going to mess up but not allowing it to be appealed is ridiculous. Then again I suppose they already have my money so they obv need to cull the player numbers on the server somehow.Buy it on sale only at least 50% off otherwise walk away. You dont need this kind of BS in your life.Edit 1st August 2018For some reason I got a huge cash lump sum from R*. Dunno why not complaining.Been playing this again since just before the After Hours Update. Havent seen many spawners/money droppers in the sessions. Hopefully R* has managed to sort out most of the issues.I must say I'm loving the Back to the 80s vibe with the Gay Tony return. I always did love playing this game and the extra stuff in the After Hours update is almost like reliving GTA IV. Now if they could only do San Andreas in the V engine or even GTA London then I'd be in my element.From what I've read they've changed their policy on people whom had money dropped on them. Seems promising. With this in mind and the recent update I'm changing my review to positive. Like I said before the game was always great it was the way they handled cheaters and innocent victims of these cheaters that made me place the negative review. Time alone will tell.

review: So i figured the byline of Steam's refund process "case by case basis" would give me some leeway since I tried to get this game to work and not crash during almost any cutscene randomly. That was not the case. I was refused/denied a steam refund for playing for 5 hours. You'd think multibillion dollar companies like rockstar and valve would have a fairly streamlined game here with few bugs but apparently that's not the case. This the first game I've not been able to get working on my setup (6700k 1080ti 32gb) ever and also the first and only refund request I ever made. Not a good look for either and I suppose I can now fully latch onto the idea this platform and its ethos has calcified into a soulless "screw you gimme money" platform like all turn into. Oh well.TLDR Don't play over 2 hours or you can't refund if the game is nigh unpplayable. Claiming you tried to fix it a bit after the 2 hours means nothing. The 'case by case' byline of steam's refund policy is bunk for me at least. Highly unrecommended.

review: I had to change my review from positive to negative because of how awful this game has become.GTA Online has the potential to be really awesome and I've had my fair share of fun with it but it's become obvious that Rockstar sees it not as a game with players but as a scam with marks. GTA Online has hands down the worst anti cheating/hacking measures I've ever seen. You have to get on 5+ year old Call of Duty games to see hacking this bad. More than half the servers I log into have some blowing everyone up spawning tons of vehicles on top of people or countless other annoying things. And they get even more aggressive if you're running in a CEO crew and trying to make money.Of course Rockstar has anti cheating measures but they only seem to kick in when a hacker is doing something that helps players get around buying Shark Cards (GTA's 'pay real money for in game money' system). I've never seen a hacker shut down for doing annoying t or for destroying players who are trying to make money honestly (even when they're reported). I've seen countless hackers shut down for giving free money to players with the players also having their money taken away. Taking this along with how absurdly grindy it is to make money in this game and I'm forced to the conclusion that Rockstar only cares about their players insofar as they can get them to buy more Shark Cards. I can't recommend this otherwise excellent game so long as they're continuing slimey business practices like this.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Everything is so realistic and the online part of it has to be my favorite. Being able to blow up my friends in 1v1 style combat is tantalizing. review: This is the best Loading Screen Simulator I've ever played! There's barely any time you have to wait between Load screens so you don't have to wait to wait. The game in between Load screens is pretty fun too but luckily the matchmaking and the mission/heist joining system is so buggy that you're never separated long from your favorite spinning Loading icon! Then there's the bonus the game crashes and gray screens! These are really fun too and not hard to find either as you can find them with any graphics settings on almost any resolution.I rate this Loading Screen Simulator 9/10..........unless if you like the game in between Load screens in which case you'd better just wait until Rockstar decides to optimize the game (I'm sure chasing hacking and modding is their first priority so they'll take their time getting to it).

review: After over 700 hours in this game I have learned a lot. First off it's a blast. The singleplayer is definitely worth the purchase alone. In online people can be s (Extremely annoying s) I mean s as in kill you over and over for no reason. That takes some getting used to. Most importantly this is a grinding game. It has races and adversary modes and other tid bits but it is primarily grinding whatever you can for money. If you don't like grinding games don't play GTA online. But if you do welcome to paradise. I have spent somewhere's around 600 hours grinding in this game for my "criminal enterprise" and I am still not getting bored. The biggest issue you will find in GTA online is the used to be frequent but now somewhat rare modder. They can screw anybody's day up. I was never really much of one for giving reviews but here is what I thought I should say. 93.65% recommend.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Almost 400 hours into this game 100% online. I've loved and hated this game for years but keep crawling back for more. It's potentially the best online game to play with friends however that goes without mentioning modders or the sometimes 5min+ menu loading times just to get sent back to another F'ng load screen for 3mins+. Modders are good and bad you can probably guess how they can be beneficial but 93% of the time they will be jackasses spawning on you or just blowing you and your car up no matter what mission you've been trying to do for a hour. Great game but you can't have thin skin online and single player is like playing GTA V beta there's none of the cars that are available online so you are always forced to crawl back for more. Good job Rockstar. Oh yea.. the ingame swear/curse/badword filter is horrible you can't say "Rockstar" and abunch of other words that are not even close to being bad.

review: First off I first bought this game and made an account back on my X Box 360 like 5 years ago. So don't let the few hours that I have on my Steam account fool you. Secondly if there was a netural button I'd be hitting that instead of recommend/not recommend to be completely honest. However I do have to say the PC version is a lot better cause you have a lot more content and stability.Now on to more of the up front and brutally honest opinions/facts of the PC version of GTA V Positive 1 There is a lot more content like I stated before. As well as newer content being released first on PC(Although I could be wrong about that part) 2 This version of the game runs much more smooth as stated prior. 3 You have the option to multi task using more then one screen with out having to switch between screen settings(If your console and PC are hooked up to the same TV unless you have a laptop) 4 More key binding options then console versions. 5 Computers will more likely have more memory then a console so no need to uninstall any games to run this one with all the new updates always coming out. Negitive 1 There are a lot more hackers and it seems to me like you have to report them A LOT to RockStar in order for them to even start giving a damn! Plus other player's love to exploit them for money and other items instead of reporting them! 2 The cost of certain things you need to do to expand you MC/Org Bunker and the newer features plus a lot of the cars is stupid compaired to how much you make per mission or other jobs you can do. Plus the fact that some Heists take so long to prepair and are so hard it's like you need a team of PRO gamers plus the payouts suck! I mean come on RockStar that's why you have people hacking in the first place! Maybe if you lowered the cost of certain things and gave us missions that gave us better payments but not as much as Heists things might just be better! 3 RockStar support is always hard to deal with so it matter not which version of the game you have you will usually always feel somewhat empty when trying to get help from them. And when I say usually I mean like %92 %98 of the time you'll feel like it was nothing but a waste of time even if you got the issue resolved and the only way to resolve was through RockStar. 4 Even though this game is not free the game can attract some toxic crowds from time to time. So while in free mode you might not want to deal wth it. Alright let's kick them! Vote to kick someone you got like 3 votes..... person is still not kicked. Now you got like 7 votes out of say 24 people......... Guess what! you need like %90 of the people in the server to vote to kick that one player in order for them to be kicked! So if it's a hacker ruining your day Just find another server everyone will suck up to them and do whatever they want to get some free cash! Don't even bother trying to finish your cargo run or that car delivery it's not worth the frustration if the hacker is targeting you. Do not give them the satisfaction of killing you and making you waste all that time and effort. Quit while you're ahead and on top. 5 RockStar keeps coming with more content but no new real ways of earning real cash in game unless you already have lost of cash so you can buy the new content. They are trying to steal your money(Real life hard earned money. Don't put any real money into this game it's NOT WORTH IT!) If they put some more missions that you could actually do with the base content that paid out rather well then we'd be getting somewhere! Greedy jerks!

Then they'll almost always run away and avoid you until you least expect it then do the same thing or they might just go in passive if they know that you will destroy them. I call these people K/D Warriors all they care about is killing people and their kill death ratio. One of the major reasons people hate this game is because of the cheaters. If you have played this game at all then you know what I'm talking about. I guarantee you will run in to at least one cheater while playing. review: This game is absolutely fantastic. There's very few bad things to even mention about it. The story is composed to make fun of the American ideals and it succeeds in it. To add to that the story is really long which offers a lot of game time (30 something hours of story) + a bunch of side missions to do in addition. And the multiplayer which supercedes GTA IV by miles. In terms of performance this game is so well optimized. I don't have the strongest PC out there (AMD R9 290 AMD FX 6300 6core 8gb ram) and I could still run it on high settings. If you want to squeeze the most out of this you're going to need a titan and lots of ram. Try crossfiring too to get the most out of the amazing graphics.The only few bad things I do have to say would be that with all of their immersion with the environment they really should've added indicators. Adds more realism for us role players. In addition to that there was also the fact that no matter whether your gun was silenced or not police got right on you no matter where you shot. And when it comes to multiplayer then occasionally me and my buddies had difficulty getting in each others games but that's about the only bad thing. I hope they add big bank robberies into multiplayer soon.All in all it is a very very good game that I can happily recommend to anyone who wants to be armed with 20 guns to go on a killing spree on bikers gang members and the police. People who enjoy a good story will not be disappointed either with superb voice acting and sound quality. The performance as I mentioned earlier is also a very good reason why anyone should try it out. It might just run smooth as butter on your baby.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: With Some hours under my belt I have to change my mind on GTA V being a good game. To be honest It's not. It's a pretty boring rehash of what used to be a fun game but which has been milked dry by now. The story mode is alright the story is basically san Andreas 2.0 . The dialog is funny. And so on. The missions become repetitive pretty quickly and after a while you just get bored. Sure the city is well made but the amount of entrable buildings is very very lowThe online mode... Well that's repitiion coming out of every pixel. You have a bunch of heists which are the only interesting missions but that's all. Some standard races with occasionally a funny twice when you race golfcarts. Some fedex misisons collecting item A then taking it to point X. Some ratkilling in there somewhere. Done. Then random people on a random server. Don't kill them too often and don't destroy their precious cars that respawns though. You'll get Bad player points because you have to be a nice criminal. Meanwhile if you drive around aimlessly doing F*** all you are rewarded. So yeah that was the part where I said to myself "Really?" In the end GTAV is a game you can buy in one of Gabe's discounts. It's fun with friends but outside of that there's too much repitition to be a game you'll spend hours playing. Unless you're some hardcore fanboy. 20 30 would be a good price for it.

review: Great game and the king of sandbox play. Their opening of the sandbox to online play is incredibly exciting and some of the most meaningful online play you can experience in an ideal scenario. However there is a lot of rot in the form of hackers and this is incredibly unfortunate as it completely destroys an otherwise amazing experience. Past this the game gives a whole plethora of activities for you and your friends to do and an armada of vehicles to collect in various bunkers and facilities scattered about Los Santos. Currently it is in the twilight of it's Golden Era look for something newer and shinier in the future but not too soon as Rockstar is now cenetered on consoles with their release of Red Dead Redeption 2. Red Dead Redeption was never released on PC dispite a few petitions and obvious potental to make millions and it was Rockstar's first entry into online sandbox multiplayer which had very few problems on consoles. After what the PC community did with GTA V in regards to hacking and headaches I doubt we'll be seeing Rockstar bringing RDR 2 to PC. So if you want to experience the best there is in sandbox play here is this mess with no announcements for the future or even if there ever will be one on PC.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The story was fine I can't really compare this to the last few games because the last GTA game I played was is San Andreas on the PSP and that I never actually finished it. The story was fine and easy to understand technically there are 3 stories but that doesn't matter much. All you need to know is that the game is fun. The controls are very tight the combat is delicious and the driving is good of course the driving is good in a GTA game.Once you finish the story you will want to play some online right? The answer is NO this game is filled with hackers it is actually impossible to be in an online session without any hackers. What you need to do is host a private online session with your friends and it really just defeats the purpose if you're looking for a war spree with some randoms.What is the worst thing in this game is the loading time the load time is ing terrible not for the story but for the online. The game loads forever and when it finishes you are in a server with flying tanks and hackers dropping money on people (which can get you banned even if you're not hacking)4/6

review: This is definitely one of my favourite games.The singleplayer is amazing theres so much to do the story side quests (Strangers &amp Freaks) activites etc.All the characters are so well written they all show character development as you play through the story.The amount of detail put into the world of Los Santos is astounding the animals buildings vehicles civilians.GTA Online has mass amounts of problems connectivity issues all items being overpriced and sometimes people being banned for no reasons. But GTA Online is still so much fun you can always have a laugh with your mates and even make new friends. And its amazing how rockstar are still updating the online mode even though the games been out for nearly 5 years.All in all GTA 5 is an fantastic game i highly recommend it

review: If you buy GTA V for the singleplayer you will have a great time and I really did enjoy it but the multiplayer was my main focus and why this review is negative.The multiplayer now takes me over 20 minutes to load into which is just insane. I get it is a large game but it used to take 8 minutes.While I have personally not met many hackers and modders I know there is a large amount of them that can easily ruin a session and potentially get you banned. Rockstar support with ban's never really works and is frustraiting to work with.Lastly It now just takes too much of a grind to get any large amount of money because Rockstar wants you to buy shark cards. Every new car is overpriced and takes too long to getIf you want a great singleplayer experience then this is a great game but if you are looking for a good multiplayer game I would advise checking out other games first.

However every once in a while the wire accidentally gets tugged a bit and it disconnects for about half a second not long enough to have a major effect and it isn't that common luckily at least in every other controller supported game. With this game however whenever it happens the controller switches to player two. This doesn't make any sense to me at all considering it doesn't have a split screen multi player option for two players to even work. None of my other games do this it just connects right back as player one even games that DO have split screen multiplayer options.Edit I should also mention that it will switch back to player one if I completely close out of the game reconnect the controller (wired) and log back into the game.

review: To be honest I don't really have anything new to say about this game that haven't been said already. Grand Theft Auto 5 is a well crafted game. The singleplayer aspect of the game is fun and worth playing through but the online aspect of the game is where you'll have the most fun and what you probably pay the game for. Wait you have a hard time getting money in GTA 5 Online? Well you got some options.The first one is obvious. GRIND. Making big money takes a long time but if you are dedicated and have a lot of hours to kill this is the solution. But wait if you also have some money to spare waste them on MICRO TRANSACTIONS silly! That will definitely speed up the process. The last one isn't all that common but you could encounter a hacker in the lobby that you join. If you are lucky enough they might give you a couple billions and be on with their day or make your session a cluster .Sounds good to you? Buy the game.Godspeed.

review: The online component of this game is unplayable. Every public session is full of hackers.They like to teleport everyone on the map to their location and blow them up or walk around invincible shooting everyone or any number of other annoying things. But by far the most annoying thing was them adding money to my account. There is no way to stop them or to seperate out your funds from what they added.Now when I bought the game a couple weeks ago I also bought 3 shark cards with the bonus running at the time that was about 20 million in game currency. I figured it wasn't really any different than buying expansion packs for other games and that that would get me up to date on all the old content and ready for gunrunning. But I had that problem with hackers adding money to my account. When I logged in today to get started with gunrunning most of my money was gone. Rockstar adjusted my account down to about $2000 in game currency. you R*. I will never buy another one of your games again. Now it's entirely possible that I had actually spent the money there isn't actually any way for me to tell. But I really don't care. As I said public sessions are unplayable because of all the hacking. One of them actually thought they were doing something nice for me and that's what R* cracks down on? Not all the ing trolls teleporting me to their location with a proximity mine waiting? you Rockstar.Never again will I buy one of your games. I want my money back for the game and for the 3 shark cards I bought.

Not being able to mod the game just because rockstar wants more people to use online so they can get more money is wrong. If rockstar had a actual problem with it they would've stopped it 10 years ago. Don't get me wrong I love the game but I don't know if I'll be able to play it in a few months. Next thing you know they remove story mode or something. Do not buy this game on any console/pc until it is more stable.

review: This game is FUN. If you haven't played it before I suggest that you at least give it a try. Singleplayer is pretty amazing so is Online Mode though cheaters may troll you sometimes... All you have to do if that happens is either join another session or go to singleplayer then back to Online.The game is filled with a lot of content that is still added almost every month or every 2 weeks in some cases. Also Online is very good if you have some friends to play it with.You will find things such as racing adversary modes a very good storyline for singleplayer along with a very good story tons of places to explore dozens of easter eggs heists amazing graphics and all that nice stuff. Oh and.. A LOT of cars.. I mean... A LOOOOTTT.Anyway if you find it hard to make money in Online mode I recommend you find a money guide for Online and not use cheats because there are pretty high chances you will get banned and your character will be reset second ban and you are going to not be able to play Online mode forever. So.... **DONT CHEAT GUYS**

review: Grand theft auto is what you wish your real life could be. Its a game with no limits. The single player campaign has you invested in till the end. And then the biggie comes "GTA ONLINE". GTA online is the place where you let your imagination run wild and do all sorts of things that make you feel good. The graphics of the game are solid and it runs very well on low end pcs too. Its a must to have in your library.

review: After playing this game for several months I've done nearly everything there is to do but I'm still having fun! Finishing the Story Mode was quick and rather easy however that's only a fraction of what this game has to offer. Playing GTA V Online is a whole new game with new missions new obstacles and the chance to interact with plays who most of the time make the game more difficult just by being bad. That's just part of the entertainment.There isn't much I could bash this game for. It's a large map with an enormous variety of NPCs weapons locations and vehicles so you do sometimes run into a really annoying glitch but except for the occasional game drop there's nothing severe. The biggest problem I have with GTA V (Online) is how many modders there are. No game that I've played has every found a definitive solution for hackers but in most games you can't change the actual world using hacks like you can in this game. Modders spawn UFOs make ground vehicles fly and can glitch your character so hard it immobilizes you or even makes your game drop. I love that Rockstar constantly updates the game and adds new content so often but these modders are a problem that should be prioritized. I cannot recommend this game highly enough especially if you have friends to play with online!

Rockstar keeps adding unnecessary weaponized/Sci Fi flying vehicles that I personally believe don't belong in GTA but rather other games like Saints Row. Also like I stated earlier modders can easily get into GTA online which is really toxic so that'd be good if rockstar could fix that. Like a 4/10

review: Ok i have seen that people are getting banned from gta for stupid reasons but lets be honest they probably got a hacker or were hacking and got themselves banned because in this game there is no shortage of hackers in the absloute slightest like 1 2 per server but thats not really a problem when you work your way around them. I recomend this game because of its online multiplayer aspect and its ability to keep me hooked for long extensive periods of time without any doubts of playing anything else whatsoever. However there is the argument that "hey some vehicles are so expensive you have to give your family away to a terrorist group to pay for it." However i have found that the vehicles at that price have their reason to it being they are very powerful and useful however thats also no a problem either because when you get a hanger and you have some friends money is not a problem to speak of just time and effort and you will have what you wanted. So even though people are complaining they're getting banned and such thats just the fact a hacker may have done something to them and i would agree thats a problem Rockstar needs to adress with GTA 6 because of the utter easiness to hack in the game. But i would still recomend this game because it is 2 games packed into 1. Singleplayer which i havent even gotten into but ive heard its good and then multiplayer which brings the best multiplayer experience I have ever seen in the entierty of my existence. Buy the game you wont regret it.

review: This game is kind of absolutley terrible Servers are absolute horse br&gt Due to this fact Combat is unbalancedPeople will have terrible phantom hit boxes and their modle will frequently not match their hit box Enemies tend to take 60+ rounds of an assult rifle and still get up to kill youCombat is also unbalanced in the same way as peer to peer combat works You can't have fun fue to constant disconnectsAlmost every time I play with friends I have atleast 5 random disconnects that ruin everything for us.On top of this Rockstar refuses to fix hacking and modding problemI frequently see hackers getting people banned because they (being the hacker) keep spawning money on their character (that being the innocent) until the servers think that they are hacking and ban them. This is an absolutely broken system and pains me to even think why Rockstar has not fixed this with a simple anti cheat engine yet. Rockstar refuses to fix server problemsI will frequently experience copious ammounts of lag for no reason at all. No lag spikes are shown in my ping but I will still rubber band around the map. On top of this the peer to peer connection is absolutley broken as well. I will be playing with my friends during a heist and at random they will disconnect and force restart the heist 100% reverting all of our work. online is the only allure that the game has leftIf all the game has left to do is do heists over and over again as well as jobs then this game is beyond on its last legs. I cannot explain the tedious build ups to the ends of the heists where you actually make any kind of money. Further elaborationRaces races races races and more racesYou can't play any elaborate mission that doesn't require a large sum of money to start up. All the rockstar jobs and online posted jobs are absoulute trash and barley fun to play the first time around. I cannot see why people are still having fun with this horse Heists are boring and repetitive. Go in kill someone get a vehicle or information then rob the place. They are all boring and the ammount of times you will be restarting the missions due to 1 person getting killed will make the end result so underwhelming that you will want to quit the game then and there.When your game's only remaining selling point is online wouldn't you care even a small bit to make it playable and good? This game is over hyped beyond all others for no good reason and should be forgotten like all the other garbage GTA games that came before this one. I can't recomend this game at all to anyone due to its absolute fest of online content.2/10 rockstar is a terrible company that will never change. I do not expect this game getting any better from here. DO NOT BUY

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: For how much money Rockstar has made off of this game I'm shocked that their servers are in the state that they're in. You'll find hackers or "modders" as they're so benignly dubbed on every other server. I constantly see pooros asking for them to drop money for them and they wonder why they're getting banned left and right for violating terms of service. It's not uncommon to just wind up dead because some eleventeen year old used a hack to make everyone suicide at the same time. I usually jump ship and find a smaller lobby which is where you'll want to be if you run VIP or MC jobs that guarantee money. There's a healthy toxicity in some lobbies but not all. There is also a mix of foreign lobbies and sometimes you get paired with 3 Russians or Brazilians in a heist who can't communicate with you. The game has some fatal online flaws and the grindy nature of it all can be a turn off. Once you get over that 2 or 3 million dollar hump things get a bit easier. That being said the game is still a riot of fun. I find myself giggling or bursting out loud with laughter at some of the absurdities I encounter online. Finding a group of friends can make this game 10 times better but there's a kind of pleasant solitude if you can find your own public lobby. I usually can turn on or off my VPN while joining a lobby in order to get my own all to myself. It makes VIP missions incredibly easy because nobody is trying to kill you and you can fill your MC businesses with supplies with all the time in the world. I recommend the game at the price point I picked it up at $38. It's gone on sale now for $30 in the last sale or two so if you're on the fence about picking it up only commit at anything less than $60. It's kind of insulting that it's still $60 this long after PC release and 3+ years after initial release.

review: I'll be talking about the online portion of this game because the singleplayer aspect of the game is obviously great and very well done GTA Online is great on the condition that you have friends to play. The game provides many ways to make money but you're going to need to spend a lot of your money to do things like have a corporation motorcycle club etc. Despite all the ways to make money becoming a millionare is a slow process and will take some grinding but with friends the pain is alleviated. Despite these problems Los Santos is a compelling sandbox to explore and there's enough variety to keep you occupied for hours on end.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I have a love hate relationship with this game. The story mode is ing amazing and is like being a part of a movie. I absolutely loved it.GTA Online is a different story. The community is as toxic as it is friendly and it's a gamble whether or not you get to play wth competent people. That's not the games fault though. I haven't had too many interactions with modders/hackers although I don't play a ton. You definitely have to grind a lot to get what you want.Final summation Story mode is a masterpiece and Online could use some work. I do reccomend this game especially if it is on sale.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The story mode of this game is ing amazing but most of you already know that and are probably looking to buy the game to play online with your friends and let me tell you the online is a total . Modders everywhere impossible to make money to buy cars. Only way of getting rich is by playing this game every single day of your life for at least 4 hours or buying shark cards. Rockstar is greedy as and its disgusting. 4/10 on the nigg scale
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is honestly one of my favorite games. I have played the story mode multiple times over and i still come back to mess around. I don't play GTA Online so i mostley just mess around in single player with mods and trainers. I first played this game on Xbox 360 when it first came out and i finished it at least twice on that alone. I then bought it on the Xbox One and probably finished it another 2 or 3 times. Since i've had it on Steam i've probably played the story 2 times agian. This game has one of the best singleplayer stories of any game. One of the best things about it are the 3 main characters. Franklin Michael and Trevor. They each have their own appeal and they feel like real people and even though they are the bad guys you can still connect with them. To think this game came out in 2013 and it's been on 5 different systems says something. This game is still going strong and will continue to for a while. The only thing i can say bad about this game is that they were planning singleplayer DLC but it was canceld in favor of GTA Online development. Besides that this game is really good. Defenitley worth the price.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Let me get this cleared up. This is not a "I hate this game" review.The game itself is good. The single player campaign is extensive and very fun. The character vehicle and weapon customizaiton is great and the game is overall fun.It's Rockstars policies that force a negative review. They ban EVERYONE for recieving modded money intentional or not. You were so caught up in a event that you didn't notice the money? BANNED! You were confused and didn't know what was going on? BANNED! Yes you can escape a ban. If you can go to rockstars support page and write up a post asking them to take the money away within 5 minutes if not... BANNED!The worst part is. You can't appeal. If you were banned because some ******* hacker made you his target you can do absolutely nothing about it. Remember that money you spent on shark cards? Well get ready to spend it again because a hacker just gave you $5!The game is good but Rockstar is getting too careless with who they ban.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After being positively surpised by GTA GTA2 Vice City and San Andreas I was disappointed with GTA IV** and almost skipped GTA V as well. But luckily I didn't as this game is brings the title back to its old glory. Fun beautiful addictive. That's all I have to say.GTA Online in the other had has some serious issues. The public servers are very quiet and mostly populated by hackers who blow every player up every 5 minutes. Trying to do some missions or racing may involve 5 10 minutes of waiting for other players. However if played in a private session with friends GTA Online is incredibly fun. Heists offer lots of challenge (especially trying to do elite challenges) and the forced grinding doesn't feel that bad (you'll need to level up your character to use certain weapons etc.). Too bad there are only few heists and they'll get repetitive after you've done them few times in every role but yet they are fun to play.**) I don't know why. I really liked only the Lost and damned expansion.

review: They totally ruined GTA Online. I played it because I liked the real life simulation and the fun that there was. I stopped playing for a year and now I'm back and I'm greeted with flying motorbikes with missiles and a pay to win freemode. New DLC cars (which at this point are all the exact same thing with a reskin so you can give up as much money as possible thinking you're getting "content") cost 3 4 times as much as the already not very affordable ones did in the first DLCs anyone who puts real money into the game can buy one of several kinds of invincible death machines (or you can grind for literal weeks...) all the RPG realism is totally dead...It's not a real life but cooler simulator anymore. It's just a game for people who put real money into the game to bully and flex on normal people just wanting to have fun. Everything has to be bigger better faster MORE explosions MORE sports cars... All this superficial trash that is unattainable for anyone who doesn't invest either huge chunks of their free time or of course real money.Having something cool to destroy people with like a fighter jet used to be difficult enough rewarding fun and balanced. But with stuff like the Hydra and MKII Oppressor people who spent 30 on each vehicle and just literally float up to you and wipe you out with no resistance. You just get defenslessly annihilated. Not to mention the literal missile truck and that weird future tank thing.GTA Online isn't fun or rewarding anymore. It's just feels like you're a pig having carrots dangled in front of your face by Rockstar and pay2play players.

review: This game is trash.No let's say it in another way.GTA is good.GTA V is also good.GTA Online is pure trash.It is fun when and if you play with a friend you know and I write this having 300 hours of it between PS3 and PS4 but at the end of day the activities you do are always the same. Grab some weapons/crates/cars and bring them to your expansive base hoping no one will come to bother you. Is this fun? No. Then why you do it? Why for money of course because Rockstar always find a way to block cheaters but I don't mean those cheaters who destroy you while well... cheating. I mean people who gain free money with a mod menu because if you want to make money in the hard way you will get bored of it before you get more than one supercar and a single office or bunker or whatever you want. And that's why those greedy a**es gave us an option to buy money with money. Cool right?! Yeah throw away 75 Euros to have 8 milions in game (and they still won't be enough). Now I'm tired I spent every single hour looking for an hacked session but I found nothing I'll just play something else.By the way if you want to play the regular GTA V then you should buy this not the best game but still fun but stay away from GTA Online.

review: I honestly do not know what to give this game because the singleplayer is great but the multiplayer is NOT so great even though all I play now is GTA V Online. The singleplayer is really rich in story and it is also an open world game so there are of course side missions you can complete and basically a lot of things you can do however I wished the game was more open world being able to enter any buildings etc. But overall it has a really great singleplayer mode and many things to do/take part in. However the multiplayer is just a disaster. The character customisation at the beginning is really limited and horrible followed by the incredibly long loading time it can take up to 10 minutes just to load you into the world etc. Most heists/missions are usually the same and you fail too quickly if someone in your team screws up (I did a mission with this guy before and we had to replay &gt 20 times because he kept alerting the enemies. Boring minigames annoying phone calls from people that asks you to buy a property and poorly paid tasks. I wish there was more to rob other than minimarts (like a bank etc.). I still play this game (Online) don't get me wrong and I really enjoy it because it is something unique you get to fight with other players and own several businesses making yourself a true Kingpin but it just has a bad execution and felt like the Online mode was made in a rush compared to the singleplayer mode which was well polished so I wasn't able to give a good review for this game.Overall 5.5/10 (Mostly goes to singleplayer)P.S. AIRCRAFT CONTROLS ON PC IS TERRIBLE (or maybe its just me lol)
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Before (i have been randomly suspended + all character wiped) you read this I would recommend a few specs to have before buying this game for decent settings and a stable frame rate. Trust me I have a 1050ti i3 2100 and I play 720p with the lowest settings possible and I barely get 60fps.Have anything about or higher below for good settings and 60+fps1050tiI5 74008gb ram100gb of space on hdd needed.Random bans I was recently suspended for no reason and also they wiped all my characters details. I dont mod i get money drops *not wanted* i was level 300 and something (why would i mod after all that?) but since you made me do all that and get wiped. give me a refund. i dont like this game anymore i cant even appeal for the suspension *bans are final*. this is pathetic because i know other players have been banned for no reason.Single player Play between 3 characters known as Micheal Franklin and TrevorThe story is quite big as I spent about 30 hours for the story mode for the PS4Multiplayer (GTAO) Make a character and be prepared to grind for hours to make a simple 100k. Most of the vehicles are at rediculus prices like 5 million for a rocket car when you can get a armed flying car for the same price? 11 Million for a useless yacht? Microtransactions DO NOT BUY ANY OF THEM AT ALL. It is not worth it anymore since GTAV is ending soon. And it pointless.Hiests Some of them are good. There needs to be more bank hiests in GTAO. Graphics I'm not sure about the higher graphics since I use a i3 2100 but I see videos with the redux mods and it looks really good.Mods Never used mods much on GTA so I'm not sure what to put here. Kinda just gave up after none never worked. *Dont use mods in GTAO or expect a ban*Fivem You need GTA to use this.The best thing you can use for GTARP and for servers. Servers can have mods and not be banned.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Warning Somewhat contradictory content ahead&gt Right. So this comment was initially posted in response to an unjust ban and I will keep the entirety of that original comment below and will not change it. I do believe it contains important information to consider if you are thinking of purchasing this (or any other) Rockstar game. I stand by a lot of what I said in it and personally will most likely not purchase any further games from Rockstar or Take Two in the future unless they clean up their act in some key areas.That all said I need to acknowledge their relatively quick repair of the situation in my and at least some other peoples' cases that I am aware of. As of shortly before this edit my GTA Online account along with my character and stats has been fully restored having been banned and reset over the weekend as part of an apparent "ban wave". I'm very happy about that and more than a little relieved given how much time I've sunk into it.In light of the fact that they *did* take action to restore my unfairly banned account I am changing this to a "recomended" review BUT I strongly advise reading my original comment below. Poop most definitely occureth where Rockstar's online stuff is concerned and if you are interested in this game for its online portion (as I am) then you should go in with an awareness of some of the more glaring issues with it.I do apologise for the lengthy read but it's not exactly a cheap game. Better to know what you're getting in for.My original comment follows _____________________________________________________________________________I've been playing GTA V almost since it was released on PC. I bought it *primarily* for the online aspect and personally loved it. It's EXACTLY my cup of tea. The single player portion is also very good. Not really all that interesting to me personally but it "is" very good. If that's all you're interested in then go for it it was a great story. I'm only really interested in the multiplayer portion though so my review is following my experience of that. I have 1392 hrs in GTA in total as of this writing and the vast majority of that time was spent in online mode grinding missions and faffing about. I have spent all of that time using the same character and DO NOT CHEAT. I *have* however been harassed on many occassions by hackers griefers and general jerks. The griefers and jerks I try to avoid. The hackers I try to report and am just thankful that none of them have ever been the type to drop tons of hacked cash on me.But the other day out of the blue I was issued a temporary ban until next month along with the notice that my character would be reset and all my progress and properties in online mode would be forfeit. The reason given? " You have violated the terms of service". Ummm..... Okay? I'm pretty certain nothing I was doing or have ever done with my copy of GTA violates the terms of service. I don't cheat I don't (knowingly) exploit game mechanics and I generally stay as far away from other players as I possibly can so I don't see how I could have been interfering with other peoples' gameplay experience. Four separate tickets opened with Rockstar Support resulted in four *word for word identical* replies amounting to "all bans are final. We don't care if you are actually guilty or not. We already have your money. Please get stuffed. Love Rockstar Support".Strange how most courts of law in the civilised world no longer assume guilt until evidence to the contrary is provided (by the accused) but big businesses can do this with impunity and get away with it. I'll be taking this to the relevant authorities in my country. Will it help? No idea. Maybe if enough people stop bending over and taking it. I DISPISE hackers and cheaters in online games but brain dead algorithms most certainly can and *do* make mistakes. I "know" I'm one such case and while I'm damn certain pleanty of the people caught in this recent ban wave are guilty as charged I'm also sure there are plenty who are not.If you can be "banned" by a robot that same robot should be able to provide you with a damn good reason beyond a simple "you have done something wrong" message. Real law enforcement don't just arrest you with the statement "you have broken the law" so why is it okay for a company that you have paid for a service or product to take away that service or product based on a vague statement that you somehow deserve it but be under no legal obligation to tell you exactly "how" you deserve it? That's basically daylight robbery since you don't actually "need" to do something to deserve it because they have no legal obligation to tell you why.Long story short If you plan on getting invested in this game in the online portion and are a legitimate player don't count on "playing legitimately" to keep the ban hammer away. The algorithms have botched up before. They are STILL botching up. And Rockstar will not even ACKNOWLEDGE you if it happens to you. I LOVE this game's online portion. But I strongly advise against purchasing this game until Rockstar starts treating its "current" player base (paying customers) with a bit more respect.___________________________________________________________________________End of original comment.If you read this far then great stuff. I hope it wasn't too much of a rant and that it has been helpful to you. My over all opinion of GTA Online is that it's a lot of fun. It has its problems gameplay wise and it has its problems in terms of BS like the stuff discussed in my original comment but in general I consider it a good game. Sometimes R* and T2 stuff up badly but it's my hope that they can learn from it and do better in future. They make great games. They just need to bring their policies in line with the quality of those games.

review: I had to delete the old review to make this new one. DON'T BUY THIS GAME IF YOU PLAN TO PLAY ONLINE!!!!Cheaters have been rampant for half a year now and Rockstar can t handle them. They've a terrible god mode mod they can do anything they want like killing all the players at the same time or subtle stuff like fighting with infinite health. The mod is everywhere very easy to get and that's why TONS of kids have them... Usually the kids that can't play good and get mad when they lose. In every session with more than 10 players there's a cheater using the mod. It's common to see three to five cheaters at the same time ruining the game.Rockstar is not banning them they just suspend the cheaters... Probably because they've real money to spend buying things in Online. Also the report button is very well hidden in game and it's completely useless if the player logs out or if you close the game. The last time i played a cheater crashed my game because i publicly denounced him... I obviously couldn't report him after that.DONT BUY GTA V

The game forces you to play with hackers if you want to make money using nightclubs businesses etc. The online portion has also lost all realism everyone now has a flying bike or car with homing rockets and machines guns. review: (My English isn't so great so I apologize in advance)By now everything about this game that can be said has already been said but I still want to bring in my own personal perspective and by doing so I'll devide it to single player and online. Starting with the single player. It's amazing. It's extremely rare seeing this amount of detail in world design in so many different aspects despite very few games which come by once every few years like this one. The world is insanely detailed and diverse with tiny details in every corner of the world that I can't even begin to explain. But it doesn't end in the graphical or even audio design which takes me to my next point. The game captures every corner of the american society in the most brilliantly hilarious and sarcastic way from the in game marketing to the radio channles and commercials and to the way the npc's themselves look and talk which in my opinion is one of the major strong points in the game. Even over 1000 hours of gameplay the majority of which is in the single player I still CONSTANTLY hear new lines of dialog from npc's which are consistently clever and well written. The story it self is pretty amazimg aswell which in the most brilliant way manages to bring togathr 3 different characters from 3 drastically different edges of society togather in a fantastically written plot line with funny and whimsical characters along side fun as hell and divers missions and plenty of great scripted side missions. Although at times the game embraces realism in mission design a little too much to the point of boredom. The gameplay is out of this world aswell with fantastic driving mechanics which till this day so many games don't get it quite right like they did here descent shooting mechanics and really good animations which result in really good walking animations which even though it doesn't sound like such a big deal it is very nice to see so much work put into such minor things which in my opinion is what this game is all about. Also one more point of view is the in game graphics which along side the crazy amount of detail are extremly gorgeous on max settings with long and sharp draw distance and sharp shadows phenomenal reflection and shading. The city of los santos has never seemed so vibrent and alive with a great aspect on people of an urban city and blain county has never looked so smooth and crisp with an amazing depiction of rural america. so to summarise the single player is realistic fun and detailed as hell and I couldn't recommend it more so If the single player is what interests you go and get it right away when it's frequently on sale. Now to the online. I personally believe that in it's core its still good and not rotten although the ways of progressing are extremly flawed. I love the way the online mode gives you the amazing world from the single player and allows you to do what ever the hell you want along side with friends but in order to truly enjoy you'll need money and that's where the problems begin. The game allows you to get money by doing certain jobs which are an insane grind and unless you don't have more fortunate friends who are constantly playing and can do with you heists which are big jobs who aplly you with alot of money or own a buisness than you're pretty much on your own. Everything is annoyingly expensive and the progression system is designed to push you into paying real money for microtransactions and buy in game currency. The terrible grind and the high pricing brings in more and more cheaters into the game mode who spoil the fun even more. In conclusion if you're prepared to grind or can just enjoy some dicking around with friends and willing to try and ignore the cheating the online mode can be lots of fun but I'd reccomend to stear clear of that and stick to the single player.

review: This game has to be split into two singleplayer and GTA online. You get both obviously but they differ quite a notch. I will keep myself short If you are loking for a singleplayer gameThis one is fantastic. I played it vanilla and loved every second. Part V is my favorite of all including Vice City and San Andreas. It is very cinematic and has a lot of nice little easter eggs. The story is basically about Max Payne living a second life under a new name from police protection programme who's befriending a joung boy struggling with criminal influences from the hood. After some time a third party joins all the fun. But I won't spoiler their relationship with each other.That beeing said I give singleplayer a 11/10. Looking for a multiplayer gameAfter playing the singleplayer I switched to multiplayer. Having read some previews before I expected nothing good. I was surprised however. GTA online has a lot to offer in regards of different gametypes and charactercustomization. There's more content than in singleplayer. There are some heist there are races you can mod your car for that purpose similar to Need for Speed like games. All in all the whole GTA O experienc remins me strongly of GTA 2 which I really like. Unfortunately two thirds of the other playrs I have interacted with only want to bully you spoling the experience to a point where it's no more fun to play. You can keep in your hideout using the ingame interweb to find a suitable gamemode but that's only a weak substitute or a classc severlist/gamemod browser.I want to give GTA O a solid 5/7 but the communitiy does spoil it rendering my rating to a 4/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA has built a genre for itself. There have been other games that take the formula and make some tweaks to it (for better or worse) but nothing else is quite the same. That being said this entry tries several new things and several of them succeed. It is not a perfect game but it's flaws are part of the charm. I do appreciate all the free updates Rockstar has made over the life of the game and it has greatly increased the longevity of the title. If you have not yet tried GTA I would highly recommend it.

review: This game is amazing. Having only owned it for less than 48 hours I've already clocked up 17 hours of pure fun filled gameplay. I have never played Grand Theft Auto before so I don't have anything to compare with but this one give you various characters to play with when they become unlocked. The story line is emmersive and the cut scenes make it all the more enjoyable. There is so much to do that there is never a chance to get bored. My controller of choice is the wired afterglow xbox 360 version. I have tried keyboard and mouse and the Steam controller but my afterglow gives me full control even for rampages. If you haven't bought this game yet go buy it. It's well worth the 29 euro.

review: In many ways I believe GTA5 is the best in the series. I only have two issues with the game though. First I thought it was too easy. The fact you have checkpoints in every mission doesn't even make it a big deal if you die and I didn't find the missions to be particularly challenging. Fun yes. Challenging no. And second the physics were better in GTA4. I don't see why they would downgrade the physics instead of improve them... But in overall it's a great game and it gave me many hours of fun. Definitely recommend.

review: Being a player of many GTA games but only completing the IV and V ones I'd definitely say that this was a great game! It's always enjoyable to roam around in a sandbox kicking and taking down names. The online aspect is definitely where all the joy is to be had especially with friends. The story on the other hand is moderatly enjoyable though I mostly found myself just wanting to finish rather than enjoying it.Pros Many Hours of killing and car jacking Graphics are definitly great if you've got the gear Online has been and still is one of my favorite things to do with friendsCons Story is mediocre The money grinding online is absolutely ridiculous for some of the itemsOveral rating 9/10 It's most definitely worth having in any gamers library!
