review: After nearly 1 000 hours into this game I can say I love it very much. I've loved GTA since the very 1st one which was a top down style and really fun.There's so much to do in this game that it's hard to get bored (unless all you do is solo). Lots of money to be made if you know how things work. Even just cruising around the map doing random things or just exploring the map is fun (at least for me).The part of the game that really... REALLY makes me mad is modders and the fact that R* seems to have adopted a "no fuks givin" attitude towards them. Yes they actively respond to complaints but it seems that modding programs are hard to detect. What's absulte BS is that modders today do everything they possibly can to destroy your fun. Whether you're doing CEO / Biker things to make money or just delivering a car to Simon for a few thousand $$ they will stop at nothing to destroy your shipments cars or set you on fire permanently so you die over and over again.Modders are the cancer of GTA 5 and it's been getting worse over time. They used to be nice and help people or gave free money to the entire lobby but R* hates modded money (which I can understand as I like to make my own money). Several months back R* removed all modded money and I was actually happy because it allowed me to FINALLY make my own. I DID however enjoy the $37 million I had aquired over time due to modders because it allowed me to try CEO / Biker businesses so I knew what I wanted whenever they did a wipe.So now I have legit businesses and it's fun. However since modders are easily banned for giving money they turned salty and are now destroying people's hard work. A lot of lobbies are with players doing their own businesses and everyone else leaves them alone that is until a modder shows up and the next thing you see is 15 Death Messages on the left of your screen because the modder killed EVERYONE. Once we re spawn we get teleported to each other and die again... and again... and yet again. At this time I've already retired from my CEO went passive and loaded up a job to do solo or joined another lobby.It's absolutely ridiculous that these little bastards just join lobbies and kill everyone or just destroy shipments / resupplies for people working on their CEO/Biker stuff and then leave. Modders can basically do anything and are completely hidden so they never get discovered.I hope one day that R* is able to crack down on modders and ban them all. That would be great.Do I recommend this game? Yes. Even with all the modder BS... it's still a really fun game.As for you modders reading this t( . t) I hope we meet IRL so I can deal with it personally.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Whatever millions were spent on this game wasn't worth the experience but I read their investors are happy! The GTA series has been rough for a while and this one's actually a good kick in the right direction. The world is vibrant animations and car mechanics are fluid and the 3 character dynamic was a nice breath of air. The story is meh I'm still crawling through it and I only like one of the 3 characters but the stories aren't why I play GTA. The cloud save feature is nice! I love that I don't have to manage my savefiles offline! I wish the cops' AI was more similar to IV but I like the new AI too they just seem less intelligent. The the new cop ditching system is fun ducking in cars or hiding in bushes is cool. Ignoring story I like this GTA a lot as a sandbox for havoc.The multiplayer is wretched. I don't think I've had a single good experience online and I'm afraid that's where most of Rockstar's focus is. I don't want to lobby with other players and missions are multi player only. So why play online? There is game content I'd like to access (flying motorbike extra missions for example) that is locked away in a dysfunctional network.Network aside I'm constantly being hounded to buy $multi million ventures over the phone every few minutes ventures I can't afford... every few minutes. Missions reward you with about $10 15k on success take 5 10 minutes to complete and are surrounded by at least 5 minutes of loading on each end of the event excluding any several minute cutscenes a player hasn't seen yet. So in total I'm making about $1k per minute *at best*. I'm sure there are more lucrative ways to make cash but at this rate I'm just staring at a mountain of work I don't want to deal with because the whole experience is a slow paced aggravation. With the "success" of GTA Online I'm willing to bet people just buy cash cards instead of earning the money in other words you can just buy game items with real world money to skip.. "the game". What is this world?Here's an example of my frustration I had to re play the same mission (the *first* multi player mission with Lamar) I don't know how many times with the relobbying and all the loading between.. guh if you really want to include all of that It probably took 3 hours to complete this one simple mission. It was just a few drive bys but with four players one would die and leave the lobby forcing a reset. What a terrible experience.

review: To me this game is only fun because of multiplayer. I would never have put the hours I did into it if it were single player only and I may have played 10 hours of SP. So if you are looking for a SP review look elsewhere.I will summarize my review as to the update simply.If your average income per day includes a full heist and some missions which is a lot of playing you might break an average per day of 200k+. The combined assets of everything you can purchase with the new DLC probably reaches into the 500 600m mark and that's not including repairs insurance upgrades and consumables. 8m of in game cash costs $100 USD and even a decent car can cost you around 4 6m for instance.Add onto this that you can be banned permanently for doing nothing wrong and there are reports of this in the reviews and you can see how this is one of the grindiest games you can play.There needs to be a GTA Online that's expanded and made fair that isn't done by Rockstar (who censors their own name in game chat btw) because this is a lot of fun up until someone decides you shouldn't have it anymore.Original review (with thumbs up) This is one of the best games I've ever played which sucks because it's also one of the ing stupidest micro transaction systems ever. If Rockstar/Take Two make GTA6 and can somehow avoid the entire dumpster fire of Shark cards and make a fun game I'll be all over it but at the rate they're going based off of previous ban waves they're likely to blame the consumer and change nothing.Only saying yes because the game itself is very fun but everything else about it when it comes to buying things is terrible.

review: At first the game was great fun. The enjoyment is wearing off very fast though. I'll try and keep this very short with pros cons. With the exception of a few big cons I found with the game. (My opinion).Pros. Game looks great it was optimized very well In my opinion. Campaign is fun Online is great with friends if you have 4 including yourself Vast amount of things to do online missions game moads and heists of courseCons. FPS aiming down sights doesn't really work that well (The game wasn't designed for it so what did you expect) using the dot for aiming in first person is great though. Flying mechanics (Not the controls) are the worst I have ever come accross in any game. Vehicles tend to float through the air when doing jumps almost like zero gravity. Looks very silly and you are able to move your vehicle in mid air? really annoying. You have to WIN races in order to unlock upgrades for certain vehicle components (Should have made it compete in rather than having to win) No plastic surgeon or option to allow you the ability for changing appearance online Enemy AI online are able to blind fire with any weapon and hit you from hundreds of yards away while you snipe. This is incredibly frustrating. The AI on hard difficulty seem to have far to much accuracy when blind firing at long range I find myself constantly applying body armour or blind firing back from cover in order not to be hit making fire fights last longer than they should. Online difficulty ballance. This one is the major problem that almost ruins the game for me. The higher the difficulty the more damage you take that's fine but.. Rockstar also chose the path of giving enemies enormous amounts of health. This is where the problem lies you can stand over an enemy and fire 7 shotgun rounds into him before he dies. Go for headshots? yep certain enemies will stilll take huge amounts of damage even enemies without bullet proof helmets take several shots to the head. Online At first the game felt great but as you level up the game becomes incredibly frustrating and I find myself playin for shorter lengths of time when I get on. Campaign Is great fun. Online with friends is where the fun really is though for a while anyway.As an Australian I cannot recommend this game for it's high price. The value really isn't there.I definitely would have preferred Red Dead Redemption.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Once great game turned into a cash cow by greedy corporate overlords. You either die the hero or live long enough to see your favorite game become another micro transaction generator. In short taketwo has made mods illegal. The only reason I bought the pc version was to mod. That was the THIRD time I paid for the game. If 180$ isn't enough for you guys I can live without your game. If I could refund I would. But I'm fine with just never playing gta v ever again. I won't buy or play the next gta to come out either because I can already tell what it's going to be. Just another cash cow. It's disgusting nowadays how game developers try to get their money.UPDATE Take two have gone back on their decision to try to kill mods. So with that I'll give em a thumbs up. But we shouldn't forget what happened here. Take two showed their true colors and we as a community said we weren't going to stand for that crap. We really have the final say in these matters because we literally pay these people's salaries.

review: GTA 5 is hours and hours of fun I love it HOWEVER for some people on PC it can cause lag and stuttering even with advanced gaming computers. If your using an Nvidia graphics card its really simple to find the fix. If not TRY THIS 1.go to Settings and advanced graphics and turn on the three.now. Go to setting and graphics and aelwxt windowed border less.now.Select DirextX 10 and select post FX to Ultra.I don't understand why this fixes it. But this is an easy fix across all graphics cards if you have a continuing lag or stutter

review: I already had been debating stopping based on the honestly ridiculous levels of misogyny and transphobia covered by a thin layer of "JUST JOKING XDDD" but then apparently my 2 minutes of online play were considered to have been hacking and I lost all the money I'd earned along with the 2 million from the cash card that was bundled with the game.Bottom line controls work as wonkily as in IV game has a serious issue with failing at satire (even the arguments I agreed with felt half and just created to rub in the opposing side's face also why the hell does this game hate celebrities so so so much? It's obviously not their money given that it's GTA... I guess the creators are jealous?) story is rather nice and fascinating but ultimately not enough to justify a full price tag and Online will just result in your character's money being taken by the developers.BUY IF AND ONLY IF you want a single player GTA more polished than IV you don't mind bad frame dropping issues you can stomach really bizarre and offensive treatments of people who don't deserve it (and a lot at people who do but honestly I don't think that's really an issue) you have a controller mic and rig capable of running this monster you don't intend to do anything but drive (list of things that suck to control swimming flying boating running biking gunning from any vehicle melee combat close range ranged combat and probably some other things I haven't experienced) you don't mind loading screens that last forever and the game's on sale at more than 50% off.DON'T BUY otherwise and ESPECIALLY not with bundled online cash which WILL be flagged and taken.SP 7/10 playable and sometimes enjoyable but shallow and with some glaring issues (plus seriously offensive content towards women trans people latinx people and occasionally gay people and this isn't a case of "offending everyone " this game absolutely loves its male early 20s to late 30s demographic) and requires ridiculous specs.MP 3/10. Playable barely but thoroughly unenjoyable and will randomly become permanently unplayable.

review: Well it seems as if it worked. Destroying a games reviews as quickly as a company tarnishes their reputation can certainly spark change it seems.Thankfully Take Two has allowed the OpenIV team to continue work on modding.The game is fun to mess around in. Glitchy but not terribly glitchy. And overall it's worth the moeny.However GTA Online still has a massive problem with it costing so much in game currency to get any of the new thing you have to sell half of your old things. Original Review Dear Rockstar What's next? Having a month subscription just to access your garages online? Having to serve in game jail time for your crimes you commit in game? You've pulled a Bethesda. Not only is GTA Online basically pay to enjoy at this point but you also shut down a huge portion of the GTA 5 Singleplayer mod scene. As a result of your terrible decisions your game has plumeted to an Overwhelmingly Negative score. However you can fix this. All you need is to man up admit you made a huge mistake and let the Open IV team continue their work. I'm sure if you do this you'll have a better review than Day One Garry's Incident.I really do enjoy your game however your incompetence as a company makes me sick. The cease and desist was completely out of the blue and has virtually no reason to have happened seeing as Open IV has NOTHING to do with GTA Online. You can fix this. PLEASE. Fix this.Your (not so) loving fan Pandaa

review: I really don't want to unrecommend this game but I had to.This game is really really fun and enjoyable with friends. It has a tons of races or adversary modes that you can play with friends. You can fly different types of aircraft or drive boats and such. A huge map for players to explore. We had a lot of fun time in this game.Here's the downsides The Optimizations It is important to have a good optimization for players which can affects players gameplay experience. I would say it is DECENT. You do need a decent PC to run this game smoothly.All the vehicles are VERY VERY expensive. Which forces you to use the microtransactions ( Shark Cards ).Tryhards They are extremely annoying. You can't have fun if they are in the same lobby.The Anti Cheat System I don't see any updates about the anti cheat system from Rockstar. This cause Modders appear in this game. They usually interrupt your gameplay experience.This game is fun overall but the downsides actually annoys you. Sorry for not being able to use proper grammar.

review: I HIGHLY recommend this game. Its some of the most fun ive had in a long time. The story mode is FANTASTIC and the multiplayer is really fun too. Though i cant seem to connect to public servers very well. I suggest that if you want to play online do some closed sessions with friends. I noticed that rockstar is trying to do these shark cards? Basically buying in game money with real life money. Some people are complaining about that but honestly its not hard to get the money if you have people to heist with or to do some missions with. I can't say that im happy about the mods situation though. Alot of people are getting banned for using single player mods and im very sad to see this. I hate that people are giving the game a bad review solely for this reason. If you have read this far you are awesome! If you dont own this game on another console then go ahead and buy it! But if you do own it on another console and want to get it on PC i suggest that you wait to see if Rockstar changes their modding policies. Thank you for taking my opinion into consideration and have a nice day. D
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: You know what's funny? While using the native trainer in singleplayer random stats will jump to 100 and the entirety of the bars that were just filled will flash. Even if you only had 2 out of the 5 bars for a stat. People are being banned for using native trainer in singleplayer.Wanna know what I'm seeing in the first person trailer for the game? Stats randomly maximizing with more than one bar flashing.Thanks for being hypocrites Rockstar. Boycotting this attitude of yours until you do what other developers seem to be failing to do recently and pull your head out of your If you want to prevent the majority of cheaters from prospering then develop a FUNCTIONAL AND USEFUL ANTI CHEAT. Don't ban people for enjoying the game THEY PAID FOR in SINGLEPLAYER. F*ck.Also do something about the loading screens in multiplayer. EVERY SINGLE THING needs a 2 5 minute loading screen. Even if I accept a job invite and the lobby is full it'll take it's time loading me back to my apartment which I was JUST in.

YEAH THIS PROBLEM IS THAT BAD.EDIT The hacker problem seems to have been cornered off... not solved... but cornered off. So I can actually play the game this time around. It's not perfect but it'll do for now.GTA 5 is one of my favorite games of all time and the freemode events update made it so much better because there is no longer an inscentive for trolls to kill people because they get nothing from it. Freemode events are something that brings lobbies together in fair competition.My review for GTA 5 from this moment on will be positive.FURTHER EDIT THIS NEW UPDATE IS FREAKING AWESOME. review: Right off the bat you might be thinking "What a price" but honestly its worth every penny. Grand Theft Auto V's world is both immersive and entertaining with numerous activies and a litter of fast cars planes and boats along with npcs to populate it. The story is hilarious and extremely fun to play through multiple times. The characters are well written along with the plot and you have feelings for digital characters populating your screen. Then there is online. Grand Theft Auto Online is one of the key selling points of this game. The ability to create your own GTA character is amazing with great customization options and the feeling of being able to live as a criminal however you want is worth another $69.99 alone.The graphics in this game are amazing and it is so well optimised that even my GTX 850m can run it on ultra with all anti aliasing and every other option on at a solid 60fps without drop. In conclusion this game is absolutely worth your money and I would highly recommend buying it if you have the money. 9.5/10 yeah.

review: Grand Theft Auto Five Online Review.Grand Theft Auto five online is mostly positive rewarding experience however there are gripes and common pit falls with the abundance of online hackers/glitchers in most online lobbies.But as far as content release Rockstar seem to be doing a pretty good job streaming consistent regular content although this game does echo fair grinding in terms of money to spend on anything remotely fun and enjoyable content in game be it cars weapons or property ( including various businesses) as the investment reaps rewards.Definitely playing with friends is a lot more enjoyable and you will spend your mission reward money on various personal customisations be it on hair styles clothes tattoos or masks.Obviously from the previous GTA 4 title car modification shots make a comeback in its strongest form yet in terms of customising a lot of vehicles (mostly any vehicle going as long as you own high end rides) all with varying degrees of customisable options.There is a pimp my ride style shop for ultimate customisation and showing off but this will set you back quite a lot money but definitely looks the coolest in my opinion.If missions are not your thing there are a lot of races coming in varying amount of different type s straight races time trials point to point and vehicle weaponized death match races. All in the format of cars boats motorbikes quad bikes and bicycles. There is also a transformers race which takes all these into consideration and changes you into the various vehicle classes when you hit a point in the race. It s different and enjoyable and also frustrating if you make an error it is unforgiving.There is other content including parachuting survival mode wave based attacks of enemies increasing in difficulty various sports sport games to name a few golf and tennis.There is a lot more content that I personally have got round to trying.I only did the things I enjoy which are fine for me and my friends. We do sometimes want to branch out and try something new to see how it goes.As a quick summary would say personally for me GTA 5 online is best enjoyed with friends as a much better enjoyable experience. I would definitely recommend this game and if you can to start out with someone who knows the game (friend or social gamer) will help get you on your feet a lot quicker.Thank you for reading my first review it may be a bit quirky but I hope this helps you in reaching a decision about the game.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: PAY 2 ENJOY ____And Here's Why_____ This game started off fun and good.But with each update the developers showed more and more of their greed.Vehicles Weapons Mission Progression Business Enterprises Buildings have become so expensive throughout this game's lifetime that it is merely impossible to casually achieve anything in this game.You are instead required to grind or use real money to buy shark cards which you can then use to make these purchases.Simple contact missions which used to be a core element in the game no longer pay you a fair amount. To put that into perspective. On average a contact missions awarded the players 10 20k and the most expensive vehicle at the time of launch was 1 million. (50 Contact Missions The oppurtunity to buy the most expensive car at launch)Now however the prices for everything in the game have went up but the payout has not be increased respectively.If you're planning to buy a new vehicle building or an enterprise to cotinue progressing in the game you will need atleast 3 million + excess to cover mechanic charges and bills for your apartments (which you can't sell). All that money gets blown the moment you make a purchase and you're back at squaure one having to grind your way to 3+ million to make another purchase.If you're aiming to get the best locations fully upgraded you're simply looking at 6+ million.If you only use contact missions to grind which have max payout (20k) which on average takes 20 minutes you're expected to do the mission 300 times which would take 4 days straight to complete. All that just for a garage for the car heist dlc. (And that is ignoring the charges for the mechanic in game waiting time lobby's to fill up etc...)Put simply the game is Pay 2 Play and Enjoy. If you buy the game you'll be satisfied for a while but then when you want to try all the missions and own a part of every dlc you're going to find yourself miserably poor.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Well i guess it's a good game? Gta 5 is literally one of the funnest games i've played if we're talking about missions jobs or playing with friends SO FUN! Besides that lets talk about the elephant in the room the game is balanced on the pay to win factor super grind factor and the modding factor. If you start fresh in the game it's nearly impossible to beat anyone at anything or even make money to beat anyone in a race your pretty much required to have a 2.2 million dollar supercar. btw thats a huge investment making between 2 30k a 10 minute race. Usually you'll find yourself being abused by a flying car that shoots heat seeking rockets or a tryhard asshat in a jet ruining everyone's experience in the game. Can't lose if there's no one that hasn't uninstalled the game from rage? To this day i cant find one season in a whole year that won't have a toxic player modder and ect. those kind of people are wasting their life shooting innocent noobs just trying to make money (and) if we're talking about the millions of modders putting everyone in cages or taking their hard earned weapons and destroying their vehicles... Or straight kicking them from the game X(. It also pisses me off how much time you have to invest into the game to actually be able to afford something. I could spend my time in a day doing jobs and make in between 1 3 million if i don't mess up and only do that all day. or i could spend my real money to get the same amount in a couple of seconds. I guess that's aspect of (( PAY TO WIN))). Eventually the loading screens will kill you or not spending 100 (REAL LIFE DOLLERS. to get 8 million in game) will. BTW that's 2/3 of a jet in the game. But to sum it up in very simpler terms fun irritating very pay to win and very unbalanced.

review: Will keep the old review here but the OpenIV thing ended and it's worth againORIGINAL If you had asked me at the start of June 2017 I'd have told you to outright buy GTAV it's a great game and has a fantastic modding scene. As of the 14th of June 2017 I can no longer recommend this game to anybody.They've taken away the appeal of the single player by giving the OpenIV team a cease and desist notice (OpenIV is like the backbone of mods). The story is still the best single player story in a GTA game but mods make the game so much better.As for GTA Online that can go itself. It's a microtransaction ladden hell hole you don't get to about and have fun unless you have money in the game And it's so grindy that it relies on you buying shark cards or finding a modder in the online (which is never gonna happen anymore). To me i have zero reason to play GTA V again. I've finished it 4 times the online is only fun when friends wanna play and even then you're worried about losing money every waking moment. The only fun there is is driving around the single player by myself and you can only do that so much before the game gets boring. TL DR unless Take Two stop this I would never recommend this game to anybody.

review: Actually gonna give this game a thumb up. The game is not perfect but you can really have fun through the game and of course if you have friends to play with. Graphics are really good and the optimization is perfect. Just all I can say is perfect. Game by itself is boring to play alone but you can still have fun even alone but you will get the best experience when you will play it with your friends. Game is full of modders cheaters however you want to call them but you know if they are not harassing you if they are cheating for themselves then just ignore them and try to have fun but if they are trying to harass you and keep throwing things on you or something like that just report them and go to another session. Believe me. Don't cheat don't mod your money I know it's really easy to find a undetected cheat because the game's anticheat is t but don't do it it's not funny. Things that the game needs to fix is the loading screen and of course ban cheaters and get a better anticheat. There are a little things they need to fix and they need to update but these 2 are the most biggest and most important ones. After all I will just say that if you have friends to play this game with definetly buy it. If you are alone you can still buy it but I can not promise you to really have a lot of fun.

review: I've found GTA V to generally be a great multiplayer game providing an equal amount of gameplay and the ability to socialise. I will stipulate here that I only play online with friends generally in private lobbys but I have played some of the missions in public lobbys. review: I started out solo with GTA Online and it was a rough start trying to get money saved up. But once you get a business running it gets better. It eventually got to the point though where I was starting to lose interest. That is until I met a great group of friends who recommended Discord chat. We now have our own small crew of people we can trust and get along with and I must say it has made this game 1 000x better then it was before. When you have a group of people who are also willing to help grind for money and are able to have fun doing it...it reminds me why I loved this game to begin with. Really brings back the nostalgia of it allSo if I had at least 1 recommendation make sure you're able to use voice chat (Discord is the popular program choice) Online gameplay isn't the same without it
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: From the early console days this game has come a long way. It remains fun to play after all this time. This game pushes the GTA franchise to a new high. The online multiplayer (called GTA Online) is great fun with friends or strangers and the story is compelling and fun to play through. I never get bored while playing GTA V since aside from the great story and fun online multiplayer there is a ton of activities to partake in around the map.

review: At 500 hours of gametime on PC alone I can say that grand theft auto 5 is an open world sandbox whome is a great experience. It has an interesting online multiplayer component which is not the shine of this game and I cannot personally reccomend it however when you throw mods into the mix you get an experience whose limits are defined by your computers capabilities. There are modded multiplayer servers where it's similar to online however you roleplay as anything you want anytime you like! Albeit most of these servers has rules. Some remove pedestrians and have it an empty experience while some expand on every aspect making it hard for inexperienced players to join in.CampaignThere is a great long campaign which is about 70% of the main game. The campaign has many bugs and occasional issues like in the mission where you chase the lady for the certain analog recording at the airport the vehicles go through a closed gate a military aicraft takes off from the helipad while sometimes 2 jets will take off and land on the runway at once during the mission.There is alot of scripted sequences that is a shame that you cannot alter in anyway.

review: Grand Theft Auto 5 overall is an upgrade on Grand Theft Auto 4 with new features and better mechanics no more feeling like you are driving a tank. Where it looses me is the lack of a serious storyline and online. I mention online because this game seems to be a big push towards and online game versus a single player game. Sharkcards the in game currency is almost needed to keep up with current content such as flying cars and orbital strikes. Where this game really lost me was their lack of online support for players who had their accounts reset when moving from console to PC.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Pros+ Great setting realistic depiction of contemporary L.A.+ Good soundtrack for the location setting+ Fantastic graphics and visual effects+ Driving has been improved and is a nice balance between IV's style+ Plethora of new vehicles and weapons + customization optionsCons Storyline feels a bit rushed and convoluted at times characters could've been fleshed out more like in IV with more meaning given to some of the storyline missions Lack of dedicated dynamic internet news sites present within IV such a small feature but still a very noticeable omission Some of the humour can feel forced at times less subtle satire when compared to IV Strong focus on GTA Online at the expense of singleplayer content Euphoria physics could use some tweaking in terms of pedestrian reactions to vehicle bumping etc. GTA Online loading takes forever and matchmaking can be a nightmare can be annoying when kids roam around with tanks and armoured vehicles

review: This is probably one of the best single player experiences i've ever enjoyed. It's a very vivid and alive world and the story is phenomenal and engaging. The graphics are stunning and the gameplay is smooth.But if you're playing it for the multiplayer... I unfortunately have to contend that it is one of the worst experiences you can have at the moment. Let me paint you a picture You and your friends are cruising around taking part in the various things to do in the packed world of GTA Online. Maybe you're looking at properties or showing off new vehicles and gear. It's all well and good until somebody who dished either actual money into the game or an insane amount of time takes it upon himself to hunt you down repeatedly and kill you over and over. Then should you choose to go into passive mode will probably be taunted or griefed in such a way that even passive mode doesn't save you. Of course you could go into a different server but your very likely to run into the same situation. Better yet you might just be trapped in a cage or repeatedly explode thanks to the efforts of a modder. In short get this game on sale if you've never experienced the story but stay far far away from the online unless you're just desperate to play with your friends.TL DR The single player is good but the online is a toxic wasteland.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've been eager to own a copy of GTA V for a very long time. I clearly didn't jump on the band wagon when the whole hype about this game got released way back in 2013. However after 5 years of waiting I finally got to play GTA V.So far I've played a good 17 hours of pure fun and mayhem and without a shadow of a doubt I can categorically say it's the best game I've played in a long while. The open world game is just mesmerising as you drive a long the streets of Los Santos. It's action packed crazy and mindless fun. The story is so compelling and interesting. I love the characters. Most of them are just stupidly hilarious. The graphics just blow me away. It's 2018 and I still feel if this game were to be released today it would still be on par with the current games. I'm playing on max settings on my PC (Specs below). I get a solid 70 75 fps but in grassy areas it drops down to mid to low 40s but that's ok. I play with vsync on and 90% of the time I get smooth 60fps. So I abslolutely recommend this game. It is a must have and GTA V is on sale now for an absolute bargain for $20. My Specs i5 7300HQ 2.5 Ghz8 GB ram DDR4Nvidia GeForce GTX 1060 6GB1 Tb HDD 128 GB SSD

review: GTA 5 (Singleplayer) is a great game everythin you'd want from a GTA game and more. I enjoyed it on Xbox and I enjoy the improved PC version just as much. But the reason for my review is offcourse GTA Online.Absolute utter garbage. There is zero incentive by R* to create a decent community it's basically everything bad that happened to gaming in one. There is gacha elements constant "advertising" by NPCs to make you buy that car / facility / factory facebook esque gaming vibe.You are constantly remininded of the fact that OTHER PLAYERS are there supposedly to you up. As such nobody trusts anybody. You could just be minding your own business and all of a sudden you're dead because that other guy thought you we're going to kill him. So you start having to kill every player in sight to get anything done. Or just run and get nothing done. There is no dedicated servers meaning your loading times can last for up to 20 minutes if you're unlucky.The game is riddled with people who do nothing more than hunt down new players in their Attack Helicopters or kill you AFTER you group with them only to steal the money you just earned TOGETHER.Crews are meaningless they're just 4 lettres next to your name. Other than a handful of extra cash / reputation you gain absolutely nothing from being in a crew. Motorcycle Clubs or Corporations are just as bad. You can't sit in both at the same time forcing you to go through the creation process EVERY TIME you relog get a new session... If you are running said Club / Corp you'll have to leave it if you want to help your friends with their Club / Corp. Having to juggle something as simple as what is in essence a "clan" is horrible.Now I could deal with most of these things but what I find absolutely appaling is the artificial difficulty they put upon GTA Online (compared to GTA SP) everything is outrageously expensive compared to the amount of money you can make. I received one free shark card with my purchase of GTA O worth 1.25M in game and without it I am certain I would've had to grind 20 30 hours in order to buy an appartment / some weaponry / a personal vehicle. (All of them cheap!) Because of the card I got somewhat of a headstart but it just made it so much more apparent I would have to again grind hours and hours in order to be albe to do a Heist with my friend. Or to expand my Motorclub to be actually usefull. Another big no no is the amount of content / DLC added to GTA O that was PURPOSEFULLY omitted from the single player version. There is 100s of vehicles and dozens of weapons / locations that are not accessible in single player. Why? THey need you to play GTA O start hating it and eventually cave in to shark cards.That is the gamingloop GTA O banks on grind your buy the thing discover you need to use the thing to grind even more . Repeat ad infinitum. No wonder the game is rampant with hackers and cheaters. I met someone who got 200M from a hacker that guy is now enjoying the game as he can buy (maybe 25% of) all things and just play y'know. But to get anywhere near his level I'm looking at atleast 150h investment. This would be no problem if the game was atleast fun but it's not.GTA Singleplayer outshines GTA O in every single way possible. The only reason I'd ever recommend this game is if you'd play it with a closed group. Get atleast 3 more people and do nothing with randoms only play with your 3 other friends. Maybe just maybe the game would be enjoyable. But trying to do things with just 1 real partner is impossible.All in all I'd say I regret my descision of buying this game and it saddens me that GTA O absolutely shrekt Rockstars reputation for me. I've been a loyal fan / buyer since their very first game but the fact that they'd allow this piece of to bear their name and clearly have no issue with it is the final red flag. I will NOT be buying GTA 6 or RDR2 for that matter.

review: This review will be split into two portions the single player and the onlineSingle Player The single player of gta 5 is amazing its one of the best stories I've ever played and the mod scene for the game is amazing. If you want the game just for the single player then pick it up but only on sale. t that its still 60 dollars when the game is something like 5 years old now.The online A ing how. It started pretty ok money was about the same to make now which was ok because the most expensive car was 1 million dollars. I believe that if you play the online portion if you never play any content released after the heists dlc you will enjoy it. After heists it became a grind for everything the game became a boring wait game. Bikers waiting. Gunrunning waiting. The whole game is a wait fest now. Its like a clicker game except its 60 dollars. So if you wanna play gta online find a friend or 2 and play the online up to the heists dlc then never play the dlcs added after. And never go into a public lobby rockstar unfairly bans because their cheat detection is Rockstar is a cash hungry company the whole point of the modern gta online is to push shark cards. Don't support that don't buy shark cards

review: Played this game legitimately for probably 200 hours on xbox. Switched to pc and literally had to mod it to be able to afford to do anything.this isnt to shame gta5 this is simply to shed light on a current truth.Currently the online portion of this game is unplayable. It doesnt matter how much free bull winding content Rockstar releases It's all so insanely expensive you have to pour a part time jobs worth of time into it weekly to see small returns.Players simply can not work together to complete heists there is no team work to the game at all which makes it incredibly boring after about 25 minutes.The shark cards are a wash. Seriously Rockstar if you read these reviews wake the fluck up. Nobody in the right mind will pay those prices for that little return when they can just buy the game every time it goes on sale for the same price and mod it or just quit the game as I and many others have.This is just a pc review Imagine how much more terrible the reviews would be for console where these problems are completely enveloping the online experience.What youve done here is made it impossble to move. Even before hacking and modding as a well off player I still couldnt reach your ridiculous numbers.With each dlc you release this problem this overwhelming sinkhole increases. You just released this Import/export dlc. You have $20 000 cars that run you a $25 000 bill to repair $20 000 to mod and out of the $100 000 after all the damage you're lucky to take home 50 000.By the way the dlc car prices are absolutely stupid. Fire who set that thats just a joke.You keep banning the people who actually make the game playable or who are actually interested in your sinkhole and soon youll find yourself with a very limited playerbase.sincerely your game is garbage.

RockStar DOES NOT CARE about customer service. They close online tickets without explanation hang up on phone calls and really have no idea how to care for legitimate concerns of paying customers. I have never been more insulted or victimized by a company or product. I wouldn't recommend any RockStar game to anyone ever again unless you want to be their next victim. Worst gaming experience ever.

review: Hackers Arsehats and children seems to be 90% of the population in this game.Game itself is good just needs better matchmaking and an anti cheat system of some sort. (VAC would be nice) I can find myself only being able to play story mode or invite only sessions with friends. Do I recommend it? No. Not unless you have a group of friends about 6+ that also have the game and are willing to play with you because that's the only way that the multiplayer will be fun. Otherwise it's just people hacking people in tanks or kids screaming at eachother about stupid crap. Breakdown Pros Good graphics Nice story Decent sized array of guns Amaizing cars and driving fairly realistic (as far as they can get without being an actual racing game) Good character customizations First Person is really well done. Cons Needs a anti cheat system BADLY. (Have gone server hoping for 8 servers before finding one without a hacker) Those who aren't hacking are either idiotic or kids screaming You need a decent group of friends to enjoy the game fully Most of the music is quite garbage but every now and then a nice track will come on. (This is an opinion.) About the last one a way to add in your own music or do something like in Saints Row where you can create your own station to listen to where you pick what tracks play on it. Takes about 10 minutes to load EDIT Was banned for a month and had my account reset for no reason. Now that Rockstar has actually started to ban people they're a bit TOO ban happy. Throwing account resets and bans around for no reason at all other than because they feel like it with no option for an appeal. Rockstar does not give a single damn about their playerbase. All they want is to make money and if they have a slight suspicious that someone may have cheated in some way even if they didn't they do not give a warning they do not give an option for an appeal. They just ban you outright and throw away all your hard work. Rockstar is one of the worst game developers out there right now because of this issue.248 hours and $60 down the drain for a game that banned me for no reason. Good job Rockstar.

review: My honest opinion after 200 hours of playing w/o ps3 time.I recommend the game for it's singleplayer it's fun.But as soon as you go online it's a different story let me tell you why I dare you take a shot everytime i say First of all let's talk about online and how the greed of people kill it. People blame everything on modders and i do myself i think they should off modders should respect that i want to play legit. People calls me to me for saying that it ruins my experience and i want to play how it's meant to be played. Go back to singleplayer where you belong instead of spawning thousands of planes infront of me. I don't really mind the grind but i mind the people that is grinding. People think that it's some kind of race to get the best equipment/car or whatever before everyone else. And that's ok but not doing anything other than sniping hiest and repeating the same ing mission is ridiculous. You can never get anything fun done because people rarely care about that. I nearly beg people on my knees licking their boots and they wouldn't give 2 s to join my lobby. And that gets me to the worst part of it all is the matchmaking system the ing matchmaking system i love it so much. All the countless hours i have stared at a lobby screen is probably 50% of the hours. Two times today when i made myself a lobby it always end in me nearly commiting suicide on how bad it is. It invites the same ing people over and over again. Wow gj rockstar and invite friends of friends of friends. Amazing system!!! That was litterally 2 hours of my day and don't get me started on the ing p2p system you should think that a company as big as rockstar could afford dedicated server that should be a common thing among AAA Titles. review: What really killed GTA online for me is when I got back on after a few months break and was almost immediately killed by a flying motorcycle shooting rockets. It wasn't even the fact that it was a preposterous concept it was the fact that there was nothing I could do to stop him. He could evade homing rockets with ease and guns did nothing while my jets couldn't even get the chance to launch not to mention evade his missiles. If I wanted to get the same vehicle to counter him I would have had to grind for months (for something I DIDN'T actually want) or spend several days pay on a few shark cards. At that point it truly was a pay to win game and it killed me inside. GTA V particularly online was one of my favorite games. I played for well over 800 hours on xbox and then PC attaining a level near 300. I LOVED that game. Realizing my time with it was over and not by my choice really hit me hard. Now I cant have that kind of dedication in any game due to work and responsibilities. The pay to win aspect of the game ended it for me. No matter how much I work ill never be able to afford a super yacht and no matter how much I play Ill never be able to afford a virtual one either. And so Ill never buy another rockstar game again. Not out of anger or spite but simply because I cant afford it be it money or time.

review: GTA V has become a highly respected game over the years and there are countless reasons for this from the truly beautiful and packed open world to the genuinely interesting characters of the story. Rockstar has managed to create a world which feels alive and real. I have played well over 200 hours (Xbox + Steam) and there is still so much to experience. The majority of these hours were spent in GTA V Online which in my opinion is Rockstar's greatest achievement with this game. The ability to race shoot and explore in Los Santos with friends creates an incredible gameplay experience. Playing with other players who all have the same level of freedom as you creates an infinite ray of opportuities. I understand that games with too much freedom of what you can do can be lacking in gameplay however Rockstar has overcome this in GTA V Online by releasing free additional content regularly. With these expansions come new cars weapons missions and gameplay mechanics. Due to this the game never loses its ability to keep the player hooked and before you know it you've punched another 10 hours into the game. The visuals audio and atmosphere are all here the game doesn't lack in anything. Gta V is a masterpiece which has and will stand tall for years to come. 10//10

review: Grand Theft Auto 5 is not only a preposterously enjoyable video game but also an intelligent and sharp tongued satire of contemporary America. It represents a refinement of everything that GTA 4 brought to the table five years ago. It s technically more accomplished in every conceivable way but it s also tremendously ambitious in its own right. No other world in video games comes close to this in size or scope and there is sharp intelligence behind its sense of humour and gift for mayhem. It tells a compelling unpredictable and provocative story without ever letting it get in the way of your own self directed adventures through San Andreas.It is one of the very best video games ever made.Grand Theft Auto 5 is a masterpiece of a game and the PC version is the best way to experience it. Its sprawling yet meticulously detailed map is the high bar to which all other open world games aspire and it s incredibly dense with excellent content. With so much to do explore and play with both in single player and multiplayer plus great creative tools it s truly amazing on multiple levels.

review: This was a good game once. The single player was well crafted story was decent and mods were abundant creating lots of new stuff to do keeping me from being bored with this game (as you can see from the 400+ hours on record). However I never really enjoyed GTA online and now TakeTwo have taken actions that make mods impossible for single player using multiplayer cheats as an excuse despite the fact that the mod tool actively prohibits this. It is undoubtably really because of the microtransactions ("Shark Cards") that allow you to purchase online mode currency and the fact that you could get previously multiplayer only vehicles in single player through mods. However they took a heavy handed approach and effectively prohibited all modding outright. I will never play this game without mods and if that means I never play it again so be it. I am currently investigating offline modes to bypass the recent updates so my installed mods still work. Make your money without disrupting modding TakeTwo. If you care about modding AT ALL do not buy this game.

review: I played GTA V when it first launched on Xbox 360 and now I'm replaying it for PC. After 5 years this game is still a masterpiece one of the best GTA games and possibly one of the best games of all time. There's a reason it still sells so well after all this time.GTA V has something for everyone inlcuding the classic GTA tropes we all love. Want to go for a scenic mountain drive above Vinewood Hills? Done. Want to pick up a prostitute? Go for it. Want to pick up a prostitute and take her for a scenic mountain drive above Vinewood Hills? Of course you do. The sheer volume of distractions afforded to you in GTA V is astounding as is the world you're dropped into. Los Santos is enrapturing. Driving around isn't boring or a grind it's literally the best way to take in the world.The driving mechanics and gunplay are the best they've ever been. The graphical upgrades are significant textures lighting reflections and water all look amazing. The three protaganists are great and their individual stories as well as the overarching narrative are engaging. I found the controls to be equally suited to keyboard/mouse or a controller. There's really not much to complain about with the offline story mode except for Rockstar's unwillingess to develop any DLC for it unlike with GTA IV. Instead they've elected to focus on GTA Online which is a mixed bag by most accounts.Admittedly GTA V has gotten some rebuke for the way Rockstar handles GTA Online and all that goes with that the cheating the way Rockstar handles mods players being wrongfully banned a toxic community etc. However I don't think GTA Online should be lumped in with the brilliant single player story mode they should be looked at and weighed separately.GTA V was an instant classic and 5 years later it's still one of the best games you can play. It's something of a phenomena how every GTA game manages to be better than the last. Perhaps that's why it has been 5 years with no word of a sequel? GTA V will be hard to top.

review: The PC version of GTA V is definitely the best version. We had to wait really long but the game finally came out in a fantastic state. Rockstar obviously put a lot of time into the PC port/version. I'm usually against pre ordering games but I made one exception this year for GTA and im happy with my decision. I didn't do it for the pre order bonus (because that was frankly just a disappointing money cheat) I did it just so I could preload all GB's in time for launch because the game is ridiculously big. I'm running it at 60 90 fps on 1920x1080 with most things on "high" except for the advanced options which is something you should only use if your running SLI or one really good card. I have a Nvidia gtx 680 which is a few years old now so im very impressed with how good I can get the game to run. You can also use GeForce experience with GTA because Nividia released a update for that day before launch.You can play GTA in first or third person mode and simply change between them on your controller. All cars have different interiors and looks when you are driving in first person. Some textures are a little blurry in first person but that is something to expect in a game of this size. Fighting swimming walking can also be done in first person so you can just pick what you like the best.If you have an SSD drive that is big enough for this game you should probably use that for GTA because the loading screens without it is sometimes very long. It's one of the only complains I have with GTA actually. Thankfully thats just when you are loading into story mode or online because once you are in the big world there is no invisible walls or loading screens.Singleplayer is fun and the 3 main characters are all very well written. You can swap between them in the open world but also in certain quests. Michael Trevor and Franklin are very different from eachother which makes the game more interesting then GTA IV's only character Niko.GTA online is probably what some people will spend a ton of time in. I really just bought it for the single player experience but after playing a few hours with my friends I have to say that GTA online is actually really fun. I think the missions will get kind off repetitive in the long run but to play free roam with friends will never get old. You also unlock heist in level 12 so that might refresh things even more.I play this game with an xbox controller and it seems like all friends I've talked to is doing the same thing. I strongly recommend it at least for the driving. You can enable auto aim on your controller if you think shooting with it is too hard or you can swap between your keyboard+mouse in combat and use controller for driving. When you crash your car and get hit the controll vibrates which I think makes you feel more immersed in the game.I tried the PC controls and I didn't like them at all. For example you have to hit "Z" to see how many players are on your server in online mode. You can however rebind all keys on keyboard mouse and controller so thats really good but the default ones on keyboard are not great im afraid.GTA is a fantastic open world game that will no doubt be played for many years to come. I have already played it a lot and I feel like I have much more leveling to do in GTA online much more to do and explore in singleplayer and many hours of fun with my close friends to come. Singleplayer was all I really needed so I will just see GTA online as a plus.Well done Rockstar! This is the best PC version you have ever made and I can see that you put a lot of effort time and love into creating it. Strongly recommend this title to all my friends whether your the single or multiplayer guy you will have a ton of fun. This will probably be one of the best games released this year.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This review has been updated after spending more time in gameSingleplayer story mode is good just like in previous installments. Hasn't received any content update since launch.Online mode is really bad. Getting any amount of money is a horrible grind. New expansions only add more properties and stuff to buy while not giving you the ability to make money any faster. Hackers are everywhere. You risk being banned because a hacker dropped money on you.Getting money isn't that hard you just have to know what to do and invest in properties and useful vehicles (like the Buzzard) instead of spending on toys. Hackers are not that common anymore and Rockstar doesn't ban for what a modder has done to you.Netcode is atrocious can be funky no official servers all P2P based if you play with friends and do some jobs/races together then exit to freemode you get dumped into a public session. Sometimes you'll get stuck on loading screen for a few minutes for no reason.Mind you I've had some fun in it but only because I had a group of friends to play with. Otherwise I'd avoid it completely.It's more fun than that. There is a good variety of things to do even alone. Ton of cool things to buy cars planes etc. Weapons feel good cars drive great with both a controller and by keyboard.

review: This game is truly amazing I have spent countless hours on console and I have decided to buy it on the PC for the single player modding experience I do not play GTA Online on PC (I do on console) because of the random ban waves that i've heard about and that's honestly the only bad thing about this game. GTA 5 lets you do anything you want in an amazing open world full of details seriously rockstar put soo much detail into this game its truly fascinating. The single player mode offers many hours of fun and when it gets boring you have countless of mods to spice up the gameplay which is an amazing aspect that only PC can offer. Although the ban waves on GTA Online keeps me and many other players away from GTA Online the game really shines in single player. If you want to play GTA Online honestly the best way to do so is on console in order to avoid random bans. All in all GTA 5 is an amazing game that really shines in single player thanks to the endless possibilities the game offers and the fact that gameplay can easily be altered thanks to mods.

review: At first I was very sceptical especially because i have seen the flaws of this game on the XBOX 360. The issue with that game on that console was that you could glitch your money in many different ways by using 2 online players and the pay &amp spray shop. You could also gate glitch and get underneath the red parking lot building and if you had a fast enough car you could even make a jump towards the metro underneath Los Santos. Most of these glitches I have tested if they still work and from what I have gathered and tried it's 9/10 made impossible. Along with the graphical update the first person view and for how you can transfer your GTA console character to the PC makes everything just perfect as it should. I espect many hours that I will spend inside this game all under the form of total freedom that we all care so much about.The only thing I really dislike about GTA is that they have taken so much time untill the PC port was finally there.. For future games this should really be quicker prostponing will make gamers angry and nothing positive comes out from that.I give this game a 9/10.

review: This game needs no review. It came out in 2013 AND IT'S STILL FULL PRICE.GTAV is a cultural icon at this point engraved permanently in gaming history. Like Minecraft Arma or WOW it is a timeless masterpiece that will never need another sequel. If you haven't played this game because you're afraid it won't be worth the money I promise you it will be.If you haven't played because your computer isn't powerful enough this game is worth the upgrade.Even if you end up not liking GTA too much this will undoubtedly be an experience tha (by the way I'm talking specifically about the online) that will have a profound impact on your gaming career. You MUST join the game. See what the hype is about. Run some complex and challenging heists and gang operations with real people. Work like crazy to start some criminal organizations from the ground up. Learn the truth of what it means to actually have to put in serious time and effort to make in game money and reap the rewards.GTA is for noobs and pros alike because there's a place litereally for anyone and everyone. The crazies and the serious ones. The rich and the broke ones. The pilots and the drivers. Stealth players and guns blazing types. review: I played GTA V/Online on console and aside from a rocky start with updates and bugs and connectivity issues the game played GREAT. I loved the easter eggs i enjoyed the off line story mode. And the online mode was great even as a vanilla game with no DLC or updates the game had SO MUCH to do Racing Darts TENNIS? Golf parachuting base jumping deep sea diving the list goes on.I felt the graphics for this game were about par as far as GTA games go they slowly keep pace with the times the graphics weren't mind blowing but they were very decent. As far as support goes Rockstar is currently reviewing a Ticket I submitted regarding a few bugs and things seem to be moving in a positive direction. DO NOT rate games on their glitches and bugs rate the GAME. And i give this game a very good rating. Now if the BUGS and GLITCHES are NOT fixed my rating will unfortunately change as i am rating this game under the assumption that those bugs will be fixed sooner rather than later.

review: There are times when I look at Los Santos and think 'why would you even think to build that?' This is appropriately a thought that I often have about Los Angeles. In GTA 5's case the tone is different baffled wonderment as opposed to baffled y'know despair. Rockstar have created one of the most extraordinary game environments you will ever visit. I look at it and I wonder at the vast expense of effort required to render every trash bag in every back alley just so. I marvel at the care evident in San Andreas' gorgeous sunsets in the way that sunglasses subtly alter the colour balance of the world in the artfully chosen selection of licensed music designed to accompany your experience. Everything about Los Santos demonstrates the extraordinary amount of thought and love poured into it by hundreds of developers over many years. The abiding irony of Grand Theft Auto 5 is that everybody who actually lives in Los Santos hates it there.This is the most beautiful expansive and generous GTA game and also by some distance the nastiest and most nihilistic. Rockstar went through a phase in Bully Grand Theft Auto IV and the sadly console bound Red Dead Redemption of framing their protagonists as anti heroes. GTA 4's Niko Bellic did some terrible things but he had a downtrodden charm that helped you like him as you piloted him through the underworld. He was surrounded by people who were larger than life but ultimately beneath the surface people. Among those people were some of Rockstar's better female characters Kate McReary Mallorie Bardas The Lost and Damned's Ash Butler.GTA V ArgumentGrand Theft Auto 5 does away with all of that deliberately but to its detriment. Its trio of protagonists occupy a city full of vapid two dimensional caricatures and they flirt with that boundary themselves. Michael is a middle aged former bankrobber unhappily married and on the edge of a breakdown. Franklin is a young hood purportedly principled but willing to do almost anything for money. Trevor is a desert dwelling meth dealing psychopath with a homebrew morality that sits uneasily alongside his capacity for violent cruelty and sexual aggression. The campaign explores their relationship through a series of heists and misadventures as they clash with every L.A. stereotype you might imagine the bored Beverly Hills housewife the corrupt fed the bottom rung fraudster the smug technology exec and so on.Against this backdrop it's only Michael Franklin and Trevor that appear to have any kind of internal life. I get the impression that this is deliberate part of the game's relentless skewering of southern California and indicative of Rockstar's waning interest in romantic anti heroes. Trevor's introduction in particular amounts to a particularly explicit ' you' to the characters and themes of Grand Theft Auto IV. GTA 5 is heartless in that way and as a result I found the narrative difficult to care about. It is ambitious well performed and the production values are extraordinary but it is also derivative and brutishly adolescent set in a world where the line between criminality and the rule of law is blurry but where it is always hilarious that somebody might be gay.GTA V ChinatownIt's an R rated episode of The A Team where the 'A' stands for ' '. The campaign's best moments come when your cigar chomping master strategist insane former military pilot and talented driver come together and when you're given the power to choose how to use each of them. These heists are set piece missions where you pick an approach and perform set up tasks in the open world before setting out on the job itself. In the best of them which occur later in the campaign it really does evoke the satisfaction of having a plan come together. Perhaps you position Trevor on the high ground with a rocket launcher Michael on foot with a stealth approach and Franklin in an armoured ram raider. With a button press you can flick between the three dynamically orchestrating a crime caper on your own terms.It is also in these moments that Rockstar's most ambitious storytelling takes place. Your choice of character crew and even certain in game actions have subtle effects on the dialogue. In an early heist a crewmember dropped part of the score but as Franklin I was able to retrieve it a side objective that I'd set for myself but that was subsequently reflected in a later conversation between him and Michael. This is another example of Rockstar's extraordinary attention to detail and if the rest of the campaign respected your agency in this way it might overcome its weaker moments.GTA V Plane ChaseAs it is this is a very long game with a lot of filler. There's much driving from A to B a lot of conversations in cars a lot of gunfights with hordes of goons who show up just to run into your gunsights over and over. It's far richer in set piece moments than its predecessor drug trips aerial heists dramatic chases and many of these look incredible even if they're light on actual interaction. In the best examples you soak in the atmosphere and happily ignore the fact that you're only really being asked to follow the on screen instructions. In the worst examples insta fail stealth sequences sniper missions and so on it's harder to ignore the shackles that are placed on the player in order to preserve the game's cinematic look and feel.I spent a lot of my time with the campaign frustrated along these lines bored of the same mission templates that I've been playing through since GTA III and making the most of the scant opportunities to play my own way like Franklin's refreshingly open assassination missions. Then inevitably I'd be doing one of those rote activities a heavily scripted freeway chase perhaps when the magic of that extraordinary world would creep up on me again. It'd hit me I'm doing 150 km/h along the Pacific Coast Highway at sunset. The rock station is playing 30 Days In The Hole by Humble Pie. It feels incredible a collision of pop culture atmosphere music and play that is unique to GTA.

review: On my first day of playing GTA V I realized this game is about freedom to do whatever you want. After completing 1 2 missions I decided to hit the golf course at about 10 30 PM.A sharp pain in my right eye broke my concentration and I've messed up the shot.Alas when I looked upon the cellphone clock it was 4 30 AM and my eyes were bleeding.BUT I HONESTLY CAN'T REMEMBER WHEN I HAD SO MUCH FUN IN LIFE and I have a pretty cool life too can't complain.The thing is there is so much to do so much to see I'm guessing it's gonna take me 100+ hours to see it all.Every ride reveals beautiful realistic eye candy that just puts a smile. Don't believe me? Grab a chopper or a plane and gain some altitude then look down on the city. It feels so alive every car driving with a purpose every pedestrian doing his own thing. This is so much more than a video game it's THE video game. It's a life simulator that it sadly way more fun than real life. P.S. One of the best optimised games for PC ever. Looks and plays wonderful.I have to sleep now or I'll die.

Only video game producers can get away with selling broken/unfinished products as finished products. These folks wonder why no one wants to pay for their games.

review: Having not played this game since about a year after release I was pleased to see after many years there is an insane amount of new online content in this game. I love the heist options and the ease of joining them. If you read any other reviews you know the main issue with GTA Online play MODDERS. It's almost a gaurantee that any lobby you enter has at least one modder the issue being if that modder is a or not. Overall I would recommend this game. Please read on for my more detailed review.ProsIf you have a high end PC the graphics on this game are absolutely beautiful. Simply amazing if you're up in a chopper and you can see the entire city.Single Player At this point you know when this game came out it was one of the best campaigns ever created that still reigns true. Not much to say about this as i'll be focusing on the changing GTA Online play.Online Aspects Run by a system of RP (basically EXP) and money.Heist play IMO the most fun. You can earn some good money doing the setups and even more money on the heist finale. Doing the quick play option from a high end apartments heist board will allow you to finish several of these every hour.Home/Bunker/Facility/Bank These buildings that you purchase control how you do most things online. Your home is used to start heist missions and somewhere for you to spawn. The Bunker allows you to run a business as long as you are a CEO/Club MC/VIP. This business will earn you money over time that you collect by delivering weapon cache's. Moreover the men at work in your bunker will research weapon/vehicle upgrades and modifications as long as they have the supplies to do so. These supplies are replenished by doing missions for the bunker that don't earn $ just supplies. If the supplies deplete research will cease. This adds a fun element to GTA Online that seems like you actually control your life and have things to worry about. A type of micromanaging that I enjoy.The Facility is the newest addition to GTA Online. It allows you to play the newest Heist The Doomsday Heist. A three act heist that is the most fun of all six IMO. The Bank is the cheapest option for you to become a CEO. Being a CEO allows you access to the laptop in your bunker so you can resupply and sell your weapons cache. At first I didn't enjoy spending $1 000 000 GTA dollars on the bank then another $1 500 000 on the Bunker just to get my business up and running but that's the price you pay. Being a CEO also allows you to hire associates (friends) to help you do resupply missions delivering of weapons cache and several CEO exclusive missions to earn RP &amp money.Earning RP will allow your level to rise and give you access to new weapons vehicles and much better vehicle customizations. Overall this game has a ton to offer for online play. Playing with friends increases the fun 10 fold.ConsIf you are playing alone it can be difficult to navigate through heist setups and other objectives where team work is key. Even having one friend with you makes everything much easier. It seems that half the setups I get in to people don't speak english which can be especially difficult for heist finales. Mic/coms are RARELY used in PUGs.Even worse than that and above all else is the failure for R* to address the modding community. With the download of an app it is easy for most to enter GTA Online with inifite money and access to everything you could imagine. It is very hard to express the rage that is induced by you almost finishing a gun run worth $500 000 that took you a week of supplies to save up only to have a modder teleport to you and destroy you with 15 rockets in 4 seconds. As I mentioned earlier this doesn't effect me too much as I mostly do heist setups/finales. Most modders tend to stay away from those and just ruin the fun of people in public lobbies.As everyone knows in 2018 a ton of companies are doing microtransactions and R* takes advantage. This is never something I partake in especially when a game that came out 6 years ago STILL costs $60 except twice a year when it's half off. For $20 US you get $1 250 000 GTA dollars. If you do several setups and a heist finale or two you can earn that money. Is 2 4 hours of GTA online gameplay worth $20? I guess that's up to you.Loading Another issue with GTA Online. I do believe my high end PC and fiber optic internet connection help me have less issues than most but still several times a week you will have to force close GTA because you're stuck staring at the city from above for 5 minutes. I have found if it's taking longer you can hit Alt+F4 then push ESC to go back to the game sometimes this forces you to load back in to a CLOSED (non public) server. Another tip When turning on GTA always load single player mode first then load the online from the menu. I always select CLOSED FRIEND SESSION to get on faster. Also the rare auto kick while entering a setup/mission. It will say "The host has left the game" when really it just booted them for no reason.Another annoyance that most agree with As soon as you enter Online mode or even return to a lobby from doing a mission/setup you are bombarded with phone calls and tool tips about purchasing all types of buildings. I don't even want to own a heli/plane since you can only use them in the lobby (not setups) and only on select missions but I still get the same ing call from Ron "HEEEEYYYYYY IT'S RONNNNNNNN" telling me to buy a hanger to store a plane. This will happen with a facilites AND bunkers. So when you're just starting off be ready for 3 calls+tool tips until you purchase these buildings.OverallIf you can get past the annoyances and the modders you can have a ton of fun with GTA. It still contains all the things you love like jumping cars off cliffs jet ski's parachuting blowing up and following the flow of traffic in your supercar for no reason. I still RECOMMEND this game but add it to your wishlist and grab it on sale.8/10

review: 希望大家买游戏之前花点时间看看我的这篇评测 对你会有莫大的帮助 本人15年189原价购入gta5 玩了1500多小时 昨天被封号了 心态爆炸 希望大家买游戏之前要三思 R星的封号机制是不接受申诉的 封号这个事非同小可 人家不让你玩了 这游戏再好玩都跟你无关 不要以为你本本分分的玩游戏就没有封号可能 先给大家科普一下R星的封号机制 1.大部分时候处于长期掉线状态 导致的结果是外挂满天飞 恶劣的外挂譬如一键秒杀所有玩家 高级的外挂还能嫁祸其他玩家 有可能别人开挂系统显示击杀者却是你 套模型 比如在你身上绑个巨型风车 ufo 让你寸步难行 这些模型往往需要重新登录游戏才能去掉 而重登一次基本得五到十分钟 另外如果你电脑配置不佳 被套模型后物理引擎的运算超出硬件所能承受的范围 游戏会直接崩溃 清空你的游戏币 不管你有多少钱 不管你钱怎么来的 一律清零 银行里显示是医疗费用支出 以及刷钱袋 很多新人看到钱袋就跑去捡 结果因为数据异常导致封号 2.极度严苛 在某些特定时候 一般是大型更新推出前 阿星的外挂检测机制会突然开始发挥作用 本着宁可错杀一千不能放过一个的原则 导致大量误封的情况 比如现在就是 开挂 刷钱 封号没什么可说的 利用bug获取非法游戏币 好吧 我承认我卡过bug 没什么好辩解的 但是在封号潮期间 即使你只是被外挂套了模型 跟外挂一起游戏 捡了外挂刷出的钱袋武器特定载具 请注意 这些都是你无法左右的 甚至只是因为你玩的太好被人怀疑开挂 或者别人开挂栽赃你 然后你被多人举报 都有可能导致封号 哦对了 中国人使用电脑都有下载安全软件的习惯 在游戏运行期间使用清理内存功能 俗称点加速球 也会有几率被当成外挂导致封号 是的 严格的封号机制可以净化游戏环境 可如此明显的间歇性 要么撒手不管让绿色玩家水深火热 要么吹毛求疵让绿色玩家无辜中枪 实在是没什么游戏体验 好 你说开挂的终究会被封 不是不报时候未到 但我们这些绿色玩家的游戏体验确确实实受到了侵害 被外挂蹂躏已成事实 伤害已经造成 日后封他号有个卵用 更何况阿星也从来没有因为你被外挂蹂躏过给你任何补偿 3.不可逆性 如我所言 阿星封号不接受申诉 说封你就是封你 没有解除惩罚这一说 封了你还要清空数据 不管你是玩了几天的萌新还是我这种几千小时的老司机 不论你所有资产中多少是合法所得 多少是非法所得 一切都从头开始 说了这么多问题诟病阿星的封号机制 其实这游戏还是很好玩的 线上造型炫酷的各种跑车 游艇 战斗机会给你无限动力奋斗赚钱 也就是所谓的肝 这也是为什么很多玩家都能玩上一两千小时不厌烦 但是没人希望自己花了几百上千小时打造的犯罪帝国会因一点小小的疏忽化为泡影 而这种疏忽 甚至是无法防范的 哦对了 就算你是RMB玩家 一旦阿星认为你开挂 照封不误 只是你充值购买的游戏币不会删除 贴吧里就有充了几千块照样被封号的玩家 讲道理 gta5是一部具有时代意义的神作 我承认写这篇测评有泄愤的因素 但以上内容句句属实 我只是专挑不好听的说罢了 下面我给大家再科普一下防止封号的几点建议 1.当然是不要开挂 不要找人刷钱 路上有钱袋不要捡 万一不小心捡了 需要向R星自首 具体方法请百度 2.不要利用任何bug 不论是否涉及非法游戏币 卡分红关 卡特殊衣服 卡特定载具都属于违法线上条款的 想不被封号就别碰 3.遇上外挂请绕道走 在任务里遇上请退任务 暂停选单里寻找新战局 在战局里遇上请换战局 开挂玩家的特征 比如等级超过400 15年入坑的老玩家大部分在200 400级左右 超过这个数字就有可能是开挂刷的 kda超过10 或者穿着非常非常奇怪的衣服 给人异次元错觉那种 或者战局里出现不可能出现的东西 比如马路上刷出一个ufo 一个大铁网圈起你的房子 或者车库里出现铁笼子 或者显示某一个人一瞬间杀了所有人4.封号潮期间少上游戏 如前所述 误封的真的很多 不上号才是最保险的方法 关注GTA5百度贴吧 误封潮期间会有很多帖子讨论这件事 5.如果你玩过盗版 或者线下开过挂 一定把游戏目录清理干净 最好彻底重装 如此才保险 另外 不要点加速球 不要点加速球 不要点加速球 6.这个游戏最赚钱的合法方式是做抢劫任务 然而利用特殊方法可以跳过繁琐的准备环节 不停重复最后的分红关 俗称卡分红 以获取大量游戏币 卡分红有几率导致封号 不论你是开任务的队长 还是参与任务的队员 因此大家除了要做到不卡分红 还要防止 被卡分红 如果你的好友每隔十几二十分钟就退出游戏然后重登 然后给你发分红关的任务邀请 如此循环 他很有可能就是在卡分红 不要接受他的申请 爱惜自己的账号 7.作为一款网络游戏 gta5还是跟基友一起玩才好玩 去贴吧找组织 加玩家群 发帖求带 然后尽量少去公开战局吧 尤其封号潮期间 8.以上建议只能降低封号风险 如果你被无故封号 也要保证素质 不要报复社会沦为挂逼 也不建议新玩家就去刷钱 因为那会严重破坏游戏体验 完全丧失gta5的乐趣

review: I bought this game twice. Once for the 360 and once more for my pc. And at the time they seemed very much worth it but now it seems that the game has in fact changed than when I first played it. The online component is very much geared into getting people into spending money on Rockstars microtransactions I can't in good faith say that isn't a scumbag tactic. The singleplayer is very much the same with no changes. I would say don't buy this game if you dislike microtransactions in games especially if your prone to gambling. And if you think that you can resist the microtansactions. Then by all means purchase this game on a sale. BUT BE WARNED Rockstar will bundle their game with microtransactions on sales forcing people to pay more for the game and for their fake currency so just do a littel more browsing and you should find the base game.

review: I do indeed enjoyed this game but I cannot recommend it to anybody new. This game takes WAY to long to get up and running. I once had a dream of owning every car in the game and I did that in the base game. But now it's impossible. The DLC they release basically ensures that you buy $40 worth of shark cards. To get the full enjoyment of this game you either need 500 or $300 in shark cards. (No really this is actually what it would cost to have a taste at MOST of the side features in this game) The campaign is really solid but this game is now out of hand. They do a poor job midigating hackers because people need hackers to enjoy this game. A SINGLE CAR can cost you $60 REAL MONEY to get if you don't want to grind the 40 hours to get it. It's a grind fest. And a not fun one because you usually have to drag your friends along to replay side missions that are just boring. This game can be a lot of fun with the right people but you NEED to have owned this game since release. It is not worth it to anybody new!!! Save your money for a game that doesn't nickel and dime you into a negative review of an otherwise good game.
