review: People are complaining about modders and I can't blame them. They are all over the place and they are annoying. However the way to deal with them is simple. Just LEAVE the server. That's it. Problem solved. If there is a modder on another server just leave again or stay away from them. Now for the people complaining about Rockstar. I agree completely that Rockstar shouldn't just hang up customer service for millions of false bans and they should make a system to catch cheaters/modders without falsely banning people. My only advice is to leave servers with modders leave servers where people are money glitching or play some jobs to get away from them.As for the game itself I would very strongly recommend buying it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The online community is full of only cancerous jerks who drop out of missions so you can experince the fun of more than 50% of your playtime being loading screens.would be an alright game but people are just the worst.DO NOT BUY UNLESS YOU HAVE A BADASS RIG TO PLAY WITH or else its all loading times for you my friend and very little of actually finishing a mission.that being said the early game mission are just infuriating! the they expect you to do fresh of the plane is stupid! unless you drop MORE money on the game to make for an enjoyable gaming experince free of jerks and having to interact with them. but then WHY AM I PLAYING A MULTIPLAYER GAME???? LATER EDIT After playing the game more I have started to understand the online progression. don't do Lamar's mission jump in lobbies untill you can afford a house witha heist room (500k+ish) and then start doing heists.BE WARNED the hiest missions are UNFORGIVING to drop ins.also the whole story campaign thing is heaps better to play at the moment because it is snowing for chrismas and it wreck all yo' tractioning.also get friends. good ones.

review: Well There goes 700+ Hours of my Life Thanks Rockstar I have just received notice that my account has been Permanently Banned So many people are exploiting the game modding and basically griefing an enitre lobby of people trying to do missions yet they seem to focus on the Clean Players who try to grind their way up with the help of the occasional Shark Card. Thanks to their way of thinking I have no way of knowing what I did to earn a Perma ban. This is the second time I've been banned for no damn reason Last time it was 30 days But somehow I've killed their LORD or something to get banned Permanently from a Game where Modder's Rule. This has officially put me off all Rockstar Games Doesn't make it fair that we can't fight the ban either. I would have to get a new Steam Account and buy the game again and Restart From Scratch All I'm going to say is screw that The first ban took everything from me and now this second time has just ran me head first into a brick wall and killed me before I could get back what I lost from the first ban.I'm done! Through! Damn Rockstar and their Faulty Ban System is basically running off alot of players due to the constant bans gong around and not to the right people either And now the game is worthless to me Single Player is fun for awhile but it get's tiring doing everything over and over. With Half the game missing what am I supposed to do with it? Now I got a Useless Icon in my Game Library that is basically sitting there as a big F.U from Rockstar. Word of Advice Do NOT buy this game or You'll probably end up in here doing what I'm doing and letting people know to not waste their time in a game where you can simply sneeze in your own home and get banned for somehow breaking the Terms.

The banning system in this game is complete Don't abuse the game get banned. Seems legit. If I do infact get unbanned I might change this review. Top Stuff
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: the game is awesome....if you are playing with your own friends in your own session. Because the gameplay in public contradicts it self. To me it feels like the game was done by two groups. One that likes coop and the other that likes the oldschool GTA4 multiplayer where everyone kills everyone. That's why when you play public you feels as if the gameplay contradicts it self. You want to kill people but you get nothing from it. On the contrary you get punished. You have to pay for his vehicle if he was in one and also you have to pay for the bullets you've wasted. But that's not all you also have to pay for every single time you die. So in other words the game was design for you to spend money on sharks. Also when you play CEO everyone wants to break your crates even tho they get nothing from it. But it is part of the game and they should be allowed to do what ever they want. The problem is that there are tons of CEO without balls that like everything handed to them easy and they try to vote kick you. So basically the game is broken. It like I said contradicts it's self. CEO should belong to a coop world instead not public.

review: Listen it's Grand Theft Auto you know it's going to be good. It is a great game made by possibly the best studio in the world. It doesn't matter how to it compares to the other titles in the series on its own it is a technological achievement and deserves the praise that it receives.The online has a hacker problem and has become difficult to play due to incredibly over powered players. IMO Rockstar Games should consider bracketing these open world multiplayer games in the future or maybe having privately owned servers. I personally could do without the flying cars rocket motorcycles and armored vehicles.If you are looking for a fun single player experience you will have one. The online...it might be too late by now but you could still have a lot of fun. I do believe GTA V on PC is still a good purchase in 2018 and is by far the superior version.

The time I spent that wasn't story mode was pretty much just aimlessly wandering around fighting the porr innocent npcs p Since then I have got more into the game and found that it is so much more fun than I thought. Sooooo much content to experience. Heists CEO Motorcycle Clubs Bunkers Facilities there is so much you can do and so many crazy things can happen! Yes it is certainly a bit of a grind but if you read or watch a guide to learn tips on making money it isn't that bad. The game is also exponentially better to play with friends doesnt feel like as much of a grind then either

review: The game has issues with audio which haven't been addressed by it's developer in more than 6 months.When it is started the first logo's have sound and after that it completely cuts out.I have repeatedly requested aid from the developer Rockstar North to solve the issue as have thousands of others. And they haven't even bothered to reply.The 28 hours of time played has been roughly 6 hours of actual gameplay the rest have been waiting for it's lengthy load times while restarting it over and over hoping for it to have it's rare boot where the sound works.And then when the sound does work the online servers are so atrocious that a good portion of the players get disconnected and thrown into a private server where nothing works within 15 minutes of logging in.I just tried re installing the game hoping that might make a difference at least one time so I could have some fun this weekend and now Rockstar can't even find my account for their horrendous webstore nonse that I have to be logged into to play a game that already has online only functionality and cannot be played without Steam open.I've had more than my fill of the arrogance greediness and complete disregard for it's players by the developer and no longer wish to support this game. I have just issued a refund.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: You played GTA 1 2 3 Vice City 4 and now you're ready for the king of them all.. GTA V. Well are you though?If you were expecting an open world do anything shoot steal and be a maniac type of game... I guess this technically fits the bill. But what if you found out it was designed for consoles in 2013 and it still felt like a console game on PC? Sure the graphics and framerate are umpteen times better now but if it wasn't for some of the unique gameplay it would just be another 5 year old console title.I preordered this on PS3 &amp PS4 played it every night for years and still 100% never did everything there is to do. It's amazingly endless replayability just crusing around and of the cops is a blast. But somehow I still feel like I got cheated out of my money on PC. The online multiplayer is where it's at right now buying properties customizing cars chatting with ethugs new game modes and free DLCs every other season. And yet it just feels so dated. I transfered my character from PS4 and played it only a short while. The driving mechanics are still on rails the lack of NPC interaction is unsatisfying at some point I finally realized it was just missing that revamp that would have made it 10/10. The best I can tell the fact it's a console port explains it all. It just doesn't bode well for what we expect on PC. Rockstar thank you for this great game but I hope you learned your lesson.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Hacker simulator 2015 2018Play at your risk when there is double money and RP Event for PVP. There will be a lot of hackers taking advatange to grind the money or troll other people. Please be cooperative when there is hacker/modder on your own team or other team and report them for your own sake and others.Rockstar impletantion against hacker is half baked. We only can confirm people are hacking by spectating the match but when you are spectating but we can't report until the next round. Also when the round ends when you find out he/she is hacking it is too late the game does not let you report.Great single player loading time horrible load time in online.You spent more time in loading screen than playing the game.Compare this online loading time 4 5 min single player loading time less than 20 Sec.Mind you i have moderate Nat Type.There is also alot of bug in the game at the moment makes want to pull your hair out.Unlimited Loading Screen Crew members cant drive during heist Police still onto you even you are out the vision error joining session everytime you have done heist or mission as a host and some AI can shoot through wall in certain location.What make it worse is that r* do not want to acknowledge this bugs exist.I only recommend this game on sale and single player only. Not worth full price

review: The singleplayer is awsome The online is pretty good but has plenty of negatives. For example it has many things to do you make many plans on how to use your money or invest them on something BUT the heists or any activities you do do not give you enough money so you have to grind alot and it gets boring. In the Online again alot of people are too toxic and kill players in free roaming. I prefer to go for a ride with them or something but i cant find anyone else who wants to as well. Now the real problem is the servers. They are quite badly maintained and sometimes you crash. You might as well see modders in some lobbies. Anyways i recommend buying this game mostly for the singleplayer and IF you have any other friend playing the same game you should try going on private lobbies (online) and having fun with them (and of course doing heists with them or any other activities)

review: This game is insanely fun in practically every way possible. Singleplayer storyline combat and all the features make it absolutely amazing. GTA Online is also fun yet some things can improve. A better system to prevent cheaters would be amazing because there are a lot of them running around multiplayer. Micro transactions are also highly unnecessary and deter many people. For a game that is normally priced at $60 that is a steep price and is definitely worth it although micro transactions are only for greed rather than to improve the experience of players. In a way they cause players to become pay to win because those who spend lots of money can buy overpriced items to enhance their game and even cause other players to become mad at them and the game. As a gamer who loves GTA removing micro transactions would improve the online gameplay and would most likely draw a larger audience to play the game(s). Overall an awesome game yet as with anything things can improve. Game is worth the price.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After 140 hours logged on the pc version and something like 50 accumulated days of playtime logged across the ps3 and ps4 version of this game I can only say I heavily regret getting the pc version Why you might ask? After playing the game at a higher frame rate and ease of aiming with a mouse I can't see myself being able to go back to the console version This is a problem because the PC version of this game is completely ruined by the community I have never encountered more hacking in a video game in my 15+ years of gaming and Rockstar either doesn't care or is unable to control the issue It wouldn't be a problem if it was simply players giving themselves money or something using programs I really couldn't care less but the problem comes in when almost every session contains multiple hackers trolling players either by using god mode to get kills or through other wackier means such as sticking a campfire on a player causing them to burn alive as they spawn. If you haven't played the PC version yet DON'T keep playing the console version and stay there as you're ability to play on PC will be heavily affected by the community's acceptance of hacking and rampant use of external programs. I know this probably sounds like I got owned by hacks and I'm just venting but honestly it pains me to make my first bad review on steam one of my all time favorite games and if anything happens to midigate the issue I will change this review in a heartbeat since outside of the hacking I have had a blast playing but it really is such a signifcant problem I would have to say newcomers stay away the console versions are much cleaner when it comes to hackers not that they don't exist on the platforms but here it's just insane how bad the issue is.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Online mode?If you like grinding for money or paying all your real human earth money for fake virtual dollars that can buy you one car then go right ahead.Story mode?Yes absolutely. It's amazing (until a random glitch causes pure rage) and some of the cutscenes and dialogue is pretty funny.I do like mods for singleplayer they add a whole new layer of sillyness and messing around to the game.At the end of the story mode don't kill any of the three playable characters. It blocks off a whole part of the game. (and all of the cash dollars that character had probably.)Play the online if you want.Absolutely play the singleplayer.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Trevor why are you so broken? You're the best psycho ever.Micheal if I ever met your kids I'd slap the stupid out of them.Franklin instead of hustlin with the guys you coulda took the money from the second heist and really got out of the country. Nope you waste it and stick with the guys.What can I say about this game that hasn't already been said?Not much. Its just so good.I had it on the 360 when it came out and played it to death back then. Didn't really do the GTAOnline thing much as I knew the 360 version's character gen wasn't as good as the pc's but I wasn't gonna blow out for the game twice.Then my kid and friends got into it big time about a year later and so I hung out with them online doing races and generally arsing around in LS. I must have 100 or more hours in it before deciding to get in on some pc Mc.Lovin and get the big boy version.Oh am I glad I did. LS looks and sounds glorious its just so much more LS than LS if that makes sense... The weather wow. The first time a thunderstorm turned up I actually jumped because my sub rattled so much. Ah good times.First person view is a godsend driving is now actually doable with characters other than Franklin. Flying is easier too. I actually am spending a good amount of time in the aircraft in game and can fly without crashing everywhere. Of course a gamepad is pretty much mandatory for this game and something I found that makes it so much better are thumbstick risers. Little rubber nubs about an inch long that fit over the thumbsticks and let you have so much more travel of the sticks.Mucho mondo accuracy. Which is a really good thing as the aim helper from the 360 isn't there so its all hands on deck as far as shootin.I like that I've been able to transfer my online 360 character over to the pc so I've got all my cars houses and money I played for on the 360. That was a nice touch and R* should be congratulated for it.I'm enjoying Online on the pc I guess I've been lucky in that I've not come across hackers yet (touch wood) and griefers are easy to deal with just go into passive mode till the go away. They do tend to get bored easily.The stunt racing Before I bought the pc version I thought what a stupid idea. We have all the tools and things we need already to race and do stunts already. Oh boy was I ever wrong. What fun it is to tear through loop the loops at high speeds. Doing jumps at stupid heights and praying you make the landing. Yeah that's my favourite mode.But then they go and bring out the Bikers expansion... Oh whut? Bike gangs.. Go on then. Ouch clubhouses are expensive but what fun the outfits bikes and everything they've brought out for it is. Its candyland for bikers...Whats this $3m for a boat? O Guess I'm gonna have to go rob more liquor stores )
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V is not only a preposterously enjoyable video game but also an intelligent and sharp tongued satire of contemporary America. It represents a refinement of everything that GTA IV brought to the table five years ago. It s technically more accomplished in every conceivable way but it s also tremendously ambitious in its own right. No other world in video games comes close to this in size or scope and there is sharp intelligence behind its sense of humor and gift for mayhem. It tells a compelling unpredictable and provocative story without ever letting it get in the way of your own self directed adventures through San Andreas.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: action pack game where you click on strippers
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is insanely good. Despite playing this for over 500 hours on the 360. It still has the drawing power to make me want to come back and play new things. Story mode is simply increcible I've replayed the main story 4 times now and in my opinion it is the best part of the game. With so much to do and so many ways you can play it differently each time I've never had a boring moment. Story mode for me is what makes this game well worth it's price. Moving onto online for me I find it more tedious to play by yourself. Gaining money without grinding heists is very tedious and often leaves me finding a new game to play for the evening. However if you do play this game with a friend or a group of friends you are in for a great time. I can't remember how many times I've had my face hurting from laughing so much after a session with some mates. So to conclude GTA V is well worth the buy even for the story alone. But once you throw online in there I would be happy spending $150 on this game. If you can't afford it or aren't convinced because you thing there are too many hackers (I've never actually seen a hacker but that may be because of me being on Australian servers) then at least wait till it's on sale and give it a go. This was the first Grand Theft Auto I played and was so good it made me go back and buy the previous titles.TLDR Well worth the price tag pick it up now or on sale. Story is the best feature and online can be incredible with a group of mates.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Currently my favorite game. I wish they would come out with more DLC's like the gambling/casino one they have been talking about forever. They have done a better job at getting rid of all the hackers. I rarely see a hacker these days. It is fun and enjoyable especially when you have friends to play with. My major problem is some lag amd random connection loss. Besides the fact that I need a better updated PC to handle it better. Other then that I love it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Bought this game off code worked fine. However to get the game to realize that my steam account was already linked with a R* Social Club account was a . Single player works fine but the multiplayer oh god the multiplayer. It crashed at every chance it gets loading screen *crash* fifty restarts later the game still won't ing work. I googled it to see whats wrong and my one conclusion (that is probably not the real reason) is that the DRM is completely and utterly ing my game. you R* and your DRM also every other company that uses DRM I'm looking at you Ubisoft.It's been a year since I bought this game and I only just got it to work. When I bought this game and couldn't get it to work I contacted R* support they were beyond useless. They had me try so many different "fixes" which fixed nothing and after all this they just said stuff it and wouldn't respond to any of my requests for help. Either way a year later months after giving up one of my friends fixed it for me. What he did was set me a static ip and that solved it. Why didn't I think of this? because I didn't know it would effect the game. So this review is more about R* support at this point. I spent ages talking to them and they didn't even think of telling me to set a static ip. So a year down the road this game is still worth it but if you have issues with it don't contact R* support they're beyond useless.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: As by now it appears most CrossFire issues have been resolved (excluding an incidental case of a lightbuffer bug which makes the game double brightness which can be resolved by alt tabbing out and back into the game) I can again recommend the game from a technical and graphical standpoint.Using triple R9 290x an i7 3820 and 32GB of RAM I can again easily run GTA V on it's highest settings in 4k bar shadows (this is set to high) and MSAA (limited to 2x in my case) resulting in a 58 frame average when using Freesync Framepacing and AMD Chill good going team!I'm however getting slightly annoyed by how each and every addition to the game seems to become more ludicrously expensive A freaking mini for 360k?/lada for 150k without mods? come on guys... I also would dare challenge the newest supercars are worth the same as a fighter jet but that's just my humble opinion on that... At least the game itself runs fine as long as the servers don't crap themselves.The main gripe I still have with the game has to do with the lobbying system I can't fathom why it's never changed that the game first leaves a world to then check wether the new world is full of players having to load back to another (often different even if you were in a world filled with friends) world if you can't join the new one.I'd love to see actual logic applied there in that the game checks the new lobby first if it's full poses the question wether to queue/join and only after that leave the world if the new session can be actually joined this would really save me and other players a ton of time when trying to join invited sessions which end up to be full (even if the game stated otherwise just seconds before...) Also quite a lot of worlds are so often ruined by one guy having to misuse the Opressor/Deluxo out of 12 ish players in total indirectly forcing you to drop to an empty session if you want to have any hope of achieving anything... It'd be great if the game could detect people with a tendency to get in their boom mobile and throw them together in one big of a game might teach them a lesson why it's bashful.Other then that especially when played with friends it can be a fun experience playing missions with Randoms is very hit and miss mainly since a lot of players seem to lack even more communicative skills then I personally do Be ready to carry if you wish to play any mission above normal level.

review: Alright I've spent over 1k hours in GTA V and GTA Online and I think it's time for an review. The core of the game is masterfully done and there was a lot of thought and process that went into the game and it's online addition. This is mostly noticable in the detail of the world and how it works with the player to make you feel immersed. The big problem with GTA isn't GTA V itself but the problems that exist in Online. Especially modders crashing other players games and the horrible loading times. Rockstar have made multiple attemps at fixing the hacker plauge that has spread over Online with Gunrunning being the most noticable one. There are unfortunately still hackers everywhere trying to destroy for other players and killing them when they are doing missions in a freeroam lobby. I understand why it is such a big problem for Rockstar to remove the hackers when there are so many diffrerent mod menus out there both free and paid. I also want to talk about the ridicoulous prices of some of the vehicles in GTA Online most noticeably the Lazer. The Lazer is an fighter jet that can be found in the Military Base and stolen as long as you're skilled enough to get away from the enemies both on the ground and in the air. In late 2017 Rockstar made this jet purchasable for 6 5 million dollars which is around 800$ in real life money. The only thing that you get for buying it is that you can make it another color than grey. There was a huge outrage about this because of the fact that the jet is still stealable from the Military Base and because it had such an ridiculous price. Other vehicles with ridiculous prices include The Luxor Deluxe which is an golden jet that costs 10 million dollars in game. There is also the Jachts that go from 6 10 million. I'm not here to complain about them though because all of these vehicles are completely useless and you are never forced to buy them. Overall I love this game. I'm an big fan of the whole GTA Series and for me this was an huge addition. The game is coming close to five years since it's original release on PS3 and Xbox 360 and Rockstar are working on Red Dead Redemption 2. GTA V doesn't have many years left but it will absolutley go down in history as an great example of what an ambitious and motivated developer and publisher can do.I conclusion I recommend this game to anyone that likes open world games action and getting blown up by an Tryhard with an explosive sniper.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've given this some long and hard thought. I'll start with the good things.It's beautiful large chunks of it have wonderful attention to detail. The enormous open world that can sometime look photorealistic in the right light and distance is great. The ability to run a wanton criminal empire is great the driving is alot of fun and loving detail has gone into the sheer number of different cars bikes planes and boats available. There is an in game purchase system that isn't lootbox based. A bunch of the missions and races and whatnot are good fun in coop and there's lots to do. I'm hooked and may be coming back to it a long time if the annoyances below don't kill it for me eventually. Unfortunately there's so much wrong with it that I can't possibly give it a positive review.1. Ridiculously expensive.The in game purchase system is preposterously expensive and dramatically unbalanced. Eight million in game dollars buys you very little indeed and rockstar has the gall to charge you 75 euro's for that. It's ridiculous. I've found myself paying it though but it gives one a feeling of disgust and dirtiness. Rockstar does not get my sympathy and I will think three times before ever buying another of its games.2. New players.If you haven't spent say 200 euro's on in game dollars you're ed. There is nothing to help new players into the online version of the game and the complete lack of any sort of balancing means that you will be constantly slaughtered in ambushes or one sided exchanges in freemode untill you reach end game levels of cash which you need to bring something like 500 euro's to do or thousands of hours of gameplay and even then you will still be subject to the general freemode balance problems.3. Balance.Heavy military hardware is far to cheap relatively. Freemode is dominated by s flying gunships hiding and griefing anyone who is trying to make some in game money which they don't really need anymore since they've already got all the cool gizmo's. Freemode pvp gameplay is a sequence of one sided exchanges and ambushes and respawning is so close together that after the first death it's just a matter who spots who with a sniper rifle first. It's inane. Rockstar needs to look at open world pvp games and learn from them. APB has a system which is far from ideal but dramatically better than what's going in in GTA online freemode.4. Hackers.They're incessant and constant. Rockstar doesn't seem to want to do anything about it. You can't tell me that it's impossible to put a sanity check on the means by which someone was killed or what happened in the minute or so before someone switched sessions. Or they should talk to the OpenIV developer and include anti cheat code in that software. if you can't detect tanks being dropped on a helicopter in mid air you're incompetent rockstar.5. Story mode.No female character? Seriously you can't write a story which has three switchable characters ffs and you can't make one of them a woman? You have got to be kidding. Of all its numerous shortcomings this is almost the most glaring. The previous four can be attributed to rockstar's inexperience with online pvp environments but not including a female character in the main storyline requires actual long term vision. If story mode had a decent female character I probably wouldn't visit online at all its so full of jerks and hackers.Not catering to female gamers in the main story line and the intolerably bad protection of new players is really bad business by rockstar and I'd be having a serious words with them if I was one of their financers.The sad thing is most of this isn't all that hard to fix which could make it magnificent. As it stands it's just barely tolerable and since I've run out of other games that are holding my attention I'll stick with it untill something better comes along. It can hardly take long.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The character limit of this review does not allow for me to list all the faults present in this game.Here are some of the highlights Toxic community most public sessions are filled with absolute s. Cheating and game hacking is so common place it's more surprising to enter a public session without a hacker than a public session with a hacker. At one point GTA's servers lost my character and all my progress for GTAO and it took 2 weeks and dozens of support tickets to get it back and I mostly received automated canned messages and had my tickets all closed. Combat is horribly unbalanced and gameplay is totally illogical. For example You can be walking down a street and any random player can come at you in an armoured bulletproof car and shoot you repeatedly from inside of it while you can't touch them. But if you blow up their car the game will fine you a small amount of money and call you a bad sport. Seriously. Rockstar has made it extremely difficult to acquire money without playing in public sessions while at the same time hasn't done anything to address unbalanced combat or widespread cheating/hacking in the game. The fastest ways of acquiring money mostly involve doing a substantial amount of grinding building up 'product' then 'selling' the product in a mission. Other players will receive a notification that you are selling product and will be told to go destroy it. They receive no reward for this. If your product is destroyed you just wasted several hours of gaming for no reward and actually probably lost money overall. There can be 20+ players in a session. Imagine it. GTA's servers falsely accused me of acquiring hacked money and removed $4.5m GTA dollars from my account. I will say it until I turn blue in the face I've never hacked cash in the game. Again GTA's support system has given me nothing but canned responses and closed my tickets without resolving the issue. To put it into context $4.5m is about a week worth of nightly grinding for a high level player and about a month for a new player.There is a great game here buried under all of the horrible business decisions made by Rockstar and Take Two but this game continues to be fun really in spite of Rockstar and not because of them. I would not recommend you buy this product.Update Orbital cannon? You ing kidding me? I'm done DONE.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: EDIT The mod situation has been resolved! Most companies don't backpedel so I have to give them credit for listening to the customers.I can't and won't speek on behalf of the OpenIV team. The is on my behalf only as a consumer and a person that loves mods. I do not agree whith what t2 did with the OpenIV creators. and for that I have to say that I don't recomend this game. What that means to me the base game is pretty good 8/10. The online is crap and I do not wish to participate in it at all. I don't like all the people that KOS when you are min. level with no guns. The constant cheating and hacking is annoying. The only online I enjoy is in a private server with friends and that's not possible.If you enjoy the story and that's all you care about only get the game super cheap. The single player alone is not really worth even $30. The single player mods made this game replayable and so much fun after the story is finished. I will be uninstalling this game and WILL NOT bother with online. I was disapointed that the 'private server' mods were shut down but there was still single player with mods. Now that's gone and as soon as the next update comes out for this game I'm sure the last version of OpenIV will be unusable. I will come back to it when something is changed or figured out with the mods. Until then I don't want it wasting HDD space.

review: Great Times! Best GTA game out there next to San Andreas and Vice City. Great story mode and has stupid dumb amounts of content. Great game! Higj recommend.Also for those wondering about all the negative comments about Take 2 making modding illegal....First off it was because of online hackers. People giving away free money to players and grieving thr online community. This hasn't only cost the company real money but the community itself has been at Rockstar to rid of cheaters forever. review: Funny how telling it is that Rockstar/TakeTwo are using screen shots from the multiplayer to sell this. I do not like multiplayer. It stresses me out and I deal with enough stupid people in my day job that I dont want to deal with some on the other end of the world being a I dont like it that's my personal take. However with TakeTwo they seem to only want money and have been throwing EVERYTHING at the online portion. Meanwhile the single player while fun at times is completely forgetable. Trevor Micheal and Franklin are all s in their own right and none of them are what one would call likeable. The heists are fun but limited in scope. However and here's the kicker most of the game is completely forgotten after a short time. Why? Well there's one campaign. That's all you get. TakeTwo hasnt added in any substancial content for the single player guys to enjoy. No DLC for single player no nothing. I mean Im greatful that there's no microtransactions but when they pretty much dropped the ball entirely on it I think that was a mistake. So what do you get for your 60 ING Dollars for a now 4 year old game with ooodles of hackers a now crippled modding scene and a 60 GB download that seems more like it's meant for only the multiplayer? You get a 20 hour campaign a fair number of side activities and some goodies. However if you want to experience anything in the screen shots according to some buddies (as I dont play multiplayer and am now going to uninstall this game from my computer due to the modding scene damage) you get to grind or pay. I dont think that's fun and when I heard about the grind and microtransactions I lost all intrest in it instantly. Good job Taketwo/Rockstar. You took a promising game and killed it. If you do want to pick it up get it on sale. $60 is not worth it after 4 years. Actually you know what? Dont bother throwing money at this mess. If you want a drive aroundy shooty bang story with a lot of fun and none of this bull go get San Andres. UPDATE 6/24/17 Good job community on kicking up a huge stink. You're the reason we have the news we do. TakeTwo has back peddled from their orignal statement seemingly. Firstly with the "talks with the openIV dev" and suddenly a new small update for openIV. However do not let your guard down. At any time they can take down that statement and go back aftrer modding. It's still dumb because of how little TakeTwo thinks of the modding community and if it werent for the reviews getting abosolutely tanked and will remain that way for a while and everything else that happened modding would be effectively ended on the PC Side. My review will still remain negitive though.Why? Multiplayer sucks and you can get banned for seemingly no reason out of the ing blue It has microtransactions in the multiplayer. That alone is enough for me not to recommend playing. No content updates for the Single Player planned full stop. Thats all for now. Will update in the future with more things if TakeTwo decides to continue to backpeddle or if they go fullll retard and go back after modding.

review: Recently there's been a lot of negative reviews for this game so I just want to give my two cents on the topic and hopefully it'll change someone's mind for the better. *Disclaimer I have not played storymode as of now (so you can tell I'm an expert on the topic lol). Currently I have logged 191 hours when this review was written off of only online mode so imagine how many hours you could get with playing story mode.*To begin yes there is a somewhat long wait to get into online mode. However if you have an even satisfactory computer relative to what is necessary to run this game then the wait is bearable. I would be lying if I said there is a minimal wait time but 5 10 minutes is fine considering I spend three hours playing. Normally I turn it on get it running and then watch a quick YouTube video or make a sandwich. When I come back the game is ready to play. Simple as that.Once again while the claims that there a plenty of hackers on this game are true it doesn't make the game bad. I'd say every 1/5 servers I go on has a hacker and of those hackers only 1/2 of them are there to make your day worse. So about every 10 severs I go on there is a 'bad hacker'. However there's a simple solution the join a new server option. Then you don't have to exit the game but you do get to join a new server. Easy fix. )Lastly there are some reviews about this game saying that online is too difficult because all the weapons/cars etc. are overpriced. Keep in mind I've only played online and never story mode but speaking from experience that's kinda BS. Yes it takes awhile to accumulate wealth (I still haven't gotten top dog stuff after nearly 200 hours) but that's the fun to it. I don't care about how it'll take me awhile longer to get all the most expensive items because getting there is so exciting. And to be honest there are easy ways to get money and all the really really expensive items are kind of just showy stuff you don't have to have it to have a great time but it does surely enhance the gameplay.After all this time I still hop on whenever I can because the game and sometimes even the people can be extremely enjoyable. Don't like the "abundance of hackers" or just interacting with people in general? There's a single player online (though seemingly counter intuative I'm sure someone has found good use out of it). But personally I've made plenty of good friends on this game and I bet that you will as well. If I have convinced even one person to get this amazing game then writing this review was worth it. Enjoy. )
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Игра на много часов весёлая особенно в компании.Абсолютно стоит своих денег. Но я хотел бы обратить внимание на минусы. Огромный минус комьюнити этой игры. Неадекваты которые убивают без какой либо причины не способны вести обычный диалог ливеры с конца подготовительных/ограблений читеры с которым мы плавно подходим к ещё одному минусу.Античит отвратительный читеры творят невероятную херHю а античит этого не видит. И скорее забанят простого игрока чем самого виновника (уже два бана имею за просто так первый получил в первую неделю игры).Долгие загрузки aka симулятор загрузок. Многое конечно зависит от железа но загрузки больно долгие. Механика подбора игроков и лобби. Подбирать игроков в подготовительные/ограбления это просто боль. Это не проблема когда есть стак из 3 друзей.Рефарминг. В игре тонны способов потратить деньги. И эти деньги надо получать. Рефармингом ограблений/различных заданий. Это просто чepтoвщина. За практически 700 часов это уже осточертело.Но не смотря на минусы игра опять же стоит своих денег на 100%

review: At first I feel like voting as not recommended because of how fast you go through the storyline but then I realized this game left me wanting more. Specially more heists and more story&lt &gt world interaction. I remember playing the older GTA's and GTA's jewel of the crown has always been it's interaction and relation between the world and the storyline. In this case the story feels like it's in a completely different universe than the side quests and characters. I mean for example why bother adding the possibility to hang out with characters if it doesn't make any difference. And that's the thing. Although the story is rich with a lame ending choice side characters and the universe around it seems pretty badly explored in my opinion leaving you with just a couple of side missions and the online mode to explore after you finish the game...I'd like to say I loved the game. But this one seemed a bit detached from GTA's all time premisse of a storyline perfectly blended in a highly chaotic world you cannot escape from.

review: A Polite Review on the Online Gameplay This is completely ignoring the campaign because overall story mode is ok. However I would like to dedicate this review to the hard working polite staff of rockstar. They have created a system that really looks out for their players. Well done.Now on to the point. I believe I hit level 20 before I was flooded with modders. Most of which were kind of passive and just minded their own business. I'm against hacking and personally avoid taking any sort of short cut that would overall shorten my game time by just spawning myself cash. But those passive hackers just go around their own business and bother no one. And from what I can tell they don't even put on godmode when doing public supply missions. Unfortunately I am not writing this review in regards to the passive players. This is towards the pleasant players who destroy the fun factor of others and that the system in place that is meant to prevent such actions is completely useless. When I finally hit level 30 I am constantly killed by god mode vehicle spawning explosive ammunition wielding modders. Now the correct process would be to report them and switch server to deal with some other player who tends to have similar if not the same hacks in place. Fun. However a week later and the exact same usernames pop up to spawn camp me. Or even force money on top of me when asking them to stop. Are they banned? No.This is when the almighty banning system comes in with it's completely ridiculous algorithms that just ignores the true threats to the game. I eventually hit level 50 and grinded like crazy to max out a bunker during a massive discount weekend. Now for some reason. Banned. Fantastic. This is only a month suspension and I would have just brushed it aside as a break from a game isn't the worse thing in the world. But as to the brilliant staff behind it all after the suspension is finally lifted EVERYTHING will be reset and I will have to restart all over again. For what? playing the game by the rules?My online experience has been dreadful. And trying to discuss it to the staff directly results in hanging up copy and pasted replies that CLEARLY indicate that my issue has not even been read and/or be left to deal with an automated reply by some bot because of a subject I selected as to try and stick to guidlines. A really alround great staff.So if you have poor internet or just aren't interested in online gameplay then go ahead and get the game for the singleplayer campaign. I dare say you might enjoy it! HOWEVER If you are thinking of getting this game for online. Remove from any wishlists shopping carts and start looking for a different game with at least 90% less hackers. I understand games have hackers in them but 9 in 10 servers is an absolute joke. If i wanted to play a pc game to deal with unfair gameplay with hackers I would have brought any CoD.tl dr DO NOT BUY FOR MULTIPLAYER
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Break Down of Review (FINAL REVIEW)Story 8.7/10 (Great) Engaging and action filled. Relatable characters.Graphics 9.0/10 (Great) Decently optimized. Game looks good on ultra settings.Gameplay 9.0/10 (Great) Easy controlls. Loads of content. Easy learning curve.Overall Effect 9/10 (Great) Content filled. Great graphics. Great gameplay. Great storyplot. Action packed.Overall 8.9 (Great) Grand Theft Auto V is definately one of my favorites. From the enjoyable story plot to the activites Grand Theft Auto V demonstrates a strong effort into creating a cohesive well planned game. Grand Theft Auto Online also holds its own with new content being released frequently and modes that prevent one from getting bored. This game is also easy to mod and add extra expansions that can keep this game relevant. Overall great game!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: New Update Nope just nope. Rockstar says modding is illegal. All they cared about was making money on this game from day one. There will be NO MORE MODS. So if you're buying this on pc for mods save some money and don't bother because there won't be any.Well after continuous updates the game no longer runs on my computer. Even after a fresh install. Used to work just fine. Now though it'll crash after about 1/2 of gameplay.Update again after new graphics driver as well as insuring everything is up to date. The game is broken for me. Again they only care about not so micro transactions so their updates are for content only. Not making sure the game works. I can no longer recommend this game at all.6/21/2017I will never take this review down or review it. An attack against gaming itself shouldn't ever be forgotten. Take Two made games shaped my childhood starting on the Playstation 1. They used to make games to be fun. Not be be a money sucking leach. Oh well plenty of other publishers and game developers that really deserve my support. I will never EVER buy a Take Two and certainly not a Rockstar game again as long as i live.7/1/2017Rockstar/TakeTwo changed their mind. I haven't. They push content for multiplayer and it never comes to singleplayer without mods. Oh and there's a DLC they promised for singleplayer that still hasn't happened. OH and guess what hackers get banned. The malicious ones that make the game unplayable? Nope. Just ones that give out money. It's not worth buying unless it's $15.11/22/2017Update time. Should you get this game? NO. 1 their takedown of mods caused a severe distruption to singleplayer modding. The required scripthook is almost never available to due GTA getting an update for multiplayer that breaks the hook shortly after release. 2. If you're not a "whale" aka rich enough to buy shark cards have fun spending countless dozens of hours grinding to earn enough money to buy ANY of the most recent cars. 1.5 million GTA dollars or higher. Which to buy with real money is obscene. EA didn't get away with this pay to win BS so why is Rockstart STILL getting away with this?3/30/2018Beware shark card bonus offers that you'd not elidigble for. AKA see a bonus offer for a shark card? Have you only seen it once? Guess what it may be fake by rockstar themselves.

review: I've been big fan of the Grand Theft Auto series since GTA 3. I think this game is amazing in every way possible. When Online launched me and my friends spent countless hours doing the most random things in game together having fun making money and memories. When I seen the next gen trailer I was blown away and pre ordered the game for second time. And when it launched again I played for countless hours. When the PC version launched I couldn't play it due to me not having a PC that could run it. When I finally got my new PC GTA 5 was one of my first purchases and I was looking forward to grinding. But I was upset deep down about how Rockstar decided to make this games grind to literally be endless. Overpriced items and vehicles 30k for a mask? Really? Making money in this game is almost in possible and is way too grindy. People run around in this game with God mode No clip freezing other players Deranking other players Taking away money and generally running a muck and ruining the fun. And they don't get banned. But. If you decide to download a menu to have some fun in Single player and Invite only sessions with a couple friends instant ban. When it comes to ruining others fun it's all dandy and just fine. But having fun with a harmless menu. Unacceptable. I'm done with this game. I had my fun and this game will be dead soon.

review: Great release all things considered being a port. You are able to switch between a Xbox control if you wish for driving flying etc. Then go back to the keyboard and mouse for running on foot for shootouts. Full of Graphic settings to mess with to find the sweet spot of fps and eyecandy that you perfer. (Long shadows and mountains can eat fps with long shadows.)On a sidenote I had issues with crashes dealing with ERR_GFX_D3D_INT. (GTX 980 SC) In event viewer it will say Display driver nvlddmkm stopped responding and has succesfully recovered. I have tired reinstalling the drivers along with the game. Each of course at different times. Even lowering the factory overclock to stock did not help. After countless hours of missing out playing with friends I redid the GTA 5 ready drivers but this time only installing the driver Physx system driver. (Do not install the HD Audio that appeared to be my issue.)Dealing with the crashing it was random sometimes loading right into online or in about a hour or two. That happening in heists causes a failure for your friends and teamates. For me it left a bad taste in my mouth to let them down. Anyways enough of the QQ. Since I avoided installing the Nvidia HD audio. I was able to play around four to five and an half hours straight of online gameplay with friends.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is one of the most innovative video games at its time. The largest most ambitious world Rockstar has created with an insane amount of detail and variey from ghettos in Los Santos to hippie camps this game has it all. A campaign that lasts 30 hours with some of the most fun missions I have ever seen in any GTA and a story that really is in relation to the time the game was released (2013). Combine that with a large multitude of mechanics each perfected to the game's desires. Driving shooting flying running all work together as one. Finally there is an online mode and despite the microtransactions and hackers can be amazing when only with friends due to some of the best co op gameplay ever seen in an open world game.This game is a masterpiece. One of the best games ever made. 10/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is probably the best game of all time for me because of mods and the Rockstar editor.The online is fun... when it works. Most of the time you'll be sitting at a loading screen... just waiting and waiting.. It's horrible. There are times I've waited 10 minutes and other times where I've waited almost half an hour. It's just a huge waste of time but great when it works. There is a lot of things to do online.Story is great but not as good as GTA 4's story but still entertaining nonetheless. The open world could of used more interiors and places to go to. It's just very empty but mods exist to fix this problem. Graphics are still incredible especially maxed out but the NPC models don't look as good as the story models. They are just not as detailed. No interactivity with NPCs and environment like in GTA 4. In GTA 4 you could buy hotdogs from vendors pick up items off the ground and throw them climb and scale a lot of things etc... GTA 5 has some things to do but not as much.With all that being said I still give this game a 10/10. It's perfect for a creator like me. You can make whatever you want with the editor and with mods you can make anything..
title: Grand Theft Auto V

If you want to have a good time you'll find no problem here.Cons Long loading times (Not always but occasionally you'll get an irritatingly long loading screen) Modders The longer you play the more you'll realize how overpriced some things are (to push people into buying their shark cards) Making money is often a slow grindI like this game a lot but sometimes I get dissapointed in how they chose to design certain things like the hangars. Nontheless I will give it a thumbs up because I had tons of fun with it and will probably continue to have for some time.

review: Product received for free. &gt Let me be clear to point out the fact that I played and finished this game back in 2013 on the PS3 and that this game wholesomely receives a recommendation MOSTLY due to the singleplayer aspect alone. &lt Everyone knows this game by now so I'd rather choose to ignore discussing about singleplayer despite the fact that it's absolutely one of the most enjoyable stories I've had the pleasure to partake in as the 13 year old kid me back then and even now.ONLINEThere's a recent inflow of gamers these days where apparently people only have 30 minutes of dedicated playtime. The pricing in Online is not as horrible as people make it out to be it's just like any other game that requires you to farm to get what you want. People want things too easy these days (aka every c*nt ever that complains about how things require time and dedication). News flash bud YOU EITHER HAVE THE TIME TO PLAY OR YOU DON'T oh boi the flak I'll get for defending Rockstar's pricing.I'd say the primary issue I have with this game is that it's hard to consistently earn money if half of the time what you're doing is staring at a loading screen. Doesn't matter if you have the game installed on an SSD or HDD it just relies on connectivity but it's still f*cking awful 1 2 minute(s) just to disconnect from a mission session.First Person View gets a huge plus from me it's like playing a new game.Game is worth every penny you paid for it even just for the singleplayer alone.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Fantastic got this game as soon as it released and haven't been disappointed yet. They did start with a fair few issues where a lot of people couldn't even start the game when it came out and I had similar issues but was fixed by changing some graphics settings on my actual computer (not the settings in game).Have played this game for a long time and still love it I do play with mods so that's what made the game worthwhile for me as there is a lot you can do with mods. Everything is just beautiful with this game. I recommend the game to anyone that likes the GTA series or for the psychopaths that just want to go in and kill everyone. Also an excellent game because I can take my real life frustrations out by killing people and hooking up with hookers.10/10 IGN GameStop and whatever other gaming review industries that are out there.EDIT ROCKSTAR GOT RID OF MODS SO I NOW DO NOT CARE FOR THIS GAME. SINGLE PLAYER MODS WAS THE ONLY REASON I PLAYED IT.ONLINE MODS I UNDERSTAND BLOCKING SINGLE PLAYER NO AS IT DOES NOT EFFECT ANYONE AT ALL.***EDIT 2***Mods are now back unfortunately the steam store page has already suffered for the game but happy to say that mods are back and the game is back to normal for me congratulations to Rockstar for allowing single player mods again.

review: Rockstar might be one of my favorite gaming franchises. It never ceases to impress me with their content and their singleplayer campaigns are always fun with a little bit of dark humor mixed in. The online for me is a totally different story however. The community can be pretty toxic occasionally thats not the worst of it the money system in the online is horrible. Assuming you aren't hacking or cheating the only way to get money in game is to either spend the equivalent time youd spend in a part time job or spend a part time jobs worth of cash just to afford the shark cards in order to even scratch the surface of what GTA online has to offer. If you are just buying this game for the singleplayer then you will not be dissapointed although you may be incredibly annoyed by the wealth gap in its online mode.

review: I am playing GtaV since it was announced on xbox 360. I was shocked by the graphics because it actually was a pretty well designed game. I didn't payed attetion to the story that much because younger me though that GTA games were only cheat codes 5 stars police chases ect. I reaplay it on pc and I understand it was a lot more to it. The story is flawless the characters are very well designed. The game cauterize America on its own way. The graphics on pc are amazing! A lot of people are complaining about the price tag (60 euros in my country) even though it has been about 2 years since it was released. We pay the full price BUT we get every DLC for free! I haven't play online that much but I can safely say that you are going to have a lot of fun. The best way to play online is by having friends along but that doesn't mean that you are not going to enjoy it alone. My opinion? 10 out of 10. I have some complaints about the bushes and the trees but that cannot change my opinion for this game. I 100% suggest it!

review: I love the game but takes way to much time to make money to but he new toys so you can have fun.I spend a lot of time playing with friends and we have to play hard for hours to make 500k but a new helicopter will over 3 million and to get a facility with all the works is over 5 million but you buy a card from the shop for $100 that will get you 8 million so that's 2 maybe 3 things and you hope it's a good buy because I 3 buildings that I wish sell to get some money back but you can't because they are yours for life but I can sell all my cars if I want. The game play is great and is really fun if you get friends playing with you.The only thing we would like more is if they would make everything on the public room in invite only room because I could fill a room with friends and we all could do our on thing and not get in a room with players that call bad or players that can kill everyone on the map at the same time.Now if you are a new player it's going hard until you get some money up in the bank so I would recommend looking at some YouTube videos to guide you On the best and fastest way to make money or get some friends together and play hard on some jobs for VIP'S or CEO'S.Good luck to all and may you make a lot on bank. And most of all have fun.

review: I've played gta online for about 800h without the story mode. And this is my review. It was mostly fun mostly.. The money making methods are pretty easy now in this 9 months of playing i've maid over 100 million dollars no modded money and no t. The heists Inport Export missions contact missions VIP missons they are all fun but the MC and Bunker bussinesses are crap. They were big updates but the money method is really boring it's like they don't care about that. The steal missions are boring and long. Everytime I want to play some races adversary modes or heists I can't you maybe ask why? the reason is THE SERVERS SUCK. My internet connection is good 35mbps download and about 10mbps upload but whenever I join the lobby or try to play with my friends it just lags and says that everybody left the lobby. I've tried different kind of stuff to fix it reinstall bought a new router bought an internet cable (didn't help at all) but still over and over again. It's like they don't want you to have any fun.

review: It's still a game I want to play but the ingame credits are hard to come by and the out of game credits that would open up the new content is way overpriced.There are really cool roleplay severs but due to the player limit they're constantly busy.There's also the old holdover of being banned mid session for whatever reason Rockstar deems fit as they don't have to tell you why.As I said I want to spend money to open up the new content but it's over priced and requires "friends" very weird game world trying to be realistic and fun but failing at the most fundamental level that of having a low barrier of entry to the new content.The races are fun if you can find a group of people to race with. If you like open sandbox games buy it. If you like a strong (although OTT but this is Grand Theft Auto) story inside that sandbox buy this game.IF you enjoy online play get this game if you find it easy to make friends. If you don't find it easy to make friends make the effort and buy this game.But lets take it in stages shall we.Game mechanics sound and graphics.Robustly involving Easy to learn difficult to master comes down to practice. This can be especially important when on missions that require the control of the three characters.As in previous GTA games the mini games are an interesting diversion but that's all it really is. The tennis can be interesting but the golf is a bit annoying a lot like the real thing actually. I haven't tried the others though.Earning cash can be done but sadly only by reading tips and tricks on forums and websites. The main missions however progress enough for you to make enough cash for the important stuff. Making money can come down to exploring and taking advantage of what you see so when driving around do take a moment to keep an eye out.The scenery is absolutely amazing too.The soundtrack is as usual top notch while not all players may appreciate all the music genres that exist there is something for everyone.Pros Lots of things to do through the eyes of three protagonists each with different backgrounds you may end up actually not liking any of them though. Online play can make this a title you return to for many months or indeed years to come. It's the freedom and fun found in the original Grand Theft Auto updated for the 21st Century.Cons When you start playing a four hour session will in fact be eight or more. This is unfortunate as well as a testimony to it's greatness. The best online modes are locked until a fairly high level is reached. Online play can of course be random at best terrible at worst or if you're lucky enough to have a good group of friends a brilliant exhilarating experience.So if you're in doubt buy it or wait till the price has lowered the servers will still be active and there'll me more tips and advice to enjoy.Hopefully there will be less of an elitism but I believe it's more of a time/money/effort balance that could be addressed by Rockstar by having lower level Heists to act as an introduction to the current ones.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: i have played this game for over 1000 hours so i thought it was about high time that i wrote a review for it story mode the story mode of gta 5 is honestly pretty good because of the fact that you can explore the entire map from the beginning of the game also i think that the missions that you do show the emotional connection between the main characters (especially michael and trevor).online to be honest online sucks d*ck because of countless hackers that attack you when you are having a good time pvp'ing against other people in the last month i haven't had ONE single session that was filled with players without a hacker in it that was messing things up for others. other than the hackers i also advise against buying it if you dont have friends that play regularly because of the ENORMOUS amount of choices that you have to make and account for if you start playing GTA ONLINE. if you do have friends that play regularly and are also pretty good at the game then go ahead and buy it in sale for 30 bucks.in all honesty R* should have stopped releasing DLC after the IMPORT/EXPORT DLC because now there are sooooo many OP vehicles in the game like the Hunter helicopter Khanjali tank rocket APC Rocket bike and some other planes that got implemented in the smugglers run update not to mention the HORRIBLE explosive ammo that every noob/tryhard abuses. DON'T PLAY GTA ONLINE IF YOU WANT TO GRIND MONEY OR TO HELP SOMEONE ELSE GRIND MONEY BECAUSE THERE WILL ALWAYS BE A HACKER OR A TRYHARD IN A STARLING/HYDRA TO BLOW YOU TO BITS!so just trust my words (after all i played the game for 1000+ hours) when i say that the game isnt worth it anymore because of toxic community and constant new updates that put unbelievably expensive items in the game.just don't a concerned player.

Suddenly I got an email telling me I was suspended and all my progress was deleted. The email told me I had broken terms of service so I read the terms of service and I have never as I recall broken any of these terms. When I asked costumer service to tell me why I was suspended I got a copy paste message telling me that the terms of service must have been broken. The message came the same second as I finished writing my question. The costumer service closed the case the same second and from a costumer point of view it feels like a door slammed in my face.

review: Fun when its good an extremely frustrating tedious ing grind when its not.I've only played Online mode so i wont review singleplayer. PROS Heaps of content for your money loads of activities missions races etc. Combat Driving Pedestrians all the things that make a GTA game awesome.Character customization including weapons clothing and accessories (they cost a lot of money though).The Heists are fun and interesting the first few times the cutscenes can get annoying though.Cool and unique game modes.Free DLCCan grown weed and cook methCONS Take two tried to remove singleplayer mod support not cool they should be able to work how to stop cheaters without trying to do DCMA takedowns (or whatever its called).Loading so much loading its crazy.Some missions and heists send you driving across the entire ing map its alot of driving to do.Everything is really expensive and making money takes alot of time (mainly because of all the loading). Even clothes and jackets etc cost thousands of $$.A lack of control over the mission and setup lobbies you cant just do a bunch of setup missions and then do the heist. After EVERY setup you load back into freemode (if the lobby has got a lot of players this takes a ton of time).Missions work a little differently you can choose from a selected bunch of missions on the lobby voting screen however they took away the ability to 'replay' the last mission so you cant just grind the same mission over to make money.Some instances of cheating personally I've only seen it a handful of times i just find a new session straight away.TIPS Play with friends more friends more money making potential join a crew as well. Get the Armoured Kuruma Passive Mode use when you dont want to be killed over and over The micro SMG Go off radar Get an Apartment/Penthouse that enables you to do the Heists. you should really do your research before purchasing an apartment. Think about what you want to get out of the location and what other jobs/activites that you regularly do are nearby? Where is the nearest Helipad? Is is near the CEO/Biker office/clubhouse? What garages are nearby? Is it easy to get home if someone is chasing you? Get a place out of town When you can afford it buy a cheap garage or house out in the country the city is very chaotic lots of players have their homes there and it can be a pain to always start in the mayhem. Buy a fast aircraft When you have the money buy a fast air transport the Buzzard is a good choice any personal vehicle can almost always be called for missions and freemode. Check the websites for vehicle discounts I got the Savage attack helicopter (the Russian HIND gunship) for 1.4 million on special. Watch the minimap you should always have one eye on the minimap in freemode. Only buy a few guns And clothes etc. If you buy an item of clothing you cannot get rid of it and things can end up clogging your clothes/weapon menu. Macros If you can do it setup macros for putting on armor and changes clothes etc they are usually several menus deep. Eat Snacks Press M and go down to where it says 'action' change it to eat snack then you can press Capslock to eat and regain your health. You can spam it while in cover (press Q) or in your vehicle. Go into passive mode Before Heisting with randoms go into passive mode at the end of a setup mission or heist you all load into free mode right next to eachother! Anyone can and WILL shoot you in the back. Save your money Save save save everything costs even a gray jacket in the clothes store costs like $20 000. Sometimes its best to hold off any purchases.When its all running smoothly its a ton of fun some of the missions make you drive a long way but other than that the game is awesome. With this game you really need to be making an effort to always be making money doing missions setups/heists biker CEO jobs etc. Sure you can roam in freemode stuffing about its great fun but focus on making money and things become much better.

review: I don't recommend this game. GTA5 story mode was quite good a fair bit of content for solo players. However the reason I don't recommend this game overall is for several reasons that can be summed up with GTA online sucks balls!First off there is the player base most people are alright but the few s in this game are enough to ruin online play. You have pay to win idiots that throw some money at R* and buy the most overpowered weaponized vehicle and spend all day flying around blowing other players up for no reason other than they have a micro peen. Then there are the modders that do the same except they just use cheats. Finally the pay to win s that ruin the racing again by just buying the best car available putting the best mods on it then spend all day hosting races with rules that only benefit them and then kick players that have the nerve to beat them fair and square.Second the content. As I mentioned there is a lot of single player content easily 100 hours. However 90% of this game's content is online. If they add new vehicles guns properties missions or whatever it is online only! Online and takes many many many ing hours of grinding to buy all while the players are trolling away with their OP toys. There is no balance grinding money is no fun after a while. This game is just a huge cash cow for R* and it's only fun if you are willing to empty your bank account into R*'s pockets.Anyway... Rockstar!*Edit*Also R* seem to ban players just for associating with cheats. My friend and I were doing some heists with some randoms and suddenly my friend and the guy on his team for the mission both went offline and my friend got a message saying he had been banned for 30 days and his characters reset. My friend admittedly can be a bit of a sometimes but he is not a cheat he's being punished just for having a cheat ride in his car. Could have happened to anyone. Sort your ing out Rockstar! Ban the right people.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The gameplay is realy enjoyable and the graphics looks amazing but all the ingame content is WAY TO EXPENSIVE!!!!!First you have to play many many hours to earn the money to buy a mandatory property Than you have to play many many hours to afford a car Than you have to play many many hours to unlock upgrades Than you have to play many many hours to afford the upgrades.Or just spend a few hundred dollar/euros or whatever on shark cards cuz money just drops out off the sky in real life right?The game is still full price after 3 years sharkcards are ridiculously expensive so you would think they make enough money to turn it in to a decent game. And yet the game is still full of bugs glitches insane loading times and cheaters.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Let me just preface this with saying that this is my first GTA game I've ever played so yeah here's my review. I've put in quite a bit of time into this game and I must say it has exceeded my expectations in every way. Rockstar has put in a lot of effort into their latest AAA title and it shows. This game hosts multiple types of gameplay from racing to shooting to tennis minigames. The story is rich in action although I did find it a little boring at times overall it was amazing. This experience is further enhanced by GTA Online which brings forth a slew of multiplayer missions heists and gamemodes that significantly increase the playing time of this game. With the Rockstar team adding new things on a near weekly basis playing GTA Online never gets boring for me. I'd recommend this game for everyone.

review: For this review I am going to treat the single player and online as seperate games.The single player is one of the greatest open world videogames of all time. Los Santos is ginormas and sprawling with each distinct area perfectly flowing into the next creating the most lived in worlds of any videogame.GTA Online however is a completely different game which is utterly flawed by the in game economy. To do literally anything in the game you have to have money and lots of it. Thats fine by itself however when you factor in that you have to do hours of grinding to earn enough to afford any of the cool stuff. To make the matter even worse you can buy in game money with real world money making the game pay to win. And finally to top all that off there is the toxic community.So in conclusion buy for the single player and not for the multiplayer and you won't be disappointed.

I bought this game at full retail and I was angry at myself. But I'd like to think I got all my money's worth in the strip club.

review: Gta 5 is a good singleplayer game. Great story good action and lots of stuff to play around with. The story had me involved and I really enjoyed all the characters. Some of the scenes in the game were very well done to bring an emotion out of you and this game says alot of truth about our society but hides behind satire which is ok. It's also pretty long too if you can d other things while doing teh campaign I don't think it was a long as GTA SA but the missions have alot more life to them. You can run people over which is my favorite thing to do or you can mingle around like a normal citizen and punch people in teh face. This is a good game if you getting it for the single player. The multiplayer is what turns me off. You got two sides of the coin here first off they did an alright job of putting it together in free mode and the instance zones but it takes a big dump is its heist mode with friends. Why you ask PEER TO PEER gaming folks. Its 2015 and R* is that cheap even though they made their investment back and then some but they haven't spent any time fixing the horrible lag issues. My friends and I all live in the same area roughly and have good internets but we can't do a heist ever. It lags out and is one reason why I stopped playing the game. If you do get lucky with your buddies and have smooth gameplay and a good time well good for you but for alot of people the lag makes it unbearable. The whole online experience I have had has left a bad taste in my mouth if your just gonna screw around in free mode go ahead but you better find people who have super internets and live close by if you want to have a smooth heist experience. FIX THE LAG ROCKSTAR! #FIRSTWORLDPROBLEMS

review: Okay. So I played this game when I had an xbox 360 about two or three years ago. I upgraded my PC and recently decided to return to it but it is NOT the same game. Microtransactions were always a part of the game but back then 20$ shark card took you a long way. Now the top end vehicles in the game sell from the dealers for like 50 100$ in REAL LIFE. The value of about 1.4 million is 20$ 3.5M is about 50$ and there's another for 99$. Thing is the most awesome cars businesses flying motorcycles all of that ranges between 2.4 million 5 million dollars in game. Specifically the flying motorcycle costs about 50$ in shark cards. Do not waste money on this game unless you just wanna rob stores with friends. At best legitimate money making will take at least 4 5 hours a day to get anywhere. Forget it if you're a solo player like me as well. CEO and MC jobs REQUIRE that you have a team of other players or you are blocked from doing anything with them.

review: Well I tried. I dealt with random connection issues griefers hackers and silly design choices from rockstar. This game has some fun elements. Overall though it's not worth the money or time investment. The mediocre amount of fun I was having in GTA O during heists required a significant amount of grind to attain and the rest was pointless timewasting. The single player game was heralded to me as some fantastic mix of amazing characters but really just left me thinking that no one knows what good characters are like.Overall it's a mediocre game that you'll dump a lot of time into trying to find the fun parts before finally getting bored blowing up some personal vehicles and getting dumped into the bad sport lobby. Then you'll quit playing. If that's worth $60 to you feel free.
