review: Online JournalI haven't been out of prison even 4 hours before they approached me. All I wanted was a new heart and a new start.But that's not how this works...Even still... Somewhere in the back of my mind If you could call it that... I knew that the action was always the real juice.6 37 P.M. Tuesday"Just finishing up here." "Yes everything has been taken care of we are about 15 minutes ahead of schedule." " I'll be there in 45 minutes. Leaving now." *Beep* "All of the files have been erased including the back ups.... ?" I ask tucking my cell into my pocket with my free hand. I press my silenced pistol tighter against the back of his head as his face squeezes into the wood desk littered with coffee mugs wires and computer equipment. Admirably keeping his cool he tells me "Yes absolutely everything is wiped." *PEW!* *PEW!* $25000 1 22 A.M. Thursday It's fascinating what a garbage truck can do to a car full of columbians and 4 million dollars in coke. $75000 5 30 A.M. Sunday *Pew!* Huh... She fell funny... $50000 2 04 P.M. Wednesday Burnt down someone's home today... I completely ruined this guys life... Everything he worked for. Every paycheck stashed years of eating out of cans pinching his pennies and patching his clothes to save up for his dream in cash. I got in the car and "Send Me An Angel" was on the radio and I completely forgot about all of that for awhile. This Yoga and Power of now stuff is great for letting go of the past and enjoyig the present. That must be what those bhuddist mormon scientists in Vinewood Hills meant... $25000 10/10 Would live a hyper impulsive life like this in a cultural breeding ground for mass murderers again!

review: One thing GRINDFESTI'm a Warframe player perhaps that'll ring a bell. Ding ding yes it's more grindy than Warframe.Aside for the grind It's good. I played with some friends. Solo online? No as I mentioned above too grindy. And....toxic.In my current state I can make 1 million in about 2 4 hours of boring repetitive mission.Meanwhile I need 5 to 10 million to get thing that I want.Okay maybe that's an high end thing. Then lets talk about early game.Armored Kuruma and CEO (which is essential early) is around 900k + 1 millionWhile your ideal max income (with various mission and trick) is around 50k per half hour.Fyi those crazy sh*t race /TDM/ other mission that you saw on youtube only gives like 10 20k.TL DRGrind is okay for me while this game have grindfest worst than WF. It's okay if you play with friends. It's not okay if you play solo online.VerdictRecommended but be wary of things you heard about GTAV because most of the are right.

review: Review Edited due to Rockstar removing the Cease and Desist. Grand Theft Auto V is following the proud tradition of changing up the gameplay featuring three different playstyles along with an online which while it takes a lot of grinding can be rewarding if you have friends to play with. Franklin represents the older 3D games a character who starts from the botom and claws his way to the top lacking a litle in the character front with Lamar Davis being the most annoying side character I have had to deal with.Trevor represents the old top down GTAs which were more murder friendly rewarding you for running over groups of elvises. Micheal represents the new style of GTA someone who is near the top but is stagnating and needs that push to do the crazy Then we have online online if you have friends to play with is fun if not you have good nights where you can earn money go to car meets iwth randos and chill. Then you have bad nights where people who either just bought shark cards or hacked money are just killing the people trying to work for their content. Shark Cards haven't been adjusted since GTA O came out the max shark card is 8m which is nothing in GTA Cash so it makes them a huuge waste of money R* would need to adjust them and refund anybody who has ever bought one the difference to make them relevant again.In Summary If you have friends and the game goes on a hell of a sale get it if not I would avoid this game as its still very expensive considering its age.

review: The game was fun when you didn't need to actually purchase in game money to experience the new DLC I would have much rathered a GTA IV style with actual expansions like The Ballad of Gay Tony or The Lost and Damned. OK yeah you have to buy those but at least you can go around and use everything that came with the game without having to grind for hours on end or just purchase money also those expansions added extra single player story and that for me is a reason I play the game. Another problem is people are losing their money who have legitimately earned that money and people who actually deserve to be punished are fine. I will admit I have been banned for the use of mods (which was entirely my fault my single player mods were still on when I went onto online) which was fine I understood that. The hiest missions are pointless unless you have 3 other people who are good or else you probably have a better chance at the casino. Each mission could also be done with just 2 people as well I don't understand why it had to be 4. Why does everything need 4 people like the MC/IE/etc

review: DISCLAIMER From all of the friends I know who play this game it seems that only a few are getting crashes and similar but not as frequently. you might not experience problems and if you can avoid them the game is AMAZING you will undoubtadly (if that is how you spell it) get an endless amount of hours in this game.At first i thought that Rockstar Games was one of the best companies and I still in a way think that because of my lack of experience so take this review with a grain of salt. I always thought that 60 dollar games arent worth it however i made an exception with this game. When i heard of the amazing reviews this game had i thought why not give it a go? In the begginning I hade amazing thoughts about the game (even though the tutorial for online alone is longer than 2 hours so once you do that you wont get a refund). I was addicted to this game even though the amount of bugs i have experienced. I have been finding the usual bug here or there and that was ok but getting TEXTURE GLITCHES AND GAME CRASHES so frequently. I have done everything to fix this I have searched through forums and forums and still no fix. The cherry ontop of the cake is that after 80 hours in the game GTA Online is glitched and cant seem to fix it either and everytime i start up the game its like starting it up from scratch. Thankfully I didnt lose the game files as other people have. I have read about that and the answer that everyone got is to save their game files on their pc EVEN THOUGH there is an option to save your game files to the cloud. Theese arent all of the problems i have experienced but just a few and for a 60 dollar game it is disgraceful. However if you can avoid the problems somehow this game is a steal.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Didn't play the multiplayer yet so this is for Singelplayer only.Fantastic game. Really quite a masterpiece actually. One I won't soon forget. The story is immersive and well written and the main characters are very likable. Something that put me off the older GTA games was that we always had to have this mafia / gangster cliché going on. For once GTA isn't just about crime all the time. GTA V lets us do other stuff (which is actually relevant) in the game world. You're focused on a more realistic interpretation of a person with each of these characters getting involved in their lives and ultimately caring about their choices. I really hope we see more of Trevor Micheal and Franklin.Now for the revolutionary stuff. This game blends 3rd person with 1st person like nobodies business. You can gracefully transition between views during pretty much any time giving you unprecidented access and control over what you're doing. First person in this game is just so good and feels natural to use. You'll get to see the world in all its detail through the eyes of the characters. The game world is beautiful and feels boundless. Runs smooth as butter on the PC and didn't cook my card.A memorable moment for me from this game would be taking a breather after speeding down a highway whilst avoiding cars panning my camera up to see Michael's son dangling from yatch on a trailer also going 100 miles an hour and watching him sheepishly drop into the back of my convertible. How I pulled that one off in first person I do not know. But it was possible and it felt great.Come for the story. Stay for the sandbox.

It's baffling to me that after all this time since the game's initial release they outright refuse to admit there is anything wrong with it. They are however ironically proficient at patching exploits that may benefit players. If you do not own this game already do not get it. If you already own this game do not enable Rockstar to continue this outrageous business model by purchasing their "shark cards."

review: GTA V was the game to break the internet back in 2013 with record breaking sales. The game earned it's records too. Great Story gameplay the usual GTA humor among other things that earned it's praise. If you are thinking of buying the game for the singleplayer experience you will not be disappointed.GTA Online is a rather mixed bag for me and I'm sure majority of the community. GTA Online is the first attempt by Rockstar to create a multiplayer experience in the MMO style. Saldy that did come with MMO's cancerous microtransactions. In my opinion if you are thinking of buying GTA V for GTA Online to enjoy the game with friends (and I mean friends as in no less than 3 other mates) then you will enjoy the game. If you are flying lone wolf then... Payouts are so bad that by the time you earned enough money to enjoy one of the more expensive objects in the game you may be old enough to qualigfy for pension. A game about a sandbox world where you can murder destroy and generally make the world feel your wrath... can lose some of its fun when you are joined by up to 29 other players who have the same potential for chaos. Sandbox games and chaos have a way of mixing weirdly depending on who causes the chaos. Finally whether it was the developer or the publisher who decided a game that went for "full price" this generation and last gen have a free to play's business model has some interesting thoughts... You may feel milked for your money playing GTA Online.In short. GTA V? 10/10 Singleplayer. GTA Online... kinda like a relationship... happiest kind of torture to endure/enjoy
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Now that this game has been out for a while I wanted to redo my review. Originally I enjoyed the game and I still do. It runs well plays well and most bugs have been worked out. However if you want to get this for the multiplayer look elsewhere. R* didn't have a problem banning people for FOV fixes but even now months after release there are still true hackers ruining the game for others. You can't kill them. Not to mention that even during peak times you get grouped into lobbies with 5 10 people. RediculousAnd now with what is probably the worst sales tactic I've ever seen. They bring the game to sale for 30$ for 2 hours. Those lucky to spam refresh on the store page got a great deal. Everybody else is getting royally shafted. The base game as well as a 5+ year old game that's normally on sale for less than 10$ and a 20$ in game cash card are now bundled together for the Low LOW price of.... 59.99 The same it was BEFORE it went on sale.So if you want to pay a premium for an old game the base game which is almost 2 years old mind you and i'm guessing less than 500k Multiplayer money then go buy this game. you Rockstar

review: Category Details Rating Graphics GTA V's graphics still hold up to be some of the best graphics of today even for a 5 year old game. Mods enhance this even further 9/10 Preformance Preformance is great! Game is very optimized. However the servers do seem to be an issue as people are frequently kicked into solo sessions and various other issues. 8/10 Gameplay Gameplay is great especially content wise there is so much to do. But after a while things to get repetitive in online. Movement is a bit weird and clunky but I can look past that. 9/10 Community/Developers The only problem with the community is the people that treat GTA Online like it's one big Team Deathmatch. The developers and Rockstar in general are doing terrible with this game. The in game economy is f*cked and there are hackers and modders everywhere. Rockstar never seems to add what the community asks for but rather pushes out DLC with overly expensive vehicles and clothing every so often. 6/10 Story/Singleplayer The story mode is one of the best stories I have ever played I think I've done it over 10 different times at this point across two different platforms. It is also fun to just have fun d*cking around in singleplayer and do whatever you want. And you can have mods to enhance the experience. 9.5/10 Overall Grade 9/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: EDIT Changing this review because I wouldn't recommend this game anymore. If you a casual player and want to buy the last releases in online mode forget it. You will probably have to grind for weeks in order to buy the most expensive car in the game or... buy a shark card and that's exactly what Rockstar wants you to do. If you are like me someone that study full time or work you will feel as frustrated as I do when they release new content in online.It's an amazing game no doubts about it. It's huge the story mode is very funny with very distinct characters. The online mode is very funny to play with friends get some money buy new stuff and plant the chaos around Los Santos. One con is the amount of hackers every day I always find one or two and they teleport are invincible drop money (what sucks the game's economy) and disrupt your gameplay. Despite this I recommend buying this game.

I would have to launch the game 4 times for it work. Sometimes it will say "loading single player" and will continue to say that forever and wont start. Now the update that made me write this review made my game stutter so ing bad. I have tried everything. The stuttering gets so bad that it gives me a headache or makes me sea sick. I know for a fact I can run it as I did so in the first 2 weeks (high settings too) but I've waited way to long for an update and I'm happy to say that I give up on this game and accept the fact that I wasted 60$.10/10Edit Suprise! The update didn't fix anything for me. I'm tired of trying.

review: I'll try my hardest to sum up what Grand Theft Auto V is without skipping the important comments so I'll split this review into 2 parts first one will cover GTA V second one will cover GTA Online .Grand Theft Auto might easily be one of the best games I've ever played / seen ever (Including Red Dead Redemption).It's story isn't that great I personally didn't feel attached to the characters but it was good enough since the gameplay is perfect . The gameplay is just amazing makes up for whatever thing you disliked in the game in genral . It's simply fun .Grand Theft Auto Online is a whole other story it used to be so good but it had to be ruined .As you all may know the servers of this game are horrible . Take a look for yourself this is an actual 100% legit image of the GTA Online servers (since links are removed google search "potato with wires"...) . It will take you around 2 6 minutes to join a session and there is a fairly high chance you will disconnect which is so annoying at times .The next extremely annoying "feature" is the super expensive cars . It's not annoying that it's expensive what's annoying is that if you try to play heists or missions 1 of 2 things will happen 1 You will disconnect because of the server . 2 You will get the worst teammates ever . Believe it from someone who knows how hard this is I grinded for 3 days trying to get 10 Million Dollars so I can get my yacht . It could've ended in a day if it wasn't for these stupid servers and stupid level 4 players who don't know how to open a parachute .If Rockstart could just fix their servers this game would be great . Believe me it would be the best game ever they got everything right but they had to ruin it . Preformance wise this game is great gameplay wise it's the best . Online wise ....

review: Breathing In The Life of San Andreas Some games are picked up played by a gamer and then they are laid down left to dust. Other games are picked up admired by the audience from the trailers and like a good episode of Game of Thrones the audience will automatically know that this will be "the one". Or in GTA V's case the "Big One". As you play the game you can't help but notice the small minute details that Rockstar puts in the cariacture to present San Andreas as it is an actual real breathing place. This is the first game which really showcased that. Sure there was Sim City but that was a city simulation game. This is an open world game and while you may argue that Skyrim or Fallout New Vegas were good games which I admit they are this game is the first one that started to blur a scripted game to reality.You can see it in the AI. Take for example the cars that people drive down the roads of Blaine County &amp Los Santos. Each one is wearing some different each one drives a different car depending on the area where they live in each one has a seperate gender &amp race which doesn't make it feel like it's an illusion of generated cars &amp vehicles that are set to spawn in certain locations as you drive by which applies to most vehicles that naturally spawn. Then there's the fact that they always seem to be there never popping in like God himself placed the car with the people in there.One of the other areas you can see it in the game is the interactions between the characters. Take the characteristics of Michael for example. He has a surely defined storyline within the game's main storyline itself. All the characters in this game seem to work together 'in harmony" minus that French yogi &amp that accursed tennis coach! The small viligant villans will try to ruin your character while the rich will as well. The good thing is you will always have a "little help from my friends" which is a real good thing! One of the other things that you won't ever forget is how much depth that goes within the storyline and the famous quotes that come from the game. Overall it's a splendid singleplayer experience.Then there's the multiplayer which is always evolving and changing. There's a variety of different tasks for you to take on whether it's managing your Motorcycle Club or partying on the Yatch having fun with the ladies. Whatever your most inner heart desires are just remember one thing from this review DO and I repeat DO NOT let the money rain on you! Report it as fast as you can and you will be saved from spending another $60 dollars plus the Shark Cards you buy.One last thing Fire rockets at Michael's house. He will really appreciate it. Personally he should upgrade to the crib that Franklin owns OR BETTER YET buy a trailer out in the Grand Senora Desert! Trevor will really appreciate being neighbors with you. You can deal drugs like it's hasta manana!

review: This is a great game I have this on Xbox and Playstation and had to get it for PC the campaign is a great game with in depth story where is character has a different background and story which makes it fun with the character they develop to be. The heists are a great addition to the game which makes the planning fun along with medals for each mission and side quest to challenge you for 100%. Online is hit and miss it is best to play with friends as there are people who are a higher level who attack every player or hacks which ruin the online experience. The only safe passage around this is passive mode which means you cannot do much and restricts you to so much. The online game is a grind to earn money through missions like heists races and different modes which makes the game enjoyable. R* need to look into the hacking of the online game and ban them but overall it is an enjoyable game.

(Bad Sport.)Modders that can circumvent passive mode by attaching a live campfire on your nuts and roast them like christmas.Modders that can lock your character set you to near perma rag doll mode and knock you around like some malevolent child god throwing a temper tantrum.Modders Now I JUST learned... can send vanilla players straight to Bad Sport lobbies because they seem to have finally found all the values between mental health status that can turn you psycho at will (you give players more RP when you're killed) and actual bad sport points which means for the average player you're going to be in bad sport lobbies regardless of your actual playstyle. which makes both useless.Let me explain why this is so ing &amp quot licking is so hype" rediculous and plain lies.IN normal lobbies people can report bad players. In Bad sport lobbies? Yeah it's ing nothing. There is no limit to the stupid. So lemme get this straight... Modding which was mostly new rendering new textures and sound effects Glowies shinies and a new coat of paint for extention of life. Not mechanics not how the game worked and for the most part was already incompatible with online because of the consistant patches.The biggest t is how they want you to spend your money $99 for 8 mill.It's a nice chunk of change.Here is the problem any amount of modded menus in the game makes anything rockstar offers as good as whale crap as long as modders can still spawn in whatever. The Nike' of the Modding menu world will not engage if it will be potentially detected will send you a update prompt ... do the download itself AND literally shows you it's new features.The amount of money needed for this game is huge a mod menu will cost anywhere from $20 $50 tops.I'm not saying get them.I'm saying... don't smell right.As far as R* is concerned. title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game was really ahead of its time when it came out first bought it for xbox 360 then xbox one then PC. I have almost 1000 hours logged into just having it on PC alone. The driving physics are very good the cars and trucks are customizable and have wide variety the combat like gunfights and melee are great weapons customizable map is desently big first person mode is great in driving and combat with good variety of terrain AI are great physics are pretty good though unrealistic but mostly in a good way graphics are awsome variety of gameplay.. All the makings of a good game.I beat the story mode at least 4 times and had a good time doing it the single player mode has countless hours of fun in it. But in order to gain access to about 75% of the other features in the game and play with friends one has to venture to online/multiplayer. Multiplayer was great you could go into lobbies with deathmatches races or complete hesits or jobs with your friends. You can buy houses and store custom cars buy planes at airports you can even start businesses and hire your friend's help with them.Over the years however this game has gone very sour and makes me sick as far as the online world goes i'll try to explain why.This is where my review gets negative. So currently you get into online freemode/freeroam and you can expect this a 30 person lobby consisting one or more of Higher level players obliterating you every chance they get with not only weapons but also players in tanks blowing you up constantly or some guy repeatedly running you over in an armored truck with no chance of you getting up or people in fighter jets spawnkilling you on the ground or in the air. Then theres already or eventually 2 or more hackers blowing up you (and everyone else in the lobby) and killing you every 5 seconds.Somehow with all of this going on you need to make money in the game and lots of it every feature in the game is now mad expensive. Even if have the best means to make money (like the best businesses) and even you are a high level player and even if you have a few friends helping you it takes about 3 hours to gain $1million and thats chump change in this game! There are cars that cost $3mil just for reference. AND theres still some guy in a jet that can decimate you and whatever youve worked for the past 4 hours in about 5 seconds with a cannon blast. I no joke had $3mil worth of stuff (back when money was harder to make I spent a month accumulating that stuff). I was shipping it in a plane to a drop off to make the money and some guy in a jet blew up the plane and i lost every cent of that $3mil in about 5 seconds! No refund!The twisted part is they give players money for destroying other players trying to make money in the game so yea GUESS WHAT EVERONE IN THE GAME IS TRYING TO DO WHEN YOURE TRYING TO MAKE MONEY. OH THEN THERES HACKERS WHO FREEZE YOU THEN BLOW YOU UP AND THEYRE INVICIBLE GOOD LUCK MAKING MONEY!Rockstar seems to only make a concious effort to ban the hackers when theyre doing harmless things like giving other players money. But if somenone in a levetating tank thats invincible kills you everytime you spawn thats perfectly fine. Rockstar only cares when you find a way past buying their in game currency other than that they dont care. OH SO THEN YOU HOP LOBBIES? THE NEXT LOBBY IS EXACTLY THE SAME! If they just spererated violent and nonviolent players based on kills and removed hackers the game would be enjoyable but they dont.Now I will describe the other lobbies other than freeroam/mode. So theres other game modes like race or deathmatch or cool team objective based missions or you can even do small missions that arent in free mode and they give you money BUT NOT NEARLY ENOUGH! Even if you do the highest paying job its like $20k payout and takes more than 10mins to do and thats if your really good. $40k an hour with all the loading screens. $1mil is chump change $40k is less that nothing when youre trying to buy a $3mil business in freemode.You can also play any of the other hundereds of game modes they have but guess what NO ONE IS PLAYING THEM. Part of the problem with this is 1. They dont pay enough for people to actually want to do them2. The game uses a player hosted lobby system so what ends up happening is there are 1000 hosts and only like 10 players willing to join someone else's game. I waited no joke 30 minutes to get 4 players to start a deathmatch map with me. Abysmal. AND THERES STILL PLENTY OF HACKERS WHO ARE INVINCIBLE IN THESE GAMES. If they just made a public server for every game mode that everyone can pile into you might actually get a good amount of players per lobby and again ban the hackers they might be cool but they dont do that.Now you can play races which people actually play and you might join a decent 10 person race if youre lucky but lemme tell ya the races in this game are pretty rage enducing. For one everyone is banging into each and spinning each other out the whole time but thats not what bothers me. What bother me is these devious features that are on by default 1. Catchup which makes your car slower if your in first to give everyone else who is bad a chance to catch up to you and either mess with you or pass you usually both2. Slipstream if anyone is directly behind you they get an ungodly speed boost and just ram you in the rear. They do this repeatedly until they pass you or make you spin out. BOTH OF THESE ARE ON BY DEFAULT AND MAKE RACING SOOOOO MUCH FUN!!! AAAAAH!!!Now you can host a race and configure the options to have both of these off but we all know how long it takes to find enough players to do anything. Plan on about 10mins.My other gripes with racing is how you can only race vehicles of the same "class" and how some vehicles of a class are rediculously underpowered compared to others. For instance there are cool offorad races but if you dont choose a dirtbike no matter how fast and upgraded your offroad dunebuggy is you will lose to the stock dirtbike 100% of the time. If they just made racing normal more customizable as far as what vehicle you could or couldn't use and took the stupid rage enducing features out of the races they might actually be fun but they dont.The only truly non broken good feature of the game is heists which is probably what 50% of the people in the game are doing. But either get some good freinds or a few competent players otherwise theyll take forever. Theres one heist that can give you about $1mil per 1.5 hours (if you fly through it and the cuts are split evenly). Sadly theres only like 5 heists so they get old pretty quick.WELL THATS IT THATS ALL THE FEATURES OF THE GAME IN ONLINE YOU NEED A BILLION DOLLARS TO BUY ANYTHING AND THERES NO GOOD WAY OF MAKING MONEY EVEN IF YOURE A HIGH LEVEL PLAYER JUST CAVE IN AND BUY $500 WORTH OF IN GAME CURRENCY LIKE ROCKSTAR WANTS YOU TO DO MMMMKAY? I say either you become a hermit playing single player or just embrace the chaos of multiplayer with no aspirations of progressing in the game. This game could be better though and im very very very salty. Its gotten to the point where i want to hack the game just to combat all the hackers to make money in the game IT SHOULDNT BE LIKE THAT. Oh and I havent played recently but apparetly Rockstar messed up and their game is banning players who are following the rules. So there ya go they ban regular players but not actual hackers. "AH TH EAH TH EAH THEEAA UH THAT'S ALL FOLKS!"

A multiplayer OF multiplayer games with great Heist missions console players waited what felt like ages for and a online freemode that can keep any bored gamer happy for hours on end. I recommend this game blindfolded as to the new additions to the gameplay and visuals. If you have a masterful PC and a 4K monitor all the better. Do yourself a favor and purchase this game.

review: If you like this series then this game is a must have. I think it is the best GTA yet. I bought it for the single player campaign. The characters are amazing in detail and I grew to love them. The script is great and funny. Graphics and sound are top notch here and it plays well in ultra widescreen 21 9. The cut scenes are still just widescreen though so youll have black boxes on the side for that.I used keyboard to play most of it but went to my xbox controller to fly aircraft. Controls are all good. I highly recommend this game. I got 61 hours play time out of it and I think I only did the online multiplayer for maybe 4 hours tops. The multiplayer is on the same great map just that you have other players with you and there are new missions you can do co op or just battle against others. The multiplayer still seems active because when I logged in there were always at least 5 other players on the map.

review: Some strapped on PC code to tote along a mixed style mess.First off you have to create a Social Account which means giving up your email address a potentially good password and some other information in order to play a the game in single player. After you create the account you have to go to rockstar's website and turn off a ton of email spam waiting to happen. Like I care whether some webstie tracks my single player stats. Save this garbage for IF I play the game long enough to go online.Just using the menu system is sluggish. The mouse moves really slow the menus draw like something out of DOS. ESC plops you on a social menu of some sort with a bunch of obscure keys that one does lead to a system menu. Since the game started in windowed mode for some random reason that was the first thing to change. I noted all the settings didn't indicate whether they were max or not at a glance. What game doesn't do this out of the box? You can do global "max" settings and then adjust as needed.Next you go through some pretty boring tutorial mission go here do this use your phone etc. For once I'll say STEAL SR3's control sceme fast efficient and doesn't involve wacking keys that in every other game actually do what one wants to do crouch isn't where crouch normally is prone isn't where prone normally is. If you don't do what the AI tells you it nags at you. Initally after a few nags the AI took over and did the task. So I did what anyone would do went over and surfed the web watched some video and hoped the tutorial would move itself along.After about 10 15 minutes I switched back over and the AI was still yelling at me to do something. So the first time was a freak incident. As there was no other options available I drugded along another lame tutorial. Which led me to the first beef I have super twitch wasd controls in vehicles. W and D are either not being pressed or turning the car 100% left or right. So one either wears out the keyboard trying to drive efficiently (think old school Galga) or smacking into everything. SR3 didn't have this issue.So you do the robery tutorial and think that is it for tutorials but noooo you get plopped into a car theft activity get in a car follow some AI through the streets that instantly loses you if you go through a shortcut and then get chased by the police in a confusing how do I escape the police activity.So the blue/red flashing dots are police but if I don't see any on the map how can they still be chasing me? How about since your wasting my time on something I could care less about while listening to some really crappy rap music there was no tutorial on how to change the game give a tutorial on what this whole cop chase thing is? So after some driving around smacking into cop cars that magically appear in front of me (Scotty stop beaming in cop cars 50' away from me ok?) I avoided them dropped off the car watch some bad acting and then have to get into a car and drive.At this point all I can think of is after 4 games why Rockstar hasn't figured out how to implement a custom main character just like SR3 has been doing since SR1? Why are you wasting my time in a character I can not invest in but dragging me through the chains of stagnation to do it? C'mon it's 2015 where is my custom character at?And I quit playing after realizing things wouldn't get much more interesting... waste o money. Save yours and wait until it hits $10 around xmas.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: *EDIT 30/07/18Glad to see Rockstar over turn the decision made by Take Two to ban single player modding. Its a step in a positive direction.However it is but a single act of good. GTAV is still left completely ignored in the wake of the cash cow that is GTAO. A cash cow that is becoming increasingly sour with unjustifiable ingame item costs to tempt players into purchasing microtransactions.GTAV is a good game. Its truly tragic that is has to be lumped together with GTAO a festering wart on the face of an otherwise decent experience. Had the games been seperated GTAV would be remembered as a true classic. Instead it will be remembered as fathering (among others) the 'games as service' model.If you've gone this long without buying it you can live without it. But if you must do not go online.OLD REVIEW Avoid at all costs. Same goes for all other Take Two Interactive products.They've made modding singleplayer illegal just to force people into the GTA Online mode which is complete garbage.

review: Pretty amazing really. The shear attention to detail is incredible. Call me weird but the only reason I purchased this game was because of the mods that the community have created especially LSPDFR. Unfortunately the game updates break most of the mods for a time until the mod authors can catch up. I understand the game developers can't base all of their decisions on whether or not it breaks a mod however it is a little frustrating to finally get everything working with mods only to have an update break everything. For me personally I've never really been into the thug life but have enjoyed the GTA games for many years and they just keep getting better and better. I can imagine how cool GTA 6 will be but I know it's gonna be something amazing.UPDATE I will not support a game that does not allow modding like LSPDFR. The recent decision to shut down OPEN IV is heavy handed and un necessary.UPDATE 2 Take Two has bowed to public pressure and recinded their ban. I once again can recommend.

review: Graphical Things First of all let me just say this game is ASTOUNDING. I only have a GTX 1050 in my rig but it still runs surprisingly smooth. I have almost every little "extra" graphical feature enabled and it takes up about 3 and a half GBs of VRAM. (I have 4GB by the way.) I run the game on high to very high settings and I get an average of 55 60 fps.Storyline Hands down BEST storyline EVER! I may only have 23.2 hrs on record but I've beat the game 4 times on my PS3 and know the entire storyline by heart. My only problem is... (this is a spoiler by the way so be prepped.) When Wade finds Michael it's so fast. There should be a real mission toward it rather than Wade just out of the blue saying he found Michael De Santa. Even further when Trevor pops into Michael's house for the first time Michael doesn't even question it. Like... what the actual Rockstar? Is that how lazy you were when making this game?! Aside from that the storyline is really good. It would be cool if we could go visit Brad ocassionally but... y'know... things aren't always the way you want 'em to be.Audio Ehhhhh. Pretty okay. I guess it sounds nice and they have nice sound effects but I have Dolby 7.1 surround sound in my Corsair headset and Jesus Christ... it sounds like you're trapped in a box. This may just be a problem with Dolby branded surround sound but it's so bad that I had to disable surround sound just to make it sound okay. Even then I didn't get that nice feeling of being in the middle of LS. So I've been using my speakers instead.Online One word GARBAGE. The community is SO toxic. You can't even drive around to check out the view without someone blowing your damn car up! Oh yeah. There goes 100k right down the drain! Haha! Another bad thing You get banned for NO reason. It hasn't happened to me but I've heard MANY stories and I've seen it happen first hand. My friend Joseph was driving through Vinewood Hills and jumped out of his car right? Get this... he glitched a little bit into the map and BAM! There he goes! Banned!Overall Not worth $60. However if you enjoy incredible graphics consistent framerates and amazing storylines then I'd say wait until it's on sale. I bought it during the Steam Summer Sale for only $20. Now THAT is worth it. The most I'd pay is $40 for this game. Do NOT pay full price because it's often on sale.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Who is it for Everyone but Kids. Casual Players Pro Players. Story It's all about the BIG SCORE. Graphics Astonishing graphics for an open world game. Sounds Game sounds are good with good soundtracks. Difficulty Meadium/Easy Easy to learn Hard to Master. Value for money / How Long to Beat Very good value for money endless game and fun even more with mods. Game Development Frequent updates a lot of content released FOR FREE the downside is that new content is for multiplayer only unless using mod in SP to unlock it. Single Player Score 9/10 Perfect game too bad R* forgot about singleplayer otherwise would be a 10. Multiplayer Score 8.5/10 Multiplayer lacks some optimization demanding more resources from computer causing some low fps sometimes has a BIG variety of jobs to do. Overall Score 9/10 Almost perfect game at beginning devs didn't wand a car with shooting guns now they shoot rockets fly and even go underwater. They could add more features to the game like a working casino add something new in singleplayer.

review: Single player is OK but the overhyped multiplayer is an extreme letdown. Most of the time you are just stuck in loading screens and often after playing a minigame inside the multiplayer you end up in a different lobby than your friends in the regular multiplayer even though you joined the minigame together from the same lobby. To join your friend you must sit through another loading screen only to fail many of the times.GTA V should have been what San Andreas couldn't because of the technical limitations of it's time yet GTA V is a step back. Surprisingly the possibilities are limited in GTA V compared to San Andreas even though it should have been the other way round.With the singler player you get the familiar GTA gameplay and story type but in reality most of the reason that there are many hours of gameplay in single player is because you spent a lot of time driving rambling NPCs around.Rockstar really hyped the multiplayer gameplay but its a massive letdown. Only very limited gameplay options and a very limited selection of vehicles. The biggest problem is that you are painfully aware of the potential possibilities for fun but Rockstar has chosen to implement so many abitrary limitations.Also why the hell does Rockstar hate mods so much?

review: Not reccomended if you have no friends with the game. Either wait for it to go on sale or don't get it at all. The campaign was fun but I'd be lying if I said there was more than 40 hours of single player activities. Unless you like those busywork collect em all mindless frustrating tasks they seem to fill games with to get an inflated playtime stat. I honestly prefer Watch_Dogs and this game is better in every way. I hated the helicopter missions the yoga mission the mission after the yoga mission and the far too sparse checkpoints. You or one of the other two characters died or you "spooked" somebody? Have fun starting over probably from the beginning. Then the crashes. First any menu I went in was choppy as then the game started crashing constantly for seemingly no reason. This game has crashed on me more times than there are missions in the main story. However this might not happen to you.Tl dr not worth $60 especially if you are going to play by yourself. Prepare for dissapointment.Edit after a second playthrough I can re attest to all of the points above except for the crashes. And I prefer the 'parkour' and cover systems in watch dogs way better but the driving is second to none.Edit 2 Apparently you can nullify the menu stuttering by locking the game to 60fps using an external program (Nvidia Inspector in my case) this shouldn't be necessary in a AAA title over 4 years old

review: This game is good. Real good. Any GTA fan should def pick this up. If you're not a GTA fan you should still pick this up. There is so much to this game I'll only cover a few pointsIt has first person mode you can play it the whole game. There is GTA ONLINE which is basically an MMO GTA style.The open world map is huge!You play as three different characters throughout the whole game there are only a few times when you have to play as a certain character but most of the time you can choose which one you want to play. Each character has different missions which progress the game so you can play one mission while the other missions get passed up giving this game great replay value when you play again as a different character and have different missions and perspective of the story.There is 3 different endings which you choose at the end. Once again giving it great replay value.The main story is only about 60% of the total game. Everything else is side missions and such.The gameplay mechanics and graphics are superb.This game introduces a new kind of mission to the GTA series called heists you and a crew you choose do heists to gain large amounts of cash. This is a 3 or 4 part mission. Ultimatley you choose how to do the heist which changes the mission once again adding more replay value to the game. The citizens of Los Santos are randomly generated and walk around or drive like a normal city would. You will witness car chases accidents and people committing crimes. The police are more realistic they will attempt to stop you if you are caught speeding they will respond to citizens calling them when they witness you doing something illegal. They are also more challenging to shake off compared to other GTA games. Other drivers in the game will respond if you are an . If you stop behind someone and harrass them by honking if you crash into them or flip them off there is a chance they will become hostile. Some citizens carry guns and will start shooting at you if you start injuring or killing people. THere is so much more to this game that I haven't mentioned Overall I give this game 10/10 Toast for Twenty's
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Initially i recommended this game but now i don't. The only fun to be had in this game now lies in its singleplayer as it is effectively the only safe place where you can expierience everything the game has to offer without the new trash and community. please dont buy this game for multiplayer it is not a fun expierience.Singleplayer Works fluidly within its world. The missions are interesting. Its a sandbox so you can do quite alot even once the game is finished. Includes some memorable moments and has great replay value thanks to its design. Small easter eggs and other interesting things are scattered around the place and reward you with cool things. The mod community keeps getting better and make this game look like it was released this year with these mods you wont be able to access online but imo thats a great tradeoff no paywalls no griefers just whatever you want to add to your game.Shame we never got that single player expansion hey R*. They have stopped adding the GTA O vehicles to singleplayer with the newest updates so all the cool cars and so on are not available here just keep that in mind. The trailers are deceptive like that. Mods might be able to help remove this change however.Multiplayer This is 5's worst aspect. The game revolves around the same premise as single player. A large open map in which missions and activities take place. Sounds great but on paper it doesnt work. Atleast not anymore. The free roam update after update is becoming a battle royale where everybody loses. Grinding previously was done in heists and missions so you could afford that sweet $1m car (Keep this price in mind). With the newest additions to freemode Rockstar have been merging the missions you grind and the freeroam in one. For players actually trying to play the game and work towards that juicy $5 10mil (Yes it can cost over 10 million for a single vehicle) flying motorcycle or $10m plane good luck. The community here will not help. These missions are encouraged to be griefed by the developers. What do i mean? If you start a mission and need to kill 3 NCPs rockstar will tell ALL 20+ other players to protect these NCP's to earn $ AND RP. The method by which they do so is up to them however whichever way they choose will almost always result in your death. Pick your poison. This means freeroam lobbies turn into witchhunts for whoever tries to deliver a parcel to X to a destination. The sandbox element doesnt help ironically. With each update they add more ways to kill you and less ways for you to defend yourself once you start trying to sell business's product you will understand what side the sandbox truly favours (and guess what it doesnt favour you earning $$$). With every update comes something more rediculous they can kill you with. Initially it was an armoured (fully bulletproof) car that caused a stir then it was a jet that had explosive cannons and now after a few updates there is Flying Cars with Homing missles and machine guns Flying motorcycles and now standard cars with missles and VTO capabilities that will make the jets jealous. To keepup with the ingame $inflation you will need to use businesses if not then prepare to invest 500 days grinding contact missions. This choice of forcing you to use businesses was done intentionally to force players into freeroam lobbies (the only difference here is it isnt just ai's trying to destroy your hard work). The nice people are what make this game tolerable but like i said with 20+ people in a single lobby it still wont matter. Inflation in both prices and toxicity are on the rise and depending on the next update it is likely to increase further. So what does this boil down to? If you are a newer player or even a solo player this game IS NOT for you. All the "fun" activites will need multiple people heists using the sandbox to its fullest and actually trying to earn your way to what you want will require people. The game will not let you do it alone even the things that you can do alone the game will actively seek to get you killed by every single player in that lobby. If your new prepare to get destroyed by everyone and everything. If you are a veteran well you already know the deal. Its either kill or be killed and survival of the fittest (which almost directly depends on who is richer. level and hours mean nothing here. Its whoever owns the newest vehicles.) This game does nothing to reward players that invest time into aiming perfecting your jet skills or even just helping a friend. You will recieve recieve virtually no benefit. As R* themselves put it Cash is king in this town. Solve your money problem and help get what you want across Los Santos and Blaine County with the occasional purchase of cash packs for Grand Theft Auto Online. Either you will be blownup by a bombing run cheesed by an invisible (off the radar) motorbike or someone will sell their soul to R* for 500 750mil just to have you killed by something you cannot avoid the beloved orbital cannon. Final Note I have been playing this game for a very long time before all this crazy stuff started getting added. Unless you wish to play in Public Lobby's by yourself. i highly recommend you to not buy the game. The price may be cheap they may offer a specific bundle which seems like a good deal but it isnt. The business's are grind fests and guarantee you nothing but hardwork (countless hours depending on your circumstances) and it can be destroyed in seconds. Rockstar are not generous they are not giving you a good deal. You can lookup why... theres too much to add. All in all the community that has been SHAPED by the devs is whats slowly killing this game thats the saddest part and its only just getting started.

review: This game might be fun sure. I'd recommend purchasing it. The story is probably worth the 30 dollars. But be aware as soon as you want to download mods this game goes from fun to ing hectic and annoying. There is no actual easy way to download mods you have to download .zip files and copy paste into the game folder. You can choose between playing online and having no mods or playing singleplayer and having mods. That's it. What I'd give to get back the hours I've slaved away trying to get GTA V running smoothly again most of them waiting for the damn game to re install. And I don't even have that many mods I have three. If you make one wrong move the mods up and break the game until you delete them or delete and re install GTA V. Rockstar sucks at making GTA V compatible with mods. And that's the long and short of it.

review: I have never experienced a more horrible game upon release. Even after waiting two years after the original console release Rockstar still can't get it right. I have been waiting for over 10 minutes for the story line to start (still waiting) just to see if those horrible graphics glitches (clipping) have been solved. Admittedly I do not have a state of the art system anymore but still one that is well within the boundaries of the demanded specs. I know the game can run fluently on my system with pretty high settings I experienced it in one session. The rest is just one awful experience. I am going to wait two more weeks for patches to fix these problems. If not I will demand my money back.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: About 80 90 hours of game play that includes missions heists car jackings parachuting driving flying bicyling and of course shooting during all of that. Customize your vehicle and personal appearance. This game is longer than Fallout 3 and filled with adrenaline pumping missions that will leave you craving for more by the end of the game. Even after the story mode ends you can still finish all side quests and other missions. The story mode does end but the single player campaign will last you for as long as you want after the story mode completes. It's not particularly one of the best games I've ever played but it definitely gives you the value of your purchase in hours played from the $60 debut price tag. Worth $60? Yes. It's only 1 of two games that I think have ever actually been worth that price. The other being Fallout 3 w/all DLC's.

review: This game is beautiful. The graphics are sweet and the gameplay is fun and engaging. But this game has some SERIOUS flaws that make it almost unbearable. I want it to be a good game so bad but there are so many problems 1. I HAVE TO run the game under my Administrator account as Administrator. It won't work on my domain profile which is REALLY irritating. 2. The game takes FOREVER to load. I actually wrote this entire review (the whole thing) while waiting for story mode to load (update at end of review it's still loading). It doesn't matter if it's multiplayer online or story but I get MINUTES of waittime to do anything load a local story mission load in game switch online sessions etc. I have a RAID 10 of SSDs and am ALWAYS the first to load in maps in CS GO so the slow load is something very unfamiliar to me.3. I'm stuck in story mode. To not give away anything there's a mission where you have to dive off a pier and swim. Well it doesn't tell you how to swim. Or swim up. So I drown. Over. And over. And over. I still don't know how to swim up. It doesn't say in the controls and google only comes up with console answers. 4. The menus are confusing. There's like a billion. And you HAVE TO use R*'s social serice you can't use Steam friends. 5. It likes to randomly dump you from online to story after a mission involving 10+ minutes of loading. There is so much more but just writing this is making me angry. I'm going to go pour a scotch and keep on waiting for my session to load......

review: GRAND THEFT AUTO V ONLINE is an excellent game when it works unfortunately it has several serious flaws (hence no recommendation from me).I bought this for its ONLINE content exclusively I did not care for the single player campaign and spent only the time necessary to unlock the online content playing sp (the tutorial) so this review is strictly a review for GTA ONLINE not the single player version and not the game in whole.First off GTA ONLINE's co op is fun probably the most I've ever had in any multiplayer co op game. The game world is huge and immersive and the possiblities simply amazing.Unfortunately there are some serious flaws that seriously screw up the gameplay experience 1. Connectivity issues (and no it's not my internet ALL other internet games work perfectly). Network connection is frequently lost and you are tossed into single player mode and have to load Online mode again (takes several minutes). This often happens when loading co op missions and you basically let the other players down. Also nice when you finished a job and it happens right before payout time. Thanks for nothing.2. Modders. GTAonline has a big modder community and the regulation of cheaters is practically non existent. Other players that are over powered and can play in "God Mode" can easily target new and weak players. Rockstar games also made it easy on themselves reporting cheaters comes with a dire warning report at your own risk wrongly report players might result in termination of your account. Well how about you guys DO YOUR JOB ROCKSTAR GAMES????3. Kicking out players from sessions. So I got target by a group of 3 bullies. I retaliated which made them angry so bully 1 decides to use the "kick player" option on me. Bully 2 + 3 do the same and you're gone. "The other players kicked you from this session". But good luck trying to kick a modder from a session. Very unbalanced here.There are also micro transactions in GTAo but I will not criticize these because they are optional and not required to progress. The only problem is that progress is slow. WARNING! Money is hard to come by on your own CO OP IS MANDATORY IF YOU WISH TO PLAY GTA ONLINE PROPERLY. DO NOT BUY GTA V ONLINE SIMPLY FOR SINGLE PLAYER ONLINE UNLESS YOU ARE WILLING TO KEEP POURING MONEY INTO MICRO TRANSACTIONS!With this said I personally LOVE GTA ONLINE but point 1 3 can be truly frustrating.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I'm trying to be as short as possible but I also want to go through many things in this review.First I'm going to talk about the Story Mode then later Online.Story Mode I enjoyed the story a lot. It's full of action and there are a lot of stuff to explore.I played GTA V first on last gen so it has been quite a while ago. Back then when it came out on PC in 2015 I bought the RSGC version first and played like 600 800 hrs on that. I'm not sure when I bought it on steam but it has been at least 1.5 or two years ago. This is the only game I didn't regret buying multiple times.However that doesn't mean it's flawless. My biggest problem with it is that Story Mode has been abandoned by Rockstar. They stopped adding DLCs to story mode after Ill Gotten Gains Part 2 which came out 3 years ago. That's my only complaint about story mode.If somebody wants this game for the Story Mode then I recommend it because this is one of my favorite games of all time. I will always like it regardless it's flaws.So to sum it up Exciting story and lots of action Lot's of stuff to explore Multiple protagonists Very much optimizedOnline Nowadays I only play Online. I have at least 1.2k hours in Online. I'm level 289 and I have to say the more I play Online the more I get annoyed and disappointed by it.Firstly Free Mode is a warzone...You come out of your office or your apartment with a sportscar or a supercar I can almost guarantee there will be somebody who is bored and blow you up just for fun. There are a lot of people who are just going around in free mode with Oppressor Deluxo Stromberg Khanjali Hydra etc. In my experience 7 out of 10 sessions are like that. So in order to survive or have a chance you need weaponized vehicles (which some of them are pretty pricey). Which leads me to my next point...Prices and Payouts Many people say that a lot of things are overpriced and the business and mission payouts aren't enough. I can somewhat agree on this. But what I can't stand is that there are vehicles which are expensive for no reason. Their prices just don't match their performance and ability. And you might buy a useless vehicle because you were unable to test it and to top that of there's no money back.Going over to businesses Biker Businesses are complete garbage except coke. The amount of time you spend resupplying (or the amount of money you spend on supplies) the amount of money you spend on upgrading them and the fees... It's just not worth it. I have almost all biker businesses (except document forgery) and I shut most of them down because it was a waste of money and time. Not to mention you can get raided even if you have purchased the security upgrade. Worst of all is that there are multiple delivery vehicles even on small stock so you need other people to sell. But even then it's annoying because most of the delivery vehicles are slow and vulnerable to other players. It's just a waste of time and it's so annyoing.Good businesses are Import/Export Bunker Nightclub.If you solo then Import/Export is the best one the only problem is that there's a 20 minute cooldown between selling cars.Bunker is pretty good too if upgrades are purchased. The payout is decent and it doesn't require a whole lot of work.The nightclub is pretty pricey considering all the upgrades and delivery vehicles are expensive. It takes a bit of time to break even but after that it's a really good business. I just mentioned nightclubs and another good point came to my mind...Paywalls There are a lot of paywalls in this game. The absolute worst one I've seen is the Oppressor MKII. In order to get one at the trade price all 6 client jobs have to be completed at least once from the Terrorbyte computer. The Terrorbyte is also needed for upgrading the Oppressor MKII. But in order to buy a Terrorbyte you need a Nightclub. So really it's unavoidable if you want an MKII like I did. This can add up too some serious money.Another example of paywalls is when I bought the Akula. Which was quite a while ago. I didn't have a hangar at that time and wanted that helicopter so badly. I had to buy a Facility and complete Doomsday Heist Act I to unlock the trade price for it otherwise I would've wasted around 1 Million on nothing. But it turns out I also had to buy a Hangar in order to store it. It cannot be stored in the facility. But this is not everything... I had to buy the Aircraft Workshop for the Hangar in order to upgrade the Akula. I spent a lot of money at that time to get that helicopter. But I could go on and on with these for hours.Shark Cards When I was just starting out I bought a few shark cards and bought properties and an office to speed things up. Back then it was worth it more than now. It wasn't a good deal even back then but Shark Cards are just aren't worth the money now. They are overpriced and almost useless. A 8 Million dollar Shark Card can't even buy a fully upgraded nightclub. You buy 2 supercars and maybe one weaponized vehicle for that money. And it's over. The 8 Million dollar Shark Card should be 80 Million dollars for the same price.Don't even get me started on the Criminal Enterprise starterpack. That thing is useless. It gives the worst things in the game. It's even worse than buying a Shark Card.Cheaters Hackers Modders This one is probably the most annoying one. I couldn't even count how many times I was blown up by cheaters or caged by them. Sometimes they kick people from the session or freeze them. They spawn money on you whether you like it or not. They orbital cannon people. They teleport to people to kill them with god mode etc.Not every one of them are like that though. There are some cheaters who are friendly and don't interfere with other players expereince. But this is very rare.Loading Times Lag Bugs Glitches Loading into the game is at least 5 minutes for me. Sometimes loading into interiors takes 5 10 minutes. Many times when I'm switching sessions I get stuck in the clouds. Sometimes I just restart the game because even that's quicker than waiting for nothing.There are many times when I or my friends get disconnected from the session. Sometimes I can't even join them and get a Timed Out Loading Session error message.Online runs considerably worse than Story Mode. Much more. Sometimes it even lags. It's just plain annoying. You drive around smooth 60 fps and then it starts dropping for a few seconds and then it smooth again. It's unplayable like that. Sometimes this happen frequently sometimes it doesn't.There are a ton of bugs and glitches in online. One time all my cars disappeared from the garage and I had to restart the game. Many times I was delivering vehicle cargo and when I was done with it and wanted to sell the car it didn't show up on the warehouse computer so I had to get another one. A lot of times the camera stucks on the entering animation when I enter the office. It happened multiple times.So for me going Online is many times a frustrating experience rather than an enjoyable one. It's just unplayable sometimes.I'm in a Love/Hate relationship with Online. I love it for what it was when it came out and I love it because it's GTA but I hate it for what it became and how frustrating it is sometimes.When I don't experience the negative things I just mentioned above then it's a very pleasant and fun experince but when all these issues come up I just rather close the game rather than get frustrated over it. The very reason I wrote this review is because today the game made me really mad. I guess I just had an unlucky day. xD If anybody can get over the things I just mentioned then I do recommend Online too but otherwise I do not!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I supported this game by buying it 3 times. GTA has been a staple in my life as a game for years and years. GTA Online unfortunately is not what I hoped for and the experience has gotten worse and worse. Modded content allows players to build an environment that they want and showcase their skills. A community developed where members shared and showcased hard work for everyone to enjoy. This doesn't impact anyone elses player experience and that is why I am let down with Take Two and as a result Rockstar. Whether I want to enjoy some singleplayer content or hop onto a FiveM private server there is no impact on anyone elses experience who purchased the game. I don't like playing online anymore but I still love playing GTA V with the custom vehicles and textures and missions like LSPDFR etc. Recently Take two decided that we shouldn't have these experiences. We must play online because a % of players will purchase their shark cards. They block everything out to make themselves the only option and thus open the door for taking MORE money from the community. It feels greedy after so many people have supported this game for so long and even purchased it multiple times. The game has been out for a while and to still try and milk money from us paints a really bad picture. I am let down and won't be purchasing future Rockstar or Take Two content until there is a resolution. Take some notes from Arma 3 and other games that embrace community creation and modded content!

review: First off how do I put this....Buy.This.Game. Reasons First person exploration of a map 20 times the size of Liberty City. Running over Hookers in First person paying them back while flipping off a police officer. Getting your head blown off after flipping off said police officer. Watching your character sprawl helplessly on the ground taking more bullets as a result of corruption in the police force. One Hitting a Gardener employed by a "Retired" Serial Burgular and instantly becoming best inseperable friends. Controlling multiple people beyond their will and laughing as they come to when you transition back to them. Beautifully edited and remastered for the next gen PC Master Race. No longer having to go bowling with your annoying Serbian cousin. Cons Absolutely none except Lester not helping during heists that guy can monitor them with ease but put in no effort. Oh and the cops insta killing you. Best things about it Wade the comic relief of a 60s' 70s' era stoner is something I cannot refuse. Trevor who said all Canadians are friendly? Some Challenge the cops in the previous games appear to be synomynous to that of Paul Blart Mall Cop (Don't sue me please I am just making a reference I have lawyers on standby.) No Bowling enough said. Simply Put BUY. THIS. GAME.

review: Pros Online This online portion of this game is more addictive than Meth. The game is large so you'll need a good pc to run it. If it's good enough to crank everything to the max setting the graphics make you forget what reality is. So much time and effort has been put into this game. Single player campaign Great storyline. This game lets you play from multiple peoples' perspectives. Each leades in with one another creating an intricate story for those who love a good plot. Cons Hackers/modders Yes...there are too many modders. I feel that Rockstar needs to implement some form of anti chest like "Easy anti cheat" or "Battle Eye." They don't seem to take any action and its too easy to get access to exploits. FOLLOWING UP ON THAT The modders don't really ruin any of the gameplay. Most of them just give you money. However to be honest there aren't really a lot of active modders anymore. They've mostly moved on. Resource Demanding Gta is a very resource Demanding game meaning you'll need a good pc to run it. The minimum I'd recommend is an i5 and gtx 1050ti. Final thoughts Unlike most super awesome games...gta is now only $30. This is 100% totally worth your money and you'll get hooked on it. I'd suggest playing online too. Thats where most of the action is. Get. This. Game.

review: Modders (often called hackers) have always bugged me and usually I just find a new session the moment I realise I'm sharing one with them but oh no... not today.Today upon discovering someone was invulnerable to damage for the billionth time they decided to lock up my movement disable my UI and then boot me back to singleplayer.The modders have more control over my gameplay than RockstarSome of them can be nice (or at least not bad) though. One time this guy just broke the monotony in the weather and then flew around in a giant ocean liner which didn't really bother anyone and actually got a few cheers... until some people started begging for them to drop money (and often threatening to report if they DIDN'T drop money)The modders hold more respect and authority among the other people in my session than RockstarNot all modders just mod from in game. Some of them make lovely community projects like the framework to host your own dedicated servers in which you can set your own custom rules and structures completely independent of the main cluster so you can't transfer anything either way. A great escape from the tedium that players in the early to mid progression face while constantly harrassed by people who can just keep pulling Oppressor MKIIs out trapping us in an endless grind.But then Rockstar decided to make those modders cease and desist because adding the option to not trudge through cancer every time you open this game would be circumventing the coding or promoting piracy or some other that most people don't agree with.The modders care more about the community's experience than Rockstar.I'm going to keep playing this simply because of the effort I've already put in to growing a business and the prospect that maybe I can find a heist lobby without a player who quits halfway through. But I could never wholeheartedly recommend anyone wastes their money on it after me.What I would recommend is that you find out how to suspend GTA for 10 seconds using resource monitor because that's the only feasible away to stop disrespectful s on flying motorbikes from killing multiple days' work with 1 tap. Nice way to promote player interaction you goddamn geniuses at Rockstar! I hope you're happy with what I paid for GTAV because you'll never take another penny from me.TL DR The community is largely a cesspool of griefing and modding and the developers/publishers could not give less of a about it as long as they make money.

review: I support the modding community. T2's cease and desist is cruel unfair and an abuse of power even if they have taken back their decision they should have done more research on the issue before making such a drastic decision. Shame on you Take Two.Edit In light of the lawsuit against the developers of GTA Online cheats it is now my opinion that Rockstar and T2 are taking advantage of the legal system. This lawsuit is not only a step in the wrong direction it is encouraging other developers to do the same. If their main goal was to stop cheating in the game they would work on improving their anti cheat system instead of prosecuting one of hundreds of cheat developers. Now talented reverse engineers and developers will be put behind bars because Rockstar wants to exploit their players with microtransactions more than they want to make something worth selling.

review: I had heard rumors. Rumors of the most difficult game ever for anyone who started playing after shark cards were introduced into the game. A game that quickly declined as soon as a contributing company started adding DLCs into the game. A game that will make you feel like you are clocking into a 9 5 job every time you boot it up. This game is GTA V Online. Gone are the days were one can RELAX and play this game. As someone new to the game in 2018 GTA Online feels like a slap in the face to the the original GTA all the way up to GTA 4. And I know why GTA Online is so unbelievably soul crushingly anxiety inducing. It's because Rockstar/Take Two are Micheal Franklin and Trevor. When Trevor killed Johnny (From GTA TLATD) it was Rockstar/Take Two slapping us in the face and saying "We've got you by your unmentionables and you ARE going to buy our products." And we the players of GTA Online are peasants. We have to dedicate as much time as a World Of Warcraft player has to and we gain way less reward. (And I have a lvl 100 Human Paladin. For The Alliance!) This game is a slap in the face to die hard GTA fans... But there are some things very good about this game. The scenery is beautiful graphics as well. The universe of GTA is better able to be explored in this game. The customization is amazing and very pleasing. And if you can ignore the tryhards kids who stole their parent's credit cards to get everything they want/ or the spoiled brats and the butt hole modders that kill you for no reason then I tip my hat to you. You like me try your darnedest to force yourself to have as much fun as you can... with a very overpriced game. With that have fun fellow grinder. Good luck. Nugget
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is generally fun and well done to a point. The singleplayer and online have a heist mission set which honestly kind of makes this game for me. In it's own way it gives it an identity that sets it apart from it's predecessors. Unfortunately there are many issues with the game that will unfortunately not allow me to recommend it. The fact that the Xbox version had a way for you to buy Shark Cards regardless of the payment restrictions you had in place set the tone for what I am about to say. They are money hungry a lot of the game's content is locked behind in game currency that reaches exhorbant amounts. This will usually have most people do one of two things A) buy their shark cards or B) mod the game. If they choose option B then they potentially might get banned and have to buy their game again. Because the latter is actually a small risk compared to the reward a lot of people hack extensively so. In fact every crew has that one modder friend that can boot you from the game because of how little attention Rockstar pays attention to their cash cow. The only things they add are things for you to buy and to be honest while you can do certain lucrative missions it is not fun to do 3 million times so you can get that one airplane you wanted. Since I have lowered my expectations of the game and focused only on hesiting with friends it is pretty enjoyable past that... I have no real interest in the online game.Graphics Pretty Excellent especially in comparison to its predecessor.Story Easy to follow funny and a generally a pleasure to go through.Replayability low the online gets repetative fastSound effects Great everything gives you a sense of immersion up to the small details of the radio.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Did I just grow up or is it really worse then all the GTAs we had before?From the technological point of view it's amazing. When I first launched it I could just walk around the city with first point of view looking at surroundings very detailed world high resolution textures and so on.Then I started playing the story mode. The multi character missions are really an interesting addition to the gameplay. But the characters are terribly boring and with three of them I couldn't feel attached to the story of any of them so In the end I didn't really care at all. GTA VC GTA SA and GTA IV stories seemed much more interesting to me.The radio stations didn't impress me as well. Like they underpayed the designers or something like that.You can easily see that the company made a huge accent on the online part of the game. They show off the extra nonsense vehicles everywhere and suggest that you buy virtual money packs all the time. The online part also has a lot of nice missions but it seems to me that some of them could be in the singleplayer part instead. The session making in the online mode is just terrible you can't chose the session you will join and end up with endless loading screens all the time. Sometimes it likes to crash as well. Not to say that before I even could play online I had to create a ticket at R* because the game froze during the character creation broke character data and couldn't just erase the character without help from R*.So very mixed feelings. It's a great game on it's own but I expected more from it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I'm doing another take on my old review here goes GTA V is really an amazing open world game with a stunning online mode and truely great DLCs BUT Take Two interractive (Rockstar's owner) does not care about the consumers anymore only about the money. Everything the devs put their heart into is hugely expensive and is virtualy impossible to obtain without spending large amounts of real money (shark cards).As a result people mod give themselves millions of GTA Dollars and go around killing people who are just trying to enjoy the game and that's not even the worst part they don't get banned you do In my case I got banned for... well I litteraly don't know they didn't even give me a reason I didn't mod recieve money from modders or grief ever on my 1000 hours on PS4 and 200 hours on PC. They gave me a 1 month ban and a character reset completely deleting my previously mentioned 143 lvl progress houses cars bunkers garages EVERYTHING! When my 1 month ban had finnished I got back in and played for 5 minutes only to recieve a permanent ban...You can't even use a friends account that was generously given to you because your Scoial Club (GTA online) account is permanently linked to your steam accout.In conclusion Story Mode is like a dog nice and funny does what you tell it to do and just keeps on suprising you with new features and mods. Online is more like a very wild yet cute cat you're very excited to play with it at first but then it starts feeling like a job you don't even get paid to do. The grinding beacomes bananas. And then it just comes in for the kill when you least expect it and now you can't play anymore because you got banned BOI. I do recommend GTA V since it's a truely great game but ONLY BUY IT FOR THE STORY MODE AND THE SINGLEPLAYER MODS they are great.Hope I could help you out! Have a great day.

review: Simply put definitely a fun game but has a number of flaws.This game can be extremely addicting and enjoyable with a group of friends. With that you can queue up and have a blast doing heists and earn a ton of money along with it. That said for those of you who play this game solo will have a rough time. Solo heists are not even worth it due to the long queue time. Even once you get a heist going you and your team will most likely die at some point resetting you to a checkpoint every few minutes. This makes this experience frustrating and not rewarding at all. Other options of earning money is tedious and not entertaining. Overall play with friends for a good time otherwise expect a tedious grind. 6/10 game I'd say
