review: Single player is great. The story becomes political and satirical which I loved. It didn't feel like a game that's too serious to its nature. The humorous banters were consistent throughout the story. The missions were fun and kept me hooked. Graphics are great and Los Santos was amazingly designed.Online on the other hand is also good. Just a little bit of problem with the modders but everything else is not so bad. The heists were fun to do with other players. The random events on Free Mode was also fun. Becoming a CEO and inviting other players to become associates was a great way to earn in game money and Exp. The online missions did not feel like a chore at all. Each were very interesting to do and have their own way to complete.Some stuff that I want to see Online. I doubt that Rockstar would add any of these but'll be interesting if they would Fight Club Mano y mano with other players under a specific special 24/7 convenience store.RC Races Race throughout the city with little RC cars.Hitman Missions Improved stealth mechanics for assassination missions for players who love co op with stealth.Pool/Billiards Tennis? Check. Golf? Check. Darts? Check. Pool? Still waiting.Open restaurants I just wanna grab me some o' those two number 9s a number 9 large a number 6 with extra dip a number 7 two number 45s one with cheese and a large soda. Is that too much to ask?Skateboards BMXs were fun to ride but I wanna grind those rails with some skateboard.Skateboard Stunt Races Race with skateboards obviously.Buyable house on Grove Street Who doesn't wanna live on Grove Street?I ain't complaining about the other free updates but hey these are just my thoughts.GTA V Recommended. 9/10
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I used to enjoy this game and recommend it but I think it's time I take that back.Without going into a long drawn out reason let's just put out a few simple reasons.1. Pay to win/money grinding.2. The amount of hackers jesus.. "JUST PLAY WITH FRIENDS OR SOLO" and defeat the purpose of the game being played with other people I don't know maybe make a friend? lol3. The weapons and weaponized vehicles added during the Gunrunning update and later ruined the game. "MAYBE YOU'RE JUST BAD!" What a classy come back.4. When I started playing back in 2015 it was easy to fill a lobby with players to race against. These days you can only expect a full lobby from double money events or a fan base following. This could be a combination of player base being smaller and/or the number of game modes added is too high to get a decent size lobby going.5. Explosive rounds and super accurate missiles. It's bad when you can't even drive a normal vehicle or plane without the risk of these easily taking you out with no effort.6. Finally Orbital Cannon. That's all.

review: Me and GTA 5 have definitely had a rocky experience with each other. From the complete aww of the game when I first got it to the frustration that came from being banned for no apparent reason to the grinding for hours on end to get back to where I was but let's put all of that behind and see the game for what it truly is. I mean come on what other 5 year old full price game has nearly the same active player base as GTA 5?For me the massive open world of GTA really is astonishing in fact I'm still finding hidden areas around the map over a year after I first bought it. The world is really loaded with a crap ton of detail which most people wouldn't even notice like the amazing texture work the bumpy potholes the non copy and pasted roads. Rockstar truly are the masters of the open world genre at this point and I would expect nothing less from RDR2. In terms of visuals this 5 year old title holds up surprisingly well. The graphics still look sharp as ever and with draw distance that is still very impressive to this day. In terms of audio the game sounds nice in general. The cars sound as you would expect the music is pretty good and the ambient noises (ex. traffic in the background) is all pretty well done.Content is often times a weak point of many modern games only lasting so long until you have done everything you can and want to do. With GTA 5 on the other hand there are plenty of things to do ranging from sports to going on rampages. That's not even touching on the Online mode. GTA Online is in my opinion one of the best games in existence. There are endless contact missions adversary modes heists free mode sports and other stuff to do. In GTA Online it nearly never bored me never really having a dull moment. Plus it can be whatever you want it to be. If you want to play tennis with friends its got that. Golf? Got that too. Racing? Shooting? Heisting? Running a drug business? You name the criminal activity chances are GTA Online has got it.Of course with every good thing there's always the negatives with it. First and foremost the Online mode of GTA 5 is quite a big never ending grind to gain all the money you need to buy the stuff you want. The items are very much overpriced with an average car setting you back 1 million bucks. Also the Online mode is plagued with modders as well as a the trigger happy ban bot. There is also a "problem" where there is so much content in the game that not many people are playing it (which is not something you get to say often). But really with over 100 million copies of this game sold there's only so much Rockstar can do.The verdict is that this is a spectacular game that I recommend everyone try out plus the steam price is now only 30 bucks. Really I hope that RDR2 and GTA 6 will be as good as this game cause it's gonna be a tough one to beat.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single PlayerSo in GTA 5 you're going to experience a well written well acted and quite funny story filled with mayhem and colourful characters. This is a great thing too many games focus on their multiplayer first then stick a lackluster storyline in to make it worth the price tag which it often is not.Pros Lively world feels both lived in and realisticGood main cast of actorsFun Story MissionsColourful side characters and villainsGood humour...mostly...Driving is greatRadiant eventsCan 'hang out' with friends/family which is nice for some dialogue and character buildingOne or two returning characters from previous titlesCons Gunplay and general combat is not amazing but its fineI prefer the GTA 4 pedestriansStupid 'flip the car upright' mechanic that breaks realismNo real reason to keep playing single player when you're done almost like it forces you into GTA Online which may not be a good thing to some...Overall rating 8/10Closing Verdict GTA 5 is a fun experience but it does hold your hand a little more than previous titles though you'll most likely not care when you get into the story which is well told by a terrific voice cast. Steven Ogg is now one of my favourite actors (he plays Trevor) and he's making a name for himself too what with him being in The Walking Dead as a prominent and charismatic villain.GTA Online (Multiplayer)Lets be clear I've sunk a lot of hours into this and my final opinion is that it's quite...toxic...so much trolling hacking/modding (calling them hackers implies intellegence they are not Intellegent) griefing and general bad people that I wonder why I keep coming back too this money grind that is becoming less worth it by the day. Playing this with friends and just goofing around is all well and good but I WANT to make money to expand my businesses and such but other players make it hard or very trying and when a modder gets involved it can become impossible.Here's an example of just how bad this community can be. During a team PvP match a friend and I were greeted with 'We have a hacker in our team D'. Any decent player would report the modder but nah these guys seemed to be on an easy winning streak and were all to happy to let this aim botter get them easy rep and cash.Now not all bad things are the result of modders. Some players just have nothing left to do and lots of cash to spend be it from the grind or just using a Shark Card. During a friends mission to sell some cargo for a hefty sum we were on the last checkpoint in a Bunker mission to hold off a wave of Merryweather troops when all of a sudden some high level hits us with an orbital cannon. Why? Using it cost more than what he would have got from ruining the shipment. It was dome because he could plain and simple which is just another example of this bad community.And then there's the constant stream of phone calls. Call me paranoid but it feels like Rockstar are trying to annoy me into buying Shark Cards so I can buy what the callers are hyping just so I can shut them up. There is absolutely no need for these calls I do not need reminding for the 100th time that there's Facility's Bunkers or other such crap in the game. One phone call would suffice but no Rockstar have abused this idea.I strongly feel that Rockstar should never have implemented Shark Cards however as it's made the experience very imbalanced and the high prices of goods gives you two legal options to make money and one that will get you in trouble.Option A Buy a Shark CardOption B Grind for days for a single 3mil bikeOption C Begging a modder to drop money which will GET YOU BANNED but the idea that people are actively doing this should tell rockstar that the grind is broken.Occasionally Rockstar will do something grand to combat modding but they're still everywhere and it makes playing on public serers a pain. When I have to use a sneaky (and legal) trick to get my own public server it just started to make me wonder why I was playing the online portion. If we could just do our business grind in a closed/friends server I would be happy but I also WANT to play with others.I have had good moments to share. Some players will offer to help run selling missions resupplies and such and they get rewarded for it ofc. I've also seen some random silliness from people that brings a smile to my face.I also welcome the addition of Nightclubs seriously these are great! Every business in this game is so high maintenence with resupply run after ressuply run crate/vehicles collections and so on so forth but the nightclub has you only doing maybe a handful of promotion runs a day.Even if the Nightclub is dead you'll still get resources gathered from your active businesses like the Weed Farm or Meth Lab and the best thing is you don't even need to resupply them for these goods to generate in the Nightclub basement. So long as the Weed farm is running you'll have some weed added to the basement even if the supplies have run dry and the staff are doing absolutely nothing. It's a valid but slow way to make money while you just do whatever it is you wanna do.Pros Have literally cried laughing sometimesRandom events can distract the trollsI enjoy the NightclubsCons The worst community of griefers modders and trolls I have ever seenToo GrindyFeels Pay to WinPersistant and Annoying phonecallsToo many moddersToo many trollsToo many griefersCannot do selling or resupply runs in a friends/private serverOverall 4/10Closing Verdict GTA Online is fun when it's fair but Rockstar seem uninterested in addressing the big problems. I would suggest just removing Shark Cards slightly lowering prices and putting everyone on an even playing field. It wont solve all the problems (modders and griefers) but it will improve the quality of the game IN MY OPINION.The modders and the heavy pay to win is a serious downside to this potentially fun experience. With hours upon hours of stuff to do anyone with patience can enjoy GTA Online but you'll need thick skin to get through a day.

review: I will go ahead and adress the elephant in the room GTA Online is a steaming pile of hot garbage. It would be a sad and broken excuse for a game if it was some low end internet multiplayer scheme but the fact that this mess was created by a good name like Rockstar is an absolute disgrace. It's such wasted potential and squandered wealth that it's like the digital equivilant of the baby boomer generation and quite frankly the whole thing ought to be overhauled from the ground up. But ignoring that and focusing on the single player experience I am blown away. It's honestly the most enjoyable GTA game that's out there IMO. An actually enjoyable story in a beautiful immersive world. This one has a lot to offer that previous titles don't. My issue with a lot of the previous games is that they'd get very repetitive and stale after all the fun missions are said and done. It's an honest problem with any sandbox game and this one while not perfect fights it pretty damn well. I really like the degree that the world feels "alive"...the random encounters are pretty cool especially. And I like how the NPCs (and even animals) are a lot more vibrant in going about their routines it's a big departure from the cookie cutter people walking back and forth in straight lines of the older days. Missions are super fun especially the big heists. The gameplay stays pretty fresh and interesting throughout the story even on the majority of the side quests. I guess if anything could be done better it would be a little more immersive stuff to do in the world. This is nitpicky because although its leaps and bounds above any other title you can't help but feel that there could have been more. For instance the convenience store and (especially) random armored car robberies are a super cool touch and I would have loved to have more of that in the game as opposed to some of the "official" minigames. They can be a cute one time diversion but lets be real people play GTA to shoot rob and steal. Violent Crime. More of that please. If I want to get serious about Yoga or tennis I'll turn my computer off and go outside. All in all though the game is fantastic and now that the price has dropped more to reflect that it's essentially a single player only experience totally worth every cent.

review: Well the game is top notch storyline is ok buuut. The multiplayer is being destroyed by cheaters of all kind. edit After years of playing this game first on PS3 now on PC I can say this Single player is still top notch piece of open world gaming good story bold characters and all of the pieces go well together. But the multiplayer oh don't get me started about the fricking multiplayer. First years (despite of damn cheaters everywhere) was fun and playable then they added heists which gave new life to the gameplay. Later came new missions and jobs freeroam activities which were cool to. But the content gets ing ridiculous. Grotesque vehicles uberweapons and tons and tons of useless crap. If I wanted that stuff I'd go for Saints Row not GTA. Call me a purist but I loved simplier GTA not the one full of panzekampfwagens on the streets without flying cars and bikes and all that t. GTA was always great because of the uncanny similiarity with our daily world. An outstanding mockery on how we live today now it just mocks itself. I beg u as a friend don't go that way with your next game. Remember your legacy Rockstar.

review: This is a game I can not recommend highly enough but also one I apprehensively recommend to other PC gamers and only after I've known them for a while. The GTA brand is one that is known for controversy and most people have a preconceived notion about the franchise. I know I did.I played a few of the games in the GTA series (read HOT COFFEE) ) and never got it . That was until GTA V and the Heist update. It is the most fun I've had in a 4 player game (the most you can heist with) ever! Initially it was just fun to take off my white hat and stop playing the role of the good guy. But after carefully planning bank robberies with friends knocking over armored cars and breaking criminals out of prison I was fully embracing my dark side and the hedonistic joy that is GTA V. I have since amassed a small criminal empire... In the game of course. )It does have one significant drawback. HACKERS. Rockstar (RS) does try to keep them from ruining the game but they are seemingly one step ahead. With each patch RS plugs some of holes the hackers exploit but some remain and most pop back up after the hackers learn their way around the new patch.Online hackers are the only thing keeping this from being a perfect game.One thing to be aware of is the lack of controller options. It works great with most gamepads but you will need a second party program to get steering wheels and some other controlers working in the game. I have a Thrustmaster steering wheel and have to use X360ce to get GTA V to see my steering wheel. In between play sessions I often think about my crews next adventure in Los Santos. There are so many areas to explore I don't think one person can see it all. The map is approximately 100 square miles (13x7) with Los Santos being about 21 square miles The game is a technological marvel with top notch graphics and game play. I have over 1 000 hours in Los Santos and gladly no end in sight. It's a great return on a game investment.It's an absolute no brainer. If it's on sale get it! )

review: I started playing this game when it was released on the PC... It was very fun and I spent almost my whole time on this game from my second account and my Xbox One... After 2 years...It feels that your time is almost over...there are so much new expensive things that you force yourself you must get them. Because without the money and without the new things (cars businesses etc.) It's not worth that. This whole time while playing it without the new content is a little bit boring so you will probably leave the game very quickly after couple days of missions... I'm turning to all who are still didn't get this game and want to get it soon... Remember my words You will work very hard and you will do a huge ammount of missions and heists to get yourself a good stuff. But if you decide to do it on the easy way so you will probably find yourself losing experience from this game. So think and choose wisely... It was fun at the beginning but know it's just a matter of time. Take care of yourself!

review: Definitely the BEST new generation GTA game ever. Lots of things to do. It's like you have bought a hundred games in one purchase.Sure it is not perfect but it's really hella fun to play especially with friends online.I'd give it an 8/10 ratingI would give it a 9 if only they had better servers and do something about rampant chinese modders/hackers.To be specifics about the negatives here are the things that ROCKSTAR NEEDS TO FIX 1. Annoying forced lock on animations like sitting down changing gesture animation cycle and etc2. SLOOOOW LOADING TIME. They should really fix this. Players waste 30mins to hours of time just because of the loading time.3. CHINESE HACKERS4. BETTER MISSIONS with LESS DRIVING. They should really take out the driving/cruise part of a certain mission. We've already had enough of driving DURING the actual mission.5. Bring back the "PICK UP ITEM" feature and "HANG/GRIP" on vehicles feature6. When buying/taking SNACKS or any item give players the ability to place the amount of items they want like the SNACKS from the secretary. It's so stupid that we have to click on it one by one every time.7. MORE REALISTIC WORLD. Let players go inside a building or house by opening the door and not on a blip. Let paramedics do their job properly by not just declaring a casualty dead on the spot. They should take out a stretcher and try to revive a patient appropriately.8. Keys 1 2 3 to 0 should be quick switches to the assigned weapon and should no longer bring out the weapon wheel9. CROUCH. I don't know why there's no longer a crouch button but it should be there.10. ANIMALS. BRING THE ANIMALS ONLINE11. QUICK DIALOGUES MENU and GESTURE instead of just one preset gesture animation12. DESTRUCTIBLE BUILDINGS (Maybe in the future GTA6)13. RAGDOLL PHYSICS FIX. The characters look really stupid when they fall to the ground. Bring realistic animations.14. SEAT EJECTION when not wearing a seatbelt. Bring em back15. STOP THE GRIND MISSIONS. BRING MORE PRODUCTIVE WORHTHY ENJOYABLE and NON TEDIOUS MISSIONS. The HEISTS DLC was nice but you should UPGRADE it and not make future DLC suck. Make shorter and faster and more epic gameplay.16. REMOVE THE RADAR for PLAYERS. It just takes away the fun if you know where the players are. Or at least have a lobby that doesn't have a radar on it.17. Give MINI MISSIONS that can contribute to the community in the PUBLIC LOBBY.Like you can sell hotdogs on the street so players and NPCs can buy.18. FASTER LOADING TIME19. FASTER LOADING TIME20. FASTER LOADING TIME21. I could have said more but I forgot the restPOSITIVE THINGS ABOUT GTA A LOT CAN BE MENTIONED! GREAT GAME!BEST GTA EVER but even the best isn't perfect.

review: Story Mode is okay. Multiplayer with friends is where it's at key words being 'with friends' because playing GTA Online alone might actually be a legitimate form of self torture. If you don't have friends to help you out and back you up finding competent players who aren't jerks to do heists and missions and generally anything to do with trying to make money among other things become nigh impossible tasks.Once you have three other trustworthy players to do stuff with so long as you have the patience to deal with raising money manually and not through shark cards (unless you're into microtransactions) so long as you can deal with the occasional bugs and glitches and so long as you can avoid cheaters and hackers (just hop into a different session the second you notice anything weird going on) it's usually a very fun time.My friends and I have had a lot of fun together in GTA Online even in spite of all it's problems and that usually makes dealing with all of those things worth it in the end. Just be sure to take breaks from Online every now and again because the occasional annoyances start to pile up over time and might lessen the overall experience.TL DR Despite all of it's flaws I'd still (tentatively) recommend GTA 5 in 2018... but mostly to people with the patience of a saint.

review: Online is perfect. It's a slow start if you're playing with other new people or solo but once the online part of the story kicks in it's the most fun you can have with a buddy or 2. The missions are sometimes unbalanced which can lead to people getting mad. The game is not at all perfect. After the price dropped to 20 dollars there have been more and more hackers and modders. They can break the immersion and sometimes even the game. The community is filled with people who are either as toxic as a squad of 10 year old fortnite gamers or they can be as chill as the cooling agent for a nuclear reactor. The game does become more and more intese as you sink hours into. I enjoy that sense of progression it feels rewarding to make lots of money for the hard work and the effor put into setting everything up. This is where the game truly shines in my opinion. I would recommend this game if you had more than one person who is either higher level or has the shark card pack because the initial grind is very difficalt and can make you lose hope for the late game due to the ammount of time needed to start things up.

review: GTA V offers a very fun yet hardworking environment. You are able to play with your friends complete missions and so on in GTA Online however a lot of the items are overly priced so you have to grind your way to get the items! Once you get a hang of earning cash in GTA Online it will not be a big issue to earn large sums of money! Rockstar as a company tends to keep up with GTA V / GTA Online content updates however they also have a tendency to punish players without question and the absence of a chance of a appeal. If you are more towards the GTA V Single Player side there are a lot of mods for you to use if you are going for the Single Player missions i must say they are not as interesting. GTA SA was better than GTA V in terms of the story mode and missions however that may just be me.In conclusion GTA V is worth it but i would recommend you to get it when it's on sale or from CD Key websites that sell GTA V.

review: Now if I had to go back before I bought this game and make the choice to buy it again I wouldn't. In fact I'd rather ing buy WinRAR. This game started off as a gem on PC. When it came out the 2 year wait was all worth it. Flash forward 3 years and the game's online population is 90% hacker. The other 10% can't escape the never ending grind for weapons cars and apartments. Essentially everything new they add into this game is worth millions of in game dollars and HEISTS give you ANYWHERE FROM 30 000 750 000. That's way too little for all the effort. It's so much of a grind that GTA V created a third party buisness which people sell modded accounts. So essentially you can buy a modded account for $10 which has 500 000 000 in game dollars on it. Or you can buy a shark card for $10 WHICH GIVES YOU 200 000. What in the ing are you gonna buy with that? New tires for your 3 000 000 dollar car? This game is filled with micro transactions which led to so many people hacking on PC. I've put around 1 000 hours into this game including console and PC and I can say without a doubt don't buy this dog game. If you must buy a modded account or pirate it. Don't give Rockstar any more money for ruining their game. Which mind you is still 60 dollars 5 years after initial release.

review: Forget everything you think you know about remastered video game rereleases because new gen Grand Theft Auto 5 punches the rule book steals its car and then reverses back over the battered leathery remains just to be sure. The obvious question is should I buy GTA 5 all over again? to which the answer is a resounding Yes. Right this second. The improvements are numerous and obvious right from the get go. Better facial animation gives added weight to the already excellent vocal performances. A longer draw distance pulls you deeper into an open world that was already obnoxious in its level of detail but now feels even more exciting and alive. In fact it s so beautiful that simply existing in the sun bleached sprawl of Los Santos and surrounding countryside is as enjoyable as tearing through it on a lunatic murder spree. One of my favourite moments came when I flicked the radio off and drove slowly over a patch of lakeside dirt listening to the crunch of gravel under my tyres while watching the afternoon sun peel across the water. Bliss.Most impressive of all is the new first person mode. Rockstar could have simply crammed an extra camera in slapped a bullet point on the back of the box and had done with it. Instead what they ve done is essentially built an entirely new game. It s a switch in perspective both literal and psychological. Playing GTA 5 while looking through the eyes of your character connects you to the action in a way the traditional third person viewpoint never could. You re doing rather than observing. Punch an innocent bystander in the chops for a laugh? Suddenly it s not as funny as your first whips out in front of you and cracks them in the cheek sending them reeling. Stamping on enemies while they re down feels intimately gruesome (I still did it). It s a genius way of reframing a series notorious for its slapstick attitude towards violence. I found myself being well nicer. I drove more sensibly called taxis rather than hijacked cars and resisted the urge to whip out the sticky bombs every five seconds to make mincemeat out of the cops.

review: Well Grand Theft Auto has been around enough that most of us know almost a lot about the franchise So whats good about this particular one you ask ?..well first ask your steam friends coz am sure at least 2 out of 10 people you know own it could be more not lessThe Game Play Well this iteration of GTA is a mix of goodies from older iterations it even grabs some perks from Red Dead Redemption driving is not as tough as it was on GTA IV in game population interaction like Read Dead Redemption (Role playing and character build up) you'll like the most of itStory/Plot No Spoilers This time around its based on three characters not just one and just like every GTA iteration you dont just start from scratch building an empire its just different for each character you can interact in between characters in game or even switch to your own online character Story is great I personally like the GTA4 one but this one is not bad or boring either I feel like ending it again and again and game environment also place a part in it because it is part of San Andreas after all if not most of it.GraphicsGraphics are amazing they really nailed it Los Santos was not as fun looking in San Andreas(just the Los Santos part) as it is now graphics of this game make it very addictive especially the Game environment is best ever on any GTA gameRequirements Well most of GTA games have been tough on GPU and Hardware side of things but still Ill say compared to GTA 4 this one seems well Optimized to me although stil you need a good gaming rig for 4k Ultra UPDATE its a mixed bag I have played this game on different HW unless you have a good GPU e.g RX580/GTX1060 you'll be spending a good amount of time adjusting Graphics settings for better FPSGTA Onlinehere comes the best part I recommend every user to at least buy this game for GTA Online Unlike FPS games High Speed internet is recommended but not mandatory yes you'll spend longer time in Loading screen but once you are in a session swapping sessions joining missions is not a big deal I have personally tested it on a 4mb and 2mb network even on evey traffic The online features are great you can build a character and start from scratch like any GTA story mode and work for other players or earn from missions plan heist's but cars apartments and the best part is unlike story mode or any GTA game before your car if insured wont be lost if left on map it can even be claimed if blown or wrecked wish they implemented this in Story Mode

review: I enjoyed the single player portion of this game. Played through it probably 2 times now since it's been out. But like most gamers you are interested in the online portion because you may believe it'll give you a more immersive experience. For the most part that is true. In the case of GTA Online? It's false.You'll wait around 2 5 minutes for the online portion of the game to load. In which you'll begin to experience the clunky smooth loading of menus transition to game lobby screens and then into the game itself. If that's not enough to ruin your experience of the game then the community will. Unless you are an absolute scumbag of a human being you will not enjoy the community this game has to offer.In the last two weeks I played 22 hours total and of those 22 hours I estimated 2 2.5 of them were waiting for loading screens. I estimated that approximately 6 of those hours were of heists that only half finished due to someone repeatedly failing or someone leaving the game. 6 more hours could be counted towards waiting to find games and waiting for them to start and the rest of the hours were of actual enjoyable gameplay.If you are one of the lucky few who finds a friend or someone online who is helpful and fun to play with you might enjoy the game. However if you are like me and likes playing a game that has an established community this is not for you.

review: I have to go not recommended never thought I would not recommend a GTA game but this is why.After playing the game for like 45hrs I have completed it and now no replay value and no point playing any more I could have completed the game in about 10hrs but it s fun just to drive around getting cops to chase you It s no GTA 4 let me tell you the missions are crap and boring nothing like 4 I only managed to buy 1 garage and 1 business to make some money ..yeah right you don t earn enough money throughout the game to purchase hardly anything the heists don t pay enough for the time and effort put into it .until the last heist 9million and the game finishes well all that it s too late most of the sub missions are crap and buggy like the collecting the submarine parts for a pay out of 10 dollars .really who wrote this garbage! And then I got stuck in a ship wreck after amazingly passing through the hull like a ghost!!!!Multiplayer ..ha forget it it s a joke just full of idiots that just kill you with rocket launchers from nowhere all the time.The game it s self is very good graphically but not very open world for a game in 2018 GTA 4 is way bigger and in my opinion much better.In short GTA 4 is better and more fun better missions longer game play building an empire etc but not as good graphics wise.GTA 5 Has better cars and more custom items and my fav the musical air horns .lovely jubbly.GTA 5 has gone pay for multiplayer route .not good it will kill it off GTA 5 missions are crap and boring and way too short for a game for 2018! Paying too much for a nice looking game.Use of the N word way too much.Buy Mafia 3 better missions better game play full stop.

review: 7/10A great game for all types of gamers or just casuals. The story isn't bad and not too short lot's of fun online messing around especially with friends. I like how there's a level system and money in the online mode but it takes too long which makes you either end up getting bored or having to spend money. All DLC is free but you need to buy it with in game money which comes to having to spend money or grinding for a while. Lot's of variety in the game which is perfect and a good amount of customization. You can easily find yourself spending a lot of time in this game but eventually you will most likely get bored. For the price it's at now it's a good pick up and you'll get your money worth.

review: I've been playing GTA 5 since 2016 and I have just decided to write a review now. GTA 5 is a really great game beautiful graphics well polished and has a really fun single player campaign even though the campign is a little short. The storyline is great absolutely love the story mode. Really great idea how they allow you to choose how you want to end the game. The online aspect however isn't looking too good right now. It's full of griefers and modders who just mess up the entire server when everybody is just minding their own business. The online aspect also consists of way too much grinding to get anywhere. All of the new content is really overpriced and to actually get and upgrade a lot of the new vehicles you have to separately buy overpriced things to upgrade the new vehicles. It just forces you to grind way too much but trust me once you have completed the grinding and reach the top it is so so satisfying and it makes the grinding and dealing with all these modders and griefers completely worth it. Overall GTA 5 is a really great game and it is definitely worth every cent of your money. Good job Rockstar Games for making this great game!

review: It's been a long time since I've wanted to write a review for this game. Having accumulated that much playtime here are some good bad and mixed points. Pros Solid singleplayer The story is memorable (so are three main characters) albeit for some people it may be too short. There are many things to do even after finishing storyline (i.e. collecting cars going on rampage around huge city scuba diving and many others) Support of modifications Even if one becomes bored after doing everything in the game it is quite easy to revive it by installing third party mods which range from clothing to adding additional vehicles weapons or missions Long lasting multiplayer To be frank this thing has kept me entertained for more than 700 hours. It has been maintained since 2013 and is still going strong. It massively expands options which were available in the initial game and adds a lot more. One is free to create a character (which is quite customizable by the way) and build a criminal empire from scratch. Make friends participate in air races assasinate other players you name it! Cons (multiplayer related) Phone calls This one is truly annoying both for newcomers and long time players. The developers offer everyone to buy particular businesses on a regular basis. In case one doesn't want to do it the game constantly bombs you with calls and text messages. There is no way to fix it unless you purchase them. The other aspect is NPC calls. Even not that frequent they may distract player from flying texting or shooting which is irritating at times Anti cheating system The truth is if one encounters a cheater and reports him it's highly likely that nothing will be done about it. I've spoken to some modders and they stated that despite numerous complaints from others they always come out clean In game pricing In short this is ridiculous. In order to get any decent vehicles or businesses one should spend a lot of time before buying any (in case one gets assistance from others it's less of a problem). Of course everyone is free to buy virtual currency with real one but for some it costs way too much. Mixed (again multiplayer) Controversial community The gaming base is quite broad which may or may not be good. Sure there are people who are willing to help fellow player. On the other hand the number of not so nice gamers is huge. By them I mean those who find pleasure in killing others over and over again or just ruining someone's hard work Neverending grind In the end it all comes to this. First in case a player doesn't have any rich friends he goes through some missions as heists multiple times. Later on it's about using vehicles to get from point A to point B (everyone on the server gets notified about player's actions and is free to disrupt them) with a little variety. Even with some glitches making money may easily become tedious.And that's going to be it. Hope it helped you make up your mind.P. S. There are unofficial multiplayer projects (such as FiveM) based on Grand Theft Auto Online so YMMV.

review: Grand theft auto has always been a favourite of mine. From learning to drive and somewhat getting over my fear of heights by playing it the game has not only been fun but also very educational.GTA V for me is particularly amazing. For the small amount they ask for the game you get a nice open world game with loads of updates that don't require extra money for DLCs. I am really enjoying the car heists that they brought into the game. Brings back the original GTA feel.Having said that there are a lot of things that they could do to improve gameplay. Especially between CEOs and Associates. But all in all it truly is a great game. Best money ever spentUPDATE Amazing work by R* keeping the updates and missions coming. A truly remarkable experienceUPDATE2 Even more amazing stuff released this year. The after Hours DLC especially

review: Offline mode is fantastic. Great story and great gameplay. Worth getting just for the offline mode.Online would be fun except full of cheaters and little can be done except to switch sessions. Online is a bit of a grind as well but overall the experience is decent enough so the grind isn't horrible albeit very prevalent. The buy and sell missions are varied enough that you don't feel like you are just repeating the same thing over and over...even though you are. Also in online everything is extremely expensive to justify the use of shark cards. Shark cards essentially create a F2P mechanic in the game. R* has to put things in the online game that are grindy and not very fun to justify people buying shark cards to skip all that. So they are putting bad grindy content in the game on purpose so that people will want to skip it by buying shark cards. This overinflates the online economy and also means that R* wants you to pay them so you don't have to play parts of their game. F2P is not F2P rather it is pay not to play. You pay not to play the grindy bad portions of the game. This is a horrible idea dreamed up for online mobile games and has no place on the PC. I would argue from a gaming standpoint that this cancerous idea has no place in gaming in general but that is another discussion entirely.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I Got GTA to have fun i completed the story mode numerous times and its one of the best campaigns that i have ever played and then started playing online but quickly become bored and frustrated with the high prices of everything fair enough the DLCs are free but they expect you to buy shark cards or have no life and play the game everyday of your life do you have enough money to buy anything so I rarely played online due to this and when new content did come out he would want to play it but you would have to pay millions in game money two do anthing. In the end Rockstar and TakeTwo is just all about money not about the players they don't listen to the community and they don't care about any one but themselves. When thay tryed to take down OpenIV was the last straw modding is so fun and has such a big community.I Loved playing as a Cop with LSPDFR and as i am British and using openIV changing the vehicles to UK ones. GTA/ Rockstar and TakeTwo should embrace modding in SP as it gets more people playing there game and now to take off a FIVEM more and more people are switching to this online platform do you have fun and mess around online together not having to worry about messing up each other's car because it might cost them $5 000 to fix it. It just opens up a massive opportunities for Communities to form. e.g. DOJ RPI can only recommend this game because of the campaign and modding and what that adds to the game.NOT GTA ONLINE! I don't recommend GTA Online its a wast of time and money.We did it we got back OpenIV #BringOpenIVBackhttps //www.change.org/p/rockstar games save openivMORE things I don't like about the game or could be improved 1. Loading screens take forever.2. Everything is EXPENSIVE as all hell and it's extremely time consuming to make money and you can hardly even do that without d*ckheads constantly trying to kill you and blow up your product which is really stupid because they don't really get much of a reward out of it at all.3. It doesn't matter how big your gang/ crew is all it takes is one d*ckhead with a rocket launcher or a jet to blow up your plane or truck full of cargo worth hundreds of thousands of dollars that you wasted half your f*cking day trying to make. I'm sure there's a couple more things I missed on this list but whatever.

review: **DISCLAMER**This is my personal opinion on the game. Dont get butthurt please.Good game but you need friends in order to have fun. I mean you can almost do anything from selling coke to stealing cargo in order to sell it on the stock market. But solo is boring AF. At least 3 people required to have a good time. ********* EDIT **********Story The story is ok. Not better than GTA IV and not even close to GTA SA but its ok and its fun even though R* still own us a f*cking Story Mode DLC but whatever.*Online After a month (After the new update) I can say that the Online experiance is out of f*cking controll. Before Doomsday Heist the game was OK. It was fun with friends and all but after the new update the game has gone to sh*t. A game that you suppose to start as a Hustler and slowly progress in order to become a Kingpin has gone to Nuclear Warfare and WW3. Hell this aint GTA no more. Its ing WW3 simulator. FFS R* the online has gone to absolute SH*T. *Conclusion If you are looking to buy the game grab it while its on sale cause this game aint worth more than 25 bucks anymore. If you pay full price you just wasted your savings. You will enjoy the Story but you will find the Online kinda weird. Old school players like me that we used to play on Old Gen (PS3 Xbox360) will remember the good old days of hustling and grinding. Peace. Im out.

review: NOTE This review is based entirely on the GTA Online mode not the single player game because the only portion of single player I've played is the few minutes of tutorial that are inexplicably required before you're allowed into Online.GTA Online is to put it plainly a giant mess. The problems began with the early design decision to use a peer to peer networking scheme likely as a way to save money on server resources. Peer to peer lends itself to hacks and cheats and both the game's original two platforms (PS3 and X360) and PC are infested with players using mods usually to ruin other players' days.But the worst problems have developed as the game has been expanded over the years. Once the developer (Rockstar) and/or their parent company and publisher (Take Two) realized the revenue potential of selling in game currency for real world money the game's design has been primarily driven by the desire to "encourage" players to buy Shark Cards. As items purchasable with in game money (vehicles properties clothing etc.) have been added to the game their prices have undergone tremendous inflation requiring players to acquire more and more in game money to enjoy the new content and keep up with other players.At the same time while additional money making activities have been added to the game they've been locked to public sessions where the game not only encourages all other players in the session to interfere and stop the player trying to make money but gives those other players tremendous advantages (including telling them that someone's doing something lucrative in the first place giving them a real time updated map of where the money making player is and allowing them to use all of the miliary style weaponized vehicles that have been added to the game in the last few years while the player attempting to make money is usually limited to a slow unarmored vehicle such as a civilian car delivery van prop plane etc.It's possible to use various techniques to interfere with the game's network communications in order to get into a "solo" public session to avoid other players while engaging in money making activities but this generally makes it difficult to play with friends as well as strangers and could easily be considered a violation of the game's license agreement. I haven't heard of anyone being punished for this but it's a chance you take.There are other issues that can be raised as well such as the developers primarily relying upon other players to provide challenge rather than NPCs their unrealistic and inept use of NPCs when they do use them (for example NPCs who can headshot a player in the cockpit of a moving helicopter at extreme range with an SMG or just check YouTube for videos of NPC traffic deliberating swerving and doing other crazy stuff to hit players particularly during missions that hinge upon delivering a vehicle with minimal damage) and many of the game's updates over the years being composed primarily of content basically cut and pasted from previous updates just with a new skin.All in all GTA Online is the poster child for what can happen when game design and development are driven primarily by corporate executives' need for constantly growing monetization both immediate and ongoing rather than more traditional goals such as player fun or adherence to an artistic vision.

review: To keep things short get this game for the singleplayer because it is enjoyable and fun with the characters and story. It is lacking in the singleplayer DLC minus some drip feed cars that you probably won't til the end.As for the online be ready for a grind and a half but it can be made easy by playing with friends and meeting more with the Rockstar Social Club. As for the issues well....... Server Kicks and Disconnects thus making you lose progress. SHARK CARDS (It is just not worth the asking price even with the 'microtransactions in a priced game argument' is ignored) Other Players being jerks Destroying Cargo Using Orbital Cannon alot Griefing other players K/D ratio warriors etc With all the money this game has made somehow hackers are still running rampant in this game glitching money or just using God Mode and Teleportation. (And if hacker drop for you money don't pick it up!) Payouts for various missions races Modes being too low thus making it hard to get more players to play them. Insane prices of some vehicles and PropertyAll in all if you can have 2 6 friends to play this online mode with then it gets less grindy. So I reccomend this one but wait for a sale.

review: I recommend this game it's pretty funny especially if you play with friends. But there're some problems with GTA Online players. They're crazy. (I know about the passive mode).The biker club business isn't effective at all because of GTA Online players. Every time you sell for example documents or deliver materials you get a very high risk of being destroyed by a freaky guy on Opressor Mk. II or another wunderwaffe. Okay I would understand this if I could deliver documents by my helicopter with weapons or another vehicle but I can only use vans/planes/bikes that the game gives me. This pity thing destroys my desire to play GTA Online. (And I forgot to write that you can't use the passive mode when you're the president of the Biker Club/SecuroServ Organization).BUT if I understood it correctly I can sell all my production with the help of the Night Club so thanks for that. But you also need to earn about $1.000.000 or more.I hope that Rockstar will do something with the community in GTA Online.Thanks for reading this. I'm sorry for my grammar mistakes I only practise English.

review: If you want a game that's fun to mess around in this is a game I would highly recommend. Especially if you have friends to play it with. You can go around stealing things doing heists rob a grocery store etc. It's pretty fun but here are a few notes I have about the game.This game has two options when you launch it. The GTA online mode and the regular game. If you want to play online then you have to boot up the online one. But if you want to play the main story campaign you need to launch the base game. When you boot up the online version in order to actually play online you need to complete the tutorial because otherwise it won't let you do certain things in the online session. For example it won't let you use car shops to sell or edit cars. The tutorial takes at least 2 hours to complete but it's better off doing it that way you don't encounter that issue. When you're playing online and trying to get the money it can be draining at the beginning. But once you get more and more money it gets easier as you go.Otherwise I don't really have much else to say about it. I think that it was worth the time and money I put into it. E s p e c i a l l y f o r t h e s t r i p c l u b .

review: Some personal tips for grinding online *When you first start do contact missions. They're far less excrutiating than heists and Lamar's missions. Also higher the mission rating easier the mission. After you get more money start doing VIP and Terrorbyte jobs*Armored Kuruma and Oppressor MkII are the best vehicles for missions and VIP jobs. You're pretty much invicible with the Kuruma while you can zoom across the map quickly with the MKII using the speed glitch. Just please don't go about griefing other people with the MkII. Please?*Nightclubs are a great source of passive income if you have MC businesses.

review: GTA V Online in specific is a fantastic trip. Rockstar pushes out free content frequently. They are always adding new vehicles quests advesary modes community events clothing and other content. As par for course for Rockstar they charge their players nothing for all this. Thanks to the developers being on top of it GTA V Online stays fun fast and relevant. My only complaint about the game is Rockstar definitely needs to find a way to end the modding. When a player is able to mode game code to the point of making the game physically unplayable for another player a line has been thoroughly crossed. I would give GTA Online a 10/10 if not for the modding which forces me into about an 8. I and my friends absolutely love this game but there are HOURS many nights a week we are unable to accomplish anything due to being in a cage or locked in an apartment or constantly hopping sessions to find one without UFOs being dropped on our heads.

Also some hitboxes aren't alligned properly and have a lil wider hitbox then they should but you'll never know where and when that'll happen.Physics are 10/10 realistic I myself fly through the air with a motorcycle everyday to and when I drive my car and hit something irl I also do 7 360's.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto VI've been looking forward to a follow up to Grand Theft Auto IV for quite some time and after far too much waiting and an asinine delayed release compared to the console versions V is here on the PC. The question now is whether it's worth the price. Buckle up kids this is going to be a fun one...GraphicsGrand Theft Auto V is designed as a third person shooter. While it has a first person mode you will quickly notice the lack of smaller details (high resolution textures models etc.) if you stay in it. With that said the fact that they modeled interiors and instruments/gauges for every vehicle is appreciated and adds to the immersion. It features a nice color palette and a decent enough level of detail on most levels. As a result it is fairly appealing to look at and definitely works well. However it isn't perfect. Wilderness can be lackluster with plain ground textures and no modeled grass in quite a few locations reminiscent of old pre Source engine games. Some textures appear overly flat some are too shiny and others not enough and there are some other annoyances. So while it won't set the standards for graphics it's appealing enough as long as you can get past some annoying minor issues.http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 426135917AudioThe voice acting is quite decent and I have no complaints there. Vehicles all sound decent enough but weapon sounds will be where I raise issue. They simply don't sound powerful enough none of them. I highly recommend looking into mods to resolve this. The ambient music is pretty good but most of what you'll be listening to consists of licensed tracks on the radio. I won't get anywhere near that because I don't know much about music besides that I hate pop and rap.PerformanceWell it isn't bad but it isn't great either. You definitely need a decent graphics card for Grand Theft Auto V and I highly recommend that your system exceeds the minimum requirements if you want to consider this title. Low graphics settings look abominable and you'll need a respectable system to run higher settings. There are also some bizarre performance hits with certain graphics and gameplay options so keep that in mind and consult guides to fine tune your settings.GameplayThis is an open world shooter with a large open environment relatively realistic cityscape and far spanning countryside. The controls are decent enough and feel a little slow on purpose as they do with some third person games. First person mode has slightly more fluid controls but it's still very similar. There is a run of the mill cover system you can carry every weapon you own at the same time à la Doom and the weapons feel like you'd expect out of a third person shooter. Vehicle controls are acceptable but they're far from perfect and definitely feel like a step back from Grand Theft Auto IV. Helicopter and aircraft controls in particular are very poor. It is still quite fun though and there's a wide variety of things to see. While you will eventually become bored of the gameplay that won't be until after you finish the campaign. The AI is problematic though. Pointing a gun at someone won't make them put their hands up and surrender to you. Instead they simply flee in terror. They will also call the police on you for simply standing nearby them a strange quirk to say the least.SingleplayerThe singleplayer campaign follows about 70 story missions typically ranging between 10 and 30 minutes in length each with a large variety of side missions to complement them. The side missions truly are extremely varied from assassinations to playing tennis. The detail that has been put into this game is rather impressive and this covers both ends of the spectrum On one hand police can be found sitting on the side of a highway sipping coffee and snoozing instead of monitoring their radar guns. On the other there's a fully functional strip club which you can visit. Not a game for kids.http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 623658469The plot isn't anything revolutionary all things considered. It's about what you'd expect from Grand Theft Auto A satire of American culture to the tune of high risk high reward felony. You'll spend less time stealing cars and more time stealing assets from banks in this game though as that is a major focus of the campaign and where much of your characters' income will come from. On the whole the singleplayer world is the highlight of Grand They Auto V and where you'll get most of your playing time if you're like me. It was fairly enjoyable and managed to avoid either overstaying or understaying its welcome.MultiplayerAlright I've got a bone to pick with this part of the game 'Grand Theft Auto Online'. Quite simply Rockstar's handling of it has been abhorrent. It is essentially an MMO version of Grand Theft Auto that locks you out of most items until you grind enough to unlock them in various gamemodes which are separate from the "overworld" of Los Santos. Doesn't sound bad at first but it's bogged down by some serious issues. First you can purchase currency for Grand Theft Auto Online on Steam. This gives whoever does so a direct advantage and is quite frankly disgusting. It has no place in a sixty dollar triple A title like Grand Theft Auto.The loading screens are incredible I've spent more time sitting in them than I have actually playing Grand Theft Auto Online. It is also plagued by hackers and griefers you'll be hard pressed to find a server without either a hacker who ruins the experience or somebody who simply takes either an MRAP vehicle an attack helicopter or the armored sports car and attempts to kill every player they can find. And of course we have to make an honorable mention to Rockstar themselves as they have banned players for simply being in the same game as hackers without actually banning the hackers themselves. Bravo bravo.Community ContentRockstar's policy towards community created content so far has been deplorable to say the least. Many times in the past their patches broke mod support for some time and they offered no support themselves for modifications to Grand Theft Auto V. Their publisher Take Two Interactive has also shut down any attempts to create third party multiplayer with extreme prejudice on one occasion dispatching private investigators to harass the developers of such a modification. They are decidedly shooting themselves in the foot by acting this way.http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 462165197In spite of the issues with modifications community created content has been released and some truly impressive stuff it is indeed. LSPDFR is set to be an impressive overhaul of the game from crime simulator to police simulator. You can find mods that replace player characters with Iron Man complete with functional suit if that's not big enough maybe you'd like to try a Hulkbuster suit on for size. Those familiar with Superhot can find a mod that slows time when the player isn't moving. No matter what you're looking for Grand Theft Auto V's modding community has something for you and with this community I can almost recommend the game.VerdictThis game has its fair share of flaws but it is also a splendid open world one which plays host to an entertaining singleplayer campaign and one which the modding community has taken full advantage of despite its lack of development tools. With that said thanks to Take Two and Rockstar's absurd handling of mods for the game they have earned my ire and I'll likely not be supporting them as a result.I do not recommend Grand Theft Auto V.

review: This game used to be absolutely great before Rockstar decided that griefers needed a help in ruining the fun for other players by adding flying motorcycles and cars that can shoot missles and what not at other players that are minding their own business without putting themselves at any risk. This prevents many people from doing any sort of missions such as Headhunt that requires the player to roam the city as the you will be constantly bombarded with missles from flying motorcycles and cars. Not only that but Rockstar decided to charge high prices for those vehicles so that only those who grind constantly or decided to fork out their wallets for Shark Cards can actually afford them. If you want to make a lot of money in the game you need a lot of money to start up businesses if you dont have a lot of money then you can either buy Shark Cards for the easy way or grind hours upon hours upon hours to start making a good amount money (hoping that the griefers wont come along and ruin everything which they can easily by destroying any resources your carrying from point A to B resulting in a lot of money lost).Of course this isn't the only problem with the game. The long loading time freezing texture pop in overpriced vehicle the time needed to dedicate to buy anything fun or interesting in the game and many more just ruins this game for me and personally I really don't recommend anyone who is debating whether to start playing this game to actually play this game save your time and money and use it somewhere else worth investing.

review: Its a fun game at least until they ban your friends for getting griefed by a cheater... Cheaters are rampant on the servers and really ruin an otherwise decent game. I was willing to put up with it until a cheater recently managed to kill a bunch of people in a lobby in a way (I don't understand how exactly) that put all the deaths in my friends name. A few days after this happened he tried to log into his account and got a message telling him that hes banned for 30 days and will have his character reset. This after he bought the Criminal enterprise starter pack a few cards and put in over 200 hours. Tickets put in to complain about it have been totaly ignored so hes out everything he built up over months because Rockstar can't control cheating on their own servers. I can't go 2 hours of playing this game without running into modders but regular people are getting banned. I can't help but feel that the devs have no idea what they are doing.None of this impacted me directly but I'm done I won't support a company that treats it's repeat customers this poorly. I'm applying for a refund from steam as soon as I finish this. Even if I don't get it I'll never be playing a Rockstar game again.

review: Product received for free. Sorry but I'm not gonna defend this broken game along with R*'s shady practices including flagging legitimate players as false positives by banning them because they received modded money against their will or being at the mercy of hackers. And the fun part? Hackers get away with it unpunished and are never banned. And even if they are banned so long as they keep buying the game just to evade the ban they'll continue on with their reign of terror and R* are obviously blinded by money.Wanna know the fun part? Those billions of dollars R* has earned from the game alone are being dumped for their latest game that is Red Dead Redemption 2 instead of spending their money of fixing their broken servers constant lag and most all getting rid of the hacker problem. They are completely devoid of their fanbase and their fans as well. And their customer support is one of the worst as well.In case anyone wonders no I have not been banned nor will I ever be. Sadly real hackers will never be banned either.The hacker problem has gotten worse long and inconsistent load times are persistentYep the hacker problem went as far as to reach to Single Player/Story Mode hackers can now kill players in single player with just a click of a button which makes Online look like Disneyland. No lie. Look it up and you'll see what I mean. In addition loading times have become seriously problematic when booting up the game and it's not just Online even Single Player is having persistently long load times as well so unless you have a supercomputer grade PC along with ultra fast internet speed you're out of luck.And because R* is completely oblivious with that kind of issue it's a gamble in itself.Servers are becoming worse because R* depends on P2P and not dedicated servers nor are they bothered to fix the servers themselvesTitle says it all. R* doesn't learn a damn thing when it comes to dealing with broken servers. Even if you have an internet speed that's of perfection constant lags and frequent disconnects makes Online feel like a total chore than fun. But most people have the gall to tell people to say "it's on your end" proves that they are basically insecure kids who constantly beg their parents for them to get overpriced content.And speaking of overpriced content...Overpriced content and griefing / funGrinding is a chore and not fun just to get nice things and griefing (unless if it's a vigilante kind those who have grown tired of kids blowing stuff up because it's considered to be "fun") just adds insult to injury and it clearly causes a friction to friends and allies alike. And that's because R* here has the nerve to push Shark Cards for easy transaction which is beyond EA (Electronic Arts) levels of greed.And don't bother reporting people if they are intentionally trolling you not only will R* ignore it they will actually ban you while hackers/griefers only get a slap on the wrist and allow them to continue on. As for innocent players? They obviously refuse to give them second chances much less listen to their reasoning. Even with proof R* will simply shut them down by blatantly saying "all bans are final and may not be appealed".Community is toxic because the forums are completely un moderatedAgain don't bother reporting people who brings up toxicity especially since the majority of Steam moderators don't seem to pay much attention to them and even if they do they'll end up getting swamped by having to deal with kids who think that the devs are basically the gods of gaming when they're obviously not. They have billions of dollars yet prefer to dump all of their earnings for their new game over fixing GTA V/Online altogether.ConclusionIt used to be a great game but with overpriced content coupled with constant server issues including long load times no matter how good your PC or internet is it's overall quality is dwindling pretty fast yet people will still thumb it up because they want to support greedy devs (or because they simply write down one liners or none at all mostly because they might be obviously underage) and eventually find themselves at their mercy at the hands of hackers who will delightfully cause serious problems by bombarding them with modded money insta kills and use invincibility for them to be as good as un killable be it on free roam or Deathmatches. And R* will not be entirely bothered in dealing with an ongoing hacker problem so long as money talks and they walk away with them leaving everyone else to suffer all while hackers have their fun and not get punished whatsoever. It used to be amazing but it's now a hollow shell of it's former glory.And no I didn't give R* a penny for buying their game. If any I did got it for free a few years back.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It's a rare thing for me to buy a game at full retail price yet when this game came out on the 360 I immediately bought it and played it blind having only watched the trailer. I was not disappointed The set of characters for the game are what's to be expected out of a GTA title. You've got your stereotypically dumb celebrities corrupt police force mixed in an overall insane world which are complemented by the simple yet well written main characters going between rags to riches no longer retired heist lords and crazed homicidal maniacs.Going through the main story and exploring Los Santos and the surrounding areas is incredibly entertaining and enjoyable because there is simply so much see and do especially in the backstreets. And then you have the multiplayer which albeit a microtransaction hell there is a tremendous amount of content to enjoy with your friends.Overall this game is worth just for the singleplayer OR the multiplayer. If you enjoy both even better.

review: I've played GTA since the first one. Religiously. And this one is yet another great release.I have trouble finding time for SP nowadays though so I have not completed the SP (TBH I did not complete GTA IV DLC's aswell due to having to restart it several times trouble with savegames) and I basically jumped straight to MP in GTA V.Sadly though GTA V MP is legendary for its' "Loading simulator" feel where you spend a bunch of time waiting for the loading to complete and often enough questioning if it will complete or you are better off restarting the game. The lobbying partying up etc. part of MP is really bad but when you are playing together the game is really great. Laughs oddity absurdity tension etc. all seasoned with good old R* humor. There are TONS of different things to do in this game and it gets plenty of updates aswell. I haven't played this all that much but I always find so much s#it to do and even the simplest activities end up being a bunch of LOLs.What I'd change 1) The in game ads for "buy this and that via. the browser on your phone" are disturbing and even moreso when they are replayed on every reconnect. This is annoying as f#ck and should be possible to turn off. There is no need to remind me how good of a purchase a nightclub or a bunker is. I'm not gonna buy shark cards anyways D2) Joining Online &amp Friends/Crew etc. it's absurd that the fastest way to join your friends is for one to invite everyone to heist setup then quit the heist setup and have everyone at his Heist room. This way joining takes almost no time at all and nor does the exiting of Heist setup. This is what assures me that the painful loading times could be fixed. I don't get it why they haven't been fixed to this day as the game gets updates (great) and has been around for a while. All other ways of joining sessions are a lot slower and also bugged meaning often times it one of the guys joining fails to connect.3) Re joining heist/mission when playing with friends (upon d/c) this should be enabled... re entering lobby and restarting the mission from the last "checkpoint" would be great it's really annoying when a long mission gets failed because one of the members dropped. Basically a party system would be great.4) Joining lobbies from phone should check if the lobby has been filled in the meantime before letting you join a full lobby meaning you have to rejoin online. Meaning if a session is full it should be known before it's possible to attempt to join only to be d/c'ed.5) When someone is attacking you (specially if it's constant spam killing) it should not be your burden to pay for their equipment if it gets destroyed meaning provoked attacks would leave the burden of insurance costs of destroyed equipment on the attacker (for their gear). This should wear off with a cooldown.Currently it's pretty annoying if people annoy the hell out of you with expensive "easy killing lock fire forget cant dodge" equipment &amp you really don't wanna kill them because the only way would be to destroy their equipment meaning $$$ lost.Which brings me to "Misc" 1) Some of the content is just tooooooo unreal for me lol.2) A bit cumbersome using the map a dedicated key to display full map and not canceling actions (driving etc. like in PUBG i.e.) would be great. Also an easy way to set relevant waypoints maybe a favorites system &amp a hotkey to toggle favorite waypoints (+ current mission waypoints). This way you could drive &amp do everything + set the waypoint at the same time.Great game anyways. I wish GTA VI fixed the connecting lobbying up etc. MP issues this game faces. The loading times are just wayyyyy tooooo looong this might also be an issue why I haven't played it THAT much.

I even reported them because at that time I did not realize that they were lagging I thought they were hacking.not to say there are no hackers in the game the game is full of hackers from exploding everyone in the session repeatedly until they all leave to inviting people to their apartment an invite they can't reject then they killing them.and then there are the opressers. i dont know why that bike even exists with 0 counters to it if any of this happens to you and believe you me it will happen to you alot in this game switch sessions these people deserve to play alone. there is no point reporting them cos rockstar makes it super hard to report someone and even if you successfully manage to report the guy it feels like a waste of time.ps(shutup grammer police)

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This review is only for main story mode I've been a big fan of the GTA series on PC and console since the beginning. The open world sandbox coupled with sharp witty writing made me come back time after time. I love just driving around in the city exploring all the nooks and crannies while listening to the radio. GTA V is a faithful sequel to the series but I feel that some of the magic sauce from the previous iterations is missing. First up is the story/gameply I never felt drawn to any of the characters or their plight. The introduction is Trevor is a well needed shot in the arm yet he arrives much later in the game. The two other protagonists Michael and Franklin are pretty cliché and dry. Some of the missions are pretty original however by the end of the game it become quite repetitive. While driving around the city is still fun the city feels very empty. Even though there are sometimes random events such as robberies and surprise side missions these boil down to escort or kill missions. If you're solely coming to GTA V for the story mode only buy the game when it's on sale.Secondly the graphics and controls The graphics are definitely impressive. I was impressed by the animations reflections and lighting effects. I can't really compare this game to others since it came out five years ago (2013). I especially like the explosion effects and sunsets. Controls are pretty good. I tried playing the game with keyboard and mouse yet I find the console controller more comfortable. I could never get comfortable with the cover/shooting system. Half the time it would work. I always hear people complain about the driving controls but I've never had a problem with driving. This game is just like the previous ones. I love driving and it mostly depends on which cars you're controlling. They did a good job giving each car its own characteristics with sound control and physics.Wrapup Purchase on sale. The story mode is good but not great. It's a GTA game through and through just not as memorable as the previous ones. Besides a handful of chuckles the characters are a tad dry and the missions get repetitive. There isn't enough innovations in gameplay or story when comparing the rest of the GTA lineup. Now I'm waiting for the PC versions of Reddead Redemption II.

review: GTA V is a release of a long going chain of games inevitably all following a similar playstyle just like GTA 4 this one also has online play which is alot more polished and a much more investable time sinkProsGood time sink for you solo or with friends as the multiplayer and singleplayer to some extents both have story if you call the cut scenes story ofcourse. Game play is what you expect from a GTA V game Shoot em up car theft robbing banks and running down yobs in the fastest car you can acquire its a really big time sink making sure you come back through the means of a repeatable online experience as missions have a multitude of roles you can take turns in performing through heists missions and more player vs player oriented content to participate in if shooting the ballas over and over while nicking their car isn't your cup of tea.doing some player versus player missions like races can unlock you things which aren't buyable till you do the mission such as the tron bike and outfit.the other mentionable feature is that there is some map creation I think for the PVP/Races? I've never gotten into the nitty gritty side of things personally not being very creative without re inventing the wheel first.The consIts big open world daunting to the newbie where the fastest catch up mechanic is paying for the criminal enterprise pack or buying shark cards levels will leave you feeling weak in open lobbies as alot of players have the best obtainable attachments and upgrades so PVP in free roam atleast is a No go. Costs can be very off putting as for alot of the snazzy cool stuff your asked usually for 1.5 2 mill its a long tread mill without much incentive bar levels new clothes and the such inbetween while you aim for the long term goal.I would rate/reccomend this game to friends/others as theres big goals to be achieved despite the time it asks to make these big goals achieveable and it is seeped content or bonuses to doing x content every week or so while providing a very strong singleplayer.

review: I played a LOT of this game on PS4 before moving to PC but I sadly cannot recommend it. While a lot of fun can be had in this game most of the online content is basically pay to play with excessive amounts of grinding required to acquire most newly added content (or buying the in game money). The freeroam is overflowing with modders who will either give you tons of free or kill you and stop you from being able to make money. This said the minigames and missions are extremely fun and I've had tons of laughs playing with friends. The actual added content despite how overpriced it is is quite fun to play with and the toys they add are poorly balanced letting you dominate other players in freeroam if you purchase wisely.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I love this game. I've played the story countless times on both pc and ps3 and have been playing since the game came out on each platform. I've also been playing GTA V Online since I got wifi on my ps3 (I dont know when but it was about 1 2 years after I got the game) and Online has got me hooked. Online has changed a lot so its kinda difficult to be a new player but the point of Online is the grind and it never really stops but I love that about Online. They have a lot of new missions that can give decent money and they're pretty cool. And the reward of getting something new is fun and now there is a lot of cool stuff to spend your money on. Also with the price going down on this game by 50% I don't think you could go wrong with buying this game.
