review: Grand Theft Auto. What a game. With over 300h on the playstation and a couple dozen more on PC I have to say that this game definitely deserves a solid 10/10. GTA V has an expansive world with a lot of things to do but the singleplayer is only the tip of the iceberg.For those of you who have been in multiplayer we all know there are fun days and there are bad days. I usually have fun when I team up with some friends. Why? All those stupid ragdoll moments are just that much more fun the missions aren't as tedious and generally having a large group of people in a gang ensures immunity against everyone else in the server which in turn helps you do your Motorcycle Club missions at ease.I've been playing this game since day one and have only recently returned to it. In those past two years I missed out on SO MUCH content that I can't even name most of them. Rockstar updates online on a regular basis in order to keep its playerbase happy with fresh content. I wouldn't mind paying full price a third time. Honestly you get a 60 dollar singleplayer with a free multiplayer. Of course Rockstar has their notorious shark cards for the online version of GTA V but seeing as they invest their time and money into improving it regularly I am fine with having microtransactions even though I personally wouldn't buy into them.Overall good game. 10/10. All I'm hoping for (but probably won't happen) is that singleplayer DLC they promised before launch.

review: A really fun open world sandbox game with lots to offer. The singleplayer story isn't the greatest and completing it twice can become a chore. But there's defiently is some fun missions with creative action scenes. But luckily the PC version allows for mods which can really boost the fun. Now the online part is really where Rockstar hit the jackpot. You create your own character and persona and with some friends you can have some serious fun with all the different activites missions and challenges. But you can still get some fun out of the online mode alone.Though i do recommend buying the game with a shark card so you can get easily started with all the fun. Hope this review helps.

review: Rockstar needs to revamp their control system and RAGE engine. Their animation system was nifty a decade ago but even by the time of this game I couldn't handle it. It was frustratingly unresponsive. It's a common problem I've always had with Rockstar's open world games. They design richly detailed vast worlds to explore which are great fun but then tie in some awful controls and mechanics to their games. Luckily the world story and characters make up for it most of the time. I didn't feel like this game achieved that. The story was traditional GTA over the top but it felt far too much like palying an updated San Andreas except with less to do. The triple character selection I also did not like at all. In this type of game I want to play as one character I want to build that character I want to grow that character and I want to dominate as that character. With this triple character design it means resources had to be shared. You had to decide which properties and businesses each one bought. Certain characters were better at other things forcing you to play as them even if you enjoyed other characters better. It felt like a weird addition to a tired game formula.As far as PC aspects go though. Game has tons of graphics settings. It runs well. All is good.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Love this game and rockstar. I recommend for anyone to buy is gta 5. This game came out in 2013 2015 for pc and is still killing it. No other company could top this game other than rockstar themself
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Only spend your hard earned money on a sale for the story mode if you haven't played it before the graphics are beautiful no load screens when playing you definitely do not need a controller like others are saying it works fine on a M&amp K. The voice acting and cutscenes are quite hilarious albeit not as great a storyline as III IV Vice City and San Andreas but it retains the GTA charm.Very immersive because it has a lot of content customisable weapons and character(s) purchasing properties upgrading cars and flying planes side missions races jumps punching hookers. All that great authentic GTA fun. However it is an 80GB download. Online Beware be very careful when purchasing this product for onine purposes read the negative views and weigh up your options. I wouldn't recommend online but would recommend campaign/story.

review: I love the story/singleplayer mode a lot more than the online multiplayer. The story mode gives purpose for gamers who like objective type of games. Also it creates different missions help the gamer experience almost everything the game has to offer such as the Stranger Things missions (like side missions you talk to certain strangers to get them). Additionally the story mode has 3 sets of characters with difference personalities which are Michael Franklin and Trevor (I love him the most cause he be wildin). On the other hand I'm not a real fan of grinding but online multiplayer is alright at first (because of the customizable character and beating random people) but it's highly recommended that you play with a friend because things can get lonely when you're soloing the missions or VIP/CEO works to earn money. Overall this game is all about the grinding to get more money to buy whatever when you're in online multiplayer mode and story mode lasts about 40 hrs? but it's imo worth it.

Online used to be like hell when hackers would lock you in a cage or kill you for no reason but I've been playing it recently and haven't encountered any hackers. A big improvement over GTA 4 is obviously is GTA Online with a lot of things to do like heists and missions things that you couldn't have done in GTA 4. Overall I'd give it a 9.8/10 just because all the vehicles on GTAO are overpriced but besides that it is very well made. )

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Singleplayer is a lot of fun. Multiple characters that each have their own story. Most heists/missions can be played in multiple ways each with their own benefits. Shame about the promise of singleplayer dlc that was made in 2013/14 and to this day still hasn't been released.Multiplayer is only recomendable if you have friends to play with or are willing to search for people to play with. Since atleast from my experience playing gta online alone is far from interesting. There are quite a lot of free dlc added to gta online but most of them are just items like cars airplanes buildings etc. And require you to either pay money or grind for ingame cash. Every mission is kind of fun to begin with but after you played them a few times for rp or cash the boredom kicks in. The one dlc that doesn't require too much of a grind to start is the heists dlc and those heists are without doubt worth your time.For 30 bucks this game is definitely worth it even after all this time. The singleplayer on it's own is absolutly incredible and the multiplayer is fun with friends. Though it does suffer from hackers.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I remember in the past that it was hard to earn a lot of money but now that they have done some updates it's lot more interesting to play and earn more money!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: TLDRIf you don't (really) care about the online part of the game get it!If your primary reason to get this game is for its online part however please be aware that you'll have to grind money for many many hours in order to unlock the most fun things.SingleplayerIt's really a great singleplayer game! Yes it has its flaws and yes I would've liked to see some things done differently but it's still one of the most solid GTA games ever made in my opinion (don't cry San Andreas you'll always be my favorite baby). The thousands of mods available will make sure there's always something new to do in case you ever get bored of the vanilla game. Props to the developers on delivering this to us gamers!OnlineUnfortunately a lot less great. Don't get me wrong it can still be fun. In fact I used to enjoy playing online a lot. Heists and all that were great and just free roaming in the world was fun most of the time. For me this all turned around the moment the update with the big expensive ship was released. From there on I felt as if the most fun things were getting locked behind such a high price tag that you'd have to grind hours upon hours to get the money for it. This is not at all what GTA is about in my opinion. I do support having to earn money to buy things but as it stands today it's all way to much of a grind.Another unfortunate thing is that there are still a lot of "modders" to this day. On the one side you've got your fair player grinding away to unlock stuff. On the other you've got modders spawning everything they want in a matter of seconds and if they want can really annoy other players.A third thing is the shark cards you can buy with real money. Apart from the fact that I totally despise this business practice the prices are so outrageous that I'm just not going to waste any more time on this matter.So...I originally thumbed down the game because I felt the devs went the wrong direction with the online part which to me is a very big aspect of the game. However the game is still worth its money to those who mostly care about singleplayer. I figured it would be fair enough to thumb up for the good but with a mention of the bad.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: A fun game with a fun story. Sometimes it's almost like watching a movie when it comes to the cutscenes but once you get into the missions it becomes very fun. Nothing is really too hard to figure out nor is there really a learning curve. The online brings a whole new aspect to the game and is fun in a very different way. I personally don't find the online mode very entertaining with the abundance of hackers and players that paid for ingame currency. However this can be negated by playing with a multitude of friends.

review: As has been the case since 2001 Rockstar has created a large beautiful and rich open world full of surprises and fun activities to take part in. And once again accompanying this world is an even richer action packed thriller of a story full of amazingly written and acted characters.As well as providing the usual singleplayer treatment Rockstar have provided a massive in depth multiplayer experience letting players work with and against each other in the construction of their own criminal empires. The only major complaint I have with Grand Theft Auto V is the major inflation introduced to the Online economy thanks to Take Two Interactive's greedy reign making the journey to any significant purchase a very long tedious grind. Thankfully Rockstar know how fun works so the grind is still fun enough to stay engaging.
